Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LM P
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, friendly staff, and nice breakfast included. Beautiful garden courtyard filled with orange trees. We stayed on the second level (Room 15). We enjoyed sitting on the upper outside patio every morning and evening. Free bicycles available for use, locks included. Very nice and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLB68
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is ideal for a relaxing, peaceful stay. The rooms are all on the ground floor and set around a couple of courtyards full of orange trees. It's a beautiful setting and quiet, although you can often hear local musicians playing in the nearby square which is actually a bonus. We stayed in a family suite which was ideal for our needs, clean and pleasant. The staff were friendly and helpful and the staff in the breakfast room in particular were lovely. We stayed over Easter and there were complimentary Easter eggs given to us at breakfast. The range of food available for breakfast was excellent. The hotel isn't very central for sightseeing Rome and you do need to walk a little way to reach any public transport, but the area immediately surrounding the hotel is full of character and it's a lovely place to come back to after a day exploring the city. My children loved the hotel and we would definitely go back as a family again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: dianeYakima_WA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Rome. The room was very nice and the bed very comfortable. It's clean and well staffed. The rooms are situated around a patio with orange trees-very beautiful. The breakfast is great. It is located in a wonderful neighborhood full of restaurants and shops and a beautiful church. The streets are a maze and very narrow so the taxi dropped us in the piazza and we had to search a bit for the hotel-but well worth it! When we left a taxi did come to the hotel-she barely made it through the narrow streets, but it is possible!

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: Ali921
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Trastevere, the Hotel Santa Maria provides a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of a few hectic days in Rome. It is less than a couple of minutes' walk to excellent restaurants, bars and shops within Trastevere itself but a longer walk is required to get to the main sights of Rome. The hotel itself has a very nice courtyard area which you can sit in and enjoy a coffee or a drink from the bar. The room we stayed in was spacious and very comfortable with tasteful decor. A definite recommendation if you want to avoid staying in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: ConcordRay
Reviews.Content: Excellent place; Great Staff and Good People. We will definitely stay here if we get to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CC1225
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for six nights and were very happy with our visit. The room was comfortable and very clean and we were delighted with the lovely courtyard filled with orange trees where we were able to sit and enjoy coffee or a snack . Breakfast was provided each morning; it was plentiful and varied with cereals, scrambled eggs and pastries as well as the more traditional European breakfast fare of meats, breads and cheeses. Coffee, made to order, was available as well as a variety of juices and fruit. While Hotel Santa Maria does not serve meals other than breakfast and a snack in the afternoon, a wealth of restaurants is available outside the gates of the hotel. The Trastevere neighborhood, where the hotel is located, has a well-deserved reputation as the place where locals come to dine. We ate each evening in Trastevere and were not disappointed. The hotel is located "across the river" from the major sites but everything is easily accessible by public transportation (taxi, bus, metro) or by walking. We walked everywhere. It was lovely to come back to our neighborhood each evening and escape the hustle and bustle of central Rome . The neighborhood is a very old one comprised of small, twisting streets; great for strolling about before or after dinner. It is a bit gritty in spots but that is part of its charm because it is a real neighborhood and feels like one. We very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Santa Maria; the staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. We would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: We met in Rome to celebrate two birthday's for some of our best friends and the Hotel Santa Maria was the chosen spot for all of us to stay and we were not dissappointed. The hotel rooms were very nice, the courtyard was an awesome place to sit and enjoy our mornings and evenings, the breakfast was awesome, very convenient to everything, with the staff and service being the icing on the cake. The hotel is very close to the Santa Maria church and square and all sorts of restaurants and entertainment. On our last day in Rome, my wife and I took the bicylces, which were supplied by the hotel, and explored the city which was an amazing way to see the city, just be careful and watch the traffic. We went to the parks, saw the sites and ended up at the Pantheon. An overall awesome experience at a small and quaint hotel. We will be back. Thanks to everyone at the hotel for being so accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful yet efficient”
Reviews.Author: Beth51
Reviews.Content: My third stay in Hotel Santa Maria, this time with a grown up daughter, proved that this small gem of a hotel has kept up the hard work and take pride in their quality. Unbeatable location close to the beautiful Santa Maria square and church. You can walk everywhere, or, if not so keen on walking tram 8 takes you to P.Argentina, buses over to Testaccio and Piramide. The rooms are spaced out around an orchard of orange trees. Lovely breakfast with superb coffee (!), an afternoon snack buffet included in the price. Efficient service, helpful staff, lots of good eating options around the corner. Yes, Santa Maria is more expensive than the ones they compare with, but - having once tried out a seemingly nearby and cheaper alternative - certainly worth it. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the chance to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hillcrest69
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in at any price. The location is perfect, the breakfast was great and the hotel itself is just all around pleasant. The staff could not have been any better. I highly recommend this hotel Joe DeMarco United States

Reviews.Title: “dellndan”
Reviews.Author: dellndan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great location, excellent breakfast. We have already recommended it to friends. This was our sixth visit to Rome and enjoyed being in a different part of town. Recommend arranging for pick-up at airport, as hotel isn't convenient to public transportation and would be difficult to find. All major sights are within walking distance, and lots of worthwhile local sights close by, such as Farensina, which few tourist get to see. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost's. It's a filthy circus not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hellen C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was a last minute trip to Rome in January and the staff was so rude and uninterested. They spoke on there cell phones whilst checking me in and the yelling between the staff was horrendous. This seemed more like a cirrus then a hotel. When I asked one staff member her named she refused to give it to me. You are better sleeping in the street then in the hotel. HORRIBLE ON ALL COUNTS

Reviews.Title: “Great, traditional hotel in a superb location for sights, bars and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Stanners54
Reviews.Content: A lovely old hotel in a great location. Very good value (out of season). Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: chefamy
Reviews.Content: Rick Steves of PBS fame recommended this b&b and we really enjoyed it. In fact we are staying there again on our last day in Italy before we fly home. We were lucky that they were able to accommodate us for 1 weekend night. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Plenty of heat and hot water. The garden outside the rooms has lovely orange trees. Their "happy hour" is very nice with lots of delicious little noshes like foccacia with potatoes and olive oil and olives and sun dried tomatoes and meats and cheeses. We were told that the limoncello was made by one of the worker's moms. And it was quite yummy. The rooms are very secure and feel safe. It's in the very young hip neighborhood of Trastevere which is always bustling especially at night. But Santa Maria had no noise issues at all. Lots of shops and restaurants in the neighborhood and an easy 10 minute walk to The Pantheon and other historic sights. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Erte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed here several years ago in a Junior Suite and I was quite disappointed. The room was dark and the bathroom (by American standards) tiny. When were not able to book a different hotel this trip and had to stay at the Santa Maria again I was dubious. I was pleasantly surprised this stay. We had room number 15 and it was wonderful. The size was perfect and the bathroom was large and modern. Whereas last stay I thought the room was overpriced this time it felt like a good value. We paid 160 Euros a night. The breakfast is diverse and satisfying. The trees laden with oranges and lemons adds to the romantic ambiance. I'd love to stay here when the weather would permit enjoyment of the outside spaces.

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: amewin
Reviews.Content: we had a fabulous stay in Hotel Santa Maria in January for a 5 day escape without our kids. couldn't fault the service. Nothing was too much trouble. Great location and an easy walk across the bridge into Rome's centre. We used the bikes on 2 days and cycled to Villa Borghese and around the cobbled streets. Next time in Rome we would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Santa Maria. Also recommend the hassle free, prompt airport pickup and drop off.

Reviews.Title: “Sad lies”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: I don't know who is writing these positive reviews. The staff? The place is terrible: -Loud (I can hear the neighbors all night long) -Filthy (I wouldn't let a dog sleep on the bedspread / linens -- nasty!) -Cold (Yes, it got cold here in February and the heat is inadequate) -Height (If you are over 5'5, you won't be able to stand up in the shower, or the 2nd floor where the bed is) -Rude (Staff is inhospitable, at best; rude, on average) This place is a dump and not worth the money they are charging. Do your family a favor and stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable to find such a quite place in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: egarceau
Reviews.Content: It is unbelievable to find such a quiet and peaceful place in the center of a vivid neighborhood such as Trasteverde, in the middle of all of Rome's excesses! One of our best hotel experiences ever! The room was clean, everything was in proper working order! The morning breakfast was fresh, and the staff was attentive to our needs. The surroundings are enchanting...we wish we were there in the summer to have breakfast in the courtyard. Trasteverde is very lively on saturday nights (the day we arrived) - we felt very safe walking around the neighborhood, and the ambiance was unique! We managed to get around pretty quickly and easily - if you like walking, the hotel is a maximum of 20-30 minutes walk from all major sites, but also a 5 minute walk from the tram which can take you to the train, buses or metro. There is also an ample choice of good restaurants nearby, which is extremely convenient if, like us, you walked all day, are tired, and don't feel like going very far for dinner. The only issue we had was with the wi-fi connection...it worked very well when we were able to connect, but we had many problems getting connected during our stay, even though we were able to clearly see the network on our devices...this should be looked at. The PC in the common area is a nice backup, but it is very slow, and isn't equipped for "skyping" with our loved-ones. All-in-all, a very positive experience...obviously at low-season rates...but I would not hesitate to pay the higher rates for this hotel during the hsummer! It's worth it! We lived Rome to the fullest, and slept soundly at night! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Rome hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Santa Maria and could not find any fault with it. The staff were very friendly and helpful with regards to advising on the best ways to attack Rome from a cost effective and efficient perspective. The room was spotless with a very comfortable bed and power shower - AMAZING!!!! The location of this hotel just off the River Tiber is the perfect base to explore all of Rome's attractions... We usually never return to the same hotel as a matter of principle to explore new places but when visitng Rome again, the Santa Maria can not be beaten. Traditional Rome with modern customers expectations adhered to. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Palmtreetheory
Reviews.Content: When the driver dropped us off, we thought we were lost and narrow cobble stone streets lined our path. After asking for some directions in the best broken Italian we knew, we made a couple turns and we saw the gate. From there on in, we felt at home and safe in this amazing hotel! The staff is great and extremely helpful and the neighborhood of Travestere has the best food and is in perfect walking distance from everything. I will ONLY stay here in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Downt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in January. The hotel has a great location but you should be willing to walk! That will be the same for any hotel in Rome though. Clean room and very quiet location with nice restaurants. Would have liked tea and coffee making facilities in the room though. The staff were friendly and efficient but not obtrusive. Would certainly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: Delightful, charming hotel in Trastevere near Piazza Santa Maria. Our family of 5 loved the Senior Suite, with 2 single beds in the upstairs loft, and one double and one single downstairs. Very clean and comfortable, delicious buffet breakfast, lovely courtyard area and very quiet at night. We walked everywhere from here - to Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Colosseum, Trevi fountain and Spanish steps and our kids (14 year old son and twin 11 year old girls) did not once complain! Great choice of reasonably priced osterias and pizzerias nearby. Friendly and welcoming staff, particularly those who served the breakfast. Trastevere is the real Rome, full of character and not crowded with tourists. We would love to return to Hotel Santa Maria one day and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: made k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria Hotel for five days and we loved it. Good buffet breakfast, very spacious, simple and practical rooms and the best location: quiet and close to everywhere you might want to get. The staff are very helpful and pay great attention to detail. Would definitely stay there again if going back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: LCSF
Reviews.Content: I went on a family vacation to Italy, and stayed in objectively "nicer" hotels in Venice, Bologna and Tuscany - but this was my favorite hotel of the trip. It "felt" very Italian - nestled between apartment buildings in a non-touristy part of Rome. The rooms weren't too overdone, just simple, clean, and comfortable. It didn't try to be too cushy or too boutique hotel like, which was a welcome change. We loved the courtyard the rooms all faced - it was a definite oasis after a busy day of sightseeing. Another plus is that they had hotel bicycles that you could rent for free. This hotel felt like a home away from home. As a side note we shared the largest room, which I beleve the website says can sleep 6 adults. There were 5 of us (all adults), and we were all able to sleep comfortably - 3 on the lower level (one queen bed and one single) and 2 on the upper loft (2 single beds). I think this room might be better fit for adults with small children or teenagers - with 5 adults it at times seemed crowded, even though the room was very big.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quite area to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephenfamilyofsix
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Santa Maria because of excellent reviews. I must say that we were not disappointed and the accommodation met expectations. However we also stayed in lesser rated Hotel prior to our cruise and the experience was better. The hotel is in an excellent area and allows a very different Rome experience away from the main tourist areas. The main sites still being an easy walk. Exploring the narrow laneways of Trastevere was a real pleasure. We are a family of six, hence stayed in two ‘triple’ rooms for three nights. On booking, we did ask for one room to have three single beds which was confirmed however they were not configured that way when we arrived. The toilet in one of the rooms was faulty on arrival and on asking they moved us to another room. The power also went out one morning for a number of hours due to some urgent works. The breakfast buffet was good. Excellent coffee. The highlight being pre-dinner snacks with a wine/beer after touring all day. Overall service was good. We tried three restaurants in the Trastevere area close to the hotel (one recommended by the staff) all were a little hit and miss. Some meals being excellent, some average. The hotel has a very different character and I have no hesitation recommending it to either families or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in lovely orange tree garden in heart of Trastevere.”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantBeazbillies
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay and could easily walk to many excellent restaurants. Had mixed levels of help from the front desk. No concierge so front desk seemed stretched thin and impatient at times. Overall, very convenient and lovely place. Breakfast of nice cappucinos, prosciutto, cheese, pastry, eggs included. Happy hour spread daily in same game room area. Free wifi, although spotty and you could not send email, only receive from your phone, but they have a computer in game room. Had to reboot phone after we left to get it to work again. Clean rooms with lots of space per European standards. Bath spacious enough to soak in. Owner gives horseback riding tours of the App road. Would have liked to known that in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Exotism in the Centre of the real Rome”
Reviews.Author: Magellan63
Reviews.Content: Rooms circling central courts rounded by orange trees. Serenity and exotisme of ancient stones very close to the center of the Eternal City and in the middle of real Romans, far from tourist zones such as Navona, Spagna and Trevi. Really enchanting and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: mdeliyski
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while in my room at the hotel! It is absolutely perfect in every way! I can not say enough good things about the people, location and the overall state of the hotel. From the reception, to the waiters during breakfast, to the night staff who was more than helpful finding us a corkscrew for a bottle of wine we were planning to drink. The room is warm and extremely clean, breakfast plenty great and the coffee is amazing! We walked to everything and Rome just keeps revealing itself over and over, behind every corner we were greeted by something magnificent! It has been magical!

Reviews.Title: “we'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: Caou
Reviews.Content: Great location to visit the city by bus, foot or bicycles, charming and quiet hotel, nice patio. Trastevere is a real charming neighborhood, We apreciate to borrow bicycles from the hotel and ride along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: maliboubou
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything. On negative is wi-fi didn't work well, but the had a free computer to use if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, quiet, and simple charm”
Reviews.Author: Leisure50
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location for touring historic Rome on foot. You return to a wonderful neighborhood with small shops and restaurants. Behind the gates of the hotel there is real solitude, something difficult to find in a large hotel in Rome. The rooms are simple and immaculate. An excellent breakfast, served outside under orange trees in the summer. Bicycles available for the adventurous. There was also a patio off the room to enjoy. The price point is beyond modest but the location, ambiance and serenity are worth the price,

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: DagOsl0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an exciting week in the «Eternal City» - and the exquisite and charming Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. A perfect location, an extremely helpful and friendly staff, the comfortable room (number 20), the excellent breakfast buffet and the great courtyard under the orange trees made our stay a most memorable one. We certainly recommend this safe and quiet oasis in the lively rione XIII of Rome and will definitely stay here when we make it back to Rome again

Reviews.Title: “nice and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dirk g
Reviews.Content: excellent location and very nice staff! Affordable and quite romantic hotel. We will certainly go back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, welcoming oasis”
Reviews.Author: Liza613
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is a lovely environment with open space available to all, and a small, comfortable feeling. It is a cloister in the middle of a busy section of a busy city, behind a locked gate. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. Morning breakfast and afternoon wine. Comfortable rooms with good bathrooms and wireless throughout. I love Trastevere and would certainly return to the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TXJoeGo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a week in Rome. The Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect location with only a short walk to all of Rome's sites. Stepping out of the hotel's front gate into the historic Trastevere area transports you back into an earlier time with the beauty of Rome around every corner. We highly recommend this wonderful Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: lisabug11
Reviews.Content: This place was incredible. We stayed at some fancier hotels in Italy, but nothing compared to this one. It was laid-back, the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating and the location was perfect! Throughout our travels in Italy, everywhere we stayed had hard mattresses, this place had a bed that was more comfortable than my bed at home! They have a great courtyard under the orange trees, where we had apertivos in the afternoon and played some board games while resting from our long days. Their breakfast was the best that we had while in Italy - they had eggs! This hotel was also the most quiet place we stayed, but you only had to walk a very short distance to be right in the middle of Trastavere - which is an amazing part of Rome. If you want fun people watching, some nightlife, and no major crowds or touristy things right where you're staying, this it the place. It was easy for us to walk anywhere in Rome, we saw all of the sights and never had to take public transportation. We even used the bikes from the hotel one day and biked to Vatican city so that we could beat the crowds but not have to get up super early. We will definitely stay here if we ever make it to Rome again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smod0405
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 6 nights prior to joining a cruise. This is a charming hotel in the Trestavere area of Rome. Quiet, serene and welcoming with a courtyard of orange trees, excellent breakfast buffet and evening hor d'ouervres. The staff is friendly and responsive to your needs. Located a short walk to Piazza Santa Maria and the church where there are great restaurants and an active nightlife. The hotel is surrounded by many shops, restaurants, cafes and gelato stops yet is very quiet and serene. The rooms for 2 are small, clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay again on our next trip to Rome. Smod

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveVanPelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this beautiful property. The location is perfect, as you can walk to all of the interesting sites, then come back in the evening and have your choice of dozens of great restaurants. Our room was very large, with a separate front room that also had a television and extra bed; there was also a patio, where we could sit in the sun. The other rooms surround a nice courtyard. One small wish for next time would be for some softer pillows.

Reviews.Title: “"A great place to stay "”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl D
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four ,our girls are 12 and 7 , We stayed at Santa Maria for 4 nights .We booked here reading the reviews on trip advisor .Much has already been said about this charming hotel.It was the ideal location for us. The Trastevere is a lively and quaint neighbourhood and this hotel is behind secure gates with a lovely courtyard filled with orange trees and tables to have breakfast and drink wine in the evening .The room was well done up ,with bunk beds for the kids, my younger one loved that .It was quite spacious for us .it felt great coming back here in the evening after a tiring day of walking around Rome. It is close enough to walk everywhere.The staff was very helpful and courteous ,from the front desk to the breakfast room. They made us feel very welcome. The breakfast was excellent and a good start to our day... Felt good with our choice of hotel and will most certainly come back here .Thank you to everyone at Santa Maria .

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel, great location in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kaye G
Reviews.Content: Much has been written about this lovely hotel, but after 6 nights we had gotten to know the staff, from housekeeping to the breakfast room/ wine bar servers. On our last day, Antonio at the front desk phoned a cab and even walked us to the gate. We can't say enough about this quiet hotel. A former convent, its rooms face lovely courtyards and look up to private apartments resembling a movie set. We couldn't wait to return to the Santa Maria every night after touring the sites of Rome. We agree with the reviewer, Wike, we will never stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely refuge from the buzz of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in November 2011. Found the staff welcoming and loved the charming courtyard with tables where you can enjoy breakfast or end the day with a glass of wine. Breakfast offerings were excellent.The yummy complementary snacks at 5.30pm daily were a welcome treat after walking all day. Felt really lucky to be able to leave the crowds of Rome behind and walk through the gates of the hotel to such a tranquil setting. It's a great location -you can easily walk everywhere from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Juz2501
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and spent 4 nights in this wonderful tranquil place. Behind secure gates there is a lovely courtyard where we relaxed every afternoon after spending the day walking Rome...and yes you are close enough to everything from here. We walked to Trevi Fountain, colosseum and Vatican city. Our room had loft which the kids (12,10 &8) loved as well as the complimentary snack every afternoon. Breakfast good & plenty of travel references books to look thru. Staff always happy enough to offer suggest & book a table for dinner. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: DublinFrankie
Reviews.Content: I'm still shaking my head at the rave reviews about Hotel Santa Maria, I just can't fathom why travelers find this particular establishment so appealing, unless it's the fact that the hotel is a welcome respite from the less than splendid streets that surround it. The hotel itself is fine in a basic sort of way, to be honest it reminded me of hostel/motel accommodation. Yes the courtyard is very pretty but the rooms are very basic (but clean) and the restaurant or dining most definitely is of the hostel variety. I have to say I didn't find the staff over enthusiastic, I don't ever expect much from reception staff but the odd smile wouldn't go amiss. Trastevere itself is on the far side of the river for most of the 'sights' and while most these can be walked to over the course of a week-end visit its still a bit of a trek especially on the uncompromising Roman cobbles and in the heat. Also the area is quite run down more noticeably so during the day, shuttered doors, graffiti and rubbish strewn streets; At night I will say the place takes on a different atmosphere with every shuttered establishment turning into either a bar or bistro. There are a couple of decent restaurants but expect to pay if you want something other than the tourist menu. The highlight of our Roman experience was the trip to the Vatican City but that's different review!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: 413homeland
Reviews.Content: If you want a true taste of old Rome, this small hotel in Trastevere area is the place to stay. We spent four days here and fell in love with the hotel and the surrounding area. The location is perfect for seeing the sights of Rome, just about everthing is in walking distance or a short bus ride away. The narrow streets and piazza's are made for people watching and exploring. With every twist and turn there are restaurants and small shops to satisfy all taste. Our room was surprising large with en-suite bathroom and very clean. The breakfast was very good and the service staff friendly and helpful. The courtyard with its charming orange grove was perfect for relaxing after a long day of site seeing. The hotel also had bikes guest could use if so inclined. All in all, our stay was wonderful and we will definitly stay here again the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for , sadly, only 2 days after completing a 20 day cruise of the Mediterranean.We had been to Rome a few times before; but, inexplicitly, had never stayed on the "under side " of the river, in Trastevere. We'll now never stay anywhere else. The Santa Maria is a perfect location, with really friendly people,and a terrific garden restaurant area. It's quiet and yet only 2 minutes away from the Piazza Santa Maria with its beautiful cathedral. There are many, many restaurants in the area; and this old, original section of Rome is a treat to explore. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lee1954_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, frendly people, great place to stay and good and cheap restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mic R
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little concerned about staying on the other side of the river but it was an excellent location. Everything was a very easy walk away but at night the shops and wonderful restaurants were very close at hand in an area that is a real joy in which to stroll around. The breakfast was excellent and the afternoon snack buffet was the perfect way to kick off the evening or relax after a day of sight seeing. The rooms are a reasonable size and are very clean, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: JimSpringfiled_Va
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is a joy. In the middle of the Trastevere neighborhood this renovated convent surrounds a patio filled with orange and lemon trees. It is truly an oasis after a long day of touring. The rooms are very comfortable. Breakfast, either in the cafe or on the patio is delightful. At five o'clock the staff sets up a buffet of snacks with beverages available. The staff is wonderful and just outside the secure gates are the wonderful shops and restaurants for which the area is known. Prices are, for Rome, very reasonable and there is a discount if you pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: suz1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in September and loved this hotel in Trastevere. After walking for hours in the heat, frantic activity and noise of Rome (which I also loved), it was a relief to come home to Santa Maria's enclosed courtyard, which all the rooms open onto and is just beautiful. The breakfast was the best we had in three weeks of travelling, Antonio and the other staff were very helpful and professional and Trastevere's bars, restaurants, shops and piazzas are delightful - despite the graffiti. If only all three star hotels were like this!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend visit to Rome October 2011”
Reviews.Author: ChrisKingsC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Santa Maria before. It is a jewel of a hotel with good sized rooms with all the facilities you need. An excellent buffet breakfast & afternoon tea. The staff are friendly & helpful & the hotel is set in Trastevere which is delightful & close to the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Frank A
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this great little hotel before our cruise on the 15th of September. The courtyard and rooms were more than we had hoped for. The breakfast was great and the location cannot be beat. Any help that was needed was provided for by the front desk people. it is quiet but not off the beaten track. We will stay there again if we have to opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Haven in Hotel Santa Maia”
Reviews.Author: Vicki B
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a very charming area of Rome, Trastavere, and is amazingly serene in the midst of lots of liveliness in the area. It has a lovely green courtyard, delicious breakfast and friendly snack offerings at "happy hour". The room was comfortably equipped and very quiet. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Villa life”
Reviews.Author: Goldenski
Reviews.Content: Of course it's not a villa but the hotel has it's own leafy courtyard where you can while away the hot afternoon hours sipping a beverage, great place to eat breakfast. 10 seconds out of the courtyard door and you're in the quiet bustle of Trastevere, Rome without the edgy craziness, restaurants where they don't hustle you, and not so pricey. 5 mins stroll down through the medieval alleys to the River Tiber over the bridge to the main events in Rome. Back later footsore and weary into the calming courtyard shaded by orange trees. Much better then the "business" hotels elsewhere in Rome. (Presuming you're not on business!) Staff are helpful. Free internet. Newer rooms on top floor have an almost private terrace. Ground floor direct access into the courtyard. Did I mention how nice the courtyard is?

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sailor8n8
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews from Trip Advisor on Hotel Santa Maria, we took the plunge and reserved a 9 day vacation. Every good thing we had read was exactly as it was reported to be. The staff were very cooperative and helpful. The Courtyard was the real Oasis allowing us to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Rome culture. Everything is organized yet in an informal, comfortable manner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: happilyretired_7
Reviews.Content: We picked the Santa Maria because of reviews in Karen Brown and Travelocity. As many reviewers said the rooms are basic but very pleasing. Breakfast in the courtyard is great and it is a great place to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening. It is a quiet and restful place in a great central location and great neighborhood (Trasteverre). (used the word great many times but it is appropriate) The staff was friendly and helpful. If you want a quiet central place to explore Rome for 3-4 days this a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome stay at Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Mgmorin
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at Santa Maria. It's a truly wonderful hotel, that's quaint, has a great staff, and central location. We'll return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. An oasis of tranquility in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: modine100
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The rooms are basic, but immaculately clean. There are no stairs which was great for my mom with a bad knee. The staff was friendly and was able to arrange for tours. The breakfast was nice. In a room off the courtyard, with internet and couches and bookcase of guidebooks. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful Haven,we could not have found a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rod H
Reviews.Content: The courtyard breakfast area is a joy and to come back in an evening after walking to all the sights of Rome and sit there with a bottle of Frascati was even better.Had the bar been open after 20.00 we would also like to have sat out after we had been to one of the many delightful restaurants within a 5 minute walk.I think it is a bit expensive for a "Bed and Breakfast" but it is a fabulous place and it appears to be what you have to pay.The room was comfortable and clean,but quite small.We were dissapointed that there were no Tea/coffee facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCopper
Reviews.Content: Could not have been more please with our time here! Such a lovely setting. After sightseeing all day it was so refreashing to come back to this lovely place. We were traveling with our daughter who loved running around the courtyard and smelling the flowers. The staff was amazing and we can not wait to return! I recommend anyone whoe wants a private oasis to book here!

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this hotel to everyone!!”
Reviews.Author: Irene888_11
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 3 nights in a room great for our family of 5 at this gem of a hotel, tucked into the old part of Rome. The rumours of 'noisy neighbourhood' never materialized and the location was perfect- 30 min walk to everywhere. Riding the free bikes through Rome at night was a special treat. The staff were helpful, accomodating and a special thanks go to the guys in the breakfast room and evening aperitiv's - you were great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting within walking distance of many of the sights of Rome. We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ggsnewton
Reviews.Content: The hotel Santa Maria was a wonderful find. The location made it a convenient walk to many of the sights of Rome, and the Trastevere area has many wonderful local restaurants. Compared to two other hotels that we stayed in during our trip, the breakfast was certainly the best, with a good variety of choices. The beautiful courtyard was a wonderful place to enjoy both breakfast and the late afternoon snacks. As a family, we highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This place wrote the book on how to make a visit to Rome restful”
Reviews.Author: Petr K
Reviews.Content: The reviews we read before choosing Hotel Santa Maria were all true: an excellent rating based on a true combination of attentive service, clean and very comfortable rooms, the hotel's own peaceful courtyard and a great location in Trastevere. We cannot re-invent the good reviews already written. If you want to experience the great city of Rome and still have a peacful and safe retreat, stay in Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MJHPijl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here while it was 38 degrees, but in the innergarden it was very comfortable to read and drink something. Also there is a very good complemantery antipastabuffet at 5.30. The rooms are small but comfortable and very clean. It's situated in the hart of the really nice area Traverstere. A lot of restaurants and bars to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: rayne65
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a great place for families to stay. Tucked away in a quiet area of the Trestavere neighborhood and close to many of Rome's must see sights. The are many reasonably priced restaurants close by. The breakfast included with the room is a great way to start the morning and the evening snacks provided in the lovely courtyard is a nice way to relax following a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location - the staff are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: WGoodyear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days after getting off of a cruise of the mediterranean. We were worn out and looking for some old fashioned R&R. This hotel was perfect for this. The room was comfortable and cool (perfect for afternoon siestas), the courtyard with orange trees was delightful and having a cafe macchiato under them in the morning was pure bliss. We used the bikes one day and rode around all of Rome - I would really recommend this! The Trastevere area is handy to everything with great restaurants. Lastly, the staff here were fantastic, so helpful and friendly. They made our stay remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is the best place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisonleave
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the start of our holiday-wanted to be close to all the Rome sights, but not feel like we were staying in a hotel. This place is fantastic, own garden behind a wall from the hustle outside. Local small piazza is cheap drinking the late arvo away after big day out sightseeing(cafe on the corner as you walk down from hotel is the cheapest and best). Lots of local eateries and shops varying costs and styles (try the local restaurant that backs onto the hotel, not fancy but cheap). Crepe shop and ice cream parlour around the corner is the best!!! Breakfast at the hotel (was included for our deal) is excellent and can keep you going all day, and the free food put on in the bar to have pre-going out for dinner, is a meal in itself. Hotel (separate rooms with verandah/suites some with upstairs second room, central small garden to sit) is well located and it is super safe to walk around at night locally (OK , this hotel is not near the grotty area of the main train station thank god- but it is only 7-10 euros by taxi away) . There are parts of rome you dont walk through at night (hey it is a big city like any other) , so be careful if you are sightseeing at night on foot. Getting around- I have a disability & managed to walk to half the sights, caught the GREEN/GOLD hop on/off bus which runs nearby for some farther sights, and when we ended up at the opposite side of the city at Villa Borgheses after a big day out walking (fantastic parklands this place is a must when you get overloaded with culture), the taxi back was only 15 euros well worth it. We will definitely go back to Hotel sante maria- it is not the cheapest hotel, but definitely worth paying the extra. The 3D cinema place with the history of Rome sounds daggy, but definitely worth seeing, at the beginning of your holiday to make sense of the historical significance and timeline of the sights you will be visiting. Even if you want to visit the vatican independently, I cant emphasise how so much easier and quicker it was to book a date and tour with the offical vatican website before you go. They just slot you into one of the local tour people and you join up with a few groups, but the actual guide we had was an artist who gave a fantastic tour of the main areas without any religion and at the end we were left to explore further as you wished. Get up early in morning and visit nearby Piazza Camp De Fiore markets, Piazza Navona is nearby, empty in the morning, street performers during the day busy with tourists, expensive cafes for food, but is cheap to sit and have a local beer and people watch and take in the atmosphere, artists come out at night. Also good ATMs and bank in Navona Piazza. When out ask for local beer or wine at any cafe or bar as it is cheap and quite quaffable, and you are always served a small bowl of chips, olives and nuts (enough to get you by). If you are considering going to Pompei or Sorrento, do it as a separate trip from Rome as it is too far out. We did a weekend stopover via train to Sorrento to see these sights and am so glad we did. Car hire- DO NOT hire a car in Rome or any city even Sorrento. We hired a car leaving sorrento to go up to Chianti. While driving the countryside is challenging but wonderful experience, it takes HOURS to travel a few kilometres to get out of town- best to check where the car pickup is and get out of town at an airport which are usualy a little way out but you dont have to take 2hours to get on your way going through traffic.Do not accept an upgrade, you want the smallest car possible as the larger cars do not fit through some streets!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TERitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here prior to moving on to Tuscany. This was a marvelous hotel with a charming location. The staff was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: BCresident
Reviews.Content: I am not sure about all this great reviews which is why I stayed here? We like to walk, and it is a long walk to the sights. I even thought it was too far and I am fit. The neighborhood is so cool though, altho if you feel uneasy and like to be around other tourists, it may not be the right fit. The staff was not super friendly as some have said. In fact when I went to pay, the girl was mad cause I did not have cash. I had to walk to two bank machines to try to get cash which made us late for the train. To top it off both machines were not working, so I was sweating and ended up paying visa any how. The rooms are clean. The breakfast was average. The cappicinos were great! The cost from the train should be around 12 euros but the taxi drivers like to charge more, 30 euros. I honestly did like the neighborhood but was slightly uneasy at times, thought the rooms were clean, too far to walk, not overly friendly staff ( although this seemed average for Italy)' and breaky was only average. Would I stay her again? No, I would stay closer to the sights. Probably around trevi fountain area. Was I mad I picked this property? No, it certainly made me explore more parts of Rome because of the walking.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: grabrush
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in an excellent part of Rome if you want to be out of the hussle and bussle. All tourist sites accessible within 25 mins walking. Trastrevere offers many choices of local eateries at very reasonable prices. The hotel is a gated site and the courtyard offers a wonderful area to relax after a full day sightseeing.My husband and I would definitely stay here again, Wifi is good in your rooms and breakfast offers a satisfactory start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Rudas
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel! I highly recommend it! The location in Trastevere is absolutely perfect. In fact, I wouldn't stay anywhere in Rome accept this perfect, charming neighborhood with it's tiny streets and quaint cafes. The rooms are spacious, bathrooms are modern and spotless. The best thing about this place is the garden courtyard filled with flowers and orange trees. It is a little oasis that waits for you after a busy day of sightseeing. You can have a glass of wine, read, rest or visit with other guests. It's just great. The staff is helpful and friendly and the breakfast is wonderful. I'm a big breakfast eater and they serve eggs everyday...not the norm in Italy. I can't get by on pastries and coffee so I appreciated the good start to my day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean806325
Reviews.Content: Really easy to get to on public transport. Friendly, helpful staff. Great location. Basic but comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfast. Lovely outdoor sitting area. Trendy neighbourhood with wide variety of eating places. Easy to walk to major attractions. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: theitalianeleven
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming, warm, friendly, spotlessly clean and a great value. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The staff was helpful and the breakfast and midday snacks were great.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat... for the most part”
Reviews.Author: SarahS007
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, secluded little oasis in the heart of Trastevere, close the main streets and piazzas but tucked away with a lovely, orange tree filled garden courtyard. You don't even feel like you're in a major city when you are inside. The breakfast buffet was one of the nicest I've seen in Italy - lots of variety and everything was delicious. The room was spacious, celan and comfortable. My only complaint was that my particular room backed up to the hotel office and there was some sort of air duct that carried all of the conversations into my room well into the evening - muffled enough not to be understandable but loud enough to be annoying. I was too tired to go complain, but I recommend you ask for a room further away from the front door or be prepared to be disturbed by the sounds. Still, I give it big "thumbs up" and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: RHfromNYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here whenever we travel to Rome. The hotel couldn't be more charming. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The Trastevere neighborhood is ideal: close to the river, a lovely piazza right up the street, a movie theater that uses English subtitles, and lots of wine bars!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: NYarch17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is indeed an oasis in one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Rome. The courtyards are the public spaces of this hotel, and with gravel, orange trees and tables, and umbrellas for shade, they make the hotel a lovely home in Rome. The rooms are average in size with comfortable beds, and as noted in other reviews, full baths with tubs! We have stayed in both the regular rooms and the junior suite, and been happy with each. The breakfast is fabulous, and the happy hour snacks are just right at 5 pm to hold you over until dinner. The staff is attentive, and the desk attendants are especially helpful at making reservations for taxis, dinner, etc. And will always know the best way to get you to your destinations!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: phpmd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything it purports to be in it's web site.This is a single story hotel whose rooms are grouped around a tree shaded courtyard where one can enjoy leisure time and the excellent complete breakfast provided with the room,.The tranquility of country life is here yet one is only a three minute walk to buses and taxis.The neighborhood is replete with good,inexpensive restaurants and full of life. The people at the front desk are fluent in English ,friendly,and helpful.The staff in the breakfast room provide excellent service.The rooms are of average size,and immaculate,and the airconditioning and plumbing are first rate.We have travelled extensively for many years in Europe and have found nothing comparable in a large city. In the next year we are planning to return to Rome for a week and will definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with two teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Meems060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in May 2011. It was a great location because we could walk to many sites within 20 minutes and during the evening Trastevere had lots of fun and affordable dining options. Our teens loved the vibe in this old part of the city. We had two rooms sharing a bath--spacious and comfortable, although the A/C worked much better in one room than the other. The set up of this hotel is great with a mostly one floor of rooms and a central courtyeard filled with fragrant orange trees. It was a quiet sanctum in a bustling city. The delicious breakfast buffet was great!

Reviews.Title: “A charming oasis in a bustling Rome neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tacpccs
Reviews.Content: The staff was tremendously helpful from the beginning through the end of our stay and even took the time to meet and spend some time with every family member. The daily breakfast buffet under the orange trees was actually one of the highlights of our Rome experience. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The surrounding area of Trastevere was a cool location close to all of the tourist spots without being in the middle of them. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We all enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: peter-beagle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a delightful, cheery & quiet place to stay, tucked away in a small street in Trastevere, Antonio (manager) is molto simpatico -- friendly and very helpful. The hotel is not a fancy place, but quite comfy enough, with a good breakfast buffet, which you can eat in the lovely courtyard full of orange trees. The colorful neighborhood is great for walking around, lots of shops & outdoor restaurants that stay open late. You can easily walk to other sites in the city, though we mostly took cabs to centro to save time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sbellone
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite place to stay in Trastevere. The location is absolutely perfect and the grounds are beautiful. It's right outside of the main piazza (Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere), yet once inside of the main gate it's nice and quiet. The courtyard area is very peaceful, which is a nice relief from the chaos one finds in the tourist areas of the city. The hotel staff was very nice and attentive. They were even able to provide us with a plug adapter when we found that the one we brought was broken.

Reviews.Title: “The best! The only place I'll stay when I come back to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: I_Prefer_To_Fly_Home
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel Santa Maria for 7 days and then had to switch to another hotel in the heart of Rome for the last 3 days of my stay in Rome. What a contrast! I loved the location of The Hotel Santa Maria and the wonderful courtyard. It was so relaxing to be able to get away from the hustle and bustle and tons of tourists and just relax outside in the courtyard. The surrounding area was much less touristy. Service was great. You will not go wrong if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil setting in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NYCJOB
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 spent 4 days in Rome running around to cover all the historic tourist sights, and what a pleasure it was to return to the hotel in the evening to enjoy the quiet under the orange trees. The hotel is famous for the happy hour in the evenings (food only) and you can buy your drinks at the bar. One evening the bartender did not show up, so they closed the bar. We ventured out to a salumaria (italian deli) , and we orderd bread, wine, cheese and olives and brought it back and sat under the trees with our meal. The front desk was very helpfull in all of our requests, as far as tourist sites, taxi's and local restaruants. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel BUT wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: DBSTexas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Santa Maria with a group of friends. First, the positives: The rooms are bright and clean The location is terrific for walking and touring (but difficult for transporation to find and get to) Garden area is lovely and the hors d'oeuvres happy hour was great The beds were actually Kings but be aware in the quad it is a set of bunkbeds and one of them has a 3/4 lenght mattress. Now the bad: Somone took my make up. It was in my make up bag, in my carry bag under a table. I complained at the desk and they said that probably it "had been moved" when they were cleaning. It wasn't anywhere visible to be moved. When I went to bed that night I found 2 of the pieces under the bedspread. What maid makes a bed with" things" in it? (and only half of it was returned) . I might have let it go until my friends started talking about "strange" occurances. One person's jewelry bag was missing from inside her suitcase. Luckily they found it under the middle of the bed. Another friend took her things from the safe and then couldn't find her envelope with the money in it. She found it under the liner in the inside of the safe. How did it get there? One other person had a pendant missing off of a chain. So on the basis that there appears to be someone dishonest working there I would NOT recommend staying there. It's really a shame because otherwise I would have had high praise for this hotel. You must be able to trust a hotel to recommend it. I am a Travel Agent so I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and very safe”
Reviews.Author: Sandy1152
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Santa Maria was very friendly and helpful. Someone was at the desk 24 hours a day and always willing to assist guests with plans, dinner suggestions, travel tips. The breakfast was very good. The serving staff was fast and courteous. I would recommend Hotel Santa Maria to anyone coming to Rome for a clean, safe and very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Won't confirm reservations after numerous attempts to contact”
Reviews.Author: KimC1234
Reviews.Content: This is quite unbelievable! I made my reservation for my family in October 2010 for a planned vacation June 2011. They quickly confirmed my reservation. I recently wrote to confirm our reservation and can not get them to respond to my emails. They offered shuttle service and I have sent over 7 emails to no avail. I am going to cancel my reservation with them and make a reservation at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: laurguardian
Reviews.Content: The room was spotless, sunny, airy and comfortable. The orange tree filled courtyards were our haven to relax and re-energize ourselves for our next foray into our explorations of Rome. The breakfasts were satisfying. The cappuccino was excellent. At 5:30 every afternoon there was an aperitivo that included the best bruschetta we have ever had and our favorite part of the Hotel Santa Maria, Giampietro. We looked forward every day to chatting with him and hearing from him suggestions for our outtings the next day. We found the location of the hotel to be perfectly convenient. We were able to easily walk to buses and trolleys and even to many final destinations, such as the forum, colosseum and vatican. Also, the piazza Santa Maria, which is only two blocks from the hotel, and the rest of the neighborhood immediately adjacent to the hotel, is full of wonderful restaurants and shops. The single, very minor, criticism we had of our entire experience at the hotel, was that the office staff, while helpful, dealt with us in a condescending manner. The waitstaff, housekeeping staff, and as mentioned above, Giampietro, were all friendly and wonderful. During eight days of exploring many nooks and crannies of Rome we saw no where else that we would have rather stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nearby all the top places, and lots of very good restaurants in walking distance of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Peterspladsen
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull at the reception. Small room but ok bath and toilet. Perfect location in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely thrilled with this gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: snowzoneNY
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay with my family of four. We could not be happier with the location, room, friendly staff and lovely breakfast. Rome is a crowded, busy town and coming home to Trastavere and its' hidden oasis of Santa Maria Hotel was the perfect end to each evening. By European standards our room was huge with a separate room for the children to sleep together. The breakfast was delicious and in a beautiful setting. The hotel grounds are charming and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. Free wifi in the rooms. The Trastavere neighborhood is awash with alleys and streets full of small restaurants and shops waiting to be explored. The nearby square is a center of activity but not as loud or busy as the bigger ones across the river. From the hotel you can easily walk to all Rome attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Can't trust a hotel that doesn't return emails or phone calls for weeks”
Reviews.Author: triceratops111
Reviews.Content: Based on ecstatic reviews, I eagerly sent a booking request to Hotel Santa Maria via their website. This was literally over a month ago -- to book a room for September for a wedding I'm attending. I received an auto-email confirming they'd received the request and to await their response, and then... nothing for three weeks. I called and spoke with front desk folk who've assured me I'd get an email confirmation soon, but just in case, I should call during midday hours and speak with their booking office. I waited two weeks and after receiving no confirmation, decided to stay awake until the wee hours of the morning, Pacific Time, to call their booking office during their office hours. Over the course of an hour and several attempted calls, I got nothing but an endlessly repeating "we'll be with you shortly" message, hold music, and then a sudden disconnection. Upon finally speaking to the front desk person, I was told the booking office was busy and to call back in "ten minutes." I did, and got another endless hold music session and a disconnection. I slept a few hours, called back -- and got through to the front desk immediately! Problem? The booking office was again closed. I started explaining my situation to the front desk clerk... who testily interrupted me to take another call. Hold music again. I waited two minutes and finally hung up. I've booked hotels big and small in most of the major cities of Italy and never had to wait more than perhaps three days for a response to a booking request. It's entirely possible that I'll finally get a confirmation from these people, but between this and the reviwer below who had booking problems with them, I have little confidence in the hotel at this point and probably wouldn't accept the offer anyway. If it is as good a place as the below reviews indicate, it's a shame they'd hide it with such unresponsive booking service.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: willwork4wine
Reviews.Content: This is sort of the Roman version of an average American motel. Two beds in a room. Clean. Small bathroom. Good wifi service. OK breakfast. Lovely courtyard. Nice staff. The neighborhood immediately around this hotel is very disappointing. It was the first time in Rome that we were reminded that the modern world -especially big cities -- can be ugly places. Beautiful Italian buildings covered in graffiti including the F bomb in English, drunk/homeless laying in doorways a block away, beggars shaking filthy paper cups at you for change. The hotel is in a locked, gated courtyard for security. On the positive side, the Piazza Santa Maria for which the hotel is named had musicians playing throughout the day and the sound of the church bells every 30 minutes was fine. We did not feel it was worth the 280 Euros per night advertised. We did better with an apartment near the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - again!”
Reviews.Author: JoFri
Reviews.Content: Once again we visited Rome, once again we stayed at Hotel Santa Maria and once again a very enjoyable experience. It's located in the middle of everything and still quiet and relaxing. The service was great and everything just worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Admin - Lost Booking”
Reviews.Author: dwilliams184
Reviews.Content: All else aside, it is probably most important that a hotel can keep track of its bookings in the first place to ensure guests have a place to stay. I reserved a room in February for 6 nights in April for my wife and I. I received confirmation for booking number 406/2011 on 3 February from Hotel Santa Maria. To be cautious I even confirmed the reservation several weeks later and inquired about tours and other services. I received confirmation on this as well from Hotel Santa Maria. Upon arrival at the hotel, the receptionist had no knowledge of our booking. I had printed out their confirmations, but they were full. To her credit the receptionist on duty that night quickly found us a room in another hotel for some, but not all, of the nights we were in Rome. Through a patchwork of 2 hotels and 4 rooms over 6 nights we were lucky enough to have accomodation, but there was of course much wasted time changing rooms, hotels, repacking etc. It is understandable that a booking could be lost or not entered by mistake, though it seems less and less an occurrence with the advent of computers. It is not understandable that the hotel did not flag this up when I later reconfirmed my reservation. Had it been the busy season in Rome we may well have had to turn around and go home. One would think that there would be some simple controls in place to ensure that the administration was sound and guests with confirmed (and reconfirmed) reservations could check in in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “A gem - helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: B_BStone
Reviews.Content: Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. The staff even prepared a little goody bag for us when we had to leave early one morning before breakfast was served. They recommended great restaurants nearby and made reservations for events as needed. The hotel is away from the hustle of the streets of Trastevere which makes it a very peaceful spot in a busy city. It's in a great location to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely peaceful secret oasis amongst the madness”
Reviews.Author: monkeyLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: great location for sightseeing and restaurants bars etc. Very pleased with Hotel which has a warm charm about it. Breakfast and evening snacks were great. All staff except the main reception staff were very pleasant. Found reception staff to be pretty unfriendly and not very helpfull which let the Hotel down. Would be nice to be able to make a cup of tea or coffee in your room. The bar should be open till 10 each evening but closes a couple of hours earlier which was dissapointing and we couldnt even get a warm drink.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm and charm in wonderful gritty Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: LexidocNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here in March. Trastevere is a gritty ancient part of town with great energy and spirit (For those of you who know NYC I would say it is Rome's East Village). We love the location but it can be noisy and a bit run down. This hotel was once a convent and the rooms face the lovely garden cloister filled with orange trees.. The entrance is through a locked gate down a gravel path so you are far from the noise and bustle of Trastevere but still right in the middle of it all. We had a duplex with sitting area (could be second bedroom to accommodate an additional traveller) down and sleeping and bath up. Plenty of storage for clothing and personal possessions. Furnishings are simple, comfortable and functional. Good bed and plumbing. The breakfast is generous and delicious served in a lovely salon. In the same salon early evening there are free antipasti and you can buy cocktails or wine, also tea and espresso. We bought a bottle of wine and drank it over the two nights we were there. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Would definitely stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel, right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: grothius
Reviews.Content: We felt very secure inside the hotel gate and it was a retreat from the busy outside world. We were well looked after and well adviced. Bring good walking shoes and walk to all the attractions - they are all over. The neighbourhood is the real ancient Rome with narrow streets, a lot of restaurants and a lot of friendly people even though it was outside the tourist season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: edualq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Santa Maria only for two nights, but had a very good impression. The hotel is well situated in a side street of the Piazza Santa Maria , the heart of the Trastevere neighbourhood. The location is convenient to explore Rome by foot and (in my opinion) has the added bonus of being in a very pleasant area , especially during the day, where the streets are calm in comparison to the historic center of the city. Many restaurants and bars nearby. In the weekends, during the night, It might get annoying because of young people and turists getting drunk , but the hotel is well protected from the noise. One thing that I like is the fact that all rooms are at ground level, facing a courtyard with orange trees. I noticed some bycicles for rent, which was a nice touch too. The room (triple) had a good size, a flower themed decoration and an excellent bathroom, with a bathtub and a real shower. Breakfast was nice but can be improved with more organic choices, specially regarding cereals. Overall , Hotel Santa Maria is a fine option in Rome .

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again--charming, simple elegance near vibrant neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: abfrecka
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Hotel Santa Maria di Travestere from the moment we arrived for a five day stay in Rome. Orange trees ornament the charming rustic courtyard. The staff is kind, polite, quiet, and unobtrusive. You can get a driver to meet you at the airport to take you here. A long courtyard with a gate leads to the busy winding streets of Travestere, and to me, as soon as one left the streets to go to one's room, one left the noise and vibrant life behind for peace, quiet, and rest. Breakfast of many choices (croissants, fresh cheesecake, cereals and yogurt, juices, water and hot drinks). Small but sufficient and clean rooms overlooking courtyards. Everywhere you look in Travestere, not to mention the courtyard of this hotel, there is a picture. Location pretty central to everything, and I walked everywhere (Janiculum, Vatican, Palatine, Forum, Campo Fiori, Via Veneto, Piazza Populo, Piazza Novona, etc.) I have already recommended this hotel to relatives who are travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very quiet, friendly staff, nice building”
Reviews.Author: DMANNSUk
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that it rained most of the time during my stay, it was still a lovely hotel to stay in. The location is just great, its quiet and the staff are happy to help with anything. I liked the bar, my room was very good. I just wish it hadnt rained so much and I could have sat outside in the lovely courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballavilley
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was just as good second time round. Very comfortable although quite noisy at times as other residents and cleaning staff don't seem to be aware that people might be trying to sleep at 8am! However, the staff are friendly and efficient. The location is fabulous - this is a wonderful part of Rome, full of character. I hope to return to Rome again and this will be the first hotel I try to book.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Jones77
Reviews.Content: This was the best possible place to spend our time in Rome. It was in the perfect location, an easy distance to walk to all main attractions e.g Coliseum, Vatican, Pantheon. There was also many lovely restaurants around the hotel which were very easy to find, we found the first ourselves and then reception recommended the second to us most kindly. So being in the perfect spot meant we didn't have to take the bus anywhere! We had a lovely warm suite which we all shared and it was fantastic space-wise. The staff were friendly and very helpful and breakfast was fantastic and delicious (especially the hot chocolate). By Emma Jones age 12

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just a little on the noisy side!”
Reviews.Author: killerqueen327
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for one night before staying with a friend for the rest of my trip to Rome. The location was great, and the whole place was beautiful. The staff was very helpful, and the rooms were clean and comfortable, even though a little small. As some other travelers commented, the walls were pretty thin. Not realizing this at first, I was skyping with my parents, and not being particularly quiet, and my British neighbor knocked on my door and said she could hear every word...oops! (Sorry about that again, if you read this!) To be honest though, I'd stay again. The pros definitely outweighed the cons for this hotel. Breakfast was great, too! Thanks to Antonio at the front desk for all of his help =)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but very noisy...”
Reviews.Author: DHTS01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over Valentines. The hotel is in a lovely setting; beautiful courtyard, the room was immaculately clean, good breakfast and the breakfast staff could not do enough to help, however, it was noisy most of the time, and especially so in the evenings. Whenever anybody walked past our door, it sounded like they were actually in the same room. The walls between the rooms were also quite thin and we could hear everything that was going on in the next room. We didn't find the bells from the nearby Basilica a problem - after a short while we got used to them. Also, when we checked in, the man at the reception desk retained our passports all day, which meant a day of sight seeing without our passports on us, which I didn't feel particularly comfortable about. I would recommend staying here but recommend taking earplugs and perhaps also some sleeping tablets.

Reviews.Title: “I´d recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajmanunited
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay because the hotel is close to everything and the personal kept my room serviced well. My only problem was the church bell that seems to sound many times a day but other than that, it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “lovely neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: travellovetravel
Reviews.Content: this hotel is charming and the neighborhood is amazing. not touristy at all, just very chill, casual, laid back and younger. cute little cobblestone streets, great little gelato places nearby. the breakfast was tasty. and the staff was very friendly. the room we stayed in was a little on the smaller side, but then again, im probably just used to larger american rooms. it didn't matter, because we didn't spend too much time at the hotel. there was so much to do in rome. we spent our days and nights just walking through the streets and often sitting down for a glass of wine and pasta, and overall just enjoying ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tanskybaum
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was clean and spacious, the hotel staff gerenally helpful and jolly. Breakfast was served in the Bar aera and the hotel did cater for our coeliac relative. The bar was not open every day which was disapointing but overall we can recommend the Hotel Santa Maria. Trastevere is a great aera, away from the noisy traffic but all monuments and attractions are within walking distance. Some lovely restaurants nearby. We particularly liked "La Scala"

Reviews.Title: “perfect location & wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler444
Reviews.Content: Walking distance (for hearty walkers) to everywhere and close to bus and tram lines for those days when your feet need a rest. Fantastic neighborhood. Spanking clean room with lovely bath fixtures, the staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved so much about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: symdd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! An intimate, cozy place--loved the orange-tree courtyard. Front desk personnel was most helpful. Cleaning/cooking staff wonderful--very clean rooms. Breakfasts very filling and tasty--the scrambled eggs and cappuccino were my favorites. Neighborhood not touristy. 15-minute walk to the Colosseum; 25 min. to St. Peter's. They arranged driver for airport pickup and dropoff. Bells of neighboring Church could be sleep-disruptive for light sleepers, but earplugs blocked the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ESVancouver604
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms were small but very clean. The people were nice. The location was excellent, especially for walking around/coming home to at night, with cafe's and restaurants. The breakfast was excellent and the ambiance was very nice. My partner would have liked a seating area in the room, which there wasn't, so if you want to read or write, you either have to lay on the bed or go to their breakfast/bar room. (which is very comfortable and has lots of tables as well as a computer). The wifi worked well. We lucked out with the weather and spent very little time in the rooms. The bathroom was roomy, excellent showers.

Reviews.Title: “what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mikey8400
Reviews.Content: lovely courtyard, good little bar, generous breakfast, helpful staff, all in all I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome. Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere is for friends and lovers – of Rome”
Reviews.Author: green_h
Reviews.Content: Dear friends and lovers of Rome We have found this remarkable quiet and beautifull hotel in the Heart of Rome from where you easily can reach nearly every place of interest by walking over the bridges. Maybe you might take a ride in the daytime on one of the free bycycles that you can borrow from the nice young people in the reception and make your way along the banks of the river. Enjoy your room in this clean and neat hotel in the Siesta-time and and have a taste of Rome from the five o’clock buffet accompanied with a glass of white wine before starting the adventures of the evening. Enjoy the silent and comfortable garden of the hotel with a drink or two in the soft black night before going to bed. All you can hear from the outside are the quarterstrokes from the clock of Santa Maria in Trastevere. And then you can have a restfull sleep untill next morning, where full breakfast allready is served under the orangetrees in the yard. A new day starts, and new adventures are awaiting. Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere is for friends and lovers – of Rome Niels and Inge-Lene, Grindsted, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Simple accomodations; great location”
Reviews.Author: klegbert
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is located on a quiet street (almost an alley) in Trastevere. It is within a 5 minute walk of the Ponte Sisto, the pedestrian bridge crossing the Tiber.
