Neighborhood restaurants abound and it is a fun area to explore. The hotel staff were very accommodating, helping us every evening with reservations. There also is a nightly buffet serving little appetizers (focaccia, olives, etc), which you can eat in the hotel's breakfast room or, weather permitting, in the courtyard (gravel, not grass). Drinks, however, must be purchased. You enter the hotel through a locked gate through which you must be buzzed in. Down the drive the reception area is on the right and is attached to the rooms. The rooms surround the courtyard. A separate building on the left houses the breakfast room and "lounge." The accommodations are very simple -- almost downscale American motel; the bathroom is adequate. The furniture is blond wood - our room had a small built in desk and built in cabinet/dresser. Room size is average -- enough room to move around but not huge. All the rooms open to an outside walkway (as do the windows; the hotel is one story) so often hear people talking as they walk past. If you want luxury, this is not the place. However, the staff is exceptionally helpful and the location is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Accomodations in the Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: redsmolka
Reviews.Content: This was the first of three hotels in which we stayed during our recent trip to Italy. Hotel Hotel Santa Maria is a charming location, located right smack in the middle of the Trastevere area on the other side of the river. We liked that it was away from the hustle and bustle but still provided plenty of ambiance and fun. While it is not particularly close to a Metro stop, it does provide the opportunity to take 20-45 minute walks to reach most of Rome's main sights, which is what we did. There is also a taxi station within a 5 minute walk. Our stay was great - enjoyed the breakfast and evening buffet. Plenty of good service, from making museum reservations to recommendations in the local area. Bed was comfortable and the room was great for our needs. Staff was very accommodating and helpful in the pre-planning and during the stay. The only minor downside to the stay was the frequency of the bells from the neighboring Santa Maria Church every 15 minutes. It didn't bother me, but I could see how it might impact some travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Quaint and Lovely Part of the City”
Reviews.Author: footloose1710
Reviews.Content: An exceedingly charming hotel, set in the cobbled alleys of Trastevere offers warm, friendly service and comfortable clean rooms, all set around a small courtyard full of orange trees. The first night we stayed in the Junior Suite as there were no triple rooms available, We then moved to the triple room which was spacious and equally comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was large, consisting of eggs, cheese, cold meats, cereals, juices, fresh fruit, breads, pastries and pies and excellent espresso coffee or any other hot drink you wanted- more than enough to fortify you for a long day of sight seeing! The happy hour had a small selection of tasty bites and a good selection of wines. Trastevere has a large number of very reasonably priced, good bars and restaurants which are frequented by locals. All these are within very easy walking distance from the hotel. We found a small gelataria about 5 minutes from the hotel where we had the best dark chocolate gelato that we tasted anywhere in Italy. The hotel is close to bus stops and tram stops making it easy to get to all the sites in Rome. One thing you should however bear in mind. The alleys of Trastevere are very narrow and difficult to navigate in a big car especially on a Friday or Saturday night. There are so many cars parked all over making it impossible to drive through, unless you are familiar with the place. This made it very difficult for us to get to the hotel on Friday night when we arrived from Tuscany. We had to stop the car a fair distance away and wheel our baggage down the streets to the hotel. Our rental car driver, who was from Rome also had some trouble finding the place on another occasion. Good instructions and map on the website would certainly help in this respect. The first bit of inconvenience not withstanding we had a lovely stay at the hotel. The final really touching gesture was the beautiful book on Rome that they gifted us just as we were leaving. Thank you all of you at the hotel for everything that you did to make our stay comfortable. We take back beautiful memories of a lovely week in Rome- a holiday of a lifetime, a real dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ,great location”
Reviews.Author: licahil
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting Rome.Located in Trastevere this hotel offers clean rooms which are reasonable priced for Rome.We stayed in a double room and we were very happy. The breakfast is good but off course in Trastevere there are a lot of restaurants or pizzerias.About 10-15 minutes to Vatican city also close to Isola Tiberina.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “can't think of anywhere better to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: tomw_n
Reviews.Content: We went for the book direct, get-a-discount rate and were overwhelmed by the perfect location, friendly staff, reasonable bar prices, cleanliness of rooms and pleasant vibe of the place. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SPJ17
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Santa Maria was generally pleasant and comfortable. Although we had booked a standard double room, we were in a family room with a loft, which felt rather barn like for two of us and if the weather had not been fairly warm, it could have been a cold room and bathroom. The decor was a little drab. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite good, selection of cereal, cakes, meats, fruit, cheese and fruit juice, and good hot drinks with waiter service, even offered refills. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful setting; a true Italian experience.”
Reviews.Author: mdew8
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about Hotel Santa Maria, in particular, the amazing staff. They were eager to make recommendations, all of which exceeded our expectations. We loved having appetizers in the evening (complimentary) while chatting with other travelers. The staff was also very knowledgeable in the wine served and how it paired with various foods. The hotel proved to be a great starting place for a number of tourist destinations or simply wandering the local streets of Trastevere. A definite must!

Reviews.Title: “Charming retreat in busy Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: family5_10
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal here for several days stay in August, though we did have to change rooms twice. That was a little work on our end, but the staff did a fairly good job moving our bags around. Upside was that we got to sample four different kinds of rooms--a family room with a loft and one bath; a family room with two separate bedrooms and one and a half baths (perfect); and then two rooms, one with a queen bed for us and another with a large bedroom, a separate single and one bath for the three kids. Every location and set up was comfortable. As many people have noted, the air conditioning was adequate, but just. The garden courtyard was lovely for breakfast and drinks in the evening. The friendly, always helpful staff gave reasonable, if somewhat middle of the road dining recommendations. It was great to be able to retreat to the separate indoor "breakfast room," which also had a bar, seating, games and a computer. Oh, and there are bikes. Only regret was that we didn't use them till the last day. Totally lovely stay and we''d definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but did not live up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: RRTAdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and property, but the rooms were smaller than expected with some dated pieces. The gentlemen at the desk, Antonio, was less than enthusiastic to help out. When we checked in during the morning they stated our luggage would be moved to our room when it was ready. When we returned at dinnertime they were still right where we left them in the outdoor hallway by reception. We had such a great experience at their sister hotel, we expected more at the larger location.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of quiet.”
Reviews.Author: CandaceSpring
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel. Room was good. Requested a superior double and was given a regular double, however, the room was very nice. The garden area is an oasis of quiet beauty, a lovely place to retire to after a day of being out and about in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a perfect honeymoon! :)”
Reviews.Author: mrtore
Reviews.Content: Got married to my lovely wife on wednesday and went to Rome on our honeymoon the next thuesday! Had five lovely days in the Santa Maria Hotel and absolutely loved it! It is quiet, romantic, has a lovely staff and a great breakfast! And a lovely complimentary buffet every day with delicious small sandwiches! And its also located in central Trastevere, close to many restaurants, bars and delicassy-stores with the best ham i`ve ever tasted! I will recommend The Santa Maria Hotel to everybody who are going to Rome!! Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, marginal service”
Reviews.Author: Runner_Girl42_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely location. The rooms are small but clean. The hotel arranged for a tour at the Vatican but told us the wrong time so a group of us spent an hour standing on the street corner waiting. One of the serving staff spent every morning on the internet checking facebook and it felt like you were intruding if you asked her for a cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: MazTravel
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Rome, Trastevere has become our favourite spot - local feel with great restaurants, bars, bakeries, fresh food shops and easy walking distance to all the must-sees in Rome. We've now found the best place to stay in Trastevere. This hotel has everything. Amazingly quiet, comfortable rooms, helpful staff, good breakfasts and great bar. Sitting in the leafy courtyard with a bottle of prosecco and complimentary antipasto treats was a perfect way to end a day of sightseeing and prepare for an evening in Rome. Take advantage of the pre-arranged transport from the airport. Our driver proudly introduced us to his home city and gave us some insider tips for our forthcoming travels in southern Italy. The price of Hotel Santa Maria is on par with similarly classed hotels elsewhere in Rome, but the location and value for money here can't be beaten. We wouldn't stay anywhere else now that we've found this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PetraAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The bed and shower are the best we have found in Italy so far. The garden is very beautiful and a lot of attention is given to detail which is great to see. The location is great too, in Trastevere near the river. Lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby and still it is nice and peaceful in the hotel. The only downside during our stay was some works being done closeby (neighbours maybe?) who were drilling all day but I think this was probably just that day. The hotel is slightly expensive for what it is , but then this is Rome so what can you expect. All in all, a very good find and highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Paul2143
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel. Beautiful, quiet setting. Great location. Excellent breakfast. Nice complimentary afternoon hors d'oeuvres, friendly, helpful staff. I would return to Rome just to be able to stay at the Santa Maria again!

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path superior hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Yakprof
Reviews.Content: After a week and a half of travelling across Italy, my friend and I spent our last night in Rome at the Hotel Santa Maria. This enclave is enchanting and welcoming. Although the taxi driver gave up trying to find this hidden gem, Marlena quickly came to our rescue and guided us the short distance to the gated property. Our room was spotless, spacious and comfortable. Breakfast the following morning was the best we had experienced across three other accommodations (including 2 5 star hotels). The food and drink was impeccably fresh, interesting and varied. Trestevere is an ancient and fascinating neghborhood that should appeal to those looking for something authentic and unique. I would love to spend additional time here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GillyMac99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a star find. It is located in Trastavere, within walking distance of most of the major tourist attractions - Vatican, Coliseum etc. The area has a lively night life with a good atmosphere, though not noisy - loads of lovely restaurants! The hotel is small - about 19 rooms - located around a courtyard where breakfast and a complimentary buffet is served each day. The staff were very friendly; the rooms spotlessly clean and comfortable. We had a lovely stay and would love to return there,

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: corluc
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was a great way to experience Rome. A beautiful, peaceful oasis. It was walking distance to most of the main sights in Rome. Friendly, helpful staff. Very comfortable beds. Excellent food. We received a large breakfast and an late afternoon appetizer buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria rescued us!”
Reviews.Author: Sant_Ubaldo
Reviews.Content: Because we had to evacuate the apartment we'd rented in Rome, we needed to find a place to stay, fast, for our last night in the city. HSM took us in without a reservation due to a cancellation that day, and the very nice people working the desk knocked 20E off the rate. I couldn't tell you how the accommodations compare to other hotels at the same price, but for us, it was totally worth it to be treated with courtesy and given a quiet, immaculate and very comfortable room. We were also given good information about getting to the train station the next day amidst the transit strike. If we'd known we were going to stay there, we would have loved to take advantage of the bike rental, too.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel in the heart of Rome with great access to all the sites to see.”
Reviews.Author: FJL045
Reviews.Content: A little tough to find but within walking distance of the Vatican and Colliseum. There are great restaurants in the area and lots of nightlife. We booked through Goawaytravel.com and our agent was Jane Wright and she had stayed at the hotel and recommended it. We went online and looked at it and it wasn't a chain hotel which is what we wanted. The staff goes out of their way to accomodate you and help you get where you need to go and set up tours if thats what you need. The rooms were very clean and beds made and the room cleaned every day. In short, if I go to Rome again, I'll definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: Gotta_Love_Italy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip back to Rome in over 20 years and we were a little concerned with how to deal with the heat, noise and language issues. Fortunately we made Hotel Santa Maria our base. Right from the very first e-mail contact to our check-out the hotel was fantastic. Our rooms were clean, quiet and thank-fully cool due to the A/C. A wonderful breakfast was served in a courtyard with orange trees. After a full day exploring Rome, we relaxed under the trees with a glass of Chianti and home made bruchettas. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful - proving excellent recommendations for dinner - going so far one night as to suggest what we should order. The only small detraction was location - it is located on the edge of downtown Rome. However, tram line and bus service is close and convenient. The local neighborhood is also well worth exploring. There is no question that should we be back in Rome, we will try and stay at this hotel again. I only wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “A peacefull place with charm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Geneva6
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpfull The room had a very quiet and good quality climatisation, however we didn't need it most of the time and could open the window. The neighbour's bathrooms were a little bit noisy. The hotel is located within walking distance of most of Rom's monuments and it is surprising to find such a quiet place in the busy (at night) Trastavere The hotel has a bar end serves a very good breakfast, but is has no restaurant. This is not a problem, as in Trastavere, there are plenty of it. We liked most the location and service and least the people who are noisy when they go back to their rooms at night.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for 2 nights!”
Reviews.Author: Empion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after touring around Belgium and Sardinia for two weeks to end our trip before coming home to NY. This hotel is is a good location, literally steps away from the square in Trastevere, which is very charming area with plenty of restaurants, shops, and bars. The staff were very accommodating to any request we had. They also have a computer with free internet to use, which was a nice perk for us. It is also safe and enclosed by a gate, which you need to buzz to get in. The best feature of all, however, was that they allow their guests to use their free bicycles. Since we were there for only one full day (and a VERy hot day at that) the bicycles enabled us to tour most of Rome all in one day! In that heat by foot, we wouldn't have seen half as much so we were very pleased with our experience at Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable, terrific location, with some great extra's”
Reviews.Author: k1barns
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room with a king-size bed and bunk-bed singles. There was plenty of room for luggage, a small refrigerator to keep our drinks cold, and a good-sized bath. Very cheerful and comfortable; bathroom spotless; my son said the top bunk was a dusty (hence the good-not-excellent rating on cleanliiness) The rooms surround a courtyard where we had breakfast when weather allowed -- lovely! Good selection of food, too: Eggs, meats and cheeses, yogurt, cereal, bread, sweets, and fresh fruit. At 5:30, the bar serves delicious little appetizers, like bruscheta and bites of pizza, and the drinks are inexpensive. Free internet. Great location, just a block away from the (beautiful!) church of S. Maria in Trastevere, and the active, fun square in front of it. Tons of restaurants, bars, and gelateria in the neighborhood, and it's only a 15-minute walk to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, or the Roman forum. Even closer to the restaurants and stalls along the river. Trastevere is just great, and the Hotel Santa Maria is a great place to stay there. A few comments in the guest book were negative on the staff serving breakfast, and they were occasionally brusque but still responsive to any request, and the front desk folks are truly gracious helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria provided a lovely refuge.”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_B_Rockhound
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its garden is tucked away and felt like a hide-away from the heat and the activity of sight-seeing. Our family (quad) room was on two levels, and provided ample space for our two teenagers and ourselves. Staff were helpful and considerate. Navigating the enjoyable neighbourhood of Trastervere was a little challenging, but fun. Glad we had pre-booked an airport pick-up through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a gem alright”
Reviews.Author: dcbsas
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel based on the reviews and photos and it did not dissapoint. If you are looking for a luxurious place this is NOT the place. For casual relaxing comfort in beautiful surroundings in the heart of Rome it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, an oasis of calm in the chaos of Rome”
Reviews.Author: dartmoorgirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a wonderful place to stay for a few nights city break. It's well located and easy to walk to most of the main sites, it's also secluded and quiet at night. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the rooms were cool and very clean and breakfast was lovely, including strong italian coffee. The courtyard with it's orange trees is the perfect place to start or end the day. The hotel also puts on a small, free buffet in the early eveining which is great to go with cold beer from the bar. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What makes Hotel Santa Maria so good?”
Reviews.Author: OsloMusikant
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on these pages, and we were not disappointed. What makes Hotel Santa Maria so good? - Location: It´s in the middle of Trastevere with all the restaurants and the culture - Quietness: In the courtyard you can´t tell that you are in Rome - Great breakfast and afternoon buffet - Free and fast Internet The staff was very helpful. Will stay there again, I´m sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: car1nyc
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Santa Maria! The room was fantastic; clean and comfortable and cute. Staff was very friendly and helpful... and all spoke English. Complimentary breakfast under the orange trees was fantastic, as was the GREAT "wine time" that started at 5:30 PM, complete with loads of Roman snacks. Overall a great experience; would recommend it to anyone staying in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We were well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: ohnj
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, cool, clean room, excellent service, right in the heart of Trastevere. Felt like a little walled oasis in the middle of bustling Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jbradfordsmith
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was the best hotel we stayed in on our Europe trip. It's in a wonderful and lively location yet the hotel is quiet and peaceful. It has a wonderful courtyard in the middle of the property for eating and lounging. The breakfast every morning is wonderful and their scrambled eggs are the best in Italy! Every afternoon, they have appetizers in the courtyard. Our room was a "family room" with a king size bed and bunk beds for the kids. It was spacious, clean and quiet. The staff is wonderful, helpful and friendly. If you stay in Italy, don't miss the Hotel Santa Maria!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyThorpe
Reviews.Content: Excellent quiet hotel with good and friendly service, and surrounded by a wide selection of places to eat, drink and relax. Within walking distance of several of Rome's major attractions, but also close to good public transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: GiveandTake
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed 5 nights in the Suite Mansarda. We really enjoyed the Hotel Santa Maria. The neighborhood was active, interesting, exciting, and full of things to do at all hours. The service at the hotel was quite good. Breakfasts were filling, coffee was great. The suite was very comfortable for the four of us, though the ceiling is a bit low since it is a converted attic. Beds were comfy. The air conditioning was a bit strained to keep the place cool in the Roman summer heat, though. The hotel is in an enclave, so even though you are steps from the action, you are surrounded by quiet. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome and want to stay in the same wonderful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy!”
Reviews.Author: TVB07
Reviews.Content: The first day we arrived, I went outside my room, which was located on the 1st floor overlooking the back courtyard, for a smoke and noticed a man sitting in a window with a broken screen staring out at me. This window is located overhead the hotel at one of the villa's or apartments so it's not part of Santa Maria. Next to the window is 3 other windows shut closed by bricks and wood. The following day, I asked my husband if he wanted to sit out in the courtyard and he said, "Not in the back, saw a creepy guy in the window" and I said, yeah, I saw him too! The last night we were in the hotel, my husband awoke at 1am by the sound of something near our door so he got up and pushed the door closed, we evidently didn't double lock it. He saw a shadow go across the lighted courtyard, could of been another resident of the hotel? So he looked out the window and saw the creepy guy in the window with the torn screen sitting there staring out. We both watched him as he took his hand outside the screen and pulled it back (signaling someone? peeping tom?) and then looked left, up, down and around. We kept getting up to check, he was there for over 3 hours doing the same, looking around and sometimes smoking a cig. Finally he turned off the light of his room but came back to look around again for a long time! The next morning after we failed to get our requested wake-up call and was running late, I asked the front desk clerk about the guy in the window with the torn screen. He responded by looking down, avoiding eye contact with me and stating, he just sits there sometimes and smokes. Really?? Hmmm. I didn't question him further because it must be an issue with the hotel, must get complaints all the time? One more thing, the desk clerk lied to us about the difference between the hotel's private car to the airport for a rate of 55 euro's vs a city taxi, who's rate can be anything at all, not cut-rate. Later, we found out the the law in Rome is 40 euros from within the city walls to FCO for ALL taxi's! Not a place we will stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in a bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: NicoleJeannette122
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is wonderful! The location and surrounding neighborhood in Trastevere is the perfect place to seek refuge after a long day of exploration. Trastevere comes to life at night and the aromas from nearby restaurants are enticing. It appears to be the spot for locals and tourists alike. My husband, parents and I truly enjoyed Hotel Santa Maria because of the hospitality, beauty and of course amazing breakfast in the outside courtyard. Everything was easy from the minute we got there. Even making transportation connections from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to our cruise port was made easy by the hotel staff. I would say while the price seems a little expensive, our stay was made well worth it. Crossing the Tiber river at night to explore Piazza Navona was beautiful and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria Rocks”
Reviews.Author: soccerfan1984
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Hotel for four nights in June of 2010. Our experience was great. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the location because it was not in ancient Rome but still close to all the activity. The beds were typical European, thin firm mattress. Our room had a loft which was difficult to regulate the temperature especially at night ( just needed an extra blanket). The breakfast provided by the hotel was great. I thought the hotel was a little bit pricey when I compared it to other places we stayed in Italy but it was nice to have my whole family in one room and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This is an extraordinary small hotel that is charming, convenient, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jhbaker
Reviews.Content: The taxi drivers had to use their GPS to find this hotel, but, for us, the search was worth it. While it is not in the center of Rome, it is close enough that walkers can get to most places without difficulty. This is a converted convent that has blended all of the modern conveniences with the charm of the old structures. The shaded courtyard is a perfect place to relax after a hard day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very attentive.”
Reviews.Author: wayfarer67
Reviews.Content: Rome is a beautiful city but very an extremely bustling city busy, noisy twenty-four seven. And, unless you are a seasoned New Yorker returning at the end of the day to this quite, quaint, bed and breakfast was a slice of heaven. The rooms surround an orange grove where are the end of a whirlwind day of sightseeing, people watching, and Rome "madness" one can lounge in the shade to read, to think, or perhaps to sip a nice glass of Italian wine. And, at night there is quite. You can sleep and rejuvenate so you are ready to enter the fray, once again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel..fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dam01
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel Santa Maria was wonderful. After long days of sightseeing, we looked forward to coming back to the peaceful and lovely hotel and sitting under it's lovely orange trees. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is difficult to beat the hotel Santa Maria in terms of location (Trastevere), which is very central to all the attractions (right across the river) and has a great selection of local restaurants, bars, and cafes. The only issue is that it was not always easy to locate by taxi drivers, however, if you get the hotel to book one for you it is not a problem

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: sv-aasmu
Reviews.Content: For the third time we spent 5 days at Hotel Santa Maria. We love the place. We have tried other hotels in Rome, none of them as pleasant as Santa Maria. We are already planning next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was quiet, comfortable and the staff was very accomadating”
Reviews.Author: amdellia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Santa Maria. It was clean, comfortable, and beautiful and quiet. Even though it is in the center of a very popular and busy area it was very quiet and enjoyable. The breakfast was delicious and had many choices. Thanks everyone for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A neighborhood feel to Rome”
Reviews.Author: vanam1960
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended vacation in Italy and stayed in Rome at the Hotel Santa Maria. We truly enjoyed being in the neighborhood of Trastevere, but I wouldn't do it if it's your first trip to Rome. It's just a little bit out of the zone of all the places you want to go. We have been to Rome many times, so it was perfect for us. . The Santa Maria was great for the price. We highly recommend it. Staff very helpful, setting relaxing, great neighborhood restaurants. A little hard to find if you are driving a car. I would get better directions from the hotel ahead of time. Yes, we had a GPS, but it only had one way to get to the hotel and that way was blocked by construction. It's behind the Santa Maria church and you have to enter a non-visitor zone to get to it. Parking available on thier property for 10Euros a day. I would stay here again if we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm after busy Roman days”
Reviews.Author: ruthmedia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely Bank Holiday stay in the charming Hotel Santa Maria and hope to return. It is a calm and beautiful base to stay in lively Trastevere. The staff are friendly and helpful with everything and the beautiful, sunny central courtyard with orange and lemon trees is a fantastic place to enjoy the lovely buffet breakfast or an aperitivo (with complimentary buffet) before going out for dinner. We had long wanted to stay in this district of Rome and the Hotel Santa Maria has made it a memorable one Trastevere is well served by public transport and it was easy to visit the Caravaggio 400 and the new Maxxi gallery.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MichaeloftheNorth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in the Trastevere neighbour hood - 30 min walk to the Vatican and 45 min walk to the Coliseum. The hotel is located in a safe area with lots of restaurants and bars, but very much geared to tourists. Our room (#2) was spacious, clean and quiet at night. Most rooms face a lovely courtyard with orange trees. We ate our breakfasts in the courtyard. Our only complaint was the absence of air conditioning in our room. We called the front desk and were told that it took some time to come on... it did not. The next night we were told that a Rome City By-law did not permit the use of air conditioners until June 1st. When we were checking out, the front desk person told me that the air conditioner was broken. We would stay here again, but would make certain first that the AC is working, especially at the end of May. Because of the ground floor location, windows open onto the courtyard with not much breeze, so keeping curtains open is not an option, and not much cool air gets in at night. The hotel was very accommodating in booking our restaurant reservations and taxis. For real local cuisine and Roman atmosphere, we recommend Piccola Trattoria da Lucia (Vicola del Mattonato 2) in the Trastevere neighbourhood just a few blocks away from the hotel or Ristorante Maccheroni (Piazza delle Coppelle 44) near the Pantheon. Piccola Trattoria da Lucia is a family run restaurant and has been cooking up amazing dishes since 1938. Highly recommended. Ristorante Maccheroni was recently reviewed in Jamie Oliver's food magazine, though the food was good the staff could be a little rude towards tourists. We also had to send back the pasta with chick peas dish because it was way too over-salted. But the truffle pasta and the grilled sausages were great, as was the caprese salad.

Reviews.Title: “peace in trestevere”
Reviews.Author: favarabrighton
Reviews.Content: i've stayed all over rome and i think i have found my favorite. trestevere is a great area, and hotel santa maria is an oasis in the middle of it. this is my first time staying here, but i'll be returning again and again, hopefully

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated with excellent atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: StefanS68
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated with excellent atmosphere This small hotel is situated perfectly in the center of Trastevere with good restaurants in the close area. Al the culture and sightseeing in Rome are in reach by foot. The Hotel has a charming atmosphere with rooms facing the inner garden and the Orange trees. A free buffé are served every late afternoon, which You can eat in the romantic garden. It is a perfect start before our evening restaurant. The breakfast are also excellent and it is indeed nice to have your morning Cappucino in the garden. My best recommendation for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “happy to be here again”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl077
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel ---This was our second time at this hotel. Rooms are all on the ground level surrounding a courtyard with orange trees. Breakfast has an assortment of cheese, meat, eggs, pastries, cereal, juices and coffee. You can eat in the courtyard in good weather. You can also enjoy a glass of wine in the early evening--so relaxing after a day of sightseeing.Many good restaurants within walking distance. The only downside is that you can hear people walk by your room on the tile surface and as they shut their doors. Also, they need to update their hairdryers.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm after a day in Rome”
Reviews.Author: meribel1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within walking distance of Collosseum, Vatican and all other main attractions. Wonderful small good value restaurants on doorstep set in small winding cobbled streets. We found a sat nav invaluable to get us back to the hotel and also take us to the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and tranquil”
Reviews.Author: amapBristol
Reviews.Content: It was a really good room for three adults (often triple rooms are cramped). Staff couldn't be kinder. Being behind locked gates made us feel secure. Just lovely. Breakfast could be eaten outside and there is a nice little bar to while away some time. We liked being slightly out of the centre (1.5 miles from Vatican) as this means restaurants more reasonably priced and there are lots of them! We were very happy to walk to the sights. Taxi's are reasonable (8 euros to get to the Spanish Steps, saving us a half-hour walk).

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Fizz of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ciaosusan
Reviews.Content: We recommend our favorite hotel to all our friends who visit Rome and they love it as much as we do. We have stayed here countless times and we treated our newlywed son and new daughter-in-law to a nice stay in the early days of their honeymoon. Hotel Santa Maria is an oasis of tranquility in the heart of the Trastevere neighborhood in central Rome. The single storey rooms all open on a beautiful and quiet courtyard with ample furnishings for rest and relaxation after time in the hustle and bustle of central Rome, within short strolling distance of the Tiber, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori, the Forum and (of course) the shopping and restaurants of central Rome. Breakfast and the complimentary snacks in the early evening are delicious. Umbrellas and bikes available. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: DFig
Reviews.Content: Spotless room, charming facility, great breakfast, wonderful neighborhood - an oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, charming surroundings, spacious room, nice staff, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MW_Max
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room, room was very spacious, breakfast was excellent (eggs, pastry, meat, choice of 5 cereals, 5 juices, coffee (Cappuccino, Italian, American) fruit, nice courtyard for relaxing. Staff was very nice. Great location, loHad a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and pretty orange trees.”
Reviews.Author: erihoff
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was good but the free evening snacks could have been better (more fresh)

Reviews.Title: “No doubt - Great hotel --> here are some useful tips to make your stay even better”
Reviews.Author: Passenger-to
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great. All good that is said about the hotel is true. Nice, clean rooms, absolutely friendly staff, great location, etc. I want to add some useful tips that will make your stay there even more convenient: 1. We've stayed there with a 10 year old child so we needed a 1-bedroom apartment (junior suite). In fact there are 2 types (at least that I know of) of junior suites in the hotel - look at my picture with the scheme - room 14 which in fact is a standard 1-bedroom suite - a living room that you enter - with 1 single bed (plus a rollaway bed), a bathroom and a sliding door leading to the double bedroom. It's OK if you wish to say good night to you child and lock yourself in the double bedroom. Mind that if you'll want to visit the bathroom you'll have to go through the living room with your child and open the bathroom door exactly in front of his bed (and switch on the light there). Or if you'll want to go to the yard, which is really nice, you'll also have to pass through the living room and open the front door. But there is another junior suite 12 that is different - you enter the double bedroom with the bathroom and there is a separate room with a single (bunk) bed behind the sliding door (more convenient if you don't want to disturb your child or go to the yard). Look at the layout in my picture and be sure to book the one that suites you. 2. The taxi from the Fiumicino Airport is 40 Euro. It is the fixed rate to the center of Rome (including Trastevere) no matter what the meter says. Ours said ~43. But be sure to tell the driver the exact address (and show it on the map) since the drivers don't like to go into the narrow streets and may drop you a couple of blocks before the hotel (like our driver did) though the hotel IS accessible by car and the taxi CAN drive you to the front door (just be more insnitent). The same rate (I am not sure about the fixed price) will be for the taxi to the airport but you have to get it at the nearest taxi stop on the main street (Viale de Trastevere). 3. There is a cheaper way to get to the hotel from Fuimicino Airport - take a train to Trastevere station (7 stops, 30 minutes, 5,5 Euro), don't take the Leonardo Express (11 Euro) that goes to Termini station, it's not the one you need. Then take a 8 tram to Belli, just before the river (6 stops, 1 Euro), and then there is a 300 meters walk to the hotel (see Google maps) 4. The hotel is not exacly located close to the landmarks (30 min walk to Colosseo or Vatican) but don't be confused by that - if don't feel like walking some day you may take a bus or tram from the Belli stop on Viale de Trastevere - tram 8 will bring you to Argentina - a more central location, bus 780 - to Piazza Venezia, bus H - to Termini (via Piazza Venezia). The fare is always 1 Euro. There should be some bus to Vatican on the other bank of the river as well. 5. There are lots of good restaurants nearby - so you'll easily find a decent meal not far from the hotel. The restaurant around the corner from the hotel is good and another one nearby - at Vicolo de' Cinque, I think it's called "del Moro" - is absolutely great, you'll recognize it by the meat window at the entrance. 6. Though the yard is really nice you are not alowed to consume any food or drinks not purchased at the hotel there - so drink the wine in the room and breath the air in the yard.

Reviews.Title: “in the future, this is the only place in Rome I'll stay.”
Reviews.Author: nonamevirginia
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful, relaxing location with a great history and friendy staff. The rooms are great size and the courtyard is beautiful. The breakfast and daily happy hour are extra benefits! The location is close to bus routes and you can pretty much walk anywhere if you have time. You will sleep undisturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly oasis just minutes from everything..”
Reviews.Author: travellingwithdogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a fantastic experience. I loved the location. Trastevere is a lively, funky neighborhood full of lots of great little bars and restaurants; from fine dining to late night pizza by the slice. The rooms were decorated nicely and were comfortable. We arrived during the evening snack service which was complimentary and it was fantastic to relax in the courtyard surrounded by orange trees enjoying a glass of wine (not complimentary) and a bite to eat before setting out to explore. The breakfast buffet was fantastic with lots of choices and large quantities of food. Fresh fruit to scrambled eggs, meats and cheeses and several kinds of juice. The staff made your coffee to order. We walked into town every day and/or took the #8 tram. We had dinner in Trastevere 2 out of the 3 nights we were there. The staff made two excellent restaurant recommendations for us, Roberto and a young woman (I can't remember the young woman's name) were extremely helpful. When I told Roberto that I ate seafood but no other meat he even told me a specific pasta dish to order at one of the restaurants that was indeed to die for (must have had a pint of heavy cream and a pound of butter in the sauce so good thing we walked a lot, LOL), and the seafood I ordered at the other restaurant was also superb. They drew out walking routes to help us find things including the nearest laundromat. They also arranged our taxi to the airport, which we shared with two other guests in order to save some money. We never did make use of the bicycles but maybe next time.....and hopefully there is a next time during which we will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “This will be where we saty next time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jimpete
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, lovely staff, good beds, great shower - best place we have stayed in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Santa Maria as usual”
Reviews.Author: JoFri
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Hotel, and was very satisfied. We have now used the Santa Maria for 3 trips to Rome, and will certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: Zenata
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere is a lovely spot in the middle of the lively Trastevere. Romantic and calm. The room was very clean, the bathrom big with a very nice shower and a bath tub. My husband and I spent three nights there and we would love to come back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: TioTito
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this place for is location, hospitality, cleanliness, and breakfast. Rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time in the rooms as we were out and about. Quiet. Loved the sound of the church bells!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the heart of piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Cperlingeiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Amazing location (if you wanna stay away from the centre e close to many nice restaurants to dine), helpful staff and great rooms. The breakfast is really good. Take some time to enjoy it every morning. The rooms are large, clean, new linens and large bath towels. Great shower! They also have free wifi although it did not work all the time. Still, they give you a modem if the problem persists. The garden is indeed really beautiful and the whole ambiance of the hotel is really worth it. We definetely recommend it and would stay again. The onlye downside was no cable TV, which was kind of annoying, since we enjoy a little TV before going to bed. (Only Italian and German shows and CNN/BBC in English)

Reviews.Title: “A hidden quiet garden in a living and perfectly situated area in Roma”
Reviews.Author: PatatorParis
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find the perfect place in Roma that gathered all the important cracteristics that I wanted for my romantic and touristic four days with my gilfriend in Roma. These caracterisics were : a beautifull place, in a CENTRAL but NOT TOURISTIC area, with verry helpfull but discreet staff and comfortable rooms. I can say that I found all of these in Hotel Santa Maria and I had best stay ever. Next time I go to Roma, I will definitely go back. Do not hesitate to book a room there!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel & super location”
Reviews.Author: KattaOslo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, nice, quiet, clean hotel. Friendly staff who gave good advise. Great breakfast :-) Really nice garden with orange trees. Super location - in walking distance from most sights. Would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome - no need to look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyssi_d
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoyed a 3 night stay at this hotel. The area is very nice, lots of bars and restaurants all close by and has a lovely feel to the area - different to the centre. The hotel is in a nice setting and the rooms are basic but very clean, and have everything you could really need, as you will spend most time out of the hotel. However, ladies you might want to bring your own hairdryer, they have one in the bathroom attached to wall, which if like me you have long thick hair you will be there for days trying to get dry! The breakfast was nice, and service was good. We used the hotel taxi service, which although pricey was reliable and friendly and knew exactly where the hotel was, which other general city taxi's don't seem to. We found the location amazing, we walked everywhere with ease. I would stay at this hotel again if re-visiting Rome. Although it is not cheap, I don't think there is anywhere cheap in Rome, and if I compare price to London then it is reasonable for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ibo2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a gem in Trastevere. Orange trees in the courtyard, excellent cappucino for breakfast and free aperitivo (tapas) in the bar in the afternoon. Walking distance to all the sights and lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Santa-Maria hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gil T
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent and friendly staff excellent location. quiet and roomy Good breakfast Nice rooms and gardening design

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shumushin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Everything was fine except we couldn't use our laptops in the room because of lack of specific adapter (not a problem for europeans, though). Breakfast was included and in all you can eat style which means that start of the day was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robbo1211
Reviews.Content: Top location in an oasis of tranquility. Very nice neighbourhood with restaurants and shops, and also close to the famous sites. Two of the free bycicles took us to the Vatican in ten minutes! We had a wonderful 3 days and appreciated the hospitality of the hotel staff. very good value for money. Rob and Irene, Eindhoven NL

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, but hotel missing loving hand”
Reviews.Author: amelia1507
Reviews.Content: I feel the hotel is slightly overrated. The setting is fine, and there are lovely orange trees in the nice court yards of the smallish complex. However the rooms are noisy with tilen floors and banging doors. The room window gives unto the open tilen pathway leading past the doors. Breakfast is ok but basic. There is free internet available amidst the breakfast tables. Staff seems a little scarce, with the couple serving breakfast later in the day cleaning the rooms. What is missing however is the loving hand. For instance all flowers are made of plastic, even the azaleas and cyclamen outside in the garden. The personal touch somehow seems missing, and that really is a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: mutleylondon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this little hotel with its interior patio and lovely fruit trees. Staff was friendly and rooms were good, ideal place to spend a few days in this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, hidden away, quiet, relaxing, close to walk to sites or catch a bus.”
Reviews.Author: Viaggiareallestero
Reviews.Content: Accomodating people who are always pleasent. Good breakfast. A block from Santa Maria Maggiore and Ponte Sisto but tucked away from all bustle. We walked to the center of Rome, Campo Fiore, Janiculum, all over Trastevere. Close to #8 tram with connections to airport, Tivoli and all of Rome. Private courtyard through gated drive. A good refuge for tired feet and bodies. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a great location and surrendings - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Petronellen
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel surrounded by a beautiful garden with orange trees. Even though you are in the middle of Rome it feels like you are in Tuscany. The room was nice and clean, and a good size. Trastevere, where the hotel is located, is also wonderful with lots of small restaurants and small streets that take you away from the biggest tourist areas. All the sights are within walking distance. We would definitely stay the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel in an unmatched location”
Reviews.Author: Quijus
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet, small hotel in THE center of Trastevere. Lots of very good food, cafes, and bars around. 10-minute walk to the very center of Rome. Rooms are very clean. Some may be a little small, so if you have a lot of luggage it may be challenging. If you are looking for a cozy and quiet place to stay in the center of Rome, you like to walk, and you are open to local Roman way of life (in the very best sense) I wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful hidden spot in the hub bub of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MomroxNC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days during our visit of Rome. We avoid all the big box, chain hotels that look the same no matter the city. Hotel Santa Maria perfectly met our expectations. Wonderfully quaint, hidden hotel among the twisty turney alleys of Trastevere. One suggestion, see if the hotel will send a taxi for you...our taxi driver didn't know where it was and we ended up wandering the alleys for an hour in the blistering Rome summer sun. Great restaurant round the corner, can't remember the name but they have lines of laundry (as a decoration) hanging across the ceiling of the restaurant...truly the best meal we had in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"A charmed hotel in the middle of Trastevere"”
Reviews.Author: tetirasu
Reviews.Content: Very beautifull and clean hotel with a great and beautifull indoor terraza, full of orange trees. A great buffet breakfast with typical patisserie. Every afternoon the service organise a mini buffet of apperitives before dinner. They have bicycles for the clients and umbrellas also!!! The only thing is that even though is very calm and quite, the privacy isn't. It seems private and in many ways it is but if you open the windows you might be seen by your neighbors when they get out of their room. For a group of people should be great and also for couples...but i cannot imagine insummer when everybody uses the terrace... Eventhough I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ACE014
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!!!!......My wife and i stayed at the Hotel on Jan 7th thew the 10th of this year. As a honey moon gift my family paid for our room back in July of the previous year threw expedia.com. I did get the hotel info from Rick Steves. First off... the first night we were here our sheets were very dirty. Second, my wife and always leave our stuff a certain way when we leave our hotel room. The next day we had left and returned it looked as if some one had gone threw all our stuff. Finaly what really gets me is the day we are going to check out. I go into there office and tell them my flight is the next morning so i will be leaving very early. They offer us a wake up call at 5:30 and a taxi at 6:30 for that sunday morning. Sunday comes no wake up call. I go in the office at six to make sure the taxi is comming the guy is sleeping on the desk. I tell him we our checking out he says everything is good. He waits till my wife and i our in the taxi to run out like a mad man and accuse me of skipping out on the bill!! I have all the info from expedia.com and the credit card to prove ive paid in full. He refuses to look at it and tells me i have know idea what im talking about! He demands money get very loud... So i have to pay again or risk getting the cops called and missing my flight! The debit card i have to use does not have the funds to cover this so i get a big over draft fee. I spend 40 minutes on my cell phone at a dollar a minute trying to get expedia to fix this mess! as off today the 12th of jan i have not been refunded any money and no contact from the hotel . I had to file a claim with my bank today. What a way to end the Honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Travestere”
Reviews.Author: MrLake
Reviews.Content: Booked by e-mail, and received promptly replies. Hassle free check in, they found our reservation right away. Got a great room (no 1) that even has a small table out front. The room was spotless. Might need a bigger telly (this one was like 14" wide), but who really wants to look at Italian television. The location is great, the Trastevere area is wonderful and especially restaurant Sabatini at the Santa Maria in Trastevere square is great. You can buy ice cream close by, you have a zillion of other restaurants and bare. This hotel is smack in the middle of everything - and is absolutely quit with no noice at all. We didn't really get to test the hotels service - that will say, they actually booked a table for us at Sabatini and this worked as a charm as well. No dislikes at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: yondering
Reviews.Content: Quiet location near one one of the interesting areas of ancient Rome. Nice breakfast / bar area with good service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay on the 'other' side of the river this is probably as good a place as any”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Phrenologist
Reviews.Content: I am not quite sure why this hotel is rated as highly as it is on this site. On the positive side, the rooms are large and have almost all the equipment one would expect. As another reviewer mentioned there were no slippers or robes. In a hotel with tile floors the slippers would have been very useful in the winter. The bathroom was of adequate size and had a very unusual feature--a shower curtain! No water on the floor or anywhere else it did not belong. If the temperature had been a bit higher (it was about freezing the whole time we were there) it would have been enjoyable to sit outside in the courtyard under the shade of the orange trees. Breakfast was a fairly standard European buffet with the juices, breads, cheeses and meats. The afternoon 'party' with free food but drinks bought at the bar was also an enjoyable feature. On the negative side the place is difficult to find the first time. Once you know where it is located it is not a problem. The entrance also might put some people off. You must buzz to be let in through a heavy iron gate that serves to keep people/cars out of the approach to the hotel. Feels a bit like entering a prison although it might give some a sense of security. While they provide internet service it only works in the breakfastroom/bar area. It is not available in the rooms. This is certainly a good three star hotel located in an interesting area but I cannot believe it is one of the best in Rome as ratings on this site would indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Oasis, Comfortable Rooms, Friendly Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chezjoie
Reviews.Content: Delicious coffee with a full breakfast, late afternoon snack "buffet," attentive service, free internet access, accurate guidance for restaurants, attractions, getting around , away from the hustle and bustle of "touristy" Rome, perfect location for casual dining and evening strolls. Only one complaint: the towels should be larger and more absorbent.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaS04
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased with the Hotel Santa Maria from the helpfulness of the staff to the peaceful accomodations. We would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful, comfortable stay in Rome. Our only complaint was that we could not access the wi-fi from our room, but then we were there for vacation and that guaranteed we didn't end up working.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in charming Travestere”
Reviews.Author: Rooftopsue2
Reviews.Content: Wonderful bed and breakfast inside a quiet courtyard in busy, bustling Travestere. Quiet place to sleep, delicious breakfasts, and clean, comfortable rooms. My grown daughter and I stayed for five days, walked to all the major sights, and loved coming back to the hotel in the evening. It was too cold to use the courtyard with mature orange trees - but if it had been hot, those trees would have been a wonderful place to have a drink in the late afternoon. After reading these reviews, we arranged for a car through the hotel back and forth to the airport - it was easy and efficient. Finding the hotel by map would have been exceedingly challenging, and probably not doable, on our own. We always read Trip Advisors ratings, and have been pleased - this time was the best. Simply an outstanding place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JandRTravels
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Santa Maria in November 2009 for a long weekend to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. The Hotel is in a central but quiet location close to all the sights and within strolling distance of several lovely restaurants. The room was large and airy and well heated and the bathroom was a good size and well equipped. Everywhere was clean and well looked after and the service was very good. The long breakfast time (7.30am to 10.30am) was much appreciated after busy days sight-seeing and provided a nice selection. There is free use of the internet which meant my daughter could catch up on Facebook ! I would recommend the taxi collection from the airport arranged by the Hotel as a fast and convenient way to get to and from the airport. My tip for walking round Rome is "wear flat shoes" - not so much for comfort but as there are cobbles everywhere and heels of any sort can be difficult to walk in ! Overall our whole experience in Rome was wonderful and the hotel Santa Maria was a delightful place to stay - I can't wait to go back to eat breakfast at the tables in the lovely open air courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and relaxing, with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarkandJoAnne09
Reviews.Content: We finished up our Italian honeymoon with 3 nights at Hotel Santa Maria. We could not have made a better choice. Trastevere is a great location, walking distance to everything in Rome, but with more of a neighborhood feel. When we were having trouble finding the hotel (thanks to our lazy and clueless cab driver), a random student emerged from her front door and pointed us in the right direction. This hotel is truly like an oasis in the bustle of Rome. On two of our evenings there, we enjoyed their free light buffet and relaxed in the courtyard with a drink - a lovely way to start an evening. The staff were as friendly as anyone we met in Italy. They made two great recommendations for our dinners in Trastevere and arranged a cab to the airport for us (this driver knew the way). Our room itself was great, and breakfast was good too... I can't think of any negatives about Hotel Santa Maria!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Francois-Ile-Bizard
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 4 days with my girlfriend and 16-year-old daughter. The Hotel Santa Maria was great. The room was spacious and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. The area is not too touristy, but the location is pretty central. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel--Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: savvyduo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights this October. As soon as we arrived we knew that we made a wise choice (thanks Trip Advisor). We arrived early after an overnight flight and we greeted warmly, the room was ready for us, and we were offered breakfast. The rooms are very nice and clean and cozy, with a great bathroom. The staff members were always helpful and very pleasant, providing great recommendations for restaurants and helping us with transportation. Breakfast, included in price, was varied and tasty. Great cappaccinos too!! We also really loved the daily evening happy hour, also free, with delicious treats. The courtyard is lovely, although we didn't get to use it much because of the rainy weather. Santa Maria Hotel is situated in a wonderful vibrant neighborhood, with tons of shops, restaurants, and the beautiful Santa Maria in Trastevere church and piazza literally right around the corner. If you are a walker, you can easily get into the city from the hotel with a nice walk over Isle Tiberina. We HIGHLY recommend this charming little place, and we will definitely stay here next time we are lucky enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming oasis”
Reviews.Author: Zarah7
Reviews.Content: We recently made our first trip to Rome and stayed for 5 nights. I chose this hotel based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor - and couldn't have made a better choice. Stepping through the gates was like stepping outside of the city into a tranquil oasis. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was nice and very clean. They serve a lovely breakfast and have great cappucino.The location is also excellent; within walking distance of many attractions and convenient access to other modes of transport, shops and restaurants. The charming church of 'Santa Maria in Trastevere' is situated just around the corner and the atmosphere in the surrounding area - especially at night - is amazing. Despite having noisy people in the room next to us on two of the nights, we still had a great stay at this hotel. Rome is a city that casts a spell on you - and I definitely intend to return and stay at Hotel Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Taylor1295
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. We fell in love with it and can't wait to go back. For sure we will go back to the Santa Maria. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere, the breakfast was great, having a computer at our disposal was an added bonus. We were made to feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kmgibb
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay! The room was nice and very clean! We loved the courtyard and the lovely breakfast each morning! Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis, set the standard for our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Italy we selected the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was a perfect choice for so many reasons. It is a really lovely hotel. It provided a wonderful breakfast with many delicious selections, best hotel coffee in all of Italy. We packed a lot of sites into four ambitious days and it was convenient to walk to many locations. Also, it was easy to catch buses, trains, the metro and cabs. The area around the hotel is fascinating, full of historic churches, interesting shops, restaurants, gelato and bars. The streets are quite lively during the day and night, great people watching from many outdoor restaurants. There was a concert in the Piazza on Saturday and Sunday and that was quite fun. We never wished we had a car. It’s location set back from the street provided quiet and tranquility after a very busy day. We enjoyed the snacks in the evening and the cash bar. The room and bathroom were spacious and comfortable, very good water pressure and very clean. We stayed in the room closest to the kitchen and that was a bit noisy on the night we kept the windows open. When the windows were closed there was no problem. Everyone at the desk was most helpful with maps and information. After touring more of Italy we stayed in another part of Rome before we caught our flight and it just wasn’t the same. We can recommend: Restaurant San Calisto in Trastevere, very good pizza Ristorante Galeassi on the Piazza Santa Maria, Trastevere, good food and service Restaurant Carlo Menta Talevi Luigi e Luciano in Trastevere, fun atmosphere, food was fair, pasta better than pizza, but a fun place to be, reasonable prices, fast service Eternity Tours of Vatican, very informative, not rushed, eloquent and fun guide Ann Restaurant Andrea in Rome not to far from the train station, very good pizza and pasta Bar Antichi Sapori S.R.L. near Trevi Fountain, small but good food and service

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lainey_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights, our room was lovely, and we absolutely loved the courtyard filled with orange trees. The location is good too, hidden away in the cobbled streets of Trastevere. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TEChrisler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome for our 10th anniversary. We needed a hotel for one night before we sailed on a cruise from Civitavecchia. We wanted a small hotel with local flavor and cultural authenticity. The Hotel Santa Maria was THE perfect place. From its warm, welcoming staff, to its little amenities (complimentary fresh fruit, breakfast buffet, and evening snacks) to its prime proximity to ancient Rome, Campo di Fiori and the Trevi Fountain. This hotel truly is a gem, and we would definitely visit them again. The only complaint (if we can call it a complaint) was that our mattress was a little too soft. I hardly noticed, but my husband did. Other than that, it was a really great stay. If you're looking for something off the beaten path, with warmth and charm, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: billyclark1770
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two night stay at Hotel Santa Maria! Wonderful location, wonderful staff, wonderful atmosphere. The interior courtyard is beautiful and a fine place to relax, read a book, sip a beverage, or enjoy breakfast. The accommodations for the three of us in our group were ideal. We took advantage of the loaner bicycles of Hotel Santa Maria to cycle over to the Circus Maximus in the evening and were treated to picturesque views of the lights along the Tiber River on our return. This is just the place from which to venture out to experience Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oasis in Wonderful and Peaceful Location”
Reviews.Author: NorrisTraveller
Reviews.Content: We drove to Rome with Friends on a Car Rally from England and had booked the Residence Santa Maria for our nights stay in the City. The approach was interesting to say the least driving along narrow twisting streets in the Trastevere District. We found the Hotel Santa Maria which was not the Hotel we had booked. It was so nice that we let another car in our rally have our booked room there and took a more expensive room at the Hotel Santa Maria (200 euros for 3). The staff could not have been more helpful. The Courtyard was a wonderful place to relax, Free pre dinner snacks were provided and we ate our breakfast under orange trees in the Courtyard. Parking was available in a garage next door for 25 Euros per night. The area was busy well after midnight but the hotel being in its own courtyard could not have been more peaceful. The only negative to Rome and this area was the dreadful amount of graffitti to be seen. We enjoyed the exciting driving in Rome and look forward to a longer visit next time

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mstanco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! Welcoming staff, great rooms and that courtyard. I can't wait to go back. We were only thhere for three nights but it was well worth it. We walked to all the major and some minor tourist attractions with ease from this hotel. We got a little lost in the neigborhood but we were able to see more of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the Travestere”
Reviews.Author: Jacarandar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the Travestere and is quiet with a nice courtyard. Rooms are very clean, breakfast was good & the staff are very helpful. Great value in August although more expensive in other months.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: happy619
Reviews.Content: Quaint spot in Trastever....staff was excellent - especially Ariana & Pasquale! This is the hotel to stay in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat away from the crowds and traffic”
Reviews.Author: WalesCastle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria,Trastevere will not disappoint . Trastevere is a fantastic base for exploring all the main tourist attractions of Rome which are all within reasonable walking distance of the hotel. A street map is essential as the hotel is hidden away in a small side street which can be difficult to locate. The hotel is secured by a set of high iron gates with 24 hour access. Free snacks are provided during the early evening and an excellent breakfast choice is available in the covered courtyard. The rooms are a good size by Rome standards equipped with a comfortable bed and excellent en-suite facilities. One disappointment was the lack of any room tea/coffee making equipment. Light sleepers are advised to travel with earplugs because the nearby church and clock bells ring during the night.. Restaurants recommended by the hotel staff were excellent and very good value. The hotel taxi service to and from the hotel is recommended for price and service. I would highly recommend the Hotel Santa Maria for the tranquillity, location , service and for the opportunity to experience the "real" Rome.

Reviews.Title: “so quiet in such a big and great town”
Reviews.Author: pixxx
Reviews.Content: perhaps not so nice for kids. because there is no special bidding for them. but great for all others. you are in the middle of trastevere. from there you can start all activities. you can reach everything you want. wonderful rooms. good breakfast. very pleasant personnel !!!!!!! just one little point. they speak nearly no german. if you really need ist, it will be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and quiet oasis away from the tourist hordes but close to all the main sites”
Reviews.Author: Ethu
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with Hotel Santa Maria and would highly recommend it. It is located in the beautiful Trastevere area of Rome, just across the Ponte Sisto foot bridge and close to all the major sites. We loved seeing the sites of Rome and then escaping from the hordes of tourists back to our lovely quiet hotel. It was unbearably hot in Rome while we were there (August 2009), so we really appreciated the orange tree lined courtyard that always seemed to have a lovely breeze. Trastevere is very quiet during the day but comes alive at night and there are dozens of excellent retaurants to enjoy, all within walking distance. The hotel staff did a wonderful job of recommending restaurants patronized by the locals and we enjoyed some fabulous meals. We loved the ambience of Trastevere....walking around the streets is a feast for the eyes. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, clean, low key hotel with charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, nestled away in the back streets of Trevestere”
Reviews.Author: WerdnaWerdna
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Rome before we were unsure of which part of the City to stay in and since the reviews for Travestere and this hotel were all good, we decided to book up. Overall, we were happy with the choice made. The hotel is beautiful - very clean, tidy and fresh looking. Our room was on the small side but as with the whole hotel, looked new, clean and well finished. Great shower, flat panel TV, air-conditioning. No tea or coffee making facilities was the only negative point. The hotel gardens are lovely for relaxing in with a drink - under the cover of orange trees. The hotel is tucked away in the back streets of Travestere and without the hotel organised taxi we would never have found it. Travestere is good for restaurants at reasonable prices but as an area, appears a little run down with graffiti and untidy buildings. We walked around Rome, visiting most of the attractions - the hotel is about 30 mins walk from the Collosseum, about 45 minutes from Trevi Fountain. There is no Metro station in Travestere. Overall, a very enjoyable weekend in a great hotel that is tucked away in the quieter part of town. Perfect if you don't mind walking or getting a taxi into central Rome. I think that if we return to Rome, we will probably go for a hotel nearer the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Happier”
Reviews.Author: Joel_Sandra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began our trip to Europe in August 2009 with four nights at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere, Rome, and could not have been happier with our choice. We booked a car through the hotel to pick us up a Fiumicino, and would recommend this highly, as for first-timers the hotel would be difficult to find. The location in Trastevere was good for us, as we love to walk. We were no more than a five-minute walk from the Tiber, and a ten to fifteen minute walk to the Campo de Fiori. The neighborhood is packed with restaurants, and the hotel's recommendations were helpful and good. The room was small, but very attractively appointed and absolutely spotless. The bathroom was equally clean, and included a tub. While Trastevere is a very active neighborhood in the evening, the hotel was unfailingly quiet. Indeed, the courtyard seemed absolutely tranquil, befitting the place's former life as a convent. Summer of '09 was perhaps the hottest on record in Rome, and I'm happy to say that the air conditioner in our room worked quietly and well. The breakfast buffet was simply the best I've ever encountered. It included two kinds of melon as well as other whole, fresh fruits, well-prepared scrambled eggs, a numbert of Italian cold cuts and cheeses, breakfast cereals, many different types of bread, yoghurts, and coffee made to order. Unless there is an extremely compelling reason for us to be in another part of town, my wife and I will always return to this hotel when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming!”
Reviews.Author: DukesterGeorgetown
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. The location is perfect. Excellent restaurants, bars boutiques and sites nearby. Not a "tourist trap" location with regards to restaurants. Really pleasant having a quiet breakfast among the orange trees. The afternoon antipasto in the bar was delicious. Special kudos to Roberto on the front desk and Christiano at the bar. You guys were terrific!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Brugst
Reviews.Content: The hotel was truly a little piece of heaven during our stay in the city of Rome. After a tiring day of visiting the cultural highlights of the city, it was very relaxing to be able to sit down under de orange trees and have a sip of delicious white wine. The staff was very helpful with our search towards the right restaurants and transport media. When we'll visit Rome in the future (we threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain, so we will come back), we'll surely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty petite hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: countrycheel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for three nights (myself and 2 freinds). We had a triple room which had one double bed and one single. The room was large enough for three but three women sharing a small bathroom was always a bit ambitious. The room was clean and towels changed regularly. The bathroom had both bath and good shower (over bath) as well as hand held shower. The courtyard was very pretty, we ate breakfast there every morning and enjoyed the last hours of the day chatting in this very peaceful environment. We used the hotels recommended transfer service and was picked up at the airport by a polite driver, even after a flight change meant some re-arranging of pick up times. The hotel is very secure, large gates protect the area and are locked at night. As well as this the room had a small electronic safe for valuables. The best bit of the hotel is the location, if you enjoy eating and drinking in typically italian restaurants then this is your place. The hotel is perfectly located to enjoy all of the facilities of the district, and yet is very peaceful and quiet. The only downside we had was that we booked a taxi via the hotel to take us to an organised tour and it was very late. This wasnt the hotels fault but it took a lot of persuasion to get the receptionist to call the taxi company to find out where the taxi had got to.

Reviews.Title: “a romantic and quite oasis in the middle of rome”
Reviews.Author: jhonMiami
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights on this small hotel located in the middle of Trastevere , nice location just few steps from the beautiful piazza Santa Maria , several great trattorias and pizzerias ( Dal Poeta ,fantastic ) rooms are very clean and confortable, breakfast is very enjoyable outside surronded by orange trees .
