Service was very frendly . I will definatly recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Paradise in a big city”
Reviews.Author: carrieul
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Santa Maria. Incredibly charming! There were 5 of us, including 2 teenagers. Although the area you walk through to get to the hotel (Travestere) looked a little sketchy in the daytime because of all the grafitti on the bldgs, the hotel was an amazing hidden gem and the location was great for walking to all the Rome sites. We never needed a taxi but we did do A LOT of walking, which we enjoy as a family. However, the area comes alive at night with sidewalk cafes everywhere that are all packed with diners enjoying great Italian food. You wouldn't know it was the same place. However, Santa Maria remains quiet and enjoyable day or night. We loved the courtyard, and looked forward to relaxing there each afternoon after siteseeing in crowds and heat all day. We even just kicked back and played a boardgame one afternoon to rest our feet. Breakfasts were excellent, with made to order coffees and delicious food choices. We sat out in the courtyard amidst citrus trees and really felt relaxed. The rooms were very nicely appointed and up to date. Staff is very friendly. Only drawback is the lack of a pool for kids on hot days. If we visit Rome again, we would DEFINITELY stay here. Much better than a large, impersonal hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simple the best”
Reviews.Author: akol04
Reviews.Content: When I read the former reviews i can't agree. We were there the same days and We have a great service from the lady in the reception. She helpt us with a lot of things and We think all the staff in the reception were helpful and polite. The hotel is just wonderful, we are almost full time travellers and this is one of the best hotel we have been to. In the price tou have a little "aportivo" buffet every evening, so you can just relax with a book or your cumputer in the courtyard. Just lovely. When We were there most of the hotelguests were from America, so I think I really must recommend this hotel for the Skandinavia people so they also can find this lovely hotel. We got a excellent map from the reception and it was easy to go everywhere. We hope to came back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: eramm
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Hotel Santa Maria. My wife, mother and myself stayed seven days. First, the hotel is beautiful. The courtyard is like an oasis in Rome, very quiet, clean and a beautiful garden setting around a grove of orange trees. The rooms are average size but are clean and in great condition. The location is perfect about a block away from the church in Trastevere. The breakfast was great I would definetly stay there again. My only issue was with one their employees. I'm a very laid back individual and always courteous with the staff. This one lady they have working there continually gave us dirty stares and purposely tried to difficult when we had a basic question or two. Early in trip I asked for internet access. She wouldn't give us the password to the internet until noon even though there were others online as early as 7 in the morning all week. We also asked her to book us a cab to the airport on our final day and she neglected to do so. I only found this out five hours before we had to leave. On the last day we also had our bags by a gate that opens up to let cars in. She arrived at work the same time we were leaving and she saw us in front of the gate and didn't even have the courtesy to let us get our bags out of the way before she opened the gate. We had to scramble just to keep our luggage from getting knocked over and she had the nerve to glare at us as she went by? Not sure what her problem was but clearly it was intentional. I'm not sure of her name but I saw her driving a Nissan Murano SUV and a motorcycle on different days and she works in the morning so please be careful in dealing with her. They also have another staff member there named Roberto, he's great and truly a great representative of the hotel. The rest of the staff were helpful as well. We also had great luck with the restaurants in the area. One in particular, Carlo Mente was great and very reasonable about a block away from the church. Overall, I would say the hotel is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful site ruined by malicious staff”
Reviews.Author: Xenophile149
Reviews.Content: Positives: The grounds were serene and immaculately maintained, providing a great place to relax in the shade during the hot Roman afternoons. The rooms were similarly comfortable. The breakfast buffet was well-stocked and tasty. Negatives: One of the staff members was not only lazy and inattentive, but went out of her way to lie to us and kept lying even when called on it. When we arrived and checked in, the woman at the reception desk confirmed that our room was ready, then asked us to wait outside for "five minutes" before she would show us to our room. The five minutes stretched into more than 40 minutes as she chatted with a coworker. The same woman was managing the desk when we checked out. We asked her to call a taxi; before she did so, she asked where we were going, and we said "the airport". We then waited outside for the taxi to arrive. When the car arrived, we attempted to confirm the price would be 40 euros, as is the law in Rome. The driver said no, then went inside to talk with the hotel woman; the woman on staff then came outside and tried to tell us that because it was a Sunday ("a holiday") that the regular rate doesn't apply. When we pointed out that the day of the week had no bearing, she tried a different excuse: that the rate only applies to travel to/from the center of the city. This again, was patently false, as the law explicitly includes everywhere within the city walls, where we most certainly were. To be clear, she was not trying to come up with possible reasons the driver would be charging more than legally allowed, but actively arguing for the higher charges and lying through her teeth while doing it. I can only assume that she or the hotel itself get some sort of kickback from the customer getting scammed, as she went out of her way to even get involved in the first place. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend a hotel, however nice the grounds and rooms are, when they choose such lazy and deceitful people to act as their public face.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel - I will be back”
Reviews.Author: vwillms
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I was traveling alone and always felt that the staff were looking out for me. The courtyard is heaven! The perfect place for breakfast and an afternoon drink. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Location is great. Close walking distance to all the major sights. I am recommending the Hotel Santa Maria to all my family and friends. And, I will stay there on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A great Roman getaway!”
Reviews.Author: KTRSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a perfect place to stay in Rome. My husband and I loved our stay there. The courtyard is beautiful and relaxing- a great place for breakfast or a drink after a day of sightseeing. The room was spacious, comfortable, and well kept. We couldn't have asked for anything more. The staff was also wonderful. THey were very friendly with giving us information about things to do and how to get places. The bar staff was amazing and helpful as well. We had wonderful cappucinos every morning, and delicious wine in the evenings. The location couldn't be better. It's within walking distance to everything in Rome, but Travestere allows for feeling outisde of the hustle and bustle of the big city. There are plenty of neighborhood shops and restaurants that are worth a visit too. This was a wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Almeida1982
Reviews.Content: To anyone considering coming to Rome, all I can say is stay at the Santa Maria Hotel! Eating the wonderful breakfast in the sunny, orange tree covered courtyard while the Trastevere bells ring out in the nearby Santa Maria Piazza will be a memory I keep with me forever. The rooms were clean and comfy, the staff were welcoming and friendly and Trastevere itself has fast become one of my favourite places in the world. Despite the hustle and bustle of Rome, the hotel is quiet and relaxing - but close enough to the action when you want it. I would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the big city”
Reviews.Author: travellover1006
Reviews.Content: From the courtyard, you can't tell that you are steps away from the big city! We stayed there two times this month on either side of a cruise. They were very accommodating and had our room ready early AM upon our arrival. We were in a suite, with a king bed and two bunk beds for the children. The breakfast in the courtyard was what we looked forward to with each visit. The cappuccino's are to die for and the buffet spread is great: juices, fruit, yogurt, breads, eggs, meats etc. They were great to refer us to nearby restaurants for dinner, and didn't steer us wrong there. The only complaint I had was misinformation about the cost of a transfer that they set up for us, but that had nothing to do with the stay at the hotel itself. I would highly recommend the hotel for a stay, and plan to go back myself in the future!

Reviews.Title: “best ever location”
Reviews.Author: Allykent
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children for two days at this hotel and were very impressed. I liked the fact that our quadruple room had built in beds for the children, not just camp beds in the corner. The location is ideal with plenty of bars and restaurants right on the door step. I would recommend the collection service from the airport, as it made travelling to the hotel completely stress free.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful oasis of tranquility”
Reviews.Author: marytms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (aged 11 and 8 ) stayed at hotel Santa Maria from 3rd to 8th of July 2009 based on the excellent reviews read on the tripadvisor website. It is an absolutely beautiful place to stay. An oasis of peace and calm in the wonderful city of Roma. The hotel is situated in a narrow street leading from a lovely piazza. It was great to eat breakfast in the little court yard under the orange trees. The evening complimentary snack buffet was also a lovely treat. Our room had bunk beds for the boys. So important as most accomodation for 4 includes two double beds. The decor was lovely. We had a slight problem with our shower and water sometimes over flowed on to the bathroom floor . My husband found the bed very uncomfortable as he sometimes suffers with back problems. The boys and I had no problem sleeping. An amazing sound at nightwas the clarity of sea gulls cries..It is such a shame there is so much graffiti on the street walls and in Rome generally. The hotel staff were corteous and helpful The restaurant recommended by the hotel was one of the nicest places to eat in Italy. So be sure to ask for recommendations and advice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travellers visiting Rome. Due to the hotel's location and ambiance you really feel part of Rome. Book now you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: TrojanBob
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria in June 2009. It was highly recommended by Trip Advisor and Rick Steeves. We are so glad we stayed there. We really enjoyed starting our day with a relaxing breakfast in their beautiful courtyard with orange trees, and ending our day with wine & appetizers in the same location. We were on the go most of the time, but Santa Maria helped us balance the hustle/bustle of Rome with relaxation. We recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lucymama
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in EVERY way. Taking breakfast (with an endless supply of fabulous coffee any way you like it) in a garden of fruit trees listening to the tolling of Rome's churches and the seagulls was the start to another perfect day at the Hotel Santa Maria. We arranged a transfer through the hotel and the smoothness did not stop there. Roberto provided fabulous recommendations, including gelato, restaurants and sites. The other staff were equally helpful and the pleasure of our visit to Rome was made that much more by our stay at this fabulous hotel. The rooms are perfect, quite and serene. In short don't bother with anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel - worth a trip to Rome just to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: GiaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a large, comfortable room with a loft. We have a 15-year-old and a 6-year-old, so accommodation can be tricky in Italy. Bunk beds won't work for our teenager, neither will a pull-out couch generally (mattresses are always so bad, he ends up with backaches). This room had 2 separate twin beds in a loft atop of a generous main room where my husband and I slept comfortably in a large queen bed. Bathroom was spacious and comfortable. The room was clean, there was also a good amount of clothes storage capability as well as a room safe. Service was quiet and efficient, and breakfast was very good: a step above most continental breakfasts offered in Italy. But the best part was the courtyard, where we had breakfast amidst orange trees. When we first got to Trastevere, the area in which the hotel is located, we had to navigate through a series of maze-like streets and asked directions a couple of times to just find the hotel. Once we did find it and buzzed at the gate to enter, it was as if we'd passed through the gates of heaven itself. The hotel offered a tranquil setting, a really sanctuary, in contrast to the vibrancy and busy-ness of Trastevere. We couldn't believe we were right in the middle of Rome! Only a 20 minute walk from most of the major tourist sites at the most; 30 minutes, maybe, to the Vatican. Surprisingly, there were many families with kids staying there of varying ages. We never took public transit, so I can't comment on that. Lots of nightlife in Trastevere, but that wasn't our thing; although we got back around midnight or later, both nights we were there, we never felt unsafe walking around. Great little shops selling wonderful shoes you won't find anywhere else, lovely unique stores and restaurants galore. Many restaurants are trying to fight against the tides of tourists proudly proclaiming they offer no tourist menus. One of my husband's cousins, a Roman for over half her life, met up with us at the hotel and marveled at our find. We only stayed 2 nights but at least it was at the end of our stay in Europe, and we ended on high note for sure. We are already trying to figure out when we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it is. You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler111Usa
Reviews.Content: Reasons to avoid this Hotel: 1. The people who work there seem upset at the guests. Seemed wierd. Most seemed just simply disinterested, period. They avoid eye contact and no hellos or goodbyes. They simply do their job. Ask for a glass of wine and she will pour it and walk away. Service with a smile is not a concept here. 2. The area feels like the slums with grafiti and trash everywhere. 3. Too far from metro. Bus route is nearby though, but the destination options are limited. Taxi is very expensive and will not try to negotiate the narrow alley the hotel is located in. 4. The afternoon snacks are poor quality, almost unedible - and the wine is too expensive - over $10 per glass - more expensive than the restaurants. For breakfast, the only warm food is scrambled egg. But, the eggs were runny (undercooked) and we were concerned about food-borne disease. 5. Very thin walls. You can hear the entire hotel. Light sleepers will suffer. Late night partiers will keep you up. Early risers with kids will wake you up early. The church bell goes off every 15 minutes. Reasons to stay at this hotel: 1. The hotel has a nice court yard with orange trees. But, after the initial impression of "that's neat", it's no big deal. Not worth the high hotel price. 2. The orange trees give off a nice scent. But the oranges are not the edible variety. 3. The receptionists speak english and will provide basic services such as recommending restaurants and giving you a map of how to get there. 4. Lots of restaurants nearby. But, they cater more to the locals. Tourists are rushed to leave. One restaurant actually has a sign saying they are against tourists and war. 5. The free internet can only be used from noon to 10pm. For us, this meant we could not use it before the start of our day and by the end after dinner, it was too late. Not sure why they limit the time bcz the room itself is accessible. Overall, I cannot recommend this place. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Respite from the Congestion of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MachinePhoenix
Reviews.Content: This a wonderful hotel situated in the heart of the most charming neighborhood in Rome, called Trastevere. The hotel has a private courtyard so after a hard day of touring and fighting the crowds of Rome you can return to quiet courtyard and have a relaxing drink of wine without being bothered by the noise of the city. If you choose to reenter the world of the vibrant city you are just a few meters from many restaurants and bars that fill the Trastevere section of Rome. Trastevere is alive and vibrant almost any time of the day but especially at night. Yet ,you can get away and relax at Hotel Santa Maria by heading for the daily treat of an afternoon buffet. The wait staff in the afternoon is young helpful , very warm and friendly. The day staff could learn from the afternoon staff how to be more accommodating. I would not stay at any other hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location All Around!”
Reviews.Author: pji
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 night stay at this hotel, conveniently located in Trastavere, Rome. It is truly walking distance from all of the major sites in Rome. The hotel's setting is serene amongst orange trees and ivy covered walls. The hotel staffers are a mixed bag with the exceptions of Antonio and Roberto ,who offered the kind of Roman hospitatlity one would expect. The breakfast is plentiful and they even "throw in" an end of the day aray of snacks in the late afternoon. Overall, this would certainly be a place to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “only place for me in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bams
Reviews.Content: stayed in the family suite upstairs - loads of room / ceilings a bit low / shower a bit awkward - but I can't complain. I love this property - 2nd stay here / I book all the time for clients - NEVER a complaint. We stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel recommended for our last night a nearby restaurant - it was the best - Ai Fienaroli / great food, ambience, price (all locals there)... love this neighborhood - very busy at night with strolling Italian youth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: KerryAd
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a lively Roman neighborhood, this hotel was everything it advertises. The staff continually went above and beyond to ensure that we had the best stay - always ready with an answer to our questions, assisting with arrangements, and making excellent restaurant recommendations.The rooms weren't large but they were comfortable and quiet. The wifi didn't work in the rooms, but was accessible in the courtyard and in the bar. We really enjoyed this hotel and the staff. If we go back to Rome, we would definitely stay at the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ElenaA3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay a lot. One has to use their shuttle service because even the cab drivers have difficult time finding the place. Once there, however, it is wonderful. The staff was super nice and helpful. Traveling with 3 kids, we very much appreciated the breakfast in the morning and the beautitful yard setting during the day when we came back to take a break. Take a bike and go visit old Rome in the night (we did it around midnight). Sidewalks are empty, the weather is cool, and the sights are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: MCAInnkeeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in May of 2008. As an extended family we had 4 rooms and everyone seem to be happy with their accommodations. It was quiet and serene (with the exception of our family), and we were always happy to come back here after a busy day of sight-seeing. The breakfast was typical and always satisfied us. The afternoon appetizers and wine were always enjoyed. I was able to get wifi while there, but am not positive it was the hotel's wifi. My mother says this is definitely the place she would stay when next in Rome (I think the same is true for my family as well)!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria is a charming hotel in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret00
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not fancy, but comfortable, the service is great. Breakfast and cocktail hour snacks in the charming courtyard are included, along with bar service in the afternoon and evening and free internet. Staff is very helpful about getting about, and the location in Trastevere is great--restaurants of all sorts all around, and just a block or so off the main piazza where one can eat outside and watch the never ending and always varied activities on the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Rome and can afford Hotel Santa Maria we cannot think of a better place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JandRDevon
Reviews.Content: Lovely quiet hotel, excellent location, very helpful friendly staff. Great breakfasts. Seagulls a bit noisy if you try to sleep with windows open - otherwise faultless.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Flax_Cambridge
Reviews.Content: Superb. This place is stunning, a quiet oasis within the busy old town. Fantastic breakfast, which is eaten in a rustic courtyard with a canopy of orange trees. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: RetiredGezer
Reviews.Content: The location is accross the river from most Rome attractions but we found the location to be a great Get-A-Way after active days of tourism. The restaurants in the area are fabulous and the Reception Staff can provide great recomendations. They actually knew of an Organic Gelato store a few minutes from the hotel. (We rated it the best we found in Italy) We walked to the Forum on our first day and it took around one hour so all other days we used Taxi's which were reasonable (but make sure they use the meters). The breakfast and happy hour in the shaded courtyard was always a delight and a great way to start and end each day. Each evening we met other guests which made the Hotel feel very intimate. The room was cozy (for three) but the bathroom had been updated so we were pleased with the accomodations. When we return we will stay at Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and good home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DebsterNYC2
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Santa Maria to celebrate our honeymoon. The staff was friendly. The breakfast every morning was delicious as were the cappuccino's they made on request. The room was cozy and very clean with a perfect bathtub for soaking. It was tricky to find initially, but the waiters at the cafe around the corner seemed very accustomed to pointing the way without us even asking. And Trastevere was a good neighborhood to center our trip in. We were able to walk to the Vatican AND the Coliseum. The only flaw was that we were able to hear our neighbors' every word when they parked themselves outside their door instead of in the courtyard where their voices would have dissipated. We could also hear them a little in their rooms. Also, it is closest to a tram stop instead of a metro stop, the trams being more complicated to sort out in our first moments in town. Overall, would absolutely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaC
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming place to stay in a wonderful neighborhood in Rome. I previously stayed near the Spanish Steps and I like this area much better. It is a short cab ride to the Vatican and to Old Rome. The rooms are clean and simply furnished. The courtyard is a great way to start your day with a nice breakfast and cappucinos under the orange trees. The staff is helpful and the price is right. We had 2 triple rooms and were very pleased with our acccommodations. The staff made all transfer arrangements for our arrival at the airport and departure to the cruise port. The restaurant recommendations were great as well. We felt very safe in the neighborhood and loved walking around all the shops and restaurants. It was very quiet at night, even though it's in the middle of the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some like it hot?”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMarlin
Reviews.Content: Everything written by others is true. Very nice place but I would only recommend it for non-summer months. I would rate it higher except for the temperature factor, one that negatively impacted the hotel experience. That is, the air conditioning (AC) is centrally controlled and set at around 78-80 degrees. If you are used to cooling off by returning to a cool ac when it is hot outside and you have been walking for a few hours, then you will be out of luck. Rome is hot in the summer and many places in the area do not have ac.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AZTAFan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a great place to stay in theTrastevere neighborhood in Rome. Residing, even if for only a few days, in the heart of old Rome with Chiesa di Santa Maria's bells ringing in the hour, made for an unforgettable trip. The staff of Santa Maria made our stay so comfortable. And, the breakfast each morning was quite good - hot, scrambled eggs - not expected!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Simplicity in a Beautiful, Bustling City”
Reviews.Author: DebNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of 5 (ages 59-10) thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Santa Maria on our first trip to Rome. It was quite surprising to find how it is tucked away down an extremely quiet street in Trastevere, Rome. Amidst the hustle and bustle of the city, we LOVED our delicious breakfasts outside in the peaceful serenity of the orange grove garden. It was also lovely to come back from site seeing and enjoy this outdoor area for the late afternoon cocktail hour. (complementary snacks) The staff couldn't be nicer - very pleasant and accommodating. We hope to return there on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009 based on nothing more than the reviews on Tripadvisor and once again I wasn't disappointed. As others have said this hotel is clean, quiet and well-located. The rooms aren't big but very nice and spotlesslessly clean. It appears that the place was either fairly recently renovated or very well upkept or both. The location was excellent as far as we were concerned. Its a bit of a walk to the touristy stuff (colleseum, Trevi, etc.) but no big deal. We would walk to all the sights and at the end of the day if we ended up too far from the hotel we would just take an relatively inexpensive cab ride back. The immediate neighborhood is great. Abour a million reasonably priced and tasty restaurants within a 15 minute radius of the hotel. Lots of interesting shops as well. Less touristy than other parts of the city. The courtyard surrounded by orange trees was ideal for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast was basic but good and the service excellent. Afternoon snack was also nice though we weren't always able to take advantage of it. The desk people were always helpful in booking tours, recommending restaurants or just giving some general advice. The only downside I can think of is the churchbells at the Santa Maria go all night every 15 minutes. But I'm a light sleeper and it didn't really bother me. Also, it can be difficult to find as its on a tiny street hidden among other tiny streets in Trastevere. We just told the cab drivers to drop us off at the Piazza Santa Maria and we walked the last two minutes back to the hotel. That's the only cons I can think of about this hotel. Of the four hotels we stayed at all over Italy this was my favorite and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here agin or recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last time”
Reviews.Author: ChumsVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. In the heart of the Trastevere, close to everything but away from it all. This time we had a room in the back. So quiet that we almost missed one of the included breakfasts, which would have been a tradgedy given the quality of food and the unforgettable capuccinos. Once again we bought the three day Museum Pass which includes free use of the Rome transit system, buses and metro. Once you get the hang of it you can zip around the city with ease. Liked Best: location and capuccinos Liked Least: cost, but it is Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, clean and in good location. Everyone was very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: traveling2gether85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria. This was our second time at this hotel in the past two years. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean with tile floors. They offer a nice breakfast in the morning of eggs, pastries, cereal and fresh fruit. The courtyard with it's beautiful orange trees and tables is very peaceful and perfect for eating breakfast and relaxing after a long day of touring the city. Everyone from the front desk, housekeeping and in the dining room were very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to help us with transfers to and from the airport and transfers to and from the port for our cruise. They even helped us arrange a car and driver to help us move our daughter out of her apartment. The hotel is in a great location in Trastevere with many restaurants within walking distance. local buses and trams are close by. We hope to return to Rome and will stay again at the Hotel Santa Maira.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MARKPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel. We loved being in the Trastevera region , being in the centre of all the fun and yet having a quiet peaceful haven to return to each evening. the staff were very helpful and friendly.we enjoyed our outdoor breakfasts under the orange trees. Also , it was great being able to use the internet {free}and although we only went to the free 5.30 pm snacks ,once , we did enjoy that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: AaronDublin
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria for one night in May. The regret was that it wasn't for a few more nights. The staff were lovely. The hotel is something of an oasis, bang in the middle of the Trastevere. It's a great base to explore Rome and I suspect would just as well suit couples, friends or families. The price is a bit juicy but this location will never come cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Retreat in the Heart of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: MomtoLH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Hotel Santa Maria for the second time. My daughter graduated from John Cabot University this May and also worked at the hotel part time. They were extremely gracious to us and to her and we thank them for their kindness. The breakfast is wonderful and the afternoon appertizer time was very relaxing. The rooms are immaculately clean with great showers. Don't spend alot of money staying on the other side of the river, it's not necessary. Again, thank you to everyone there for making Holly's graduation so special. Mario you are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and peaceful place for our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ssalvo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the nicest setting I have every stayed in.The orange grove breakfast garden is beautiful and perfect for your morning caffe.From rooms to location all is good.Friendly staff .Loved the area of Trastevere,perfect for our young adult kids who travelled with us. We used the car pick up service and very glad we did,just made getting there easier.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: putigers
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, and the location was excellent. It is off the beaten path in Trastevere, with a beautiful courtyard/garden seating area. Quick walk to any of the other neighborhoods in Rome given its central location. We'd definitely return! The hotel was not a bargain but I believe priced fairly.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: jessnap
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome, alone, for two days this month. It was my first trip to that city, and a friend suggested I stay somewhere in Trastevere. I ended up choosing the Hotel Santa Maria and I'm so glad I did. The service was excellent, the breakfasts were delicious, and the courtyard was relaxing and I was touched to find the trees bursting with ripe oranges. It was a great place to stay, I would love to stay here when I'm in Rome again, and I will recommend this hotel wholeheartedly to anyone traveling there!

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo”
Reviews.Author: KarenSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, particulary the staff. thought their location in the Trastevere was wonderful. Some problems with the air conditioning while we were there but this was not a problem for us. The whole atmosphere at this hotel was one of warmth and hospitality. Antonio and Roberto were exceptional and made our trip to Rome something we will always treasure. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCanuck065
Reviews.Content: oasis of peace amidst a sea of roman turbulance! very peaceful and secure.good value with full breakfast included.another nice touch:bruschetta,pizza,and olives at 5:30 when you get back from long day.interior shaded court with orange trees to relax,have breakfast,or a drink.staff very helpful and considerate.will book tours and taxis for you.literally dozens of restaurants within 2 minutes of hotel for supper.rooms clean,quiet, and good shower system for us north americans.hotel is 15min walk to many sights.however,for vatican,borghese,via veneto,etc.you should take cab.bus and tramway stops are close by.highly recommend to all and would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: romanciaobella
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is so lovely. The service is personalized, the location wonderful and the setting exceptional. Our two children - 9 & 10 - loved their room and loved the courtyard areas with their beautiful orange trees. The afternoon appetizers were a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutch123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night while on a trip to Italy. We love this area of Rome and the hotel was an oasis of calm in the middle of the buzz. Staff were very helpful and welcoming and breakfast was good. However we personally felt that the room was somewhat overpriced and although it was spotlessly clean some of the fixtures could probably do with updating.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis of serenity in the best neighborhood in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TheSTTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. I stayed here 5 years ago somewhat by accident and loved it so much that when I was lucky enough to be back in Rome for 2 days, I didn't even consider any other place. It is a small, boutique hotel, just perfect in it's appearance and experience for a visit to Rome. The rooms are generously sized, immaculately clean and well appointed. There is a small courtyard where you can eat, have drinks or just sit and review your plans for the day. The staff is as helpful as can be. On top of all this, it is located in the center of Trastevere, which is the best (IMHO) area of Rome to be in after you have spent the day touring the rest of the city. It is filled with lively crowds, restaurants, outdoor cafe's and shops. The only negative that I would like to see changed is that the WiFi Internet access was only available in the courtyard and breakfast area. The signal was non-existent in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A gem - go and enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: sdawes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria for 3 nights in mid-May. The setting, staff, and amenities are just wonderful. Rooms are a bit small, but well appointed and spotless, with roomy bathrooms and a great tub/shower. The staff are friendly and very helpful with information, restaurant recommendations and reservations, directions, and so on. The breakfast is very good and to eat or just relax with a drink in a quiet oasis under orange trees in the middle of busy Trastevere -- priceless. Use the car service they offer for arrival and departure -- cab drivers can't find it easily so we (my husband and my 80+ year old parents) had to drag our luggage through several rough cobblestone streets when we arrived. By contrast, our departure by car service was as simple and easy as could be. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing, comfortable stay at the Santa Maria Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoxieCC
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Santa Maria Hotel, and had a wonderful time. We had four adults in the senior suite, which was cozy but very economical - the room was clean and comfortable. The beds were on the hard side (which I prefer), but that seems to be the case in most European hotels. The bathroom was spacious and clean (if you are picky about toiletries such as shampoo and conditioner, then bring your own). The outside courtyard was a great way to get over jet lag, enjoy the sunshine and have a nice glass of prosecco. Breakfast was excellent - scrambled eggs, cured meats, yogurt, etc. Location of hotel is great - we walked everywhere - the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Colosseum. Favorite area to eat was the Jewish Ghetto (a very close walk). Try Il Crespini gelato near the Trevi Square - absolutely delicious. And don't forget to try the artichoke, Roman style! Mmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria is no longer a silent sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: ingliab
Reviews.Content: We have been at the Santa Maria several times before and we have loved it ans always given it top rates. But not this time! I'm afraid the hotel has been known as a suitable place for noicy children and there extremly bad mannered parents - from the Netherlands and from Norway. If you want a peaceful stay in Rome: stay away from Hotel Santa Maria. The next time we go - in june - we will be sure to chose another hotel. We are very sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - an oasis in busy Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Rettoc
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a long weekend in Rome with family where we stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria Hotel. We stayed in the Mansard Suite upstairs which sleeps 5 people although there were just 4 in our party. The room was big enough, clean and very quiet (except for those bells that do indeed ring all night!). The shower was fantastic!!!! The breakfast buffet was great and had everything you would want - bread, meats, cheese, juices, yoghurts, scrambled eggs, pastries - to set you up for the day. The staff were excellent and couldn't have been more helpful. We arrived late on Friday evening and the lady on reception kindly booked us dinner locally (which was fab!) even though it was a public holiday and Trastevere was absolutely packed with Romans enjoying their night out. There are some great places to eat and get gelato in the area. The hotel is within walking distance of all the sites so don't worry about public transport, just bring a good pair of walking shoes! I'd also recommend asking the hotel to book you a car to pick you up at the airport. We didn't and our taxi driver dropped us on the edge of the neighbourhood and we found ourselves wandering around Trastevere not having a clue where were were going even though we had a map! He also charged us 60 euros for the privilege so I'd definitely say take the hotel up on the transfer. We booked a car to take us to the airport who kindly took our bags to his car parked in Piazza Santa Maria. We could have done with him Friday night but that is our fault, not the hotel's. It was lovely getting back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing and just relaxing in the little courtyard surrounded by orange trees. It definitely helped to recharge our batteries. All in all I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel. It was lovely and we had no complaints whatsoever and will hopefully stay there again next time I'm in Rome - I say hopefully because they are so popular they rarely have availability! One of the best secrets in Rome is no longer a secret....unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; beautiful space.”
Reviews.Author: jeanbobean
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel, in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome, is a great location. It's close to the historic center yet has its own character and is right off a great piazza, Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, with a beautiful old church of the same name and numerous restaurants. The rooms are around two courtyards with orange trees and umbrellad tables. The breakfast is great (including scrambled eggs and tasty meats) and service is friendly. Rooms are typically cozy (as in small) but very nicely decorated. The only heads-up I'd give is to bring your earplugs - the bells of the beautiful Santa Maria in Trastevere church ring all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Lahela
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a delight and made our stay in Rome unforgettable. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly. Pehaps the best part was the buffet breakfast which was delicious. All in all one of the best places to stay in Rome and highly recommended, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet spot in otherwise chaotic Rome”
Reviews.Author: love2travelDenverCO
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Hotel Santa Maria, down a quiet alley in Trastevere. Rome is such bustling, loud city, that it was great to get away to this tranquil spot and relax. Trastevere is a great location -- an easy walk from the sights, but really another world from the busy tourist-ridden centro storico, and a nice selection of restaurants nearby. The courtyard is lovely and peaceful. The evening "happy hour" snacks were a great way to relax before dinner. Breakfast was wonderful. The only negative was that our room was small and dark, and didn't really have a place to sit and read or relax. But in a city like Rome, space is hard to come by. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Charming Oasis, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: heavtbagtravelyear
Reviews.Content: A gem. Family run, this small hotel is perfectly situated to visit all the sights in central Rome. Very comfortable beds in small but quiet rooms make for excellent sleeping. The staff is very helpful and friendly and . generous with everything from breakfast buffet goodies, evening appetizers, to maps and restaurant recommendations, Most of the guests seem to be American and Canadian and the staff is happy to speak English or help you practice your Italian if you prefer. Hotel Santa Maria is an oasis of peacefulness, Most of the rooms open onto a quiet courtyard full of orange trees where guests can and often do relax at tables in the sun, even in the winter, sometimes with a glass of wine or a cappucino. A few steps from this garden tranquility, outside the gates of the hotel, you emerge into the bustling, cobblestoned Travestere neighborhood, full of people, cafes and shops and within walking distance to all the major sightseeing spots. Three minutes from the hotel is the lovely Piazza Santa Maria (don't miss seeing the inside of the beautiful church, the oldest church in Rome). My husband and I have been traveling for nearly a year and have stayed in lots of hotels including many nice 5 stars and have never given accolades, or even written a review about any other hotel We stayed at this one over a week and went back a month later because we had such a good stay.. This hotel has the charm of a small boutique hotel and the straightforward detailed quality service of a family run business that cares about the needs of its guests. Very comfortable. The Santa Maria is also extremely well priced, a great value in a city that does not have a lot of good options in that category.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location; great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tompig
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere was ideal for me, my husband and 14 year old son. A stone's throw from the square, cafes, gelato...lots to explore and removed from the main hustle and bustle of Rome across the Tiber but within walking distance. The Hotel itself was fantastic...our windows opened onto a charming courtyard filled with orange trees with little tables for relaxing or having a drink/snack. The Hotel had a really good breakfast with excellent cappuccino and opened the bar area later in the day for free appetizers with cash bar. Since dinners are late, it provided the perfect opportunity to get a glass of wine, some app's and hang out in the courtyard. The restaurants in Trastevere are excellent as well. Everyone at the Hotel was friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for more and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay-Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Darlorafa
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in wonderful Trastevere.Service was excellent. All the sites within walking distance. Restaurant tips: Excellent-Gusto,Piazza Augusto -Alle Fratte de Trastevere(in street of same name) -Ivo Pizzeria,Via Francesco Bad & pretentious-Glass Hostaria

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: CallieBrookllyn_NY
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel set in a great neighborhood for walking about - Trastavere. Take the bikes out for a ride in the neighboring park if you have the time. The staff is excellent and very friendly. The room - junior suite - was lovely and the court yard is a haven from the bustling tourists in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: DrJayConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Italy where we spent five nights in Hotel Santa Maria. This is really an extraordinary place. From the moment our taxi dropped us at the square we were entranced by the quiet alleyways that lead to this lovely and secluded the hotel. Little did we know these same alleyways become lively nightspots full of people strolling and dining in the dozens of trattorrias and wine bars. The hotel is an oasis in Rome, with quiet garden patios under orange trees where we sipped cappuchino and used the Wi-Fi. We walked easily to most of the sites. The staff was happy to summon a taxi for others. They couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was a "mansarda" suite, meaning it was on the second floor in a sort of dormer configuration. It was very comfortable with a seperate sleeping area and 1/2 bath for our teenager, and so quiet that we all overslept the first day. The only sounds we heard were birds and chuchbells from nearby Santa Maria. The breakfast buffet, served in a lovely cafe with beautiful pastrys and fresh cappuchino, made it hard to leave each day, but the incredible sights of Rome await! In all, an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than a hotel, it was like staying with exceptionally good friends”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Dxb
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had been on holiday alone with my eight year old daughter. What a wonderful time we had at Hotel Santa Maria. The location was perfect. During the day we could easily walk to all the sites, stopping for ice cream along the way, and in the evening we could relax outside in the hotel courtyard before seeking a place for our evening meal with a multitude of restaurants to choose from, all less than 5 minutes walk away from the hotel and much more reasonably priced than those next to the main tourist sites. Any questions we had or information we needed was readily provided by the hotel staff with a smile and a genuine interest in making our stay in Rome enjoyable. From bus tours, to tram routes, recommended restaurants, where to buy ice cream, the best wines to bring home with us, current events in Rome and consoling a tearful child (who didn't want to leave at the end of our trip), Hotel Santa Maria was there to help. We enjoyed the courtyard style of the hotel and the fact that it was an intimate experience. The hotel had a simple formula of good friendly service. When we go back to Rome, which we surely must, there is nowhere else that I would want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a long stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: dkpla
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Santa Maria. Our children are 7 and 10, and we were given a perfect room for the four of us. A bedroom with double bed for me and my husband, and an adjoining room for the kids with a bunkbed and sliding door for privacy. And all for a very reasonable price... really a great value. The room wasn't large, but we were very comfortable, and it was quiet, which was a big plus in noisy Rome. The staff was always helpful, and we enjoyed relaxing in the lovely garden and enjoying the complimentary afternoon antipasti buffet. It's also in a great area, Trastevere. It was easy to walk everywhere in the city... nothing seemed too far away. All in all, the Santa Maria was a wonderful experience, and we will definitely stay again next time we go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely book here again”
Reviews.Author: Norway2rist
Reviews.Content: A perfect quiet place in "the middle of" Roma (Trastevere). Lovely (rather small) clean rooms, great breakfast and top service all the way. Several orange trees surrounding the hotels private garden made this hotel something special and not what one expect of a hotel in a big city like Roma. We now know where to stay next time we visit Roma.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: demoville
Reviews.Content: Although it is very hard to find at first, the hotel is a very secluded retreat from the noise of the city. Lots of good restaurants and shops in the area. Our room was functional and clean, maybe not as luxurious as the price would indicate. Breakfasts were good. No internet access in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with Very Good Service and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was everything it was advertised to be. The service at the hotel was wonderful, ranging from arranging very late night transportation from the airport to returning items left behind by the children with us. Breakfast was a highlight with items for every taste, including excellent coffee. The location was ideal -- we walked to all the sights we wanted to see in Rome, from the Vatican to shopping at the Spanish Steps to visiting the traditional sights around the Forum and Colosseum, and everything in between. The Trastevere neighborhood and nearby Santa Maria Basilica added to the experience. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with our 9 yearold”
Reviews.Author: ProfJ_9
Reviews.Content: What a perfect stay in Rome. The Hotel is very clean and charming. Its location is a little difficult for some cabs to find and drive to (very narrow streets) but it is worth it. There are many restaurants nearby and the service could not be better. We stayed 4 nights and want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Really pretty hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for 3 nights in March. The hotel itself was clean and the beds very comfortable. The shower was fantastic! We loved our stay in Rome, the sights and the architecture were spectaculor, but I must say our favourite place was round about the hotel in the Trastevere area - beautiful old buildings, plenty of restaurants and a really great atmosphere. However, even though the area is busy and noisy the hotel was surprisingly peaceful. One word of caution though -make sure you take a detailed map of where to find the hotel - it's down a pedestrian lane in amongst a maze of streets and it took us quite some time to find. But that's the only small complaint - If we return to Rome we shall definately stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: JulieDurham
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Santa Maria. The location was perfect, just a taxi cab ride away from all of the sights. We enjoyed the restauraunts around the area. The hotel itself was adorable. There was a beautiful garden area, and a delicious breakfast included. The rooms were extremely clean, and the staff went over and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. We would definitely return and recommend this place to everyone!! Can't wait to return, Steve and Julie Quinn

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RMTraveler09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is amazing! The service was excellent, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and even the bathroom shower was great. We really loved the courtyards (with the beautiful orange trees), safety inside the hotel, and everything they had to offer. We arrived early in the morning and even though check in wasn't until the afternoon, out room was ready for us!! The breakfast was delicious...eggs, breads, yogurt, cereal, juices of every variety, cappucinos, coffee...there is something for everyone. It is a great location near a lot of eateries and not too far from excellent shopping. We felt very safe in the neighborhood as well. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know that is going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “We were very lucky to find this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tundeRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: we really have an excellent time in Rome, and particularly in the Santa Maria. The location is wonderful, next to Santa Maria in Trastevere, we spent every day a few minutes in the church. The dinners vere close to the hotel, which, after two or three glasses of wine can be very important. The hotel itself is beautiful with its orange trees in the yard, and the bicycles!!! We could go to San Paolo by bycicles, of course it was not a pilgrimage, but you can feel how it could have been, to see the church from the distance, and so on.. Thanks for everything. Grazie, Dio.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen053
Reviews.Content: Slightly difficult to find initially, but a good location - close to city centre but quiet. Very attractive - rooms around old cloisters, nicely decorated and good bathrooms. Very helpful staff - booked us a car back to airport which was significantly cheaper and smarter than taxi. Good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a Quaint Area”
Reviews.Author: ajs0522
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria this past July. Overall, I had found the city of Rome to be a disappointment. If we had not stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria, it would have been completely awful. The hotel and the area it is in (Travestere) were the saving graces. The hotel is by no means a fancy one, but it is clean, the service is great, and the grounds are beautiful. We especially enjoyed the cocktail hour each day; it was nice to return from a long, hot day of sightseeing to cocktails and snacks. The room was adequate, and very very clean. The Travestere is, what I had been told, the most preserved Roman area in the city. It is quaint; cobblestone, narrow streets, and a lot of great restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAK9230
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for a meeting and decided to front-end the trip with some sightseeing time. We loved Hotel Santa Maria. The staff were courteous and very warm and helpful. The bed was firm and comfortable. (Having a neck injury this is very important to me). The location was perfect. We were there 4 nights, We then transferred to a high-dollar Waldorf Astoria property in Rome to attend the meeting. It could not compare with Hotel Santa Maria. I will definitely stay here again. The only down part of our stay was when we went to a restaurant (recommended on the Internet) and were charged 100 Euros for a meal we did not get. We should have stuck with the places recommended by the hotel staff. The hotel staff told us that restaurant takes advantage of tourists and they would never have recommended that place to anyone. We have learned our lesson.

Reviews.Title: “nice and charming hotel in a charming quarter”
Reviews.Author: SwedenStefan
Reviews.Content: we, me and my wife were here in the middle of februar.The roman wintertime when the wind from north is cold as is.However the sun was shining and we had a lovely time in Rome and in Trastevere. The hotel Santa Maria was a very nice and warm place to spend the time. Christel and Stefan Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: traveletta
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Hotel Santa Maria--in Trastevere, an easy walk across the river from 'downtown' Rome, in a lively but laid-back neighborhood...off the beaten track but not out in the sticks. The hotel is on a tiny side street just a few steps away from the Piazza Santa Maria, with its beautiful church. Our room was on the small side, but clean and quiet, looking out onto a lovely courtyard (where they serve breakfast when the weather is good). Decent breakfast with eggs and cold meats as well as the usual breadstuffs--and excellent coffee, of course! Staff helpful without being intrusive. It is not 'full service'--no restaurant, limited bar, no health club or gift shop--but for vacation travel, we prefer a small hotel with character over an impersonal franchise any day. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: doobington
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Great location. Lovely restaurants nearby. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - for a short stay only”
Reviews.Author: Traveller55Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in Feb09 - very quaint hotel (quite different from the normal hotel chains in Rome). The actual hotel is very well decorated and the rooms have a chalet feel to them as each room opens up onto a central courtyard. It has all the mod cons one would expect - the negatives are that our Superior room seemed quite cramped although it was a good size. It is dark too with one small window and becomes claustrophobic if spending too much time in there. Also, they don't allow any ironing in the room. They do not allow personal food and beverages to be put into the room fridge so probably not ideal for a longer stay. The double bed in our room was laid with 2 single mattresses so there was a dip down the center of the bed. There is one computer in the lounge which is free to use but there is no internet in the rooms. There is a bar but is often unmanned and we have to ask for it to be opened. All the staff are friendly and helpful and the central patio is very picturesque with its orange trees. The area is quite central allowing us to walk to all the main sites Vatican, Colliseum etc... and there are lots of restarants within minutes of the hotel front door. So for us it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “eternity in rome”
Reviews.Author: wdpipas
Reviews.Content: piecefull, clean and total support from Hotels people. no doubt, we will repeat. a piece of calm in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Missa17
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved staying at this hotel. We had seen pictures of the oranges growing in the courtyard but didn't expect to see them in January. However, upon arriving, there were the beautiful trees that set such a romantic mood. The staff was exceptionally friendly, especially since we had been delayed so late at the airport, and breakfast each morning was delicious. We traveled to five countries in Europe and this stay at the Hotel Santa Maria was our favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Neighborhood/Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ddthompson
Reviews.Content: Good people, if you're looking for a great hotel and you are overwhelmed by the sheer number in Rome you are reading your last review because you have found your place. My wife and I stayed at this quaint hotel, a former cloister in early January 2009. It is located in the Trastevere area of Rome which is across the Tiber River (Trastevere actually mean 'across the Tiber) from most of the major sites (Colisseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, etc.) It is an easy walk to any of these sites. You may have to walk a little further to some of these sites than if you stayed in central Rome but you would miss out on great views of the Tiber River and an authentic Roman neighborhood experience. Also, Hotel Santa Maria is an EASY busride on the #23 to The Vatican. The walk to the Colisseum is about 30 minutes and the walk to the The Vatican is also about 30 minutes in the other direction. Hotel Santa Maria is an oasis in the middle of Trastevere. This part of Rome is less commercial and has been described as crusty or gritty but don't be scared off by these descriptions. If we had stayed in any of the other hotels we passed along a more beaten path, we would have missed this experience. The area around the hotel has narrow, cobbled stone streets and at night is very well lit. At NO POINT did we ever feel unsafe which is a concern for some people when they go to a foreign city and don't know the area where they are staying. Once you enter the green gate from the street and walk down past the ivy-covered wall that leads to the front door, you feel like you are in a different world. It is secluded, quiet, inviting and comfortable. If we had been there with warmer weather we would have spent more time hanging out in the courtyard after a long day of sightseeing. Mid January isn't prime hanging out weather in Rome. The rooms are comfortable and clean. They are not huge but how big a room does a monk or a tourist need? The bathrooms are modern and clean and the water pressure in the shower is hard and relaxing. They give you fresh towels everyday and make up the room. There is also a safe in the room. The hotel provides breakfast in the morning from 7:30 until 10am. Everything from pastries, yogurt, cereal and fruit to eggs and breads. There is also a choice of juice. The hotel has a computer with internet access but the time it is available is limited. I think you can't use it until noon. Not sure why. Trastevere is also a good place to find food. The hotel staff is good at recommending restaurants in Trastevere. You must try either Taverna Trilussa or ai Fionaroli. (I'm going from memory here on the names but I know I'm close on the spelling) It seems like I should put some detracting qualities about this because no hotel ever gets it exactly right. For us, however, it was a perfect little place with helpful, courteous staff and no problems. I highly recommend this place to anyone heading to Rome and wanting a quiet, clean place to stay. Also, you'll love hearing the church bells in the neighborhood ring. A nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in charming location”
Reviews.Author: CHIJCM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for two nights after Christmas. We enjoy walking, and the hotel's location was perfect: 15 minutes to the Vatican, 20 minutes to the Collosseum, 20 minutes to the Spanish steps, etc. We loved the Trestavere neighborhood and ate dinner there both nights, and the hotel itself is very comfortable and welcoming. Our only regret was not being able to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Feel”
Reviews.Author: Cavone
Reviews.Content: Great location in Travestere. Away from the crowds but close enough to walk to main attractions. Nice courtyards open to the sky. Well done breakfast every morning. Beds and showers were very comfortable. Our selection of room was the smallest of those offered. Would choose larger room next time. Staff very nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Trastevere is hopping for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel based on TA reviews. We found prices much less in Trastevere (food, drink, souvenirs, lodging) than we experienced in Piazza Navono, Veneto, and Spagna. We would definitely return. Pros's: For 170 Euros/night for a double room including a fairly substantial breakfast and evening snacks (pay for drinks,) this hotel was a good value. I e-mailed the hotel to obtain reservations for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day dinners, since I was concerned that not many places would be open) and the hotel graciously made arrangements which they confirmed back to me by e-mail. The rooms are cozy, but very clean, with good towels (no washcloths, as usual in Italy.) Many, many resto's, pizzerias, and trattorias within blocks. Reception and breakfast servers all spoke good English. We arrived around 10:30 am, and were allowed to check into our room early and were offered coffee and snacks from the breakfast table. We felt safe, as the streets were full of people at all hours, and there were also mounted police. Con's: Thin walls, floors meant that we could hear the guest in the room above us typing late at night. When our neighbors staggered in after midnight, we heard every word--take earplugs if you sleep lightly. The rooms have flat-screen televisions, but no clocks. We asked the hotel to reconfirm the arrangements I had made with Rome Cabs (by e-mail from the US,) but the receptionist refused, saying he "could only call his own taxi service" (which at 55E to FCO is much more expensive than Rome Cabs at 45E or the flat/fixed Rome Taxi rate of 40E.) I was stunned by the attitude, since his colleague had been so helpful with resto reservations! The graffitti in this area is overwhelming, and the locals seem happy to throw trash anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Clemchuk
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent reccommended the Hotel Santa Maria using his personal experience of the hotel and the area of Trastevere. There could not be a better Rome experience! The hotel is in a perfect location allowing guests to walk out the door and be on cobbled streets dripping with atmosphere yet walking distance to all of Rome's major tourist sights. Guest become part of the neighbourhood almost instantly. If you want more than just seeing the sights of Rome and are looking to feel Rome this is the area to be in. The hotel itself could use a little updating, mainly some paint. The staff are excellent. accommodating and helpful. Thank you to our experienced agent, www.lovetotravel.ca, for directing us to the Hotel Santa Maria, it made our Christmas holiday in Rome perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: LauraAABoston
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria was highly recommended by a friend, and she was so right! We loved the location, from which we walked almost everywhere, and had great access to restaurants and evening activities. But the Hotel itself is secuded and peaceful, a great haven in the midst of the city. The staff was amazing and very helpful with all of our questions and needs. And the atmosphere is authentically Roman, which was why we were there! It was a completely delightful experience and WELL worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mac747
Reviews.Content: Great safe location to stay while in Rome.Staff are very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTom
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in Trastavere, about ten minutes' walk from the Tiber and twenty from St Peter's. It is very quiet, with a secured locked door leading to the reception from a small street. The beautiful Piazza Santa Maria in Trastavere is just round the corner. The rooms are one storey and arranged arund coutyards with orange trees - very attractive. We stayed in a junior suite with our two children for three nights just before Christmas, for 250 euros per night inclusive of tax and breakfast, and got 10% off for paying cash. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good (scrambled eggs, bread, cereals, cold meats and fruits, with excellent coffee), and also free light buffet at 5.30 pm. The location is very convenient - all of central Rome is within walking distance. Staff were friendly and helpful. No need to use their limo service from the airport - the fare is capped at 30 euros from Ciampino and 40 from Fiumicino.

Reviews.Title: “Sustained excellence”
Reviews.Author: Hemerocallis
Reviews.Content: Located behind discreet yet comfortingly secure gates the Hotel Santa Maria provides a quiet and welcoming oasis in the bustling heart of Trastevere. Set about a courtyard the rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. Each member of the small but efficient staff is courteous, discreet and helpful and the service provided by them is exemplary. The highest accolade that I can bestow is that I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “True Roman Style”
Reviews.Author: Wessland
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and quaint location in a great neighborhood of Rome. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to answer any and all questions. The room was extremely clean and the grounds were very presentable. There was a modest breakfast each morning, and appetizers each evening, and wine for additional cost. Would recommend this to someone looking for a comfortable hotel for a great deal, in the Trastevere neighborhood, as the location is perfect to get to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: karenw22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for 5 nights in November 2008. We booked this hotel based on TA ratings and we were not disappointed. This hotel is a gem in a unique neighborhood of Rome. Our room was large by european standards and was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful,always willing to recommend a restaurant or give directions. There were many really good restaurants within a few minutes walk and most major sites are within walking distance. We will definately stay at the Santa Maria again on our return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay!”
Reviews.Author: mfalind
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 3 nights in Residenza Santa Maria and loved every minute of it! The welcome was warm, the breakfast was good and the room was super! Every day we left after a very good night sleep and breakfast to see a lot of Rome. Tired after a long day it felt like coming home to the hotel! The suggestions to escape the lines with people waiting to get in… how the whether would be the next day.. till the moment our taxi came to pick us up… all was warm and very friendly! Thank you, you’ve made our stay more then GOOD!!! Angelique de Keijzer and Marcia Lindeman (13-16 September 2008, room 6) The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend Trastevere and the SantaMaria”
Reviews.Author: TCvacationer1
Reviews.Content: We followed tripadvisor advice and chose the SantaMaria to stay in while in Rome. We were very happy that we did. We liked the area (Trastevere) and the hotel and its courtyard was nice to return to after a day touring. The rooms were small (typical) but very clean, the entire staff was helpful and pleasant, and the breakfast was one of the best of our trip. We have recommended the hotel to friends and will definitely stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back.”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileSPQR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel four times (great location, nice rooms, excellent service) and hope to do so again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful yard and good service”
Reviews.Author: EKraft
Reviews.Content: This was a hit. Centrally located in Rome, peaceful (previous) nun monastry. Charming yard with orange trees. Very nice, effective and helpsome staff. A large contrast to the very busy and stressful city outside. Not on the cheap side of the spectrum.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of relaxation and class”
Reviews.Author: travelers0870
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Santa Maria and loved it. Quiet, private, beautiful courtyard, the staff were extremely helpful and hospitable. Great bar service, delicious breakfast, coffee served to us at 6:00 a.m. on the way to the airport. Close to the river, within walking distance of everything. Borrowed the bikes and rode along the river pathways. Looking forward to returning to Rome and staying at the Hotel Santa Maria. Brad and Angela

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: REHARVEY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the room was perfectly serviced every day. Antonio and his collegues were extremely knowledgeable, sent us to great places to eat, and always had perfect directions. The breakfast was great, fresh pastries as well as eggs, ham etc. Conrad and his collegues remembered your coffee choices everyday. We stayed 9 nights and will definitly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at Hotel Santa Maria, as good as ever!”
Reviews.Author: CindyMR
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in the past two years. Without hesitation we recommend the hotel highly--it feels like "home", except almost better! The staff are great, the cappucino's are truly THE BEST we've ever had, the rooms are comfy, modern and clean, the location in Trastevere is perfect, etc. We could go on and on... I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with the Hotel Santa Maria! Cindy & Roy Raftis

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: Bridge013
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a tranquil oasis in an otherwise frantic city. Hidden in the excellent eating quarter of Trestevere, it provides a perfect base from which to walk to all the sites in Rome. Our family room (which was very roomy and comfortable) led directly out onto the orange and olive tree coartyard where we would sit with a glass of wine and complimentary canapes. Such a pleasant surprise! The breakfast was also superb! The hotel staff were very polite and very helpful with local knowledge of places to visit and restaurants. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome - though would love to keep this peaceful haven a secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great area of Rome to stay”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBean56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the whole of the last week of October In Santa Maria. Trastevere is a very interesting area to stay with lots of local restaurants to choose from and easy walking distance from most places in the city. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful- particularly those involved in serving the breakfast. Free use of the internet in the evening (together with the snacks supplied) was very much appreciated. The accomodation was on two floors which would be great for a family with children. We kept meaning to use the bikes to cycle around the area but never got around to it. The only slight drawback was the lack of good lighting for oldies who need it to be able to read and also the height of the ceiling particularly when standing in the shower. My 6 foot husband struggled!! I would definitely recommend it! Location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A charming Roman hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Iapyx
Reviews.Content: An intimate and personalized converted cloister tucked into the tangle of lanes in Trastevere. Excellent for those good with a map and those who love to walk about the city. Extremely helpful staff, restful courtyard, superb breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria in Trastevere in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stampfan
Reviews.Content: Very good staff--helpful and knowledgeable. Hotel is within walking distance of many popular sights and areas. The Santa Maria square is only a block from the hotel and the area has many restaurants.The square is the site of the first Christian church in Rome Cross the river to see Jewish Ghetto area plus catch city sightseeing bus--Great! Breakfasts were very good. Rooms clean and quiet,with a delightful courtyard made for wine sampling. Close to bus lines. Would stay there again. Prices were fair for what you received in terms of service and comfort. Check hotel website for photos

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boosh4
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel, great place, peaceful and breakfasts to die for! helpful, kind, welcoming staff with a 'never done too much' attitude. We really liked the bikes, went to river and back on them THREE times! Great idea! RECOMMENDED HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “charming and so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: goldengirlVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 2 nights in October of this year. It is a little jewel in the heart of Trastevere. The rooms are very comfortable, the staff are gracious and helpful, and the breakfasts are delicious...warm pastries, indulgent coffees, and fresh fruits. The rooms are clean, modern, and quiet. The location is fantastic...walking distance to many of Rome's great sights. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a trip to Siena & Chianti region”
Reviews.Author: suegj14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is a perfect location for visiting Rome! The Travestere area has so much to offer that there were times we didn't cross the bridge into the heart of Rome. We walked everywhere, and got lost plenty but discovered many interesting shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel desk was very helpful and accomodating. They arranged a private car to the airport, provided prompt laundry service, and were accurate with directions (to what extent walking directions can be given in Rome). We thought the breakfast was one of the better breakfasts we had during our month in Italy. In the evenings, the hotel offers a nice array of appetizers (no additional charge) to go with cocktails/wine at the bar (reasonably priced). The staff at the Santa Maria were professional and helpful in every regard. The rooms are clean and sufficient even though the decor is dated. We would definitely stay at the Santa Maria again while visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of Trestevere.”
Reviews.Author: Sparky017
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart of Trestevere, quiet, secure and secluded. Fantastic breakfast and wonderful walks to all the major sites and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: FrenchAmericanfamily
Reviews.Content: Our taxi dropped us off in Santa Maria Square since the car couldn't fit through the labyrinth of cobblestone streets in the somewhat bohemian Trastavere district. After a short walk down Via del Piede we came upon the gate leading to the hotel, nestled at the end of a private alleyway and full of charm right from the start.
