The first night we stayed in the larger Mansard room which is very practical for a family (we have 3 teenage daughters), with two bathrooms, one with shower. I believe this is the only room that is upstairs and does not open into the courtyard filled with orange trees. Nonetheless it has a nice view through skylight windows though be forewarned that the ceiling is a bit low. The remaining 3 nights we switched to the suite (not available the 1st night), which is more like a small apartment. Well worth spending the extra money if you can, since the high ceiling and mezzanine loft with 2 beds is spacious and comfortable, tastefully decorated. (The suite can hold 6 people; the only drawback is there is only one bathroom, which some people may think is a problem). It opens up onto the courtyard, with a little bench right outside the door. Since it was November, breakfast was served in a charming old room with vaulted like ceilings instead of in the courtyard. A copious selection of cold cuts, pastries, cereals, juices, bread, lots of drink choices too. Another nice amenity is the little "cocktail hour" which starts around 5 pm, serving little aperitif snacks (free, but you have to pay for drinks). They also lend bicycles for free, and a bike trip around the neighborhood is well worth it ! Also, they lend umbrellas and have a computer for internet use. The staff were very helpful and nice. The hotel really is a gem tucked away in a great neighborhood, a bit out of the tourist area (such as Spanish steps, Trevi, Vatican) but only a short walk to all those main sites. So no problem with location. The neighborhood is booming with restaurants, street vendors selling jewelry, scarves, etc. but yet we didn't feel like we were in a tourist trap. So altogether I would highly recommend this hotel to just about anyone, except perhaps those with very young children (since it is so quiet and secluded). Even our teenagers loved it (and we all know how teenagers can be a bit blasé). The hotel also gives a discount if you pay in cash. The only thing to be wary of is the tour brochures at the front desk. We took a "Rome by night" tour which turned out to be in a covered bus with the tour guide speaking 4 or 5 languages, couldn't see too much and by the time he said it in our language we had already passed by the sight. (We actually left the tour early). Don't know about the other tours in the brochure, but I'm sure you could find better if you look elsewhere. But that has nothing to do with the hotel, which gets a 5 star rating from us. It is listed as a "Hotel du Charme" and it deserves the rating because it really is full of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome for a group!”
Reviews.Author: what11
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome with our two adult children and their spouses...party of 6! This was a perfect location in Rome as it is truly in the neighborhood of Trastevere, apart from the noise and crowds of downtown but an easy walk to many things and easy public transportation. It was recommended to us by a business colleague. The hotel has a wonderful courtyard in the center (it was formerly a convent) that made a great gathering place for us after a day spent apart. Quaint, modern rooms with terrific baths, a wonderful breakfast and a full bar. We highly recommend and will return! The Dobbs Family

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Veronica69Ireland
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel hidden away in the heart of Trastevere.... did not feel we were in a capital city as it was so peaceful & quiet

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay in the dynamic city of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: VaeTimmer
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant Hotel with the right atmosphere. Great service en willing personnel. Very clean, well maintenanced accommodation. Nice garden with terras. Good kitchen. Excellent breakfast. The right place to stay in the dynamic city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: krdr77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only one minute walk from Pizza di Santa Maria in Trastevere, but the atmosphere is very nice and quiet, with orange-trees in the garden just outside the room-door. The service is very good and the breakfast even better (chocolate-croisants are delicious :-) The price is higher than some other hotels, but we think it was worth it. There are several nice restaurants/pizzerias in the area and Colosseum, the Vatican and Via del Corso are only 20-30 minutes away by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: ScientistBob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked four days at Hotel Santa Maria in October on the glowing recommendation of a friend. Sometimes such recommendations can be disappointing, but this one was right on. The hotel is impeccably clean with charming rooms, surrounding a lovely walled garden where we sat and played scrabble after sightseeing. We were welcomed warmly by the Concierge (in English) who was knowledgeable and helpful throughout our stay. Breakfast each day was very pleasant and much more than the usual continental. The Trastavere neighborhood has a great deal more character than central Rome and we loved walking through the maze of tiny streets. We recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria on a recommendation from a Hotel manager in Atlanta, GA. We are so happy we did! It was perfect for what we wanted and needed during our stay in Rome. The Trastevere neighborhood is charming and not too touristy. We found it very easy to get to all the major tourist attraction by walking. The hotel is tucked away and very quiet at night which provided for great sleep. The rooms are clean and comfortable plus charming. The bed was good, great water pressure in the shower, AC, and cable TV. We used the courtyard for the hotel provided breakfast in the morning and wine & antipasti in the evening. A plus is the hotel has a complimentary computer with internet to check email, google, etc. The staff is very friendly and helpful and English speaking. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any friends or family looking for a quaint and charming hotel that is reasonably priced in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Sympathetic and helpful”
Reviews.Author: agtowle
Reviews.Content: I am sorry for not writing this review sooner. We stayed at the Santa Maria in April this year. All the reviews about the charm, location, and style of the hotel are correct. Also our transfer from the airport, early arrival from Hong Kong, was seamless. We were offered breakfast on arrival as " airlines don't do a proper breakfast and we have the best coffeee in Rome." Our room was ready soon after. My wallet was stolen on our first full day in Rome at the begining of an 8 week round the world trip, Sydney to Sydney Australia. We could not have been happier with the hotel's attitude to our predicament. They directed us to the police station, helped us with phone calls and when the frustration of dealing with Visa International became too great, treated us to a bottle of red wine. Thank you for that. I would however like to keep this hotel a secret, I would hate not to be able to get a room on our next trip to Rome. Angela and Geoff Towle

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: DavnicSyd
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. Breakfast was fantastic, as is the outside courtyard for a drink in the afternoon. The area (Trastevere) is about a 15 minute walk from either Vatican, Colosseum, or Patheon. It's very quiet around the hotel during the day, but at night time it picks up from around 7.30pm when all the bars and restaurants start to fill up. Don't stay here if you want to be in the middle of everything, but I would recommend this place if you want to be able to relax a little more, and walk to the sights each day. Rooms were quite small, although the large, clean bathrooms and the courtyard makes up for this. A little tricky to find. There aren't really many signs, and the Lonely Planet map we had marked the hotel in the wrong place. Luckily the guys from the garage up the road saw us with our suitcases and sent us in the right direction. We did think the hotel was a little expensive. We paid around E220 for this (compared to better hotels in Venice where we paid only E150), but maybe that's just Rome for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FishSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Italy, which started off in Rome. The Hotel Santa Maria was a fantastic first stop for two jet-lagged travellers -a quiet haven amid the busy streets of Rome. The location in Trastevere is great. Walking distance to all "major attractions" and great nightlife right on your doorstep. The staff were helpful and friendly and suggested very good restaurants, walking itineraries and activities. We will definitely stay there again, and have no hesitation to recommend the hotel. The only problem was that our room (Suite NO. 20) has a very low ceiling on the top floor, which is uncomfortable for people over 6 ft.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Beth624
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a trusted friend, and she did not steer us wrong! The hotel is in a great location - you'd never believe it could be so quiet and calm amidst the lively square. Exceptionally clean and comfortable, and a great place to go back to after a long day of sightseeing. Our room was a touch small, but had all the modern amenties we needed. And the breakfast (served in the courtyard) was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Secret Tucked Away in Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: KLynnW
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at Hotel Santa Maria and it was lovely. We had already decided that we wanted to stay in Trastevere while in Rome because of the old Rome feel and restaurants all around; but finding the Hotel Santa Maria really topped off our stay. We were in the Junior Suite for 3 people and there was plenty of space and storage and comfort for 3 women. We were is close walking distance to all in Trastevere, especially Piazza Santa Maria. The breakfast each morning and the evening buffet snacks were great. The presentation and selection of food was the same at 7: 30 as it was at 10:30, there was no letting the selection run low because breakfast was almost over. We enjoyed returning to wine and snacks in the late afternoon and unwinding and relaxing in the courtyard, before heading out in Trastevere to any one of the great restaurants. The hotel staff were really helpful in suggesting wonderful places to eat, but it was also fun to wander through the cobblestoned streets and choose ourselves. The hotel offered to arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel for us and it was definately worth the 55 Euros. The driver drove us through the narrow cobblestoned streets right through the gates of the hotel, it would have been very difficult for us to have found the hotel otherwise as it is really tucked away. We will definately be reccomending this charming oasis to family and friends and are looking forward to another visit ourselves. You must stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here! Many close restaurants, beautiful, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: joofa_bobbles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is truly gorgeous. After touring the loud craziness of Rome, to be able to come through the gates in Trastevere to the Hotel was a relaxing sigh so we could recoup our energy for the evening. It was so peaceful to sit in the courtyard, have the happy hours snacks :-) and wine/beer and add entries in our travel log. And, after touring Rome, to be able that evening to just walk out those gates into the funkiest and happening neighborhood and STROLL to our pick of (OH!) delicious restaurants without having to again "find our way" where to dine was wonderful. A guitarist was singing in the streets, with patrons singing along. OUr pasta at Piatti Ricco restaurant was out of this world. I was proud of myself for finding Hotel Santa Maria on the internet! The staff was so friendly and helpful, and the accomodations were beautifully decorated, with delicate borders painted on the walls, really matching the curtains. Very classy, very funky, what a cool place! The grafitti in Trastevere itself is a bit startling at first, but after seeing it all day in Rome, we knew that as much of a shame as it is (WHO IS DOING THIS??), it didn't mean the neighborhood was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Oh what an Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaBlues
Reviews.Content: We contacted the property. All the reviews were correct: this was a beautiful, peaceful villa in the midst of an energetic and fun neighborhood, replete with locals and GREAT flavor - food, wine, scents, etc. We drove (collected a car in Germany) and navigated the hellacious roads and lanes(!) to the villa. The drive/navigation ended in a quiet, enclosed, and secure property. We WALKED everywhere! The staff was top shelf, kind but unpretentious. Recommended GREAT local cuisine. We WILL be back. Brad and Julie Blue

Reviews.Title: “Greatly located, very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: virginiegoubert
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very charming, lovely and very friendly staff. We could even borrow some bikes, for free, to go around Rome! Hotel is located in the heart of Trastevere... Could not be any better! It's expensive though...but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWolverine
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, friendly staff. Our group was actually made up of two couples. All 4 of us stayed in the Mansard Suite, which has 1 double bed, 2 single beds and 2 bathrooms. At 330 Euro/night for the 4 of us, you couldn't beat the price for that location. The room worked out great and I would highly recommend it for families staying in Rome. The breakfast was great but the bar closesly rather early (after happy hour) and the hotel staff all go home about 8pm, save one person at the front desk. I do have to warn that no taxi drivers know where this hotel is. The best we could do was to get dropped off at the nearby Piazza Santa Maria Trastevere (which everyone does knows) and walk the 5 minutes back to the hotel. This was no big deal except when we first arrived and had to carry our luggage from the piazza back to the hotel because even the airport limo I had arranged didn't know exactly where the hotel was. The neighborhood is wonderful with some great restaurants just around the corner from the hotel and lots of cafes and shops to see. We were able to walk from the this hotel to all of the major attraction however some of those walks were quite long. All in all I thought this hotel was a great value and I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil haven”
Reviews.Author: thereset
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel, lovely peaceful setting, but just moments from the bustle and many restaurants of Trastevere. Couldn't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Special little place”
Reviews.Author: Flojo222
Reviews.Content: We really had a wonderful stay at Santa Maria hotel! Perfectly located (safe neighborhood), the staff is extremely friendly and happy to help with any booking you might be interested in (tours, restaurants etc...). Rooms are basic and clean, lovely breakfast in the patio, free internet access, walking distance to all major attractions... Highly recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AMB0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Santa Maria for the second time in late August 2008, as part of a self-organised holiday, travelling from Sorrento to stay in this hotel as we knew it was worth it. It was delightful to return, with welcoming staff and fantastic service - sadly not reflected in all other places we've stayed in Italy. It's only about 15 minutes walk from the Vatican in one direction, and the same to other sites such as the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain in another - a great central location, and Trastevere itself is a joy (don't miss the square just round the corner). The hotel is very comfortable and is a real haven of peace and quiet. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: chunkcat
Reviews.Content: LOVED, LOVED our stay here. The courtyard was a wonderful social gathering place. We ate breakfast in the morning, played cards in the evenings, and met other travelers, all under the orange trees. The staff was very helpful, and our room was clean. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaLeverkusen
Reviews.Content: We loved this small little hotel with its courtyard where you can sit outside under orangetrees. The rooms are clean and nice and we could sleep very well in our doublebed. The bathroom seemed to be new. Although the room is not very big it is spacious enough for 2 people. They have a new TV with channels from different countries (we did not need it because there was so much to do in Rome). We liked the breakfast with scrambled eggs, bred, fruits, yoghurts and so much more (even different cakes) and coffe was always freshly brewed. In the late afternoon there is a complimentary buffet between 5.30 and 7.00 p.m. if you order something to drink. The bar is open until 10 p.m. The gate is closed in the evening but you can ring a bell and they let you in (camera). The reception is open 24 hours a day. You can arrange a limousine service from and to the airport with the hotel (55 EUR each tour for 2 persons). This is a little bit expensive but so comfortable that we definitely will do that again when coming back. On the first sight the neighborhood looks a bit shabby (graffities) but it is so charming! We were never afraid to walk outside the hotel in the evening and often sat down on the Piazza in front of the church to listen classic music, seen breakdance or something else. The restaurants are much better than at tourist sights (like Trevi Fountain) and not so expensive. You even get complimentary bycicles but I would never use them in Rome... better walk! You can reach the most sights in 20-30 minutes by foot. But there are busses to (a 5-minute walk from the hotel). Look for the Roma Pass (free or reduced entrance in museums an 3 days free busses). We REALLY loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, charming, lovely...complimented my wedding”
Reviews.Author: MMHB
Reviews.Content: My aunts, grandparents, parents and I stayed at this charming hotel a few nights before my wedding at the church of Santa Maria in Trastevere, which is just footsteps away from this hotel. The staff is great, the rooms are impecable and lovely, and they made my special day even more wonderful. My stay could not have been more pleasant and memorable. Whether you are on your honeymoon, preparing for your wedding, traveling with your family or friends, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul small Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: frg49jms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Santa Maria. The hotel staff was excellent and everything was handled very well (in English, thank you!) from the reservations, to a couple changes we had to make (addition of a 4th person; arrival one day later due to missed connection), to recommendations for dinner, and arrangements for transportation. The location cannot be topped! The Trastavere area is so convenient for walking to all the major sites, but not in the middle of crazy Rome. We had excellent meals within 1 block radius of the hotel. The nearby Piazza Santa Maria is a lively place that our teens enjoyed walking to on their own (we never worried). Even though the hotel is in a busy neighborhood, it is gated (beautiful - you feel like you're in a private estate) and quiet. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh made Capuccino the best! The rooms were exceptionally clean. We appreciated the refrigerator/wet bar in the room as well. Our only complaint about the hotel room was the ceiling height on the second floor (we had a Junior Mansard Suite). We were unaware this was an attic type of room which was no higher than 7 feet in the center, then tapered to no more than 4 feet on either side. My 6-foot husband hit his head several times. [Unless you stand in the middle of the room, you are ducking your head or hunching over to unpack or get into bed.] We spent most of our time out and about exploring the city, so we managed during the stay and didn't let the attic room bother us. The bathroom was quite cramped with no place to put our toiletries, which if we were paying $200/night would have been acceptable, but at almost $500 USD equivalent/ night, it was a disappointment. Alas, that is the price of Rome! We would definitely stay at the Hotel Santa Maria again (but would book two rooms for our family of four next time, instead of Junior Mansard).

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL stay at Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: avragi
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Santa Maria. It was beautiful and the neighborhood was incredible. We will absolutely return and I will recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: rkgl
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel for us. The courtyard was fantastic. Rooms were clean. Firm beds. Good breakfast (and appetizers before dinner). It worked really well for us. Know that the hotel is 15 to 20 minutes away from the "sites", but is right in the middle of the night life of Trastevere. We took a bus to the sites or walked which worked well. Everything was good; but what would make me go back is the courtyard. Having the oppotunity to sit outside in a shaded environment at the end of the day (of siteseeing) made the hotel a big hit. Our 71 year old mothers loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jolittle777
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful from the moment we arrived. The reception met us at the door and welcomed us. Gave great advice on tours and restaurants. Located just off the Santa Maria Piaza the hotel is in a great location in the unique Trastevere, walking distance to most attractions. Wish we could have stayed longer. If we return to Rome we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: flwitravelers
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Beautiful gated courtyard. Exceptionally friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Like a little oasis in the middle of busy city of Rome. We loved staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: RCA
Reviews.Content: wonderful place for families. Clean, quiet,cozy, and well located. we had a very relaxing stay. The staff was helpful and courteous. they can help you with anything. great breakfast and cocktail hour. Would love to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: maha_avatar
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Santa Maria. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The rooms are very simple, clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was all you could want, and the breakfast room very charming. The better choice, though, is the courtyard, which has amazing upward views, but is nicely shaded from the sun and is given a sense of privacy by the large umbrellas. We enjoyed going back to that courtyard in the early evening for the complimentary snacks and enjoyed a glass of wine to relax and unwind before going back out into the crowds of the ever bustling city for evening walks. It was an oasis of tranquility. The hotel is in Trastevere, a wonderful, very picturesque, great location, and is just around the corner from Santa Maria in Trastevere and the piazza of the same name, which has very good restaurants and a gelato store. Do go inside the church, it is amazing! All that you want to see is within reasonable walking distance. What more could you ask for? We would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, delightful haven in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Parrotfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it really helped make our trip to Rome. Booked on the basis of its excellent reviews we couldn't fault it (except possibly the price but it is competitive within central Rome). Location - max 30 minutes walk from the Vatican, Colisseum & Trevi Fountain and in the middle of lovely Trastevere with great restaurants on your doorstep, but also unbelievably quiet. Room - big enough for a couple with a lovely bathroom, wardrobe space, free safe & flat screen TV incl BBC World & CNN, reasonable minibar with water for 1 Euro. Breakfast - good choice from fresh fruit, cereals, ham&cheese, pastries, scrambled egg, juices and fantastic Italian coffee. Evening Buffet - free antipasti incl. bruscetta and try a glass of prosecco to accompany it! Service - second to none, reception was always manned and offered advice on restaurants, transport, info about the sites etc. Thanks to the previous poster for the photographic route from Piazza Santa Maria - very helpful! My tip is to get the standard train from Fiumicino Airport to Stazione Trastevere, then the no. 8 tram to Piazza S. Sonnino then walk only 5 mins. Only 5.5 Euro + 1 for the tram (buy before you board at tobacconists) - half the cost of the Express to Termini and much quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of peace in bustling Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Carcharhinus
Reviews.Content: Came across this hotel during one of my previous visits and decided to try it out. Booking was easy and flawless, pick up from the airport went like a breeze, but taking the train (direction Tiburtina/Orte) and the tram (nr 8) is just as easy. I had the suite mansarde, which is on the first floor, right underneath the roof. It consists of two rooms over the length of the loft (two single beds in the first room, a double bed in the second room), a separate toilet and a bathroom with toilet. Excellent for family of 4/5, but not for people over 6' because of the roof. I am 5'11" and could just stand upright in the shower, so if you are taller, go for the rooms downstairs. The hotel is very quiet, which is amazing considering it sits right in the middle of Trastevere. The staff is very friendly and courteous and the hotel offers bicycles free of charge. Riding a bike is an excellent and convenient way of exploring Rome. The court yard is a lovely place to read a book and drink a glass of wine. As far as real sumptuous luxury goes, this is not the Hassler, but it makes more than up for that by being friendly, peaceful and quiet, and excellently located. How friendly? We mismanaged my booking, so I arrived one day late and left one day early. The hotel declined to charge the extra days on the ground that I had not stayed there, even though they might have let the room to someone else. I have been to Rome more than a dozen times, but from now on this will be the hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Santa Maria!”
Reviews.Author: SEWZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for three nights at the end of a three week trip through Italy. When we arrived at the Hotel, we were exhausted from traveling for so long and not expecting much from the hotel, as many of the hotels where we had stayed were disappointing. When we walked into the courtyard, we were thrilled. The staff was friendly and helpful, the courtyard was peaceful and the room was clean and very comfortable. The bed was the most comfortable one I slept in while on our trip. The breakfast was also fantastic and the snacks during happy hour were delicious and much appreciated. The Trastevere neighborhood has so much character and was such a great place to stay. It's nice to get out of the hectic pace of Rome and stay in a more "authentic" neighborhood. When coming back to the hotel after a long day of walking, it seemed like an oasis. While it is expected that the restaurant prices in Rome will be very expensive, the prices in the Trastevere seemed very reasonable. Every meal we had was delicious and we were never disappointed. The neighborhood looks a little dicey when you first get there (lots of graffiti, tiny streets) and the hotel is a bit tough to find at first, but one you get the hang of it, it is simple. The neighborhood was lively at night and very safe. We felt like it was a much less touristy area and definitely preferred it to the tourist spots. Overall, we loved the Hotel Santa Maria and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone or to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great People”
Reviews.Author: travellinandy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Hotel Santa Maria on our honeymoon trip throughout Italy and this place made Rome our best place visited. The staff was great from the beginning and the room was perfect for our stay. The food in the morning was delicious and the early evening snack was such an oasis to come home to. We also decided to take one of the Green Line tours promoted by the hotel, and it was great as well. Thank you very much for the great information and the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: kev1jr
Reviews.Content: A terrific base for a 4 day stay in Rome. Comfortable, efficient and beautifully appointed. I travel a lot and this was a special hotel. Kevin Riley

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the center of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: kris_has_wanderlust
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked our stay at the Hotel Santa Maria for a three-day stay in Rome, prior to a week's vacation in Sarteano, Tuscany. We made our reservation solely based upon the website and other reviews that we had found. We were sold when we saw the video on the hotel's website. We loved the music and photos of the "friendly staff"! We were not disappointed. This cute hotel was right around the corner from the Piazza Santa Maria. It is gated, so it is very safe, and it is located in a fairly residential section. Our room was near the back of the hotel, tucked around a corner with its own little patio. The room was well appointed, and at night we were lulled to sleep by the bells from the steeple of Santa Maria in Trastevere. Each evening the hotel serves a wonderful complimentary spread of antipasti, and the morning breakfast is just as ample. Tables are located inside in the cantina, or outside in the beautiful courtyard dotted with lemon trees. The front desk staff were very helpful in getting us acquainted with the area, recommending places to see and excellent local restaurants. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a charming place to stay in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mike_freitas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria helped us get the most out of our stay in Rome. We were welcomed with complimentary champagne and snacks to celebrate our honeymoon and treated like family. Every restaurant recommended by the staff was perfect, and we had no need to stray from the Trastevere neighborhood for meals. Excellent location and staff made this a perfect find for us. We look forward to returning someday!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in busy Rome- wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sarajlm4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a recommendation from a Friend who stayed there a year before. We are so glad we did! When we entered the grounds from a tiny side street in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome we weren't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised to find a garden area with tables surrounded by orange trees. Our room was tucked away and had it's own private seating area outside- something we didn't even request. If you have the chance- ask for room #1! This place was peaceful, charming and inviting, the evening happy hour was a wonderful chance to relax after a day of sight seeing in the busy streets of Rome. The included breakfast was also appreciated. Great walking distance from anything you'd want to see. Enjoy! S. Murphy, Lancaster PA

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sallcallShorne
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor, I have tried to book this hotel 4 years running and it was always full. But this year we were lucky and it lived up to its excellent reviews. Staff were friendly and extra helpful, it was an oasis of calm in the hustle and bustle of rome, especially the garden, surrounded by orange trees.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: fergle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GEM in Rome, and is really an oasis in an eclectic area that has an active piazza, beautiful church, and good tratorrias. The hotel has excellent service, a gated entrance with good breakfasts and appetizer/ bar. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommended in the Trastavere area!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Clezzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is utterly charming. I loved the little courtyard with its laid back atmosphere beneath the pretty orange trees and the rich green ivy climbing up the walls. There are thoughtful little touches all over the place, like the little private courtyard they gave us with table and chairs. The rooms aren't overly plush but are comfortable, beautifully clean and the bathrooms modern and pristine. As for the hotel staff, they can't do enough for you. My boyfriend unfortunately got flu on our last day and they let him stay in the room on the day of departure until we needed to go to the airport. I can't recommend this hotel and the area it is in (Trastevere is quaint, quite arty farty but unpretentious and so interesting) enough and we will be going back there. Book early - it's understandable incredibly popular. Thank you Hotel Santa Maria for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: ekkeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights at the end of April. It was perfect for me. I wanted to be in Rome, but not in the city center, and not on a noisy street. It's in the heart of old Trastevere, which was kind of like stepping into a collection of vintage postcards. The hotel is a few minutes walk off the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere down narrow little streets/alleys, and it is further removed from the street by a long driveway. It was very quiet, save the occasional talkative guests in the courtyard. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are around a central courtyard that's very picturesque. Breakfast included a good variety of fruit, cereal, meats and pastries; several varieties of juice plus coffee, hot chocolate. Stayed in room 21, which can sleep 5-6 people between the main room and a little sleep loft. Nice space, comfortable, clean. Getting to the hotel the first time was a little tricky...have posted photos showing the path from the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. (Tip: the street numbers on Vicolo del Piede don't go in a logical way!) Good dinner near by at Artu cafe...nice gelato at Blue Ice (a chain?) and pizza to go place Pizzarius very good too. They were fully booked for my 5th and last night in Rome, so they made a reservation for me at Residenza Santa Maria, their sister hotel on the other side of the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: MJSSNotts
Reviews.Content: We were searching fo rthe ideal place to stay for a 5 day family break in Rome. We wanted something different but we also wanted to be close to the centre of Rome so we could walk to the sights not be busing or taxiing in and out each day. The Santa Maria was absolutely perfect. We stayed in a junior suite which turned out to be ideal for us; two beds downstairs for the choildren and a double upstairs. The area around the hotel is great - genuine old town with small bars and restaurants. Top tip: go to the Restaurant Taverna Trilussa - fantastic real italian food. We just can't wait to go back!!!!!! Mike, Jackie, Samantha and Scott Bailey

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for A Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AandAinActon
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in Trastevere (in our opinion, the best neighborhood in Rome in which to stay) combines the best of hotel and B&B experiences: Intimate, quiet, friendly and very knowledgeable staff, excellent breakfasts, modern amenities, and full service. The hotel is surrounded by good and moderately priced restaurants and is located within walking distance of all of Rome's major and minor attractions. We have stayed in hotels and B&B's in many places in the US and Europe and the Hotel Santa Maria di Trastevere ranks at or near the top of our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Oasis in heart of Trastavere”
Reviews.Author: crossman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome and found the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastavere absolutely wonderful. The hotel staff were charming and couldn't do enough to help if you asked for anything - the rooms were spotlessly clean and as far as the location goes, it couldn't have been better. Literally seconds away from the square but far enough away to be peaceful and a beautiful relaxing place to enjoy an evening glass of prosecco under the orange trees in the courtyard. You can also enjoy the complimentary antipasti laid on by the hotel around 6pm every day. There was a very good-natured free for all pillowfight between seemingly hundreds of young people in the square on Sunday 27 April which very quickly featured on youtube later. Not necessarily cheap but worth every euro and we would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: JPB11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay Rooms were very comfortable, staff very friendly, and the location was perfect for our requirements Although it is in the middle of Trastevere with lots of bars and restaurants, the location of the hotel is a haven of peace

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Askews
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel: location, staff and facilities was very good. The staff are multi-lingual, polite and knowledgeable of the local area and city as a whole. Tips regarding restaurants and tours [of the Coliseum and Vatican] were followed and found to be first rate. The area in which it is set is very unusual, the roads are ultra-narrow and it is easy to get lost! In fact, we found this aspect of the location to be rather charming, an almost magical aspect of the district of Trastevere. Even if you do get lost in the vicinity of the hotel, don't worry at all. Besides finding more lovely bars and restaurants, you'll find your way to the hotel after a few minutes and at no time will you be in danger, as the streets in the area are always well populated with locals and tourists. A tip for those of who like to take your own music away with you, there are no DVD/CD players in the rooms. So, take your own, either a portable player or a docking station with speakers and your iPod. I found this out beforehand and fortunately we took our iPod and speakers... We took a taxi from the airport [they are capped at €30 by the government], so that cost us €30 plus a €5 tip. However, because we wanted to take no chances [time wise] when we returned to the airport for our flight home, we took up the hotel's offer of their own driver to the airport. This cost €55 but was well worth it. The driver was very pleasant and immaculately well-presented. The car was a high specification Mercedes too, we travelled to the airport in great style, and we felt like VIPs, worth every cent. In summary, when we return to Rome, we will definitely be staying there again. Will and Elaine, Liverpool, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RockyochZorro
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. This included good tips for where to eat and even to help with practical matters such as helping a sick traveller in our group. A good location to get to anything - walking distance to most all the sites, in less than 30 minutes. Breakfast buffet had a modest but tasteful selection. A daily english newspaper was also available. Transportation to and from the hotel was arranged by the hotel and very easy. The rooms were clean and had a large bathroom. We would stay here again on another visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Oasis - Great Trestevere Location!”
Reviews.Author: dmp94115
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed in a suite at the Santa Maria. It was absolutely lovely! Very charming setting with the orange tree courtyard. (Would make a wonderful oasis from the summer heat.) The 2-room suite was perfect for 3 people sharing. The bathroom was large and clean - American-sized shower was a bonus. We loved the happy hour drinks and nibbles and the breakfast spread was wonderful. The staff was very kind and helpful - recommending a great local restaurant for dinner. And the neighborhood is great - fun bars and restaurants at night, nice walk across the river to the duomo area for daily touring of the sites. We were even able to park our car there, which was a great convenience for us. All in all, it was a completely wonderful experience. I'm sure we'll be back and absolutely recommend it as a great stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice oasis of rest in hectic Rome”
Reviews.Author: MCMixed
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfull hotel in the middle of Trastevere in Rome. Trastevere is filled with nice restaurants and bars, on walking distance of all highlights in Rome. Breakfastbuffet is very good. If freshly squeezed orange juice and real muesli are added it will be excellent. Wonderfull garden and pleasant and serviceminded staff.

Reviews.Title: “It grew on us”
Reviews.Author: Harches
Reviews.Content: The walk to the Santa Maria is through back alleys which are not too clean. The hotel however is a lovely quiet place, an oasis. Rooms were clean ,well appointed and well cared for. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good . The major sights are easily accessed and eating and drinking options are only minutes away. Some good book shops in the area were a pleasant find too. At the end of a four day stay, our party of two couples went away very satisified. The hotel had arranged transport to and from the airport for us and we were glad of that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Traditional”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBumblebee
Reviews.Content: The stay at Santa Maria exceeded all our expectations. The hotel was lovely and very clean and we had a very warm welcome. The service was first class. We really liked the complimentary snacks in the evening which after a long days sight seeing was most welcome. The hotel was over the river from the 'main attractions' but if you don't mind walking then this is definitely a place to stay. It had lots of little lovely places to eat around its side streets so you are spoilt for choice. Would definitely go back and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Fintch
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel out of a hotel guide that is well known for choosing very cosy, charming and tasteful hotels in every price category, and indeed the Hotel Santa Maria fully meets these expectations. The Hotel was very lovely and clean. It is located in the middle of a beautiful and vibrant quarter of Rome, very close to the most historic sites. Within this hot spot ,Hotel Santa Maria is like an oasis, offering you a very relaxing, quite and private atmosphere. The price is completely justified. I highly recommend you this Hotel when visiting Rome. P

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: j_heart57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner in January after reading reviews on TA. The quality, location are as advertised. Rooms are clean and modern. Location is very convenient: We rarely used public transport, and walked to Vatican, Colosseo, Forums, etc. One thing that exceeded our expectations was the breakfast service and afternoon snack service: Both were excellent. The room where they serve breakfast/snacks is also a reading room / internet (free) room, and a comfortable place to hang out if you don't want to be in your room. Desk service pretty good - they all speak English, and are friendly (one of the desk attendants, a male, was the exception -- once he rudely kept me waiting while he finished a personal phone call). Trust them for local restaurant recommendations. No major problems come to mind. Some have mentioned that there is a lot of graffiti in the area, and this is true, but we never felt unsafe while walking around: It's a populous area. One thing to be aware of: Getting to the hotel can be confusing if you try to do it on the cheap (as we did). We took the local train, not the Leonardo da Vinci Express, from FCO to Trastevere station (not Termini) and then caught the Largo Argentina tram from there. Take this to the last stop before the Tiber - the stop is called Belli - cross the street and head away from the river for 1.5 blocks. turn right on via della lungaretta (a small busy street that's not well marked) and walk until Piazza Santa Maria (this is a prominent Piazza and available on most every city map of Rome). you'll know when you're there. go right on your first street after blue ice gelato, and then veer back to the left on vicolo del piede. hotel gate is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Pleasent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gumboo
Reviews.Content: This was quite a nice hotel with all rooms on the ground floor. Rooms face on to a very nice pebbled courtyard. The staff were pleasent and helpful. The area is full of narrow cobbled streets and the hotel is a short walk from lots of nice restaurants and bars. It's not as convenient as other locations for Metro and busses but a five minute walk will bring you to a taxi or bus stop. I would definitely recommend the Hotel airport transfere service, it's very convenient and the hotel can be a little difficult to find if you are not used to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: DBDBDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect - I cannot praise it enough. Its is located in a very nice area of Rome. and the atmosphere is special - The perfect place for a holiday. The building itself is very nice and welcoming. You feel comfortable from the first moment you enter the reception. Staff are very friendly, helpful and professional (went out of there way to organise something for me). Breakfast was good and in nice weather it would be lovely to sit outside on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kateandmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Year and the staff were wonderfully helpful and friendly Tizania one of the reception staff recommended restaurants each night and we have fabulous meals. the beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. Great attention to detail and no request was too much trouble Lovely peaceful location close to twisty little streets with bars and restaurants as well as the beautiful church of Santa Maria

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely charming”
Reviews.Author: Roxie411
Reviews.Content: First time in Italy and the Santa Maria did not disappoint. From the moment you walk through the gates the magic starts. As you pass the ivy covered walls you are welcomed so graciously. At this point you can't help but start to smile as you notice the Orange trees and the courtyard. The owner, Paolo, is accessible and friendly. The staff was terrific and multi lingual. The Santa Maria offers a daily breakfast and evening cocktail hour that is really delightful. The neighborhood is terrific, easily walked to dinner each night. True Roman spirit abounds every corner. Absolutely loved the whole experience! Grazie. JM, North Carolina, USA

Reviews.Title: “Nine Unforgettable Days at Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: aslentz
Reviews.Content: We just got home yesterday from our ten-day trip to Rome. We stayed for nine nights at Hotel Santa Maria. We learned about this hotel from Rick Steves' book. And we were very, very pleased with the great hospitality of the hotel. We are a Deaf couple and we felt very comfortable with the accomodations and we appreciate it very, very much. We would definitely come back to this hotel and also strongly recommend this hotel to those who would appreciate the Trastevere experience! Alyce & David Reynolds

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: abroccard
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights withe my wife and our four children in this hotel. Excellent location. The hotel is charming. We had a very nice rooms which was perfect for 6. The breakfast was excellent and the staff very helpfull. We would not go back any time and we recommend this hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in trendy area of town”
Reviews.Author: German_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in Trastevere, the up and coming, still very authentic-seeming area of Rome south of the river. A good location off the beaten track but perhaps not ideal if not planning on walking or biking through the city. Taxis were hard to come by, although the hotel staff did their best, but perhaps there was a special event on. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The room (a double) was comfortable, nothing flashy, but sadly without a safe. As we were at the far end of the courtyard, we weren't too bothered by noise, but I could imagine that the rooms closer by the entrance could get a bit noisy. The breakfast room, which is also where nibbles and drinks are served in the afternoon, is nice but far too tightly packed with tables and chairs: a shame as a very nice room. Definitely try to make the nibbles hour, as they really are good!

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FredOmaha_Ne
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in numerous hotels in Rome but none nicer than the Hotel Santa Maria. As others have mentioned the location is perfect, but for a couple of tired older travelers the best part is just relaxing in the court yard and walking safely to some very nice restaurants for dinner. The hotel will also arrange transportation to and from the airport. I strongly recommend taking advantage of that service. The cost is the same and the service is the best. The rooms are not luxurious, but be assured they are very clean and as nice as any of the major American chains. In my opinion this is the only place to stay in Rome. But please, save a room for me the next time I am in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: jakeSanFrancisco_Ca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for three weeks at the Hotel Santa Maria. The location is very near Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. The location is very convenient to all sites and has access to taxis and public transport. Nice local restaurants very close by. The staff are knowledgeable, courteous and accommodating. The breakfast and coffee are well served and satisfying. We would recommend this hotel to all interested. Thanks again to the wonderful staff for our very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballyhar
Reviews.Content: We booked the Suite Mansarde for 2 nights. Arriving after a hair raising taxi ride from Ciampino, the complimentary buffet at 5.30pm along with a couple of glasses of Pinot Grigio was a great way to relax. The hotel is just off the picturesque Piazza Santa Maria in the district of Trastevere, all cobbles and winding roads. Room was comfortable, breakfast was great, location perfect. We walked to the Coliseum in 10-15 minutes. Hotel also offers complimentary umbrellas and bicycles to use during your stay. Used the hotel recommended taxi for the return journey to Ciampino, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Happy at Hotel Santa Maria!”
Reviews.Author: TheGrandTourist
Reviews.Content: If there is a better place to stay in Rome, we have yet to find it! Each year for the past five years, my wife and I have returned to the Hotel Santa Maria. In fact, we feel as though we are part of their family. We have even come to know Aldo, the owner's dog who visits occasionally on Sundays! Rome would not be Rome without the Santa Maria. The facilities are great (clean and quiet), the complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers are outstanding (true Roman fare), and the staff is first-rate and very friendly (especially those at the front desk and in the bar). We love everything about this charming little hotel, from the courtyard with orange trees to the free bikes and spacious guest rooms. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Santa Maria for knowing how to take care of visitors with real Italian hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Molto Bene”
Reviews.Author: anonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming hotel that is conveniently located within walking distance (1/2 hour max) to all the major tourist sites in Rome. The rooms and baths are clean and spacious, the staff wonderful, and the breakfast & aperitivo are delicious. The hotel itself is adjacent to the Piazza Santa Maria where there is a beautiful church and lots of restaurants/nightlife to entertain you. If you are not in the mood to take public transport to the airport, their car service is excellent. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: bb9ron
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here during our visit to Rome on a suggestion from my brother studying abroad there. While I am normally wary of his suggestions, this one turned out to be a gem. The hotel is located in a great area. It's not overly "touristy" rather it offers unique access to the Santa Maria square in Trastevere (an area of Rome), a number of great restaurants, shops and easy access to public transportation and cabs. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. I couldn't say enough about how wonderful our experience was here. They provided an excellent breakfast, free internet service, restaurant suggestions and more. The Hotel Santa Maria made our trip even more special and enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone headed to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: chrisjon2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Rome with my 22 year old brother. This was our first time in Rome. I had my fingers crossed that the hotel was going to be wonderful and not a bust. I was extremely happy from the very beginning almost until we stepped on the plane. We used the car service from the hotel for 50E's. The driver was good and showed us some of the sites on the way to the hotel. When we arrived at the Santa Marie we were pleased with the building and courtyard. We arrived around 11am and our room was not available until after 1pm. I wish we could have checked in immediately but instead we dropped off our luggage and started looking around outside the hotel compound. The hotel provides a map that is ALL you will need. We saw some tourists using their maps from their travel guides and they usually were asking people with real maps for directions. Honestly this map was great. We found many places close by for lunches and dinners. It really is a great location for a hotel. We returned around 2pm and went right to the room. We had the Jr. Suite (Rm 14) It was nice. Two rooms seperated by a sliding door. The bathroom was nice too. Each of the sleeping areas had flat screen TV's (only CNN, BBC and MTV were in english, but that is okay). The beds were comfy and the pillows were good too. There is a small closet with 10ish hangers, 4 shelves and a small safe. (A lap top will not fit in the safe. Some larger cameras might not fit either). The towels were a bit rough but really large. No wash cloths only hand towels. There was a blow dryer, 3 small bottles of shampoo, a small pack of tissues, shower cap, and a shoe shine cloth in the room. Oh...there is little to no circulation in the rooms. We had the heat all the way off and slept with the windows open. I wish there would have been a fan. This meant we heard most of the morning noise from the courtyard. It was not too bad though. We slept in every day except the day we returned home. Breakfast was yummy. The scrambled eggs were a nice touch to a normally boring continental breakfast. We had cappuccinos and egg sandwiches almost every morning there. The courtyard and facilties are beautiful. The hotel is very clean. We never had loud guests that annoyed us or rude staff. They were helpful when we needed them. The hotel had a free bike rental (and they were in good shape) and nice umbrellas that could be borrowed in the event of rain. My only negative little bit is that I requested a car service for our return trip home. We ended up with a taxi instead. Well the taxi driver thought it was okay to drive in excess of 100 mph down the streets of Rome. I asked him to slow down and we all expressed that we were frightened by his driving. When were arrived at the airport (10mins from leaving the hotel) he laughed and asked for a tip for getting us there so fast. I was a little peeved. The first driver was wonderful and well worth the 50E's. But this driver made me really mad. I don't know if it is fair to blame this on the hotel so I am mainly just not really excited that we had a taxi instead of the car service. All in all we would absolutely recommend this place to our friends, family and anyone else that wants a great location, great atmosphere and wants to feel you got the most for your money. The price of the room was great. (we paid 250E's a night for 3 people in the Jr. Suite) I think that is wonderful!! The location is really good too. I am super lazy (or so my husband says) and I don't care to do miles upon miles of walking just to see more old stuff. But in Rome we walked from the hotel to every where. It was about 20-30 mins to the Vatican and the Collissium. And that was not a fast walk...we were looking around at all the beautiful stuff/buildings/people. Piazza Navona was a really quick walk (if you don't get lost....like my hubby did...I navigated after that one) from the hotel. Not to mention the Piazza by the hotel had some great places to eat. Stay there...you will be pleased. For Americans travelling in Europe for the first time...please keep in mind the standards are different. In some countries customer service is not what is in the US. (Rome was great though) Also the size of hotel rooms are normally smaller (this hotel still had great sized rooms). Breakfast at a US hotel might not be the kind of breakfast you will get abroad, but it is usually included in the room (breakfast at Santa Marie was tasty!) so don't complain too much. Different countries are different for a reason so enjoy the experience! If you wanted everything to be like it is in the US then don't visit another country. But if you want a true picture of Rome the Santa Marie is definately the place to stay. 3 stars is being very modest. I felt this was a 4+ hotel easy. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Beginning”
Reviews.Author: Marc_and_Tracy
Reviews.Content: I found the Santa Maria through Trip Advisor reviews and was delighted by what we found. We arrived god-awful early on Sunday morning and our room was ready for us to check in. We did arrange for the private taxi to collect us at the airport as offered in the emails I exchanged with the hotel during the booking process. This turned out to be the best option as I'm sure we would have gotten lost otherwise. We had the Junior suite. The room was clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable. The breakfast was a terrific start to the day. The breakfast/bar/housekeeping staff were wonderful. We only took advantage of the aperitivi one afternoon, but it was delicious! We walked to the Colosseum, St Peter's Basilica and Trevi fountain from the hotel. The walks aren't strenuous and we used the river as our guide. The Trastevere neighborhood is really fun with numerous great restaurants and fun shops - even a yoga studio. I would most definitely return to this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little oasis”
Reviews.Author: Lenore2
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Santa Maria. My room, while plain, was large for a European hotel of the Santa Maria's size and was immaculately clean. The staff was helpful and accommodating (offered coffee when my room wasn't ready -- I didn't expect it to be since I was checking in really early). The bar/breakfast room is very charming and the breakfast is somewhat more generous than many hotels', even some that charge extra. The cocktail hour buffet was a plus. The location is excellent, near a charming square and an easy walk to Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori and just a little bit more of a hike to the Forum. St. Peter's is also maybe a 15-20 minute walk. If if had been a bit warmer, I would have spent some time in the courtyard. It looked very inviting. If I return to Rome, I will return to the Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “liked the location”
Reviews.Author: mainehatty
Reviews.Content: my daughter and I just returned from Italy after a 7 day visit. We spent our first night at Hotel Santa Maria and then returned for our last night before flying home. I am an innkeeper from the Untied States so am aware of the difficulties of running an inn. The things I liked about Santa Maria were the location ( near the Tiber river with it's wonderful bridges and lovely views) , the local cafes and chrming back streets and color, the easy walks to see the Vatican and architecture of ancient Rome, their breakfast room with it's pretty colorful tables and robust breakfast buffet, and the pretty courtyard surrounded with orange trees. They also offer an early evening wine hour with a sampling of yummy foods. There was nothing I disliked about the hotel. The rooms were not exceptional, a bit plain and not very comfortable beds. The bathrooms were utilitarian... served the purpose and were clean. The staff was a bit cool but helpful when asked guestions. If I returned to Rome I would certainly consider visiting here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok nice location”
Reviews.Author: shannonmaine
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just got back from Italy and thought this hotel was nice. The location was wonderful, we could walk to everything. The hotel was clean but the beds were not wonderful. The showers were so small and the bath was even smaller. I couldnt sleep because of the noise all night. The employees were not overly friendly and not very helpful. The breakfast was very nice. I just thought this hotel was not special. I would not tell people not to stay here, I would just tell them it wasnt amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for a Roman holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Kubin909
Reviews.Content: As it so happens, I found the Santa Maria by accident...but it was an accident I will never regret. Initially a friend had told me the name of a fantastic hotel she stayed at in Trastevere but when I couldn't remember it, I guessed Santa Maria. After seeing the pictures I decided that it was the best choice avaialable. I emailed the hotel and although the Santa Maria was full - I secured a room in the nearby and recently built Santa Maria Residenza. The Residenza is smaller than the original hotel but with equally spacious and well-furnished rooms. In addition to the entire building being quite beautiful, our room was very clean with comfortable beds and a good bathtub/shower. The location was perfect - safely tucked right in the heart of Trastevere, surrounded by plenty of great pizzerias, restaurants and gelato joints. Trastevere is just across the river from the city and the hotel is roughly a 10-15 minute walk from Piazza Venezia or Campo D'Fiori, putting some of the highlights of the city well within rech if you don't mind a little bit of a walk. The hotel offered us unlimited and free usage of the lobby computer as well as a complimentary breakfast of various pastries, breads, meats cheeses, cereal, juice and coffee. The bar at the main Santa Maria also offers appetizers at 5:30 that we could've actually substituted for dinner quite happily. Most of all the staff at the Residenza was courteous, helpful and extremely friendly. These people were a crucial part of our stay and we were happy to have chosen the Santa Maria and found such an exceptional staff. By the end of the week we were as sad to say goodbye to some of them as we were to leave the city. I can not say enough great things about the Santa Maria Residenza. It was a fantastic hotel for a fantastic trip and I would reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Jane2605
Reviews.Content: In my opinion Trastevere is the best area to stay in as you are slightly out of the city centre but you are still easily able to walk in to all the main sites. The area of Trastevere is quaint, arty and full of interesting lanes, lovely restaurants and fashionable cafes. The Hotel Santa Maria is excellent & I would highly recommend. It is extremely clean, the breakfast is perfect (not too much and not too little!) and the staff are very helpful. Our feet were aching from all the walking but the hot showers and clean cool linen of the hotel fixed that very quickly. Worth a visit & reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Trastavere is the perfect area to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CTKath
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with the Trastavere area and will definitely be staying here the next time we come. And there will most definitely be a next time! We stayed for 3 nights pre-cruise and loved it. The Piazza Santa Maria in Trastavere was charming both day and night. We would roam the small cobbled via's and vicola's and try to get lost, which was easy, and then try to find our way back to the piazza. The hotel gave us excellent restaurant suggestions. The best meal we had in all of Italy was at the Taverna Trilussa - perfetto! Loved the cappucinos at breakfast. Everything was most charming and that's what we enjoyed the most. After the hustle and bustle of the main area of Rome (which we loved walking around) we would then retreat to our little area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ebers_1
Reviews.Content: It´s a very nice Hotel located in Trastevere just 5 minutes to the "centro storico". Our room was okay, but a little too small. The staff was excellent, the breakfast very good. We enjoyed very much the late afternoon buffet. We didn´t like the noise caused by leaving guests drawing their trollies behind them at early morning times. Is it not possible to carry the suitcases a few meters?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: 15snoopy
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Single level, which means no one above or below you. Comfortable room/bathroom space. Appreciated the security gate set-up. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful with directions, public transportation needs, siteseeing, general questions. Breakfast was wonderful. Hot and cold food, variety of breads, meats, cheeses, juices, fresh fruits. Availability of free internet a real plus. Afternoon snacks in the lounge were perfect. Location just right for walking to all the different sites. Clean rooms, fresh towels every day. Only difficulty was finding the place initially. If we ever return to Rome we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, loved the services, ambience, but beware”
Reviews.Author: jagian34
Reviews.Content: Hands down, this hotel gets an "A" for charming, cutesy, spotless, gracious hosts and help, lovely amenities, but beware, lots of taxi drivers don't know where this place is, and the ones that do, don't want to go there because of the small streets and inaccessibility to the hotel; you will be charged for the taxi ride from where the driver picks up the call and that could be anywhere from E4.00 to E8.00 away from the hotel, so it gets added to the taxi price. Hotel made taxi reservations for us several times and they were always on time; it's impossible to find a taxi on your own there. If I stayed there again, I would learn the bus and metro system and avoid taxis at all costs. Of course, if you are younger than me, walking is the best way to go and the scenery is fabulous all along the streets. Overall this hotel gets my vote, and my 3 companions also for best charming hotel EVER!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redwitchdiver
Reviews.Content: just returned from 5 days/4 nights in Rome. Superb city and everything in walking distance. This hotel is small, and would be difficult to find if you had not been before, or arranged a taxi pick up from the airport as we did via the hotel and was well worth it. The hotel itself is excellent, location great, staff are the most friendly I have met from the hundreds of hotels I have stayed in and service is second to none, from the free early evening buffet to just advising on restaurants and places to visit. The location is perfect, you can wander the city during the day and see the sights, knowing that when you get back to the hotel there are numerous good restaurants and bars nearby, so you don,t have to wander to far on an evening. We had a family room which had 2 seperate bedrooms and my 2 teenage daughters thought it was exellent also. Overall, highly recommended, as the number of reviews proves, and should I return to Rome will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Bartystix
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. The reviews were right – the hotel is located on the other side of the river from the main tourist hotspots in the fantastic area of Trastevere but only a comfortable stroll away. Trastevere itself is pleasantly busy with lots of restaurants and local bars offering cheap but good quality food. The hotel is tucked away down a side street and accessed through a secure gate – it’s not easy for taxis to find or get to – which meant that it felt like a haven in the centre of Rome. The reception was very welcoming, taking time to explain where we were in relation to the sites and making sure we settled in OK. We arrived just in time to take advantage of free nibbles, which are served at around 6pm every day, and can be enjoyed in the bar/breakfast area or the beautiful courtyard, which the rooms are based around. The breakfasts were plentiful with options of cereal, hams, cheese, pastries etc and the bar served alcohol until 10ish. Although there’s no restaurant, there were so many close by we never missed the option. Our room was fine with the usual facilities, including air con and was tucked slightly off the main courtyard with its own outside table to enjoy the evenings. The only downside was that it seemed to be located close to an area where the crockery is stored/washed, which mean that we were sometimes awoken a little earlier than we wanted. I think this would only affect one room however. All in, this is a great place and is highly recommended – I’ve suggested this place to many friends, which passes the acid test!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: AL2315
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria. It was an oasis of calm in a very hectic and busy city. No traffic noise and a perfect location, easy walking distance to all the major sights. Great restaurants nearby - try the Cassetta just round the corner - which were authentic and inexpensive, compared to other Italian cities we have visited, about half the price and twice as good! Other good points: the early evening snack the hotel puts out for guests, good breakfast, free internet, superb efficient staff.... could go on! The only noise was from the Santa Maria church bells and the local cats during their noctural activities! Would def return to this little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely second stay”
Reviews.Author: cecerose
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Santa Maria, and it felt like coming home to our little peaceful oasis. The snacks and drinks in the courtyard were the most relaxing part of my hectic holiday with a one year old. The room was very comfortable for us, with a pack and play crib the baby actually slept peacefully in! The staff are helpful, unobtrusive and efficient, and the surroundings are sweet, simple, unpretentious and charming. Great location, just a short walkt to the bridges across the Tiber, and Trastevere is a great area for restaurants and colorful scenes.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Oasis”
Reviews.Author: saunter
Reviews.Content: After reading Rick Steve's book and researching many, many reviews on Rome hotels in all areas of the city, we found that this hotel was the only one with no negative comments. We paid cash with euros and used Rick Steve's Rome 2007 for the cash discount. We did upgrade to the suite for a bigger room as european rooms are often small. We did not get to see the standard rooms. Our room actually could sleep 6 with a loft above sleeping 2 up a corner iron staircase. My husband and I had a king bed, and there was a queen sofa pull-out bed. The room was very spacious with a tub and shower in the bathroom to soak in after a day of sight-seeing Rome. Plenty of closet/drawer space, safe in room, hairdryer and minibar with soft drinks. Very quiet with only the peels of the church bells at night. Go to the bar in the early evening and have complimentary coctail buffet when you order your drinks. Lovely breakfast and buffet room; beautiful outside seating for eating and drinking if weather permits. Their website was very true to the actual hotel premises. We absolutely would stay there again when in Rome. Great location; 5 minutes to the river, one minute to two squares and one square had beautiful church, fountain and lovely outdoor restauranrts all around, which is where we ate at night after a long day running around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: shorebound910
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been reviewed many times so Ill tries to touch base on a few points. Easily, one of my most favorite hotels I have ever stayed in. Location: perfect. Trestevere is a beautiful neighborhood to stay in. Has a bit of local feel to it while being away from the main city of Rome which can be a tad chaotic. Using the church as a pinpoint and the Tiber as a referance, the hotel can easily be found. Hotel: wonderful. As stated before your rooms enclose a courtyard of orange trees...nice touch. Our room itself was very spacious and well maintained. Quick quirk was the bathroom...actually the shower. There is no "blocker" to contain the water so for those of you who like long showers...water gets everywhere. I personally was very entertained by this but some could get annoyed. I see from other posted pictures that not all rooms are designed this way. The free breakfast was excellent way to start the day and the free 5:30 appetizers was a nice little treat after ALOT of walking. Overall I am sure you will love this place. A+

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Country Charm in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MamaHolzi
Reviews.Content: Good location in the interesting Trastevere district...great location for restaurants, etc. Hotel Santa Maria has a unique atmosphere in Rome, single level small hotel with two pleasant open air courtyards filled with orange trees. An oasis of calm after a hectic day of sightseeing. We felt this hotel was better than the average three-star. Size of the cute double room was better than most by Euro standards and was immaculate; fresh towels every day. All staff spoke English, and was extremely courteous and helpful. The breakfast was generous, including meats, scrambled eggs, cheese and many pastries. Also a full bar was available, and a very nice complimentary snack buffet in the evenings, which we enjoyed in the courtyard with our own bottle of wine. We made accquaintance with fellow hotel guests during this time, so nice to share tips and experiences in Rome and Italy. Our early am flight required a shuttle, which charged 60 euro, not fifty-five as expected. But that happened all over Italy, so not a huge negative.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BomBan
Reviews.Content: Unfortuantely we suffered a theft (pickpocket) of a wallet with our credit cards (no cash) at the Rail Termi Metro. On return to the Santa Maria, we were given total support and assistance by the staff. Indeed throughout our stay we found all members of this hotel, friendly, helpful and totally competent. This incident did not spoil the rest of our stay and as others have said, it really is an 'Oasis' in a frenetic city. At the end of a busy sightseeing day, what better than to sit in their peaceful courtyard, surrounded by orange trees sipping a campari and nibbling away at a range of antipasti provided 'free' after 5.30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: magee50
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Fodor’s and TripAdvisor and was very happy with the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The front desk was welcoming as so were the morning servers. The hotel is quiet, a little confusing to get to you first time. Just around the corner is a wash and dry. I loved the Piazza Trastevere and the restaurants in that area. All major attractions are within walking distance or you can take the bus which has a stop very close to the hotel. The breakfast was hardy compared to most breakfast served in Italy Hotels - they even served scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel !!”
Reviews.Author: LucyMadrid
Reviews.Content: I went here based on Trip advisor reviews but was disappointed. It was a nightmare to get to in a hire car and the directions given by the hotel were awful. If you really want to be based in this part of Rome then fine but realistically the rooms were as appealing at a clean motel you might find off a highway. Except, the price was ridiculous for what you get...then again, that is Rome!! (Also, the staff were really poorly dressed - surely a crime in Italy )

Reviews.Title: “Noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: Stanly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very enjoyable 4 night stay. There were only a few issues we would comment on. We were in room 2 which nearly everyone has to walk past to get to their rooms along the tiled pathway. Do all women wear clickety high heels?? This was not as much of an issue than the noise generated by occasional loud conversation by the early morning check-out people who congregated outside our window while waiting for their taxi transfers. I would suggest that room 2 is potentially the noisiest one and should be avoided if possible. Breakfast is just OK with a small selection of cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts. Scrambled eggs was available every morning. The bread and rolls selection was very limited, 1 type of bread and 1 type of roll, both quite dull. Great selection of tea / coffee available with breakfast. The prices in the bar, and mini-bar, are very reasonable. Go for the 15 Euro per bottle rather than the 5 euro per glass!! There is no tea / coffee making facility within the room. The thing that really amazed us was the huge amount of graffiti around the whole area. Every surface is covered by it and don't be surprised if when dining in one of the many restaurant outside seating areas if you are right next to a vandalised wall.
