The area immediately around the hotel looks completely run down during the day but is transformed at night by the dozens of restaurants that spring out from behind their steel, graffiti covered, security shutters. Overall I would recommend the Santa Maria as something quite different from the run of the mill.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to be the one to complain”
Reviews.Author: Formann
Reviews.Content: Very surprised. We always use tripadvisor reviews as a guide to booking hotels and this was the first time our impression differed from the majority.Stayed at the Hotel following a Med cruise. The room(s) were large, but musty and dark. There was a courtyard, but it lacked the elegance of the Villa San Pio (the incredible hotel we stayed at before the cruise.) There was a riverside market nearby - which was a nice touch. But the river was filthy with floating garbage and the vendors just sold the same touristy stuff we had seen elsewhere. The worse part was that even after leaving a wakeup call the afternoon prior to our flight home and re-confirming it before going to sleep, there was no wake up call (and no way to enter a wakeup call via phone.) Thankfully, one of us just woke up early, yelled at the rest and with 15 minutes to shower and repack for our flight home, made the pre-arranged ransportation. This was the only bad experience in an incredible 2 week vacation. If you're looking for roman charm at a reasonable price, investigate the Villa San Pio. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and spacious retreat! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Leely-K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on recommendation from a friend who had stayed there 6 or 7 years ago. We spent two nights extra here after completing a Contiki trip and staying at many other hotels in Rome, Venice and Florence. This was a breath of fresh air. The hotel staff were very friendly, the breakfast was the best we'd had and the room, which could sleep 3, was spacious. We couldn't have asked for more. Yes, being right on the courtyard, we could hear plenty of people walking to their rooms, but it wasn't disturbing. We could also hear sounds from the nearby piazza, but this tended to be one Saturday night and didn't continue through the early morning hours. We weren't particularly bothered by it. All in all, it was a lovely stay, very well located and we vowed to recommend it to everyone we knew who would travelling to Rome. You also get a sense of tradition around the Trastevere district, where this hotel is located. There aren't many tourists and if you struggle to find the hotel, take a taxi...they do know the streets very well and it won't cost you a fortune. You will be presented with a comprehensive map of the area when you check-in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria.....excellent service in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: mully65
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is a charming hotel in a great location. The rooms are clean and a decent size for European standards but they surround one of the real treasures of the hotel: its courtyard. Nothing finer than returning to your hotel after a long day of sightseeing and hanging out under the umbrellas and having a cocktail with a few snacks. The other treasure is their service. I found the staff friendly, courteous and always willing to help with a request or dinner recommendation (ask for them and take them!). Trastervere is a quirky, safe, bohemian neighborhood...reminded me a bit of the East Village in NYC, others Berkeley in San Fran. Small, winding streets with restaraunts and shops around every corner. The neighborhood, quiet during the day, comes to life at night with street vendors galore and lots of tourists but not overly so (you won't heard any noise at the hotel). Highly recommend staying at the HSM.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: bccmom
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the brand new Residenza Santa Maria around the corner. We felt like we had our own apartment in Rome. The location was great and the front desk excellent!! Our luggage was lost and they offered to go buy us anything we needed. They called the airport for us every hour until our bags arrived. No room service, but lots of restaurants steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatioin and hote.”
Reviews.Author: wildkit
Reviews.Content: I too relied on the positive comments on Trip Advisor before making my decision. Took a bit of a chance as we booked a room for our family of four at the new Rezidenza about two blocks and on the other side of the square from the hotel. They were unable to provide pictures until three days prior to our departure as the Rezidenza website was still in the building process. As the property is new as of June 2007, amenities and decor were terrific! It was hot and we walked everywhere...Coloseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. AC worked great! Location, was easy to find from Termini, just over the river. Neighborhood outstanding if you are looking for a "left bank" experience. This hotel is less than one block from square and fountain with oldest church in Rome. Festival on square both nights we stayed, but NO street noise even though we were next door! Plenty of good restaurants within two or three blocks. Had to have breakfast on square as Residenza was not ready to provide, but it was included in the price of our stay and no hassle at the restaurant both mornings. Also, we did have access to the evening cocktail and munchies at the hotel, but were not able to take part. I would stay here in a heart beat without even considering other locations. If you are looking for a more bohemian stay and neighborhood, this is it! Staff was very helpful. Their recommendation for first night dinner, Quirino (sp?) was close, terrific food (might have been the best meal of our two week stay in Italy) and very reasonable including much table wine and dessert. I look forward to a return trip when we have more time to spend in Rome! FYI, this was a $13 euro cab from Termini. We were family of four with children ages 23 and 14. Highly recommend the Residenza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Stevescott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a very enjoyable trip to Rome. We spent 7 nights at the Santa Maria and we certainly liked the hotel. However there were a few issues which prevent the award of a fifth star. Firstly, the breakfast really isn't that great. I know this isn't a Sheraton or a Marriott and it isn't realistic to expect the same variety as those hotels offer. However, we found the choice a bit limited, particularly as it was exactly the same food that was on offer every morning. Secondly, the rooms are not as quiet as I had hoped. There were two main sources of noise. The first was the noise from the concerts in the nearby square. On some nights the music/singing was still going on well past midnight. The second was from other guests moving making a noise. Lastly, the air conditioing wasn't very effective which meant that it was too hot to sleep some nights. To be fair, Rome was unusually hot when we were there. Looking more positively, our room was easily large enough as was the bathroom. The furniture could be best described as rustic but certainly adequate. The staff were extremely helpful especially Conrad, the breakfast time waiter. Don't forget to pay by cash and get a 10% discount. All in all, an enjoyable holiday but with a few minor reservations.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katlyn31
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay while visiting Rome. More reasonable prices than many other hotels, free internet, a good breakfast and snack time in the later afternoon, clean rooms and comfortable beds, a pleasant outside area to sit in, and a friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Two Different Rooms Gave Me Two Different Impressions”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAgain
Reviews.Content: I have split feelings about this hotel. That’s because we had two different rooms owing to the fact that we had to change rooms on our last night there. Our first 3 nights at HSM were spent in an inner courtyard room. It was tucked away toward the back of the property. The room was clean, had a great bathroom with a deep tub, working air conditioning, and was Q-U-I-E-T. We loved it! However, due to their prior bookings we had to change rooms on our last night. We were moved to a supposedly “superior” room that was anything but. It was the front-most room, the room you’d walk past to get to all the other rooms. Although it was bigger (having an extra bed for a child) the bathroom was small, with only a shower that was enclosed only by a shower curtain. The air conditioning did not work nearly as well as in our original room. And the worst part of staying in this “superior” room was that you could hear the clanging of plates and singing of patrons from a nearby restaurant at night. We were leaving early the next morning and this was NOT how we wanted to spend our last night in Rome. The night auditor told us that the restaurant is allowed by law to carry on with the singing until midnight and at midnight the noise did cease. So if you’re a light sleeper or want a quiet area make sure you get a room toward the back of this property. Aside from the above, this hotel *is* like a little oasis. The courtyard is lovely, the breakfast choices are tasty and plentiful, and I DID find the staff to be cordial and helpful. It’s also near some convenient bus stops for getting around. If I was writing this review based only on staying in our first room I’d give it a 5.0. But the miserable experience of the “superior” room brings it down to the 4.0 (since I can't give it a 3.5). If we would have had to stay in this room for more than one night I'd have changed hotels. To be fair - I did ask for a price adjustment which was granted by the helpful staff, and we did not end up paying more for our “superior” room as were originally supposed to.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: mlals
Reviews.Content: Great central location, clean, functional rooms and bathrooms, and a lovely courtyard in which to enjoy an afternoon glass of wine. A fabulous oasis in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Peacefulness you don't always find in a big city”
Reviews.Author: thehowe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our fourth holiday in Italy but first visit to Rome. We chose the Santa Maria because of Trip Advisor reviews and we were delighted with the Hotel. It was in a very interesting area of Rome. The Trastevere area was a buzz in the evening and had some very vibrant lanes etc. I understand it is the artist's area of the City. It was very lively and exciting without being obtrusive and noisy. We loved it. The Hotel was extremely peaceful in such a busy area. I liked the 'gated aspect' in that you pressed a bell to enter the gate to the short avenue up to the hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It was so quiet that it was difficult to comprehend the fact that you were in such a busy, buzzing city. Yet it was very near the river and access to the Vatican etc, important for us . We like walking but are in our early sixties. We would definately return to The Santa Maria. The breakfast was typically Italian, very pleasant, with extremely helpful staff. They recommended a restaurant nearby and it was wonderful, unfortunately I can not remember the name. We found the map a little difficult for our aging eyes and it took us a while to get used to the little lanes but it was worth the wrong turnings we took because you were always bumping into something else of interest. Would definately use it again when we return

Reviews.Title: “Tutta Va Bene”
Reviews.Author: chappelle
Reviews.Content: Not sure what recent others are complaining about. The hotel is charming; immaculate and quiet. The staff is exceptional and nearly everyone speaks fluent English, and, of course, Italian. The breakfast is prodigious with scrambled eggs, ham, cereal, pastries, fresh fruit in season, coffee, tea and four kinds of juice. Early evening brings wine, cheese, bruschetta and pizza. Both breakfast and the evening hors d' ouevres are included in the room rate and free internet access nearly all day in the lounge. Yes, rooms are smaller than more modern facilities, but keep in mind that Trastavere is an ancient neighborhood in a very ancient city. If you are looking for a Marriott, book elsewhere. What you can expect is a beautiful, tree filled courtyard, and a splendid refuge from the chaos that can be Rome. Could have stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not as peaceful as first seems”
Reviews.Author: M.FDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Santa Maria in July for a week. It has a great location in busy Trastevere. It was very comfortable with nicely decorated rooms around a central courtyard, which cut out any street noise. But we found the layout meant noise within the hotel really travelled. It is quite a unique hotel in a city, almost like a country hotel. However from 7.30 in the morning there would be early breakfast goers walking across the gravel, and being a light sleeper I always woke. The hotel ask guests to be quiet in the courtyard in their information booklet in the rooms but some guests either didn't see it or ignored it. I also found the cleaner hoovering the room next door at 8.30 a little early. But they were the only negatives. The breakfast was good, staff helpful, room clean, but not as peaceful as it first appears.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BreashearsDesign
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay because of the great reviews from TripAdvisor and were a little upset. We stayed in the attic room with barely enough room to move around. We were 2 adults and two children aged 12 & 18. The air conditioning was not working the first night we arrived and we did not sleep most of the night. The hotel compensated us $100.00 for our troubles. However, the air conditioning did not work the second night either and I finally went down at 3am to notify the reception, who weren't available so we had another sleepless night. The bathroom is extremely small, barely enough room to take a shower and I didn't find it especially clean. We did find the grounds, location and meals extremely satisfying, and as stated in most of the comments it was a tranquil spot away from the noise of the city. We traveled for another 6 weeks after our stay in Rome to another region of Italy, Greece and London and this was our only disappointing accomodation. I would definitely find a different hotel for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location from which to base your holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HolPlanOntario
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 - 3 teenage girls Very cozy boutique hotel. If you like friendly staff, spacious rooms,bicycle riding, italian pastries, fresh juice and delicious expresso for breakfast, 5:30 p.m. cocktails and appetizers in a quaint courtyard, 1 minute from a Piazza (Santa Maria), walking distance from many historic sights, close to public transportation, and a place where teenagers can be kept happy, don't miss the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: linusvermont
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Santa Maria. The staff were helpful and spoke English well. The courtyard was a lovely place to relax and enjoy breakfast under the orange trees. Trastevere is a wonderful place to enjoy Rome, away from the noise and crowds but still with old world charm and very close walk to all sights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 4happywanderers
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous three night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere(Rome). The staff was very helpful and friendly. They made dinner reservations, called cabs, and helped us find our way around. Our room for five people was large and very comfortable. The beautiful courtyard was the perfect place for breakfast in the morning and a glass of wine in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Truely a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby&Cody
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip advisor comment and have relied on reading other reviews to plan a month long trip to Italy. HSM is everything that it promises and much much more! Our family of four (two kids ages 4 and 8) stayed in the Senior Suite and absolutely loved it. The kids had their own sleeping loft with its own air conditioner, and we slept downstairs in a very large room with beamed ceilings. The bathroom had a nice large tub, and we enjoyed the breakfast right outside our door in the lovely courtyard. The cappucino and evening snacks were GREAT... everyone at HSM was friendly, helpful, full of great recommendations for dinner. We had a great time in Rome, mostly because of the nice neighborhood and HSM (my husband is a Rome-lover but I am not...). I would consider going back to Rome one day just because of HSM... Book early!

Reviews.Title: “A week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: heartface
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this charming hotel in the Trastevere area of Rome. The hotel was a very well run little oasis in a lively part of the city. The service was excellent the rooms were clean and pleasant and it was quiet in the evenings. The only possible down point was that there was no outside window in the bathroom, but unless that is something you really need then it shouldn't be a problem. All of Rome was easy to get to from the hotel. We stayed for just under a week at the end of May 2007, on our first trip to Rome to see the sights. The hotel was perfect for this. The hotel was recommended to us and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: ttraveler401
Reviews.Content: I am writing this on the last night of our five-night stay to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. This hotel is in a trendy section of Rome, about a 20-minute walk to ancient Rome and a 30-minute walk to the Vatican. (However, both can be easily reached by public transportation.) Bottom line: the hotel is a great get-away. Hotels in Rome are pricey, but here, you can get 10 percent off for noting that you discovered the hotel in a travel book (ours was in a Karen Brown guide) and another 10 percent off if you pay cash. The hotel itself is gated, making it completely secure to those worried about such things. If you check out their Web site, the pictures do the hotel justice: the orange trees are heavy with fruit, the courtyard is cool under the massive umbrellas, the breakfast and 5:30 snacks are included in the price and even the mini-bar and hotel bar are reasonable. The staff is simply fantastic. Fluent in English, they will give you solid recommendations to restaurants and spot-on public transportation directions to any site in Rome. Antonio saved us about three hours of travel time by arranging for our rental car to be delivered to a close Avis rental facility, where we would have had to return it to the airport otherwise. The rooms were clean, cool and opened onto the courtyard. Fellow travelers tended to be either from the U.S. or Canada, with many sharing hints and advice from their travels in Italy. The only concerns: - the hotel is not easy to find. It is in one of many back alleys of the neighborhood that clog with people and street vendors at sunset. If there is one piece of advice I could give, it would be: DO NOT DRIVE. We got lost for 45 minutes at dusk in the neighborhood and were thoroughly frazzled by the time we arrived. It is much better to have a taxi drop you off and walk the five minutes into the neighborhood. - wireless internet access at the hotel doesn't exist. There is one computer that the guests share to check on e-mail, and sometimes the line backs up. These concerns aside, you will love the hotel and the neighborhood. I noticed several guests with young teens accompanying them, and you will notice everything ranging from teens to families with young childre to old couples when you venture outside the gates. My wife actually felt more comfortable here than in any other place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Find in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: SassyLadySJ
Reviews.Content: I found this area of Rome to be very special and the Hotel Santa Maria was more than I had expected. I enjoyed the peace and serentity with the safety gates, beautiful breakfast which could be taken either in the eating area or courtyard and a nice wine bar with appetizers. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Personnel were outstanding to work with. The Trastevere area is near all of the major attractions and yet, it is magical to stroll through a maze of fascinating medieval streets with some of the best restaurants in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ange_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a month in Europe and our last 6 days were spent in Rome staying at Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. I booked this hotel because of previous reviews on Trip Advisor and we were both very pleased with the outcome. This hotel is a little gem. Great location with lots (and I mean lots) of restaurants etc within a very short walk yet inside the hotel it is very quiet and peaceful. It is quite easy to get to all the Roman sights from here. The staff were very helpful and the breakfasts were wonderful. We will definitely stay there again if we visit Rome. However, this is a very small hotel and it can be noisy in the morning with other guests having breakfast in the courtyard and the housekeeping staff moving around outside the rooms quite early in the morning. If you are looking for somewhere to hibernate during the day or to sleep in very late, this may not be the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJoyful
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome and 6 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria. I booked our room several months ago based on the reviews at Trip Advisor and the recommendation in Ric Steve's Rome 2007 guidebook. First, you can get a 10% discount for paying in cash; second, if you want a total discount of 20% as mentioned in Ric Steve's book, you MUST mention his guidebook in your original e-mail request to the hotel for reservations. The hotel is an oasis in the middle of a hectic, dirty Trastevere. The two courtyards are delightful, and the hotel is surprisingly quiet. However, be prepared for traversing dirty, smelly, crowded cobblestone streets hemmed in by walls covered with graffiti in order to reach the hotel. If such things, as well as beggars, street artists, and tourist "junk" vendors selling literally on the street offend you, you might look elsewhere. The room (we had a "superior double") was comfortable in the European style. A daybed style sofa was adequate for sitting, though the two straight-back chairs were more utilitarian than comfortable. The very clean bathroom is excellent with a generous tub (with both hand-held and overheard shower) for soaking away the aches and pains of a day on your feet. There are plenty of electric plugs (standard Italian two prong round plug) and the bathroom lighting is adequate. There is no lamp on the desk so reading or putting on makeup while sitting there is a challenge. The king bed (two doubles made-up together) is comfortable, though not "cushy". The bare cotto tile floor calls for slippers. The air conditioning (separate unit for each room) is not up to American standards. In temperatures above 80F it would not be adequate though better than nothing. We purchased a fan to augment air circulation which drew adverse comments from the staff. My main problem with the hotel was the attitude of the staff. I found the reception desk clerks stand-offish and not too helpful. The two Philippino maids and bus-boy bordered on surly. Though the hotel seems to cater to Brits and Americans, there was little effort to meet American expectations. The breakfast room opens at 7:30, and there is no chance for a cup of coffee prior to that. So, if you have an early morning plane, you may begin the day caffeine-free. There is no means for making coffee in the room. Our room had a mini-fridge though the hotel "rules" forbade putting any items purchased elsewhere into it. Also, one is forbidden to eat anything not purchased at the hotel while sitting at the bistro tables in the courtyard. We chose to ignore, though not blatantly, both rules as being ridiculous. However, these attempts to regulate our activities gave the impression of a petty bureaucracy intent on squeezing the last Euro from our wallet. The hotel is expensive enough (250 Euro per night before the 10% discount for cash) without resorting to this sort of thing. The hotel website makes much of a new "computer room". This consists of a computer set up in the breakfast room after 10:30 in the morning. It is not available prior to then. The computer is password protected and only the hotel staff knows the password and they're not telling. So, you must find a staff member to sign you onto the computer and sign in and out for its use. There is no "lobby" as such at the hotel. There is a loveseat and a chair in the breakfast room, but no other place to sit on a rainy day except for your room. Regular double rooms have only a bed and a straight backed chair. The hotel is relatively close to a bus stop, taxi stand, and tram stop to take you where you want to go in Rome. Arranging pick-up at the airport for 55 Euro through the hotel worked well. The driver was there on time both coming and going. I think the Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel are accurate as far as they go which is why I have tried to fill in the blanks. It is a very European/Italian experience, and if that is what you are looking for, this will be sure to please. If the comfort amenities you would find in an American hotel are important to you, you might be happier elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Trastevere, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: rfbPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from two weeks traveling through Italy, we can happily say that our experience throughout the country was incredible. One of the very brightest spots was our stay in Rome. We found Hotel Santa Maria through web searches and reviews of hotels, so we felt compelled to write and let others know of this truly enchanting place. Rome is glorious! Although not filled with monuments and many other tourist stops, Trastevere is a vibrant area that contains the largest number of restaurants and bars per square meter within the city. This concentration provides for a lively, exciting area that is very picturesque during the day and quite lively at night, all while remaining very accessible to the major sights of the city. Our tour of Rome was filled with many footsteps. We walked throughout the city and it was wonderful to return to the intimate courtyard that is at the heart of Hotel Santa Maria to rest. As described in other reviews, it is the 'calm in the storm' of the hectic city of Rome. It was so comfortable sitting around in the afternoon under the umbrellas of the courtyard tables, sipping wine and house provided snacks while reflected on the day's sights and sounds. We reserved a double superior room at 250 euros per night, but the hotel offers a 10% discount if you pay in cash, so our room was 225 euros per night. After researching others throughout the city, we feel that this was well priced for the service, location, and amenities provided. The staff were friendly, helpful, courteous, and accessible. Many spoke English and a variety of other languages as well. We'd recommend that you include Hotel Santa Maria in your search for a hotel while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Dunderlin
Reviews.Content: All the comments about this being a lovely little oasis are so apt. The hotel is just a minute’s walk from the bustle of Piazza Santa Maria and lots of great restaurants, yet you go through the hotel gate and enter this delightful peaceful little courtyard, with trees (practically just dripping with ripe oranges) that provide plenty of shade. The hotel felt very secure as there is a security gate (you press a buzzer to enter and this is monitored 24 hours a day). The room size was fine – not roomy – but not cramped either. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was good and had a variety of options, including boxes of Kellogg’s cereals if you don’t want to be too adventurous at breakfast! The cappuccinos were lovely – but then they are everywhere in Rome! We loved the location and Trastevere is definitely the place to be on a summer evening in Rome. If you are not so keen on walking then the location may not be quite so great for getting to the main attractions, but we didn’t find this a problem. It was about 15 minutes walk across the Garibaldi Bridge to the Pantheon and maybe half an hour to the Vatican and to the Forum. But all can be reached by bus or tram quite easily and the public transport system in Rome is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: savenola
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Santa Maria. The courtyard is fabulous and a wonderful retreat from hectic Rome. The staff are friendly and give good restaurant suggestions. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria, Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: rickyredbluff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are celebrating our 25th anniversary this year and we decided to visit Italy. After looking thru lots of hotel websites, I came across the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere and I fell in love instantly. It was just what I was looking for. We just returned from a week stay there, and we didn't want to leave. The staff was incredibly sweet and helpful. They directed us to wonderful restaurants in the close area. Every morning we had a very tasty breakfast, along with cappuccinos made just for us. Then, at 5:30 each evening we sat in the courtyard (under the orange trees) sipping wine and the hotel provided appetisers. This was probably our most favorite hotel ever! The rooms are all situated around the orange tree courtyards and the hotel is behind a locked gate in a truly fun and safe neighborhood. We were just steps away from the church in the piazza, and we could hear the churchbells ever 15 minutes! If you're looking for something quaint in a large city - this is it. This is the only place we would stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but what a treat!”
Reviews.Author: troywlms
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are both in our late 20's and stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria from the 14th - 18th of May, 2007. We arrived into Rome via train and quickly hailed a cab driver to take us to the hotel. Please be warned that not all cab drivers will drop you off directly at this hotel's entrance. The streets are WAY too narrow for most cars to navigate. Our cab driver dropped us off about two blocks away from the entrance to the hotel (which we could not see) and then pointed us in the wrong direction. It took us about hour to find the hotel. The cobblestone streets broke one of our luggage wheels. Once we found the hotel, everything we read about it on TripAdvisor was absolutely correct! This charming boutique is a little Oasis in the fast paced city of Roma. I'm attaching photos of room #16. It had to be one of the cleaniest and biggest of all hotel rooms we stayed in during our 14 day trip to London, Paris, Venice & Rome. The staff was extremely helpful, trustworthy & dependable. The breakfast comprised of pastries, pies, eggs, meats, cheeses, cappucino, italian expresso, breads, juices and fresh fruits. A cab ride to the Colosseum will cost you about 7 Euro. A cab ride to the Vatican will cost you about 10 Euro. A cab ride to the Spanish steps will cost you about 10 Euro. The intial cab fare should start off at 2.33 euro. There are only two english speaking television channels provided by the hotel. (CNN International & Eurosport) One thing that we did find quite pleasant was that the minibar prices seemed quite comparable to the prices found in most Roman stores. Bottled water was 1 euro & a coke was 2 euro. HINT: You get a 10% discount on your room when paying in cash. HINT: The Santa Maria Piazza comes to life around 10pm. Street Performers, Antique peddlers & tourists all converge in this little piazza located about 1/2 block outside the front gate of the Hotel. HINT: Cafe Trastevere which is just to the right when you exit the hotel gates serves great food! We ate there 3 times. The average dish of pasta is only 7 euro and a fillet of beef can be had for 13 euro. The hotel provided us an airport transfer for 55 euro. My wife and I are very picky people. We love to indulge in nice things & wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. We'll definitely be staying there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria, an oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: PGTipsCornwall
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome, staying at the Hotel Santa Maria, located in the Trastevere area of Rome. The hotel staff were very polite, attentive and helpful. All of the rooms are ground floor level.Our room was somewhat isolated as it was located "around the corner" from the main area and didn't open out onto the gardens as expected. The room was clean and comfortable but one thing I did miss was that there wasn't any tea/coffee making facilities in the room although they were readily available in the hotel bar (at a cost, of course). However, there was a mini bar in the room. The breakfasts were continental, a delicious spread of cheeses, ham, scrambled egg, pastries, fruit, juices etc. either served in the breakfast room or in the garden. There was also a small complimentary buffet served in the breakfast room in the early evenng. Local restaurants were recommended by the hotel staff, which we found useful as there are so many in the vicinity. Considering that the Santa Maria is in the heart of the Trastevere, an area known for its restaurants & bars, it had a surprisingly calm and serene ambiance. The was some noise from daily life going on around the hotel but this is only to be expected and it certainly wasn't intrusive - in my opinion it added to the Italian experience. Overall I would certainly recommend the Santa Maria to anyone visiting Rome, it is central, all of the sights were accessible by foot , the staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sata Maria”
Reviews.Author: spannerEngland
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights with my daughter staying at the Hotel Santa Maria. The hotel was very nice, staff friendly, very clean etc. Beautiful little courtyard and our suite was lovely. In fact we do not think we could say a negative thing about the hotel. I did get a little lost in the maze of streets but once we got used to it we had no problems. We would definitely recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere, Rome is WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Lscott18
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks in Italy of which we spent three days at the Hotel Santa Maria in Rome. I wish we had stayed longer. What a wonderful place in a beautiful part of Rome. It was great to have a quiet oasis to return to at the end of each day. Yet the neighborhood around us was quite lively every night. The staff was very helpful and dealt quite well with our speaking only English. The photos of the hotel on their website are true to it's charm and beauty. The rooms were immaculate and in perfect condition. They are small by American standards but quite ample. The bathrooms are well appointed. We traveled with my 13 year old son and his grandmother; we all felt very welcome at the Hotel. It was a pleasure to meet the other guests as well. During our stay, there were several well behaved children, who like us, enjoyed the the hotel courtyards. The hotel was very quiet yet a block away from the Santa Maria plaza/square. There were many very good restuarants close by. The food in Trastevere was some of the best we had in Italy. The hotel's breakfast buffet was terrific and their coffee was a pleasant start to each day. We took a taxi from the hotel on most excursions because the walking was too much for grandmother. Had it not been the case, there were many Roman sites to explore within a pleasant 30 minute walk through lovely neighborhood streets or along the river. We were blessed to find Hotel Santa Maria and to have booked our room early. I would love to return again and again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: desmondo163
Reviews.Content: We booked a small 2 bedroom suite and loved this hotel. The price for Rome was extremely reasonable, and we were very close to many of the main attractions (so much so that when we experienced a taxi strike on the Tuesday of our trip, we were able to simply walk to the Vatican). The included breakfast was simple yet delicious, and the staff is very friendly. The room did not have Internet access, but the hotel's computer was free to use every afternoon. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: ChellEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for Easter 2007. Having searched high and low for a good hotel in Rome, we were extremely pleased to find the Hotel Santa Maria, with fantastic reviews, on the Trip Advisor site. We had wanted to stay in a hotel that reflected "true Italy," and not a so called "chain." We couldn't have been happier, the Santa Maria was everything we could have wished for and more! There are certainly no negatives about anything (oh, apart from the graffiti which appears to cover every wall in Rome!) Our room, the Suite Senior, was way beyond our expectations. It was above average in size with a second floor loft area with two single beds. My parents slept there and it was absolutely fine. The breakfast was more than adequate with fresh produce every day; croissants, cakes, cookies , bread , as well as scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, salami and cereal. The staff were extremely pleasant and went out of their way to help you. Infact one of the receptionists rang a relative to find out the times of the Masses at The Vatican. It was the little things that impressed us throughout our stay like the bottle of wine and chocolates left in our room on Easter Sunday. One thing which was a bonus was taking advantage of the taxi service to and from the airport. It was organised by the hotel and it was completely stress free. It does cost a few euros more but you can feel confident of a genuinely good service. I could write pages about the hotel and its location but have a look at their website, it tells no lies. What more can I say other than the Hotel Santa Maria is just as it is described, "a true oasis of tranquility!!"

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Suretybond
Reviews.Content: Our parents and my husband & I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere for three days at the beginning of May 2007. The hotel is delightful. We loved having breakfast and cocktails in their courtyard with the orange trees. That courtyard just makes this place. The staff is very nice and we would definitely stay there again if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Mature married couple
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were very pleased with the reality. The rooms are a little on the small size but very clean, nicely furnished and well appointed. Breakfast is taken on the patio if the weather is good, if not there is a nice breakfast room/bar. Staff speak English and are very helpful and friendly There is no restaurant but the choice in the trastevere within 10 minutes walk is vast. We had a pre-dinner (and post dinner!) glass of wine on the terrace which was delightful. Note, the hotel will sell you a bottle and cork what's left for later, cheaper than by the glass and at 15-18 euros very reasonable. All the sights are within 20-30 minutes walk or you can get the tram. You can catch a boat to the Vatican from the ponte isola. One point to watch, we wanted to go to the Galleria Borghese but it was fully booked, if you want to go book ahead by at least 2 weeks, they have a very good website. We will return to Rome and will certainly stay at the Santa Maria again, but, book well in advance, it's rightly popular. Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the noise and the service”
Reviews.Author: PaolaMariel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pretty and well located. But the rooms are not noise proof, you can hear when your neighbours go to the toilet, their conversations, etc. Also, at 7am you will hear the cleaners and their trolleys rolling down the corridors just outside your room. The breakfast is very poor, the quality of the produce they use is very low, you wouldn't think you are in Italy! So, it's a shame, a pretty hotel but at EUR 220 per night is not very good value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Haven”
Reviews.Author: stanmoregirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria between 15-20 April 2007. This was such a great place to stay for various reasons. Friendly staff, great breakfast and coffe (thanks Conrad - just one more Maam/Sir!), peace and quiet in the centre of Rome and also the close proximity to some fabulous restaurants. The restaurants we were recommended were Quirino and Taverna Trilussa and they were both fabulous and quite different from each other. We took advantage of the airport pick up which was extremely good value for 55E. Our plane landed at 7am and we were sitting in the breakfast room at Hotel Santa Maria enjoying a cappuccino at 8am. We were offered breakfast on the first morning while our room was being prepared without extra charge. We were able to shower and change and start exploring Rome by around 10.00am. Rooms were very nice and ours (No. 19) looked out into the courtyard (as do most if not all) and the orange trees that were heavy with oranges. This courtyard was where we enjoyed complimentary anti pasto around 5.30pm every night - such a lovely way to end your day of exploring before thinking about dinner. We did experience a little noise from the room above at times but this was minimal (walking with heels and toilet flushing). Other people have mentioned the bells of the church and yes you do hear them but it is such a lovely sound we really enjoyed it. On a practical note there is a laundromat just near the entrance of the hotel and we took advantage of this. No need to hang around the laundromat just head back and sit in the courtyard between loads. We walked to all the major sites (even the Gallery Borgehese). You do need to enjoy walking as this Hotel is not on the Metro but I believe the buses are very convenient - we just prefer to walk. We booked the tour of the vatican (recommended by Hotel) and took advantage of the "priviledged entrance" and this was a high quality tour. We left it too late to book the Gallery Borgehese and it was full however on the suggestion of Reception went up anyway to see if there were any cancellations and there was! This is a must see! I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel when next we visit Rome! I would be happy to answer any further questions by email if required.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Italy”
Reviews.Author: DurangoMolly
Reviews.Content: After checking out comments from this site, Karen Brown, and Rick Steves, my husband and I chose Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere for our four days and nights in Rome. The phrase that keeps popping up to describe this place is "Garden of Eden." Truly, an oasis in a bustling, crowded, noisy but wonderful city. Our room (a former cell in a cloister) was clean, comfortable, and like all the others, faced a beautiful courtyard filled with aromatic orange trees. My husband drank many, many cups of Italian coffee during our stay in Rome, Cinque Terre, and Florence, but Hotel Santa Maria's was the best (in his life, for that matter!). Their breakfast buffet offers a wide variety to suit an international clientele -- cereals, meats, cheeses, pastries, eggs, fruit, juices and the best bread we ate in Rome. Though a bit hard to find, the hotel is well worth the effort in this quaint and charming neighborhood. Everything in Rome is expensive and this hotel is no exception, but again, well worth it. If we're ever lucky enough to return, we'll be booking a stay at Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: gypsy59
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect ending to our stay in Italy. We were there April 26, 2007. We only wish we could have stayed longer as both Rome and Hotel Santa Maria turned out to be our favorites. The room was very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. The food was excellent as well. We had a 5:00 a.m. pick up (the driver arranged for by the hotel) and Pasquale was up, made us coffee and a little something to send us off. This hotel is truly off the beaten path. If you want to be with the locals, enjoy a clean room, have peace and quiet during the night, this is the place. We had room number 1 which was off by itself, with it's own courtyard. We will return to this hotel. It truly was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: jamie_curt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria at the beginning and end of our trip thru Italy in April '07; We couldn't have picked a better hotel to welcome us into the country and then also give us a couple relaxing days in Rome before coming back to Seattle. We arrived in mid-April just as the orange blossoms in the hotel's beautiful courtyard were in full-bloom. All the room's windows have beautiful wrought iron work on the outside so that you can keep them open all night, letting in the scent of the blossoms and the sound of the nearby church campanile. The staff was the best we found in Italy--so attentive and helpful--and the breakfast, as well as the wine and antipasto in the evening, were top-notch. The neighborhood--the Trastevere--is truly the best in Rome: so quaint, authentic and vibrant; defintely the most happening location in Rome right now. We will definitely be coming back to the Santa Maria on our next trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is fabulous. Breakfast in the courtyard (the capuccino is excellent) is a great way to start the day, and a glass of wine and bruschetta in the evening sunshine with the smell of orange blossoms is a great way to relax before dinner. We stayed in a quad room with our two children, and there were bunk beds built into the wall. The room was large, as was the bathroom, which had a nice shower and plenty of fresh towels every day. There was also a small fridge in the room. It was nice to have such easy access to the outdoors in a very quiet, relaxed setting, rather than feeling stuck in a hotel room when you're not out sightseeing. This is a perfect hotel for independent travelers who want to stay in a nice hotel, but don't want to be harassed by too many services (e.g., the knock on your door at 6pm to turn down the beds). The staff here are incredibly friendly and helpful, but they leave you alone to enjoy your stay! Also, the location was perfect. The Trastavere neighborhood is in a historic district, and there are lots of local restaurants that aren't too expensive. We walked everywhere we went for the entire week we were in Rome--the only time we took a cab or any form of public transportation was when we arrived and left with our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “What to expect”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvfromnyc
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Rome where we stayed at a Hotel we selected based on the combination of wonderful reviews we read on Trip Advisor and their web site detailing what to expect. The Hotel Santa Maria, in Trestevere, was all it was built up to be and well worth the few shortcomings it had. The good - Quaint, modest and very clean rooms with great water pressure and pretty comfortable beds The better - Adjacent to the Piazza Santa Maria where good food, gelati, street shows and nighttime vendors are numerous, and easy walking to the Campo Fiori area, which is terrific, and has a main bus stop to everywhere around the City The best - The hotel courtyard and bar, where the free morning breakfasts and evening food are great and bottles of wine can be purchased and shared with friends while sitting outside amongst the Orange trees and relaxing under the sky before, during and after the days events. Without question, this Hotel gives you the feel of being in a villa, while enjoying close proximity to most transportation (Metro is far) all around Rome. Our group consisted of a 12 year old son, four 40+ adults and a yourng 70 year old mother. We all would say there again, and again, and again. Johnny V from NYC

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel and outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: WitzinCville
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself, and our sixteen year old daughter spent three nights in a triple room at the Hotel Santa Maria during the first week of April just prior to Easter. We had a wonderful stay. The room was quite spacious, and we had more than adequate storage space. The front desk staff were all very cordial and accomodating. The breakfast was terrific - wonderful pastries/breads from a local bakery around the corner. The afternoon buffet was also quite nice, and it was a pleasure to come back after a day of walking/touring and sit in the breakfast room/bar, or out in the courtyard and have a snack and a glass a wine. The location was fantastic - we loved wandering all the little streets and alleys in Trastevere, and it was a very easy walk from the hotel to the Forum/Colliseum, as well as to the Vatican. Tizziana who manned the desk in the evenings was unbelievably patient and kind and sent us to several wonderful local eateries for dinners. We had a spectacular meal at a Quirona - a local trattoria. Our only "complaint" was the bells at Santa Maria ring every quarter hour 24 hours a day - it wasn't until our third night that we were able to tune them out. Nevertheless, the next time we come to Rome, we will most certainly try and stay at the Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in Trastevere, the Greenwich Village of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: eifc7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this charming hotel in the neighborhood known as Trastevere. It is exactly as pictured. Our room was a little small, but nicely decorated with amenities like a mini bar, flat screen tv, and safe. Up front, my biggest complaint, which mirrors some of the other reviews I've read, are that the beds are not comfortable and reminded me of the kinds of beds you sleep in at a summer camp--thin mattress on a slab. The pillows were hard foam. I did not get a good night's sleep. The other thing--and this is only in comparison to the other hotels we stayed in during our stay in Italy, was that the day staff, one woman in particular, was not particularly friendly or helpful. In the evenings, the staff was the opposite. We absolutely loved Trastevere. We wouldn't stay in any other neighborhood in Rome. It's artsy and lively with great restaurants, shops, and gelato! The windy, cobblestoned streets reminded us of Venice minus the water. We'd probably stay at Hotel Santa Maria again, but by that time, I hope they will have improved the bedding. It will then be a perfect place to stay. The breakfast was delicious, great cappucino, nice afternoon buffet, and internet access in the bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susieny
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 children ages 6 and 11) just returned from a 5-night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria. While I have many positive things to say about the hotel, there were also some negatives. First the positive. The hotel is very pretty. The rooms surround a nice courtyard with orange trees. This is a nice feature for families as my children could run around and play outside the room in safety. In addition to a wonderful breakfast, the hotel provides a lovely snack every afternoon at 5:30 and there are games such as chess, Uno, dominos, etc. This was great after a long day of walking and sightseeing since we did not get around to eating dinner until 8 pm most nights. There is also free internet access. The rooms are very clean and the staff was helpful. Trestevare is a great area with lots of night life, restaurants and street theater. It is within easy walking distance to many sights. Now the negative. We stayed in the junior mansard suite. This is a 2-level room. The lower level was set up with bunk beds for my children and it has its own closet and tv. The upper level is for the adults and this is where the problem lies. As a previous poster mentioned, the ceilings are incredibly low. My husband is 5'11 and I am 5'4 and even I kept bumping my head on the ceiling. My husband could barely stand up in the shower. Also, the bathroom has only one dim light on a side wall which makes it almost impossible to see anything in the bathroom. It was in the upper 60's when we were in Rome and we had to keep the one small window open all the time. This room must be unbearable in the summer. From what we could tell from looking in the windows of other rooms, they seemed quite nice. The hotel should tell you upfront about the ceiling height so that you can make an informed decision. All I can say is, if you book at this hotel and they offer you the junior mansard suite, ask for different room or look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelj0urnalist
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel, but TripAdvisor reviews cemented our decision to book. It was all we hoped for - a true gem in Trastevere. Quiet, relaxing, an oasis, not far from the city. Our rooms - first a suite, then a double - were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was awesome - fresh baked goods, meats, cheeses, fruit, etc. etc. The service was very good. Also, they offer afternoon hor d'oeuvres that were delicious. Both offerings were inclusive. Staff were gracious, helpful and spoke very good English. The location is really perfect - just across the river and within walking distance to everything, but tucked into a charming neighborhood, that's sometimes hard to leave. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: adslfkj;asdfhjsdfgh
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very pleasant reasonably-priced hotel that is both near the main tourist sites and yet outside the main areas of combustion, stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in the charmingTrastevere district. We did. And we will the next time. The one disappointment is that there is no architectural trace of its convent origins (anyway, none that we could see) but you can imagine cloisters where two courtyards now exist. (Courtyards I can imagine making good use of with a glass of wine in the summer.) Clean, comfortable, hot water, good service, nice little breakfast area - in short, all one wants. But maybe above all, as only residents are allowed within the gates, a haven of quiet to come back to after a hectic day. (Quiet marred only by the occasional cat disagreement!) In addition, there are some wonderful little restaurants in the area. Not fancy, just that wonderful basic Italian fare that is famous the world over. (Just ask Tiziana at the desk; she never steered us wrong.) With special kudos going to nearby Quirino's (we're not vegetarians but their sauteed potatoes and artichokes were to die for) and maybe even best of all, the Taverna Trilussa. Divine. (Avoid: Checco e Carettiere's on the Via Benedetta. Unless you like waiting for a glass of water for 45 minutes. Still, they seem to be a tourist staple. Probably their problem.) Otherwise, a few recommendations: 1) to see THAT ceiling, go in the afternoon, not the morning; you're actually more likely to get in faster. 2) Get a ticket to the Opera, even if it's up in the gods - opera in Rome, a lot of fun. As was the Alexanderplatz for jazz. 3) Whether or not you like gardening (we're don't), venture outside the city to go to the Villa d'Este (the Hotel can help with a private tour or several other tours, for that matter) - we thought it was gorgeous. 4) If you're a lover of literature, don't miss the house Keats died in beside the Spanish Steps. (You could also seek out both his and Shelley's graves in the Protestant Cemetery, a landmark in itself.) 5) Skip the Caffe Greco near the Spanish Steps (just too crowded) and go to Babington's Tea Rooms instead - in that tourist stronghold, a surprisingly calm and delightful oasis. 6) And before you leave the Spanish Steps area, if you've got five minutes left in you, head for the Doria Pamphilj Art Gallery, dash in and make for Velazquez's Portrait of Innocent III - one of the great portraits of all time. 7) And finally, don't skip wandering around the Palatine right there above the Forum; I found it even more magical. (But take a good map with you; Dermot O'Connell can probably help you out at his charming 'Almost Corner Bookshop' almost juset beside the Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2007
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite hotels in the world. This location is ideal and Trastavere is our favorite neighborhood in Rome. The website does a great job accurately depicting what a stay there will be like. From the courtyard, to the breakfast room/bar, to the rooms, everything is done well. The staff was very courteous and gave us great restaurant recommendations. If we go to Rome again, we will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lonebusinesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a gem! For 2 females in Rome for 5 days, we loved coming back to the Hotel Santa Maria. The staff was very helpful, spoke English and were always available. The hotel area offers many nice resturants and small necessity stores. The area is very safe, even after dark, and while out of city center it is a quick walk to all the sites. We were suprised how close everything was! We walked to the Vatican, the Colosseum, and Mt. Garabaldi with ease--and me with a recouperating sprained ankle! Don't miss the view from Mt. Garabaldi-a 360 of Rome. For those not into walking, the hotel is kind enough to call for cabs when needed--like to the train station (a 10-12 Eu ride off peak hours). Because it is an out of the way hotel, we just told cabbies to take us to the Piazza Santa Maria (which adjoins the hotel). The hotel includes a full breakfast (think eggs, meat, cereal, bread) and free internet service to check in on your flight. We used the hired car for transport to/from the airport (55 Eu for up to 4 people) versus the fixed 40 Eu rate for cabs (cabs add a baggage fee and 'call' fee to that 'fixed' rate) and had no problems whatsoever. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: upgraded
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria. The location is perfect. The breakfast buffet is fine. We stayed in the Mansard Suite. My husband and I are short. Or 3 sons are around 5' 10, They could hardly stand up in the room. It is really an attic.One son really smashed his forehead on the door frame one night. Plenty of hot water. But even we could hardly stand up in the shower. The staff was very helpful and had great suggestions on places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: daytripper425
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent 8-day stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in the Trastevere section of Rome. It was a charming little hotel off the Piazza Santa Maria in the heart of a neighborhood of tiny, cobblestone streets and convenient to a number of excellent trattorias. A great location, within walking distance of the Vatican, the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps, and the Colosseum/Roman Forum. The room itself was lovely, and gave onto a courtyard with orange trees . The staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. Every morning there was a delicious buffet breakfast , and every evening an antipasto spread in the wine bar area. I would recommend it to everyone as a lovely place to stay to enjoy Rome to the fullest!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming, picturesque inn”
Reviews.Author: shellaChicago
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel. As I am a flight attendant and stay in hotels often, it was a wonderful treat to stay in a place with such character and personality! We were fortunate to spend 4 nights here March 10-14. I would definitely recommend the hotel-arranged limo driver (we had 3 people in our party). We would never have found it otherwise! As mentioned in previous reviews, it is spotless, the breakfast buffet was the best we had in our travels throughout Italy, we never felt unsafe, and , true, the pillows were a bit hard! The Trastevere area was charming and we enjoyed the gelato and the accordian player serenading us in the piazza. I would take issue with some previous reviews stating that the walk to the Vatican was 15 minutes. Did they know of a shortcut or something?! I would say it was a brisk 25-30 minute walk-we walked it on two different days. The only time we took a taxi was to the train station-otherwise we walked everywhere...very convenient location and very serene. I only hope I have the opportunity to stay here again! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel if your travels bring you to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: COteam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was exactly as described and pictured on the website. Our accomodations were quite comfortable. We were able to enjoy wonderful nights of sleeps even though we had to open the windows. The air conditioning was not yet available since it was still winter and Rome was enjoying a bit of unseasonably warm weather. The location allows easy access to all the sights of Rome, but allows you to get away from the noise at the end of the day. We could enjoy early evenings in the solitude of the hotel and then amble to nearby restaurants for a variety of cuisine. The staff at the hotel could not have been more accomodating and friendly. We left with promises that returns to Rome will only be spent at Hotel Santa Maria. Kentucky, USA

Reviews.Title: “Still perfect”
Reviews.Author: DaveytNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and loved it so we had to try it again this year and it was every bit as good. I really don't think there is anything they could improve on. I'm known as a nit-picker always grumbling about something but this hotel has me beatent. I can't find a thing to compain about.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Santa Maria in Rome (Trastevere district)”
Reviews.Author: jtd_ontheroad
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria in Rome was a wonderful place to stay in Rome! My fiance and I picked it from Rick Steves' guidebook, and we were completely happy with our choice. The HSM is located just across the Tiber river (near the Ponte Sisto) in Trastevere in a little maze of streets. It was a quiet oasis in hectic Rome, complete with a secluded courtyard and private rooms. The hotel provided a full service breakfast (better than any other we had in our 2-week Italy vacation), a desk that booked dinner and museum reservations for us, and an extremely pleasant staff. They even serve afternoon wine and snacks in the breakfast room while the rest of the city shuts down for the afternoon siesta. It was a fantastic place to stay, and I will definitely stay there again when I return to the eternal city. J. Drake Watertown, NY (USA)

Reviews.Title: “OK but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: MissTravelBugLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location and it is easy to get out and see Rome's sites from it. It is in a perfect place to walk out at night and have dinner and watch the world go past. It is very quiet and peaceful. However, we had a few issues with it. We could not get a good night's sleep as the bed was uncomfortable. The pillows are hard and I would advise you to take your own pillow - I wish I had! The courtyard is pretty with orange trees however it is not designed for anyone to actually sit and enjoy it. The seats are nasty and it is covered with unsightly gravel. The hotel is a quiet retreat and it would be nice if you could feel comfortable just chilling out there after a hard day's sightseeing and have a beer. As it is, there is very little atmosphere. Nobody was at the bar when we looked in (including no bartender!) and the only time you saw another guest was at breakfast. The room was OK. Very dark but nice enough and clean. In summary, I wouldn't stay here again unless they had new pillows and someone to sit! It's a shame as with a few tweaks, this could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stevangela
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic, from the early communication with hotel staff, on time airport pickup, to the stay itself. Location in the heart of Trastavere, The Santa Maria is a true gem within Rome and the Trastavere area is worth dedicating time to exploring as much as possible....yes, we did it all, saw the incredible sights, but our favorite experiences had to be bike riding (provided free by hotel) to the top of the area behind Trastavere and biking through the botanical gardens and having our own little picnic high atop the city overlooking Rome! you wont find this in the guide books!...also, everyday, make time to have appertivo in the piazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little hotel in a quiet location in fashionable Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: mikepaterson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary. The hotel was lovely and perfectly clean. Room was not massive, but it all worked well! TV had CNN and Eurosport in English but nothing else. Breakfast was great and in the evening there were nibbles and games laid out whilst you were having a drink. It would be amazing in the summer as you could sit in the courtyard for breakfast and for drinks. The hotel is hidden away and is in a very good location to see everything. We walked everywhere but the hotel have bikes available free of charge. There are lots of good restaurants and bars nearby and some of the bars have happy hour all day until 11:00 at night! Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maris, Trastevere, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stargate4004
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria's "Suite Mansard" with our 18 year old daughter and 16 year old son, and it was perfect for us. Yes, the sloping ceilings proved a painful challenge sometimes, but we soon had navigational sense knocked into us, and the Suite represented exceptional value for money. The hotel's location is perfect, just 25 minutes stroll from the Vatican in one direction and a similar distance to the Colleseum in the other (and I mean stroll – we don’t do brisk walking!). The Travestere area is a strange mix of quaint well-cared-for buildings and buildings which look like they are due for demolition. It is abound with reasonably-priced restaurants with friendly staff who tolerated our monosyllabic Italian and generally spoke back to us in much better English. The hotel is its own little oasis in the narrow maze of the Travestere streets and stands in its own securely-gated gardens. We all adored breakfast, especially the girls (actually being invited to eat CAKE in the morning!!!). The staff were all very friendly and helpful, both for the booking process (via their website www.hotelsantamaria.info) and during our stay. The room was beautifully cleaned each day, my only gripe being that the maid insisted on putting the TVs into “standby” mode, thereby wasting electricity all day whilst we were out. We visited this hotel on recommendation from two of my colleagues who had taken their families there, and like them we can give it the very highest recommendation to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: SaurusDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel. Ok so this isn't 5 star superlux city centre uberhotel, more boutique resting place. The room was spotless, comfortable and all the plumbing worked well. My wife was particularly pleased to see abundant coathangers! There is a nice breakfast room / bar with excellent service. Apart from this we hardly saw any staff except at reception. Things just got done while you weren't there. It felt wonderfuly discrete, private and quiet. The rooms all surround a delightful garden with orange trees. The Trastevere area seemed to be a studenty, "left bank" bohemian sort of area which initally seems a little out of the way but you could walk to St Peters inside 20 minutes. We had an enjoyable short break in Rome, the scale of the Coloseum left me awestruck, the people are friendly, the Grafiti on the walls where ever you go left me saddened.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: tvlqueen17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria from February 8-11. I booked it solely based on the positive Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. (Clarifying, I have been a travel agent since 1986 so I can be a little picker than "the average joe" at times.) As stated in just about every review you read, the rooms are small (definitely not claustrophobic, however) and immaculately clean. We stayed at 4 hotels in Italy and Santa Maria had the best shower hands down. The hotel is extremely quiet and almost feels like a little "secret" when you pass through the gates and slip into their peaceful hideaway in Rome. Yes, you do hear the bells from the church but they don't wake you up, we only heard them when we were awake and didn't find it aggravating at all - rather charming instead. Breakfast was good! Scrambled eggs, cheese and cold cuts, fresh juices, pastries, yogurts, and awesome coffee. Perfect way to start your day and we enjoyed eating there all 3 mornings. We were never back at the hotel in the evenings to take advantage of the "Happy Hour" so can't comment on that. We didn't borrow the bicycles but definitely used the umbrellas and were very thankful for those! Distance to "the sites" isn't bad at all. We walked to Vatican City in about 15 minutes. The longest we walked to get back to the hotel from various spots all over Rome was about 30 minutes. Is Santa Maria around the corner from Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon? No, of course not. But we very much enjoyed seeing the sites and then returning to "our neighborhood" which wasn't overrun with tourists and high prices. No one mentions the handy laundromat that is literally right around the corner from the gate to the hotel. On the day we were leaving we got up and started 2 loads of laundry. Then, walked the 15 seconds (I'm not kidding) back to the hotel and had our leisurely breakfast. Afterwards we walked back to the laundromat and put the clothes in the dryer. Then we wandered around Trastavere one last time before getting the dry clothes, packing them up and heading for the train station. Had we known we were going to be able to do laundry so easily we would have packed even less! Trastavere feels "real" as compared to other parts of Rome that are so big and sprawling. We loved the tiny (and I mean tiny!) winding streets. (Think wide enough for a mini van to pass through with little spare room on either side, perhaps a person could stand there but that's about it!) The food is wonderful and definitely cheaper than the "hot tourist areas". One night we got pizza from one of the many little pizza shops we had noticed wandering around and had a fine dinner for only 10EUR. There are lots of restaurants... lots of bars... and lots of activity at night with folks walking around enjoying themselves. I even walked around one night long after dark by myself (for about 30-40 minutes covering just about every little street within the neighborhood) and I never once felt the slightest bit threatened or intimidated. Is Santa Maria the BEST hotel in Rome? Well, of course there are 5 star hotels and luxury properties in locations closer to the tourist sites. If you want to pay more or be in those areas there are other hotels that will work for you. But, if you're looking for a more moderate expense you can't do better than the Santa Maria. And, to feel like you've experienced a true part of Rome that is "real and authentic"? Again, you can't do better. We stayed at a variety of hotels on our Italy adventure... 3, 4, and 5 stars so I have some basis for comparison. The staff at the Santa Maria were very helpful to us and when we asked for suggestions or directions they never let us down. We enjoyed the people there immensely and if we return to Rome we will definitely stay at the Hotel Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPb
Reviews.Content: A perfect hideaway in the centre of picturesque Trastevere, Rome. Beyond the secure gate lies the busy, cobbled streets with plenty of bars, trattorias and pizzerias to keep you busy for the duration of your stay. Inside the grounds lies the orange tree courtyard and tastefully stylish rooms. Breakfast, generously served until 10.30 will fill you up for the day ahead and a tasty pre dinner snack is served at 5.30 to keep you going until your evening meal. A perfect hotel to spend any sort of holiday, or if like us, a honeymoon. Paula & Simon Birley. London February 2007

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in heart of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: ThomsonPerthWA
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 12 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights in January this year and absolutely loved it. The location in the heart of the Trastevere area was a perfect spot to explore Rome each day. Trastevere is an interesting part of Rome. Less touristy than the more well known and popular parts of Rome.....so less crowded too. The Hotel itself was great. Lovely rooms all positioned at ground level around a central courtyard area which would be a great place to sit and enjoy a wine or a beer at the end of the day in the warmer months. The Bar and breakfast areas were very comfortable and the breakfast itself one of the best we had in Italy. All this and very helpful and friendly staff too. Will definitely stay again when next in Rome. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeightsRunner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was recommended to me by a friend for my first trip to Rome in January 2007 and I am so pleased that I took his advice! The location provides the perfect base for exploring all that Rome has to offer while staying in a quintessential residential neighborhood. The staff was extremely helpful in assisting us with directions, restaurant suggestions and reservations and anything else they could do to make our trip a success. If they had been able to order better weather I would have been REALLY impressed but the loaned umbrellas were a big help. Our room was very clean and comfortable and the inclusive breakfast was a lovely way to start our day. We walked nearly everywhere from the hotel and enjoyed exploring the immediate neighborhood - in fact our most favorite church was the Santa Maria located in the adjacent square. I highly recommend this hotel for families, couples or those travelling solo.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: bobbHenley
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because I have difficulty sleeping,particularly where there is traffic noise.It proved to be a wonderful oasis of calm and peace and we would not consider staying anywhere else in Rome.Because of the design,there is no passing traffic. The courtyard gardens were full of orange trees and small tables and chairs,all of which were most attractive,the staff exceptionally helpful,the breakfast(included)delicious and the room met all our needs. Book very early - we didn't and it meant that during our 4 day stay in Rome,we had to change rooms from a standard to a superior for one night and find a completely different hotel for the last. Unless you want extra space for moving around in or an extra single bed,the standard room was every bit as good as the superior.February 12th 2007

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: bonnie02
Reviews.Content: We have to agree with the majority of reviews on TripAdvisor in that the Santa Maria is a great choice for those looking for a unique small hotel at reasonable cost. Trastevere is a convenient bohemian district inhabited by the discerning and we were forvever grateful that we had decided to stay slightly away from the central district. This is the real Rome where tourists are outnumbered by locals, and where you find great local food at good prices. Unless you want full service, a pool or a manned business centre, why would you stay anywhere else in this extraordinary city? Rome in February was a delight with sunshine, clear blue skies, comfortable daytime temperatures, no crowds and very few hawkers. All our bar and restaurant experiences were positive as waiting staff were without exception cheerful and helpful. We thought that we had the best value food and drink that we had experienced anywhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere - Our favorite place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ZurichZurich
Reviews.Content: After having chosen a design hotel and reading the bad reviews in tripadvisor we booked Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere instead. What an excellent choice. We had the Junior Mansard Suite on 2 floors. A cosy room downstairs with a bed and Flatscreen TV and a romantic room upstairs with a double bed, bathroom and small TV. There is nice a well kept garden with tables and chairs which invite you to sit outside - although it was too cold at this time of the year. The breakfast room is a nice place to have breakfast or stay during the day and breakfast is generously served. Try the good cappuccino! The staff at reception is extremely friendly and helpful in organizing trips, giving tips where to go and how to find it. The cleaning personnel is well trained and there was not one spot at the hotel which was not clean. We were very impressed. Trastevere is the spot to be for drinks, very good Italian food and not to forget to relax after the buzzling city and sightseeing.We hope to come back soon to Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere - our little paradise in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...Fabulous ....Fabulous !!!”
Reviews.Author: Cazeroona
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself had New Years 2007 in Rome, first time on our own after our son had been born. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is a wonderful location on Trastevere near a fabulous bakery and lots of lovely restaurants/bars. Only a stones thrown from Campi de Fiore. The breakfast was lovely, the staff so helpful and the room spacious. Thank you once again for a memorable stay. The Brown's from Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: TillyK
