Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending four days at this wonderful atmospheric hotel. We chose it from the reviews on trip advisor and were delighted with it. Firstly, it's in a great location in the bohemian Trastevere area where there are some great bars and restaurants on the doorstep (after a full day sightseeing we didn't want to go too far)!Also, practically, it feels safe as the hotel is located within an enclosed wall with a secure entrance gate. The rooms themselves are not big (we upgraded on the last night to a superior room as our room was taken - having only booked a week ago) but really clean, warm and comfortable with lovely bathrooms. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was also good and canapes are served in the evening. The hotel has some rickety bikes to use and this was a great way to see the city (we took them for two days). To get to the hotel from Fiumicino airport, we caught the train to Trastevere (about 30mins) and a tram (No 8) will take you down Viale de Trastervere, try to get off near Via San Francesco and walk down. (10 min). The hotel is just beyond the piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, it's a bit tricky to find at first so you may need to ask someone. We ate at Pizzeria Da Ivo (Via de San Francesco) and PIzzeria Dar Poeta (vicolo del Bologna) - both were very good. There were no queues for any of the sights we visited so an ideal time to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Resting sanctuary at the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: edurnelondon
Reviews.Content: A friendly and familiar feel to this hotel. very clean and cosy rooms. it felt more like staying in a small Italian village than the city. The orange-tree-filled courtyard outside the room made our stay a very tranquil and relaxing experience, especially after walking through the crowed roman streets. The hotel was a bit difficult to find at first which only added to the fun and excitement of being in Rome for the first time (with a wonderful friend and partner)- D & N from Watford- UK

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Santa Maria, Trastavere, Rome”
Reviews.Author: wanderer02
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at the Hotel Santa Maria and it met all our expectations. The hotel arranged a taxi to collect us from the airport, booked restaurants for both nights, booked a taxi to take us to the Galleria Borghese (wonderful) and another to take us back to the airport. The room was warm and comfortable, the breakfast very good and the complimentary evening snack was a nice way to start the night. We liked the little bar/breakfast room and the pretty walled gardens with orange trees. We felt very safe and secure and found the staff helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXJoeGo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week in Rome staying at the Hotel Santa Maria. We highly recommend the Santa Maria with it's great location in Trastevere, plus an excellent staff who have genuine concern for your comfort and well-being. This is our second visit and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: schnouk
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Santa Maria for four nights in early December. I have been proscrastinating about writing this review because there is little I can say to add to the kudos given so far and nothing I found negative; it is simply a marvelous little hotel in a fantastic location. BTW I booked directly with the hotel by e-mail including taxi pick up at the airport; everything worked like a charm and the transportation arrangement is in my view good value for money (we used the service back to the airport). The Santa Maria, and of course Rome, were perfect for our romantic getaway! Ian Davies

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mccorwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for four nights and it was one of our best hotel experiences in Italy. The staff were very friendly and helpful: organising tours at our request and giving advice and directions. The ambience at breakfast and early evening drinks in the garden was relaxing and very enjoyable- not least because of the attentive service of the staff. Trastavere is an excellent location for Rome, full of atmosphere and close to most sights. The district was much more pleasant than around Termini where we stayed at another time. It was great to walk around the corner to be in the main piazza, but to be away from the hustle and bustle. John & Wendy McC Australia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesBurns
Reviews.Content: My partner Suzanne and I have just returned from a blissful 2 day break in Rome. The Santa Maria is a unique location with excellent rooms- spacious and clean. Above all the staff were first class: excellent restaurant recommendations; courteous and very helpful when helping us to track down lost luggage! In additional mention should go to the new fairtrade ice cream parlour- Fior Di Luna- on 96 Via della Lungaretta. Staff have a connection here. The best ice cream produced from the purest ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “Rome hotel with character and charming setting”
Reviews.Author: Dazzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for five nights over the New Year festivities and had a truly wonderful stay. From the moment we arrived until our departure, the staff were very welcoming and helpful, always ready to give recommendations on shopping and restaurants. In addition, all of them spoke English well. The hotel itself is built around a courtyard in the center of the Trastevere district of the city. As central Rome is compact, it is possible to walk to any of the sights in 30 minutes max. The hotel also has bikes available to guests free of charge which are great as it is possible to cycle alongside the Tiber river (very close to hotel) walkway as well as to the sights if you feel adventurous. The breakfast was excellent, a buffet that comprised of fresh fruit (including oranges off the trees in the hotel courtyard), pastries, cold meats and cheeses and scrambled eggs. The rooms were comfortable and quiet, opening out onto the courtyard. In addition, 'aperitivi' snacks were available in the evening free of charge, as was internet access on a PC in the lounge from midday. Perhaps the biggest advantage of the hotel though is its neighbourhood, which is comprised of narrow streets full of local charm and many excellent restaurants. This is the area of the city where many locals dine out, so you can eat excellent food at the correct price (ie not get ripped off like you can near the tourist sights) in a huge choice of eateries. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel, especially to those who are taking a holiday in Rome and also want a break from the typical business hotel - this hotel's charm will add the finishing touch to your stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AggieKJM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10 day trip to Italy...with 3 nights of that spent in Rome at the Hotel Santa Maria. I found this gem of a hotel on this website and couldn't wait to surprise my husband with my find. Upon our arrival I couldn't have been happier with the place!! My husband absolutely loved it as well....it's such a quaint, lovely and romantic place in the middle of the Trastevere area of Rome. After a long day of walking the city, we couldn't wait to return to our little oasis and relax! The Trastevere area of Rome is great. We found it to be our favorite after walking all around the city seeing the sites. It's not as commercialized as the other areas and you actually get a feel for what it means to stay in the "Roman" part of Rome. You don't have busy traffic outside your window or all the hussle and bussle of the city out your door...which we found very relaxing. It's very easy to get to everything, the Vatican, the Colosseum, Trevi fountain, etc. We enjoyed the short stroll to see everything...it's not bad at all! We had the best stay at Hotel Santa Maria and loved Rome. The hotel staff was very pleasant and most helpful with any need we had. The breakfast was lovely, the internet a plus, and the bar and outside areas were just perfect. The rooms were VERY clean and the bathrooms great!! We have traveled a lot around the world and this stay has been one of our best memories. I noticed in a previous review that someone mentioned about the walls being "thin"....they are thinner than what you might be used to, but we found this is quite common in Italy (or Europe) and this should, we feel, by no means keep you from staying at this wonderful place!! We are most confident that you will have a lovely stay as we have..... Thanks Hotel Santa Maria...we can't wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HSM is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Hillgirl23
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Trastevere is a little rough around the edges, but tell me one part of Rome that isn't! If you are young and ambitious, I can explain to you how we got here via train (from Rome FCO Airport) and then to Tram 8 and thus saved 40+ Euros by not taking a car. If not--book the car service through the hotel because it is a little hard to find otherwise. Our favorite parts about this hotel: 1) The fact that it is different than a normal hotel. Because each room faces the courtyard, a long stay is more pleasant because you aren't going up in a windowless elevator and walking down stark hallways every time you return to your room. The orange trees in the courtyard were amazing to look at every day. 2) The breakfast was awesome. Scrambled eggs! 3) The breakfast room also served as a bar in the evenings. They had complimentary appetizers (like foccacia, etc) and then you had the opportunity to buy drinks. No pictures i've seen on here do the room justice. It's just really cute. Overall, we loved this place. And we got a good price for booking 3 nights and using our Rick Steves book to get a special discount and paying in Cash.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: Redkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the place to stay in Rome. The busy, bustling and often loud streets of Rome seem like an afterthought when entering the gated grounds of this hotel. The grounds are simple and serene. The rooms were spacious (by european standards) and the beds comfortable. The complimentary breakfasts and cocktail hour appetizers were very good (no hard rolls) and the hosts were helpful in restaurant recommendations. Overall the stay was not only a quiet retreat after spending the day walking the streets of rome but a relative steal in comparison to the really expensive hotels in Rome. I would stay there again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Good reviews are well deserved”
Reviews.Author: Gemini607
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome several times, but never stayed in Trastevere before- what a wonderful neighborhood! The hotel was really delightful, the staff very helpful, the breakfast was terrific, and the free internet access in the afternoons was most helpful. The hotel is down an alley from the Piazza Santa Maria, and it would be helpful if there were a sign identifying which alley to take (there's a sign on the corner building that says "Gellateria-Bar"). We booked a triple room, though our daughter wound up staying with her sister (who's a student at the American University of Rome), and the hotel gave us credit for the breakfasts that she did not eat each day, which we very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: strawberryjellybean
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is a good hotel with friendly staff but the best thing about the place is its fantastic location away from the craziness of the city. Trastevere is a fantasticly authentic Roman area, people who say it is run down are missing the point, it is truely beautiful. It is fair to say that Santa Maria has a self catering or hostel type laid back feel. If you are looking for the last word in luxury this is not the place for you, however it is a better hotel than many 4 star places in which i have stayed and I would definitely stay here again. One criticism is that the staff did not tell us about the wine tasting which takes place every afternoon, and we did not find out until the final evening - i have to admit i was disappointed about this as it would have been nice to have met some of the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hideaway hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Herbycome
Reviews.Content: I tried to book into this hotel two years ago but sadly it was full. However, this year we were in luck and had two lovely days staying in this absolutely delightful hotel tucked away in the heart of Trastevere. It's a haven of peace and just what you need after the hustle and bustle of Rome - no cars around and yet only a stones throw away from the squares, restaurants and shops of Trastevere. The rooms were decorated to a high standard, the breakfasts delicious with a lot of choice and the staff were simply superb. (I hesitated to write this review because it could be even harder to get into in the future!!) Finally, the location is brilliant - we walked simply everywhere. We'll be back that's for sure. Elaine & Stephen, The Cotswolds, England

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Rome”
Reviews.Author: twoifbyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for two nights prior to our embarking on a cruise around Italy. After researching information on the neighborhoods of Rome, and coming to the decision to stay in the Trastevere neighborhood, we decided to book our stay at the Hotel Santa Maria (based on reviews we found here). We were not disappointed. The location is convenient to everything, while still maintaining a sense of serenity and calm. We had the hotel make the reservations for a car/driver to pick us up at the airport and deliver us to the hotel--- worth every penny. Once we arrived (around 10am), we only had a 30 minute wait until our room would be ready. This gave us a great opportunity to take in the courtyard of the hotel (where other guests were having breakfast from the continental selection that was included in our rate). The front desk staff were always helpful (dining reservations, maps, tourist questions, etc.), and always available any time of the day. This had also been the case for the few e-mail questions we had sent prior to our trip. Rooms were nicely appointed, spacious and clean, and gave us a great "home base" from which to do our daily exploring. The location is just moments away from the Ponte Sisto, providing the gateway to the heart of Renaissance Rome (Piazza Navona, Piazza Campo di Fiori, etc.), as well as a 15 minute stroll down the Tiber River from the Castel Sant'Angelo and St. Peter's Square. For our next trip to Rome, we plan to stay with the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: NadiaYoung
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Rome a very special one. It is a beautiful and tranquil place in the heart of the Trastevere area, so brilliantly located for cafes, restaurants and small shops with character. The gardens are lovely; the rooms comforatble; the breakfasts fantastic and the staff made us feel very welcome. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent! We couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: tmjohns76
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on tripadvisor and choose Hotel Santa Maria. We cannot say enough wonderful things about our one night stay. The hotel booked our tours, gave us helpful information, and suggested fabulous places to dine. Free internet was helpful. All hotels in Rome (we also spent one night at the Mariott Hotel Flora) should strive to be like Hotel Santa Maria. If you want to see Rome outside of all the tourism, but still be close to everything. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in the city”
Reviews.Author: gereta
Reviews.Content: 12th November 2006 We have just returned home from the Hotel Santa Maria in Rome where we spent a few days following a cruise. The hotel is situated in the Trastivere area of the city which is central for sightseeing.and is an historic area and full of atmosphere especially at night when the Romans come there to eat at the many restaurants. We found the hotel very quaint and a haven after the rush of the city.. The staff were delightful, both friendly and most helpful in every way. The breakfast room was originally an artisans workshop and the food of a very good standard. If you are looking for a multistory run of the mill hotel this is not for you. But if you like an unusual and different kind of hotel with super service then give it a try. E and G (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiggers
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel that is tucked away down small street. Once through gates you are in a small oasis with wonderful courtyard gardens. We had one of the triple single bed rooms that was more than big enough for us three girls and it was well decorated with quite a big bathroom. One of the reasons for us why this hotel was so good was the staff working there. They were all so very helpful and friendly. The triple room we also had was excellent with very good facilities. The only item that we missed in the room was tea/coffee making facilities, but the rest of the hotel made up for this. Breakfast was excellent as was the late afternoon buffet/nibles they offered. It was s shame the weather was not warmer as then we could have taken breakfast and had drinks in the Courtyard. We really could not fault the hotel and it was wonderful to return there after a hard day's sightseeing. We were all upset that we only spent 2 nights at this hotel and wished we could have stayed for longer. The hotel was in an excellent location - well within easy walking distance from all the main sights that Rome has to offer. We would chose to stay in this part of Rome again rather than somewhere classed as being more central. We will return to finish seeing the rest of Rome at some point in the future and will definitely stay here again. Thank you Hotel Santa Maria for making our stay in Rome such good fun and so very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Another rave review!”
Reviews.Author: miloumilou
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic – down a charming alleyway right in the center of Trastevere which is much less touristy than other neighborhoods. And because it’s in between the Vatican and the sites of Roman antiquity you can walk everywhere. All rooms surround a lovely courtyard. As the property was converted from a convent, the rooms are small but very tastefully appointed. The wooden furniture and hardware seem original which adds to the charm. My nephew's room actually had a hidden pull-down bed which we only discovered after being there a few days. The shower and water pressure are unbelievable. (My only complaint is that the church bells in the piazza ring frequently so beware if you are a light sleeper.) The breakfast is excellent – lots of variety and as many delicious cappuccini and cornetti as you want served by an extremely efficient staff. I haven’t seen this property in any guide books so I want to thank tripadvisor for such a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the 'real' Rome”
Reviews.Author: eirekjfkelwajrao
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay, would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking the charm of a small hotel but the quality and service you would expect in large city centre accommodation. The location is perfect, a cloistered courtyard, providing a little oasis in the atmospheric Travestere district. Rooms beautifully decorated, gorgeous breakfast and lovely courtyard with orange trees. (It really is just how it looks in the brochure!). Can't wait to return......

Reviews.Title: “the area comes alive at night!”
Reviews.Author: judey_jude
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is nicely away from the hussle and bussle of the main drag of Rome. It is tucked away in amongst little streets on the other side of the river and is quite tame during the day but this area really comes alive at night. There are some great little eateries and the wine is cheap. (the ice cream is cheaper on this side of the river too!!!!) The staff are very friendly. We went on a couple of organised trips that left before breakfast but they were more than happy to make us a coffee. They even arranged a taxi to the airport. I say 'taxi', it was more like a chauffer driven car and at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: execbiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this lovely hotel in early September. What a treat! The hotel is a little sanctuary in a wonderful - but very busy part of Rome. We have been to Rome before but stayed in a large hotel. This experience was entirely different and much nicer - more intimate. We had breakfast every morning in the courtyard - visiting with other guests of the hotel. In the afternoon we sipped local wines and sampled appetizers provided by the hotel. We walked to all of the main sites of Rome from here. The staff was great - including Aldo - the resident Golden Retriever. All were very helpful and friendly. We would absolutely return to this little gem. Marcia & Bob Nichols, Danville, CA

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: conlangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at Hotel Santa Maria and it was our oasis in Rome at the start and end of our trip to Italy. The hotel, its staff and their recommendations for tours, restaurants and transportation were impeccable. The rooms are terrific and the bathrooms have a bathtub which is always a big plus in a small Italian hotel. The courtyards are gorgeous and the overall ambience a real treat. And the restaurants in Trastevere are fantastic and abundant. We had 4 of the finest meals I have ever had in Italy on previous trips at 4 different restaurants. You cannot go wrong with the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chimay1754
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria on our honeymoon for one night. The staff was great and the hotel offered a nice quiet location in the city. The taxi driver that the hotel arranged for us was great. I would certainly recommend the Hotel Santa Maria to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: russ_kw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon, and it was great. To be honest, we didn't spend a whole lot of time at the hotel, since we were out exploring the city, but the hotel is definately in a great area, walking distance to everything important in Rome. The hotel is hidden in the Trastavere area, and if you didn't know it was there, you'd never find it. The continental breakfast is the best we've ever had, and the staff was all very helpful. We just wish we had more time to spend there! They even gave us a map when we checked in, which saved us many times, since the streets in Rome and especially near the hotel take some getting used to. Also, we got a complimentary tour of some of the important sights in Rome, and it was awesome. The only complaint we would have is that there seemed to be some noise through the walls in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria, Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: quiltenthusiast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful place for 3 nights in October 2006 and just loved it. The rooms were great, and the shower was the best one we've ever had in Italy! They even thought of clothes hooks in the bathroom, something often missing in hotels and even expensive B&Bs. It is a quiet haven from the noise of the streets and has beautiful outdoor eating and relaxing areas. Very picturesque! I think it was a monastery or convent. And, very important, they had meat, cheese, and EGGS for breakfast, not just bread, cereal, and cookies. We will stay there again for sure! Take your own facial tissues.....

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful and Enchanting Hideaway in such a busy city.”
Reviews.Author: ziggiestar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria made arrangements to have a car pick us up at the FCO airport and drive us directly to the hotel. Our driver was amazing and was able to thread the extremely narrow streets of Trastevere in a very wide Mercedes without a scratch. We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for 6 nights in September. After a warm welcome and easy check-in, we were escorted through the beautiful grounds to our room. When the door opened to our room we were really pleased with the wonderful accommodations. It was absolutely inviting and perfectly romantic. The hotel provided breakfast of scramble eggs, cheese, ham, cereal, fresh baked goods and fresh coffee in the dining room every morning for us to enjoy in the courtyard right outside our room. They also had bar service everyday to be enjoyed in the courtyard. Also located in the dining room was a computer with internet access free for hotel guests to use. Trastevere is the best place to be for night-life and great food in Rome. There are many restaurants, bars and little shops very close to the hotel. You can also reach many of the big touristy sights within an easy 30 minute walk max. Some places, like the Borghese Gallery, will take a bit longer, but the walk is nice. Rome is a very busy and crowded city, but Hotel Santa Maria is a perfect place to escape to with a glass of good wine in their courtyard at the end of everyday. For more of our personal photos from this great trip, please check out imageevent.com/mcintosh/italy.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PatsChat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in Sep 2006. It was our 20th wedding anniversary. This is a unique hotel. It is surrounded by other buildings but you hardly even notice. It is quite, clean and comfortable. No frills, no big reception area, no gym but who needs all that in Rome. You can eat outside under the orange trees. The Trastevere area is a great buzz and there are lots of lovely restaurants nearby. The staff are very helpful and make your stay even more enjoyable. Definitely would go back tomorrow with someone else (joke for my wife, sorry Deirdre).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Santa Maria in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: vadimos
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Santa Maria Hotel as a part of our honeymoon trip. The hotel is beautifully located in Trastevere - a bohemian neighborhood of Rome. It is very romantic with a beautiful terrace where we enjoyed a very nice breakfast every morning. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Take advantage of cash discount as the hotel is not cheap. We paid 250 euros minus 10% discount. They picked us up from the airport which I highly recommend doing because the hotel is hard to find and most taxis will only drop you off at the Santa Maria church. The hotel is a 1 min. walk from the church but you need to know exactly where to go. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location & character ! Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Consie
Reviews.Content: We were heading to Rome for first time away without our 18 month old baby. We wanted a romantic well located hotel and this hotel fitted the bill perfectly and the other reviews were pretty much spot on ! Trastevere is a busy area with a good vibe and loadsa nice restaurants. First nite we ate at a trattoria at an outside table on a narrow street with the local bus service passing within feet of our table ! Great experience. Loads of restaurants in the area, try to avoid the tourist traps though. Restaurant recommended by the hotel was the Taverna Trilussa (within 5 mins walk) and we weren't disappointed. Try the superb tasting menu for €65 per head, including a different wine with every course, a fantastic if eventually tipsy experience. Being used to overpriced restaurants in Dublin, this represented excellent value and was a real treat ! Another night we had a good meal including wine and 2 good courses each and one dessert for €40 all in !!!!!!! Unreal ! Hotel itself is well covered in other reviews. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice. Courtyard drinks in the early evening were a real treat, breakfast was fine, had all you need. We would thoroughly recommend getting hotel to book a transfer to direct form the airport for €55, as a normal taxi wouldn't have found it (even our driver was struggling with his mapat the end) and watching him manoeuvre his large merc around narrow streets and mopeds was entertaining to say the least ! Church of Santa Maria is 2 mins walk and is beautiful. Rest of Rome has so much to see and do we'd need a book to go through it. Don't miss St. Peters, Sistine Chapel, Colesseum and everything else ! Get there and book this hotel early if you're going. Its really well worth it and will make your stay all the more memorable. Well done Hotel Santa Maria !

Reviews.Title: “I'll return to Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: SusanMack
Reviews.Content: My mother, cousin and I stayed at the lovely Hotel Santa Maria in the Trastevere section of Rome. We loved the area - away from the noise and gas fumes of the city. It's nice to walk around night or day and there are several restaurants. You must see the Santa Maria church - it is just beautiful. You can walk over the bridge to the jewish ghetto which is also an interesting area. There is a laundromat nearby. Hotel Santa Maria is so charming, with a wonderful buffet breakfast (great cappochino) and pleasant, helpful staff. There was always someone in the office to open the electric entrance gate or call for a cab. They had a container filled with umbrellas (unfortunately, we needed them). There was internet service in the breakfast room, open for limited hours. Don't forget to pick up your 5 euro phone card (300 minutes!) from a tobacco shop to call home from your room. When the rain cleared we were able to eat our breakfast in the lovely courtyard outside. The rooms are all ground level - so nice to not wait for an elevator - with pretty wrought iron on the windows. The decor in our room was simple with lovely painted borders (this is a recently renovated ancient convent). Our room was of ample size (a triple), with a nice bathroom (great shower in tub) and both were immaculate. We felt safe and comfortable and had a very pleasant stay. I plan to return with my husband next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Crawfords
Reviews.Content: Date: 27 September 2006 Reviewer: Bruce & Wendy Crawford, Johannesburg, South Africa We spent 4 nights at Hotel Santa Maria at the end of June, completing a two week stay in Italy. We'd made a final selection of hotel from the review in Lonely Planet, reviews on Tripadvisor and the hotel's web site. It was a good choice in terms of the location in Trastevere as we never had far to go in the evenings when out looking for a restaurant. The vibe of the area added to the enjoyment. The fact that this smallish hotel is in a converted cloister with a pretty garden area literally does mean you can both escape the hustle after hours out siteseeing and relax in the shade for a while before the next onslaught out. We got to the point on our second and third day when we'd plan to get back around 4pm, take a break, relax with other guests and enjoy a cocktail (guest's expense) and snacks provided by the hotel, before heading out for the evening. In the heat of Rome in June this was welcome relief. The breakfast was great, with plenty of fresh fruit for those who don't want only breads, rolls and cakes. More than sufficient to sustain us for the day. The rooms aren't large but South Africans are used to that. Our bedroom and bathroom was quite adequate considering the little time we spent in it. Having aircon was essential. It was kept very clean as well. The staff are very friendly, speak pretty good English and help wherever possible. Just be aware that taxis cannot drive up to the entrance of the hotel as it is in a traffic restricted area and you may, like us, have to lug your luggage over the cobbles to one of the main streets to catch the taxi, tram or bus. Approximately a ten minute walk. Taxis are not always available when you need them as well due to high call rates, so we landed up having to walk, and catch a tram to the station on departure or risk missing our flight out. Trastevere may shock some initially. It does get very dirty, though streets are cleaned every morning, walls are full of graffiti, but this does add to the character of the area. We were there during the World Cup and Trastevere buzzed with locals and tourists alike in the evenings. We'd definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again should we ever be in Rome for a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rchittenden
Reviews.Content: Deliciously quiet oasis in a wonderful bustly area. Hotel staff extremely helpful. Senior suite was not quite as large as anticipated, but it did squeeze all 5 of us in fine (lucky a couple of us were slightly shorter than average for the mezzanine accommodation!) Took advantage of the pre-booked cab ride in from airport and back to airport. Possibly more expensive than if you hail one down but so so much easier. Easy to get to the main tourist sites in the day, either by bus or even by foot. But wonderful to come back to in the evening where you felt that you got away from the tourist spots. Hotel staff very helpful in recommending restaurants (even booking them for us). Have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel away from it all.....”
Reviews.Author: lglass8
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel away from the crazy streets of Rome. It was nice a quiet and it felt like you were in a different city. The hotel was very kind and helpful. We tripped our breakers the first night and they were helpful and kind getting them back on. The breakfast is good and the internet access was so wonderful. Everyone there knows English. We were a bit mislead thinking the happy hour included complimentary wine. This wasn't the case. They had complimentary appetizers, not wine. We paid £20 for 4 glasses of wine upon check out. No, big deal. Many say the streets outside were charming however, we disagree. They were dirty and had tons of grafetti which we read about. Seemed like the locals in the town were bothered with tourists. Make sure you dress semi nice for going to dinner. Jeans are fine with leather shoes and a nice sweater. Shorts are inappropriate and so are t shirts for dinner. We initially stayed in room 21 which was very nice. They had to transfer us the last night to the attic room which is room 22. We read about that room before coming and it is miserable. We did fine considering it was for one night but try to avoid it. The shower leaks all over your bathroom floor. You don't have enough towels to soak it all up. I can't believe they think this is a room they can sell. Also, we got cold the first two night and they brought us a floor heater which worked well. You can't control your own AC. Overall, we recommend this hotel and would stay again. I work for Marriott Hotels and I can be very picky with cleanliness. This hotel was spotless! Have fun! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “HIghtly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker-DC
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Excellent location- oasis of peace in a bustling city. Staff offer superb recommendations for local sightseeing and restaurants. Even booked dinner at last minute at local restaurant- getting a table in "booked out" restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: mfunsta
Reviews.Content: ...stayed at the Santa Maria for our honeymoon early September, first time in Rome and the Santa Maria did not disappoint... ..good points include location, location ,location; the hotel was literally seconds from the piazza d sant mar trastevere and all the sites were easily within a days return walk from the hotel. The courtyard was indeed an oasis of tranquillity during the day and the chilled spumante was ready for us when we arrived, good shower, friendly inobtrusive staff and excellent coffee.. ..not so good points, room was a little basic for a superior tho' clean and bright and twas a little noisy in the morning with main path access right outside the room (earplugs for a lie in).. handy hints; had a lovely (special pricey) meal at the Taverna Trilussa just around the corner (ask the staff), tho' 'spose most of Rome is just around the corner; no strappy tops for the ladies to get into St Peters Basilica and get to the Vatican Museum/Sistene Chapel after 14:30 to miss the crowds... and njoi, I throughly recommend Rome from this unique hotel

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of grace and elegance”
Reviews.Author: Orbetello
Reviews.Content: My family (parents, two teenagers) stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for four nights August 31-September 4. I can't say enough about this exceptional hotel. The place exudes an understated elegance, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and unfailingly helpful, the breakfast was delicious, and the later afternoon snack a delight. The setting is absolutely marvelous - only steps from the vibrant scene in Trastevere, yet the hotel itself is a refuge of tranquility, living up to its past as a monastery. Simply a perfect hotel in a perfect location. The only challenge was getting to the hotel by car - Trastevere is a maze of very narrow, often one-way streets.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: AJLCA
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in many hotels throughout Italy and being dissappointed we were thrilled with our stay at Santa Maria. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable ( a must after a 2 week bus tour!) With a huge bathroom complete with lovely hot shower we had a totally relaxed stay in Rome. The staff were exceptional with helping us with tours or anything that we needed. Breakfast in the courtyard was great, and after the first day our waiter remembered just how we liked our coffee and bought it to us without us having to ask. That is what I call great service. We will certainly stay at Santa Maria again and will recommend it to our friends. As an added bonus there is a laundromat with internet facilities just 10m from the front gate and several good eating spots within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: buranda1
Reviews.Content: Do stay here at the Hotel Santa Maria. Travestere is in such close proximity to all of the attractions that Rome has to offer but although busy, it's not as manic as other areas. In fact, strolling around the cobbled streets around Piazza Santa Maria is all part of the fun and charm. The hotel itself is well maintained and clean, the staff are very friendly and helpful – they reserved us some tables at some great restaurants, plus gave us maps and hints on how best to walk to all the sights. And it was a nice touch giving the guests a little buffet in the early evening, to be enjoyed with a glass of wine in their tranquil courtyard. If I was to return to Rome, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bust Rome”
Reviews.Author: Paynes
Reviews.Content: Was told about this place by a friend and we thought it was really nice. Staff helpfull, rooms clean and recomendations for food was good. Good location and easy to get to everywhere on foot

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Mark&Louise
Reviews.Content: The hotel Santa Maria has a lot going for it. Firstly, It is a little oasis of beauty in the bustling, but run down Trastevere area of Rome. (Having said that, most of Rome has a run down or rustic look to it). Secondly, the rooms are extremely clean and well maintained. Thirdly the breakfast buffet was excellent by any standard, but especially excellent by Italian standards! Lastly, the staff are extremely friendly and available 24 hours. A couple of nice extras are free internet access & an evening buffet for guests. The area is very central, with I'd say 20 + restaurants within a short 5 min walk. You just need to wander down a little 'off the beaten track' streets. The area is very lively at night, although this also attracts 'unsavoury characters' (beggers, drunks etc). The upside is that the hotel is very secure. I wouldnt have any reservations about safety. The santa Maria plaza is especially beautiful. The only downside being potential noise from other guests: All the rooms face a courtyard, where tables & chairs are available to guests to sit out and chat. We stayed 3 nights, 2 of which were fine. However, one night was particularly unpleasant as we were awakened several times due to loud chatting & laughing. One last thing to note is that the hotel is a bit difficult to find - It is on a very small & narrow street, but worth it once you get there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHLS
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent 2 nights in a junior suite at this lovely hotel and we can endorse the positive reviews left by others. If travelling from the airport by taxi, I suggest you arrange it through the hotel as it is cheaper. Also, as the small streets in Travestere can be a bit of a maze, the driver should be more likely to know exactly where the hotel is (ours didn't)! The suite was on 2 levels with 2 single beds on the groung floor and a double bed and bathroom upstairs. The upstairs room had a sloping ceiling so those over 6 foot tall need to watch their head. The suite was spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The buffet breakfast from 7.30 am was excellent and included in the price of the room. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Ponte Garibaldi where you can get a tram into the city centre close to the Pantheon (1 Euro). Alternatively it is a 15 minute walk to the Pantheon or approximately 30 minutes walk to St Peter's or the Colisseum. At the end of each day it was lovely to get away from the heat and the hustle and bustle of the city to this little oasis of calm. There are a number of restaurants and street markets in the evening within a 2 minute walk of the hotel . If/when we go back to Rome we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Loochipoochi
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Rome - we stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for 3 nights 23 - 26 August. We loved the location in Transtevere - really atmospheric, plenty of places to eat, and you are in the "real" Rome - not being run down by hoards of tourists. The hotel is quiet, clean, nice bathrooms, good showers, lovely helpful staff, and good value. You can park your car safely (subject to space) which is a godsend in central Rome. The breakfast is nice and the garden is a true oasis to return to after a hard day's sightseeing. Don't miss the church of Santa Maria in Transtevere itself, and exploring the area. Woud definitely stay here again. . Lucinda & Matthew, London UK

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: fecster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in mid-August as the last stop on our honeymoon. The room was pleasant with a good, modern bathroom (and very nice shower). It was really nice to be able to have breakfast in the courtyard each morning, and the breakfast buffet had a good range of food. The daytime staff in particular were very efficient; the evening staff a little less so (a couple of times there was no-one at reception but we never had to wait long). I was very pleased to be contacted by the hotel a few times by email before I arrived (to see if I wanted an airport pick-up, etc). We also took advantage of the free walking tour that they offered, and subsequently used the same tour company to visit the Vatican as they were very good. The area of Trastevere is nice, especially if you ignore the main tourist street with the dubious tourist restaurants (the one that leads almost all the way from the tourist information kiosk to the hotel). We particularly enjoyed drinks by the river (available in summer only perhaps?). It only took about 15 minutes to walk to the Foro Romano and maybe about the same to the Pantheon. I'd certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome who doesn't mind walking a bit. At 165 euros a night, with 10% less for paying cash (as we did), it was great value too I think. Ed (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Great Retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KiminDen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was as great as we expected after reading all of the positive reviews on this site! The only drawbacks that we experienced were: 1.) One group in our party had to move rooms after the first night. They spent the first night in a handicap-accessible room and the bathroom basically flooded after they took their morning showers. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and promptly moved them to another room with no problems. 2.) As previously posted many times, this hotel is not easily accessible by car! When we arrived, the taxi was "unable" to get us closer than about 2 blocks to the hotel. On other occassions when we called for taxis, they were able to come right in the gates to the property..... On the positive side there are many points: 1.) The breakfast and afternoon snacks were very good. The made to order coffee in the morning was fantastic, and having the bar there to serve cocktails in the afternoon was very convenient. 2.) The staff was very friendly and helpful. 3.) The rooms were spacious, well appointed, very clean, and comfortable. 4.) Internet access was a plus for keeping touch with home. 5.) The Trastevere area is very charming and has a great selection of restaurants for dinner. We would definitely consider staying at the Santa Maria again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: PMcK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is an excellent base from which to explore Rome. We stayed at the hotel with our two children (aged 6 and 3) and the accomodation was ideal - a family room with separate sleeping areas and bunk beds, which the kids loved. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well decorated and well equipped with TVs, hairdryers etc. The hotel grounds are great, very quiet with lots of greenery - quite a contrast to the narrow streets of the Trastevere. The Trastevere area was spot on - most attractions were in walking distance or could be reached via a short taxi ride and there were plenty of local bars and restaurants for the evenings. We arranged an airport transfer through the hotel so had no problems in getting there - the streets of Trastevere are tricky to navigate by car but the local taxi drivers don't seem to be lacking confidence! Best advice when on foot would be to take a map as the area is like a maze. The hotel represents excellent value for money and we will definitely stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Mansard room if you are tall”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel before, and had enjoyed it. This time we were travelling with our 16 year old son, so booked the Mansard room, which had a bed at ground level and another on a mezzanine. The bathroom was also on the mezzanine. My husband is just under 6 feet and could not stand up in our bedroom and none of us could stand in the shower. The A/C upstairs was the noisiest I have ever encountered. Our bags were lost in Rome and in the half hour we took to report them missing, the limo we had booked through the hotel had gone- if he had ever been there. We had phoned to let them know what was happening but no-one was interested. This left us vulnerable to Roman taxi drivers, who charged us 85 euros for the journey, and dropped us some distance from the hotel. As we had been before we found it, but would have struggled otherwise. We are usually fairly streetwise and manage to negotiate reasonable taxi fares in such places as Delhi and Bangkok, but were caught off guard in this apparently well ordered city. We had no bags for 48 hours, not the hotel's fault, but no-one really interested in helping. I think a large impersonal hotel might have managed to find us a toothbrush. All shops in Rome closed on Sunday so we could not buy anything.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little Oasis in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie35
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Santa Maria Hotel for three nights and had a great time. The location is perfect near many great restaurants and small shops all at walking distance. The only thing that we were a bit unhappy about is the fact that the site say's Internet wireless connection and that unfortunately is not true. They have one computer in the bar area for all 20 rooms to share. Beside's that it was one of the nicest places we had stayed at and the staff were extremely friendly. Thanks for a wonderful time. Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Oasis”
Reviews.Author: inezworld
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria was truly a wonderful tranquil Oasis. Rome can be nosy and hectic, but once we stepped into the gated property of the hotel we felt we had escaped. The staff was always attentive and helpful. Chiara gave us a great restaurant recommendation! The meals they provided were more than sufficient and we really enjoyed taking our breakfasts in the Orange Tree Courtyard. We also enjoyed being in this area called the Trastevere. It kind of reminded me of Silver Lake in Los Angeles, kind of artsy bohemian. Definetely would recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing oasis in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Sydney48
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I had a marvellous time here - the property is truly charming, the staff are excellent and helpful and the food is exceptional, from the free drink snacks to the buffet breakfast. We are already recommending this hotel to everyone we know!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay !”
Reviews.Author: Hibee70
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Santa Maria based on these reviews, and I can safely say I wasn't disappointed. We stayed in a juinior suite, which had ample room for all 4 of us. The courtyard makes a splendid setting for breakfast, and you actually feel relaxed prior to hitting the sites. I would recomend this hotel, and will stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the reviewers said it was!”
Reviews.Author: Duff1052
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews, they seemed genuine but I was still skeptical. I shouldn't have been. It was everything people said it was and more. I travelled with my whole family (9) in all (18 to 56 years). They all loved the hotel. Forget about the bells you have to be trying to hear them to notice. Yes there is graffiti, (not uncommon in big cities) but it also seems to be a long standing Roman custom. The service and the staff were all very nice and very helpful. The morning breakfast was great with a wide assortment that changed each morning. The afternoon snacks also were great and varied and the orange tree-filled courtyard is a perfect place to lauch your day or share thoughts before strolling off to dinner. The rooms were bright, clean, and cheery, and surprisingly roomy. The area is Bohemian in nature and near to almost every site in Rome. If you are from New York I found it similiar to 'The Village' or 'Soho'. A lot of places to eat, drink, and visit right in area arounfd the hotel. Book your stay with piece of mind, you and your family will enjoy yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chavanne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was recommended to us by Backroads Bicycle Tours. They didn't steer us wrong! Everything about the stay was great. We enjoyed our courtyard breakfasts and afternoon appetizers. Our rooms were spotless, and a cool relief from the heat of Roman summer. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequent6O9traveller
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent two days at Santa Maria as part of our one-week trip to Italy. Yes, it is a good hotel as most of other reviewers refer, but you need to preliminary know several important factors should you try to book this hotel. -The hotel is located in the heart of Trastevere, which makes it relatively difficult to get (find) the site due to narrow and labyrinthine streets in the district. -The subway stations are far away from the hotel (this also is due to relatively poorer subway network in Rome). -The nearest Trenitalia station (maybe Ostiense or Trastevere) also is not accessible on foot. -The nearest Tram station (#8, Piazza Balli) is more or less five minutes a pied from the hotel. -A guest is requested to go to Piazza Santa Maria, one minute from the hotel, just to take a taxi (in short, you can not take a taxi directly in front of the hotel), which may matter in case you have your heavy suitcases with you (even though a driver may help you). -The bicycles are not well maintained. Again, I think this is a good hotel. I just have identified these factors in order to balance the evaluation.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneJS
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a peaceful oasis, with a lovely courtyard garden. The rooms have thoughtful touches to make your stay more pleasant, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is excellent and plentiful, and there is a bar for pre dinner drinks. My only wish would be that there was an iron available for a quick press of those crushed suitcase clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: mjeeps
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip advisor and it was everything as described. It was actually even better than that. The neighborhood is great and once you are back from a long day of sight seeing, you need to go only a few steps for a nice dinner and evening stroll. We took the advice of Antonio and his staff and never had a bad meal. We also took his advice on a few tours which were worth it. We could not have navigated through the Vatican on our own and gotten as much out of it. The appetizers and breakfast were delicious. The courtyard is a nice place to rest, relax and chat with fellow travelers. You definately feel that the staff is there to make sure you have a great time, and arrange things so that there is no stress. Have not had such a nice time at a hotel EVER! Also, we had another family with us. The husband was very impressed and said that he usually doesn't pay much attention to his hotel or accomodations, but he couldn't believe how much he liked this place! I would reccomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ein romantisches, zentral gelegenes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wir haben uns in dem kleinen und feinen Hotel sehr wohl gefühlt. Es ist alles sehr gepflegt, der Außenbereich hübsch angelegt und nach ausgiebigen sight-seeing Touren ein erholsames Fleckchen - eine Oase mitten in der Stadt. Es ist alles sehr sauber, das Frühstück ist abwechslungsreich und uns hat es da an nichts gefehlt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis”
Reviews.Author: SeppD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was an excellant oasis in the middle of a great neighborhood. My wife and I travel with my 18 yr old college student. After a long day of emersing ourselves in Rome it was great to come back a relax in the courtyard for a little wine and cheese. We had the triple room. I was expecting something a little bigger but it suited us just fine. The room was very clean and the staff was very attentive. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yellowbgt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome for our honeymoon and we were more then impressed with Hotel Santa Maria. My review is probably about the same as most of the reviews about this terrific hotel. We had a misconnect on our way to Rome, which caused us to miss our first day in Rome. I contacted the hotel and they explained their cancellation policy meant that since we were within 3 days of staying, that we would usually have to pay for the entire first night, but they were very understanding and they were able to book the room for that night and not charge us. We arrived early the next morning, before check-in, and our room was not ready yet. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we started our tours of Rome, and they brought the luggage to our room and left us some champagne and some of their pastry treats since it was our honeymoon. The breakfast in the morning is very good, and it's very important in Rome to have a good meal in the morning, because you will burn it off rather quickly. It didn't rain once, so we enjoyed our breakfasts in the courtyard every morning. The bells from the church of Santa Maria were very pleasant to listen to, and they are not as loud as some people advertise. Our room was of exceptional size for 2 people. Large bed, a desk, night stands. Flat screen TV hanging on the wall to maximize space. The bathroom is very spacious, with plenty of room to move around. The shower/bath are exceptional. The one giant advantage of this hotel is its proximity to Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, which was always bustling with activity every night. There are excellent restaurants that were recommended by the hotel staff, that are short walks from the hotel. Just stay away from the restaurants in the piazza. They are rather pricy compared to some on the side streets. I booked this hotel by reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and I advise those who are looking for a great place to stay and for a great price compared to the rest of Rome, to believe all of the good reviews that are written here and experience the greatness of Hotel Santa Maria. If we make it back to Rome, this will be our first choice. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect place to land”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was perfect for a mom/daughter trip. It was most helpful to the hotel's recommended driver to pick us up at the Rome airport and deposit us in relaxing (and confusing) Trastevere. The hotel staff was very helpful to oriente us to the city, give us walking maps each day to help us get where we wanted to go, and recommend local dining options. We we were able to walk everywhere in Rome from our hotel. Definitely the best neighorhood in Rome to stay in. Within 10 minutes of our early morning arrival (prior to check-in) we had dropped our bags, headed off into Trastevere, and were immersed in the charming neighborhood--able to wander back to the hotel for noon checkin. The hotel is quiet, the rooms spacious and clean, the breakfast is very nice and the free internet made it a great place to start our Italian vacation from. There was a 10% discount for payment in euros and this was easy to do given the proximity of ATM's. My stay here was the most expensive of all the hotels we chose for our vacation, and I was pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location in Trastevere; excellent staff very willing to help; the property and rooms were impeccably kept; 10% discount for payment in cash; great breakfast ~ would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: mamapeach61
Reviews.Content: What an adventure, from start to finish!!! This was our first vacation without children since our honeymoon 22 years ago. For anyone who wants to go to Rome but keeps making excuses, stop making them and go (and stay at this hotel)!!!! You will not regret it. We stayed here from June 5th-17th and loved every minute of it. We found the workers at the hotel to be friendly, helpful and accommodating. At no time did we feel as though they were rude or felt bothered. Breakfast was wonderful and the antipasti in the late afternoon was a nice touch to tide you over before dinner. The driver that we arranged through the hotel picked us up at the airport and drove us directly to the hotel through the streets of the city and we had a view of the Forum even before we got to the hotel. We were amazed at the narrowness of the streets and his ability to navigate them. The weather was wonderful (low 80's and sunny) and it only rained once late in the afternoon on the first day we got there, but it only seemed to make the courtyard of the hotel more beautiful (with the rain dripping from the orange trees). I thought the room was very spacious and immaculate. It felt very comfortable and like home. The only suggestion I would have for others who are used to using washcloths is to bring a couple of your own. The bells of the church are no problem at all and they do not keep you awake. We heard them the first few days just because the sound was new to us, but it was not bothersome at all. Others that complained of this in the past must have been staying at a different hotel or sleeping outdoors. Rome is busy and we walked everywhere, but we never had any trouble at all with traffic or motorcycles. Compared to any other major city we have here in America, I thought motor traffic was very courteous to pedestrians crossing streets. They just seem to take it all in stride. The food!!!! Pastry, gelato, pannini, pasta, risotto, carbonara, chick pea soup, shaved beef with rocket, the fruit markets........... I don't think we had one bad thing to eat the whole time we were there. Try eating at Augusto's that was recommended by the hotel. We also ate at Casetta(?) de Trastevere and Cilin (Chinese restaurant) in the neighborhood. All were wonderful. Drink the local wines - if you get headaches from red wine, you won't here. I don't think it has the sulphites that usually bring on the next-day headaches. Wear comfortable shoes to protect your arches!!!!! My feet were hurting by the end of the vacation. We took trains, subways, taxis and buses - transportation is very well organized and people were willing to help if you are confused. Recommend asking the fare if you come in to Termini Station and going back to the hotel - there was one driver who wanted to charge E35 (typically we paid between E8-11). We refused him and walked back to the hotel - a long walk but so much to see on the way back. If you still want to ride, just refuse them - the rate will usually go down or you can wait for another driver. If you need to make International calls back to the States, the Eurocard was the best. E5 for 200 minutes and very easy to use. A gret value and you can buy them at any Tobacco shop. We took the train to Venice for 2 days and returned at about dinner time on the third. The hotel we stayed at there was a four-star and was not as spacious. We thought the Hotel Santa Maria had more character and offered a much better value. We loved our time there, sorry to have had it all end so fast - but we're also glad to be back home with the kids. Thanks to the Hotel Santa Maria - we had a wonderful time!!!! We will have fabulous memories of Rome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria was highly recommended by a co-worker and lived up to all of her rave reviews. We loved the beauty, tranquility, friendliness of staff, complimentary walking tour of Rome and especially the scrambled eggs at breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Threads
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Santa Maria for 4 nights and what a perfect choice of accommodation it was. The hotel itself was an absolute haven with lovely rooms that were spotless, extremely helpful staff and a fabulous courtyard where breakfast was eaten (the breakfasts are great) and in the afternoons it was the perfect spot to sip something from the bar and nibble on their fantastic antipasto (which came with your drinks). The neighbourhood of Trastavere was fascinating and such fun to explore (and get lost in) with the little alleyways full of interesting shops and great places to eat. Although it is a busy, vibrant neighbourhood the Hotel Santa Maria was an oasis of peace and calm and once inside the only sound was the church bell. This was very pleasant and charming and at no time disturbed our sleep. The hotel is within walking distance to everything you might want to visit, no matter which side of the river. We walked everywhere and at no time bothered with a taxi or bus. The place is difficult to find so clear directions are a good idea before arrival. However once there it is no problem to find your way around. Would we stay there again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, comfortable oasis.”
Reviews.Author: regul8ed
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an oasis of quiet in a city that can seem much too noisy and crowded. It is only two blocks off the main square in Trastevere, which can be VERY crowded on weekend nights, but the hotel is as peaceful as anyone could ask for. The mansard suites are very nice; roomy, with a downstairs sitting room which is great if (as happened with us) one of us couldn't sleep after the flight from the US. The staff is helpful and the breakfast is plentiful. The only down side is that the hotel is far enough away from the central downtown area that we didn't feel like crossing the river again to see more sights after dinner. However, we were happy to collapse into bed at 10 PM anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the heart of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very peaceful hotel in the heart of the wonderfully bustling Trastevere. After touring the city of Rome or dining and celebrating in the Trastevere, it is great to come back to the hotel for peace and tranquility. The accomodations are very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful with tours and recommendations for dining. The breakfast included with the room was the best we had in Italy. Breakfast is served in a beautiful dining room in cooler weather or in the garden in warmer weather. The garden is a very nice and a welcome place to rest with a glass of wine in the late afternoon. Internet access is provided free; no need for an internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET OASIS”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie12_12
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the hotel in May which we selected as a result of the postive reviews on this website. We are delighted to confirm that it lived up to its fabulous reputation! Having a sunny courtyard in which to enjoy the daily scumptious breakfast and fantastic antipasti were a real bonus and provided a wonderful start and end to each day. The staff were delightful and the room though not large was immaculately clean and comfortable. We booked the walking tours that are available through the hotel and they were excellent value and gave us an amazing insight into the history of Rome. As we live in Australia it may be some time before we return, but we will definitely be coming back to the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria is a Superb Hotel, punching well above its weight for a three star. Perfect location walked everwhere, including the Vatican which was a leisurely 30 minute stroll along the banks of the river Tiber. We enjoyed the comforts of room 22 (Suite Junior) This was two rooms seperated by an ensuite bathroom. The kids had a bunk bed and we had the privacy of our own room. The hotel was kind enough to lay on anti-pasti dishes every evening which we enjoyed with a bottle of the local wine in their lovely gardens. The staff were very friendly and their restaurant recommendations were spot on. All in all a great place to stay when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs way up.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria does a very professional job taking care of you and will make your stay wonderful. It is an quiet island within a very hip and very busy local area. All good. Eric

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SpanishRootsToo
Reviews.Content: Spent our first 3 nights in Italy at the Santa Maria and found the Trip Advisor reviews and pictures to be accurate. This is a charming, small hotel in a very convenient neighborhood of Rome. Rooms were very clean and the staff especially friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying away from the more crowded, tourist areas. The hotel is a little tricky to find, due to the narrow, alleylike streets, but the hotel will arrange drivers or cabs for you, and when returning, we just told the cab to drop us off in the Piazza Santa Maria and walked around the corner to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great tranquil hotel in heart of bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: tofufingers
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here and loved everything about it. Trastevere is a beautiful italian neighborhood and one i would have missed out on completely had i not stayed in this hotel. Breakfast out in the courtyard was wonderful. Enjoyed watching the local cats frolic around every morning as well! Rome is a beautiful but bustling city. This was the perfect place to stay for a piece of tranquility amidst the madness.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Were Right!”
Reviews.Author: SCCanuck
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews on this site. We can only add to the positive reviews about the hotel based on our stay in early May. While not our first trip to Rome, this was our first stay in Trastevere. The area was great (once you get past the grafitti!, which unfortunately is not confined to Trastavere), with a local flavor, great restaurants everywhere and live entertainment (street variety) nightly in Piazza Santa Maria to pass the time after dinner. Some attractions within walking distance and all within 8 Euro cab ride. The staff was pleasant and helpful, arranging airport and other transportation and providing information. We had our two children with us so we needed the space of the suite. The room was clean, spacious and modern: room was made up promptly and all necessary amenities provided and replenished. The staff was also accomodating in extending our check out time. The continental breakfast was excellent and the courtyard/wine selection was a welcome relief at the end of a busy day. Hopefully another Rome stay is in our near future and the Santa Maria and Trastavere will definitely be in the plan. Previous reviewers, thanks for the tip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a fantastic hotel to stay at this is it! In the heart of Trastevere, Rome a wonderful bed and breakfast. The rooms were excellant and the service excellant I can't say enough about it. Thanks Hotel Santa Maria!!!!!!!! Ciao Bella

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While we were there only one night, it was such a lovely hotel, a peaceful setting and a central enough location that we promised each other we'll stay there the next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful place”
Reviews.Author: koleli
Reviews.Content: A place perfectly situated some few steps from Santa Maria in Trastevere. An old convent transformed to a small hotel. Very nice staff giving you excellent service. The court yard was magnificent. Be aware that you have to book this place 6 months ahead! Only 18 rooms. E.Kolsaker - Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A quiet and relaxing spot just a block or two from all the activity of Trastevere in Rome. They have probably the best breakfast you will find anywhere in Italy. The staff was very willing to provide whatever support was requested (e.g., restaurant recommendations and reservations, local commuting advice). We stayed there two years ago and arranged the exact time of our visit to Rome to match available dates at the Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! Rome was our first stop on our honeymoon. The Hotel Santa Maria has excellent rooms, service and breakfast. Not to mention the beautiful private courtyard you can enjoy anytime of the day. Very conveinent to all sites in Rome. Trastevere is an excellent location to stay while in Rome. I would recommend you stay at the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Maria in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed this charming small quiet hotel in an old neighborhood. It was impeccably clean, and the staff were extremely helpful in all respects. Eating breakfast outside in the sun was a pleasure. The local restaurants were stupendous. Our only criticism was that we found the mattresses hard, but others may like them that way. We intend to return there whenever Iwego to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To fully appreciate Santa Maria Hotel just spend a day in Rome. Not only will you have a noisy, hectic, crowded, absolutly great day (Rome is probably the best western European town to tour nowadays) but comes night time, you'll find yourself in a peaceful, tranquil haven, right in the middle of the fashionable Trastevere neighbourhood. Spent 2 nights at Santa Maria, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A heavenly oasis”
Reviews.Author: mtmf
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 2 days in Hotel Santa Maria this May and were extremely pleased with this charming hotel. The staff are superb and helpful and anticipated questions before they were asked. The breakfast in the courtyard was delighful and delicious. We were able to walk to all major attractions and found great restaurants and even some nightlife right in the area. Best of all was the serenity of the courtyard and a glass of wine after a day filled with the noise and crowds of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “oasis”
Reviews.Author: acmes
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria is a unique hotel--especially for the neighborhood and perhaps all of Rome. Once you're within its walls you might as well be in a tiny Tuscan village. Trastevere can be very busy on weekends and the Hotel Santa Maria provides a welcome respite. SItting in the courtyard is lovely and it's worth returning home early to enjoy a cocktail and antipasti under the trees. The staff is always ready to help. THe breakfast was one of the best I've had in Italy (eggs!) gorgeous fruit tarts. Due to it's former life as a convent the rooms are all unique. Our suite had generous proportions. Sleeping areas are set apart from each other but do not have privacy door. We found it very quiet. To be honest, I was nervous after reading some of the reviews here about the church bells. I'm a light sleeper and I have to say they had no impact at all. Even with a window open I found them very faint and pleasant--nothing more than you'd find a small Italian village. Perhaps there are some rooms that are located closer to them but I find it hard to imagine. The neighborhood itself can be very busy with tourists on a weekend. Have the hotel speak to your cab-driver on the phone before trying to find the place--it's really out of the way, but worth searching out.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: robpco
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Santa Maria! It was a great place to come back to at the end of long days exploring the city. The beds were comfortable, the courtyard was relaxing and the service was top-notch. Breakfast was good and hotel location was perfect. My only complaint was that they only have one computer and it doesn't become available until around noon.

Reviews.Title: “Mind your head”
Reviews.Author: 112610e
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, but be aware of it's limitations: 1. hard to get a cab to come there due to narrow street (the staff couldn't get anyone to come and we ended up hauling our luggage around the neighborhood until we could chase down a cab) 2. Room #22 is just a converted attic with no windows, low ceilings and poor ventilation- very hot at night, even in April. 3. The odd design of the shower leads to floor flooding if you are not careful 4. Be very careful to reconfirm your reservation- they lost all of the emails I sent.

Reviews.Title: “Special occasion, Special place!”
Reviews.Author: N_IrelandNomad
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research and deliberation, and thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked Hotel Santa Maria to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary. We usually stay in 4* establishments on city breaks but wanted to stay somewhere with character for this special occasion. We were worried that it would not live up to expectations but these worries were unfounded. The character and charm do not come across in the photos, it was really special, a perfect setting for any break in Rome and we preferred it to any of the anonymous 4* hotels we have stayed in Barcelona, Prague and Amsterdam. As you walk through the gates a peacefulness descends, the courtyard is delightful, the breakfast and afternoon snacks excellent, the staff very pleaseant and helpful, the rooms perfect, but overall the ambience is what made it special. The location is perfect, within walking distance to all tourist sites, yet at night when you don't want to walk anymore, Traestevere comes to life with excellent restaurants at every turn of the cobbled, narrow streets. One very special restaurant was 'La Trilussi', which we would highly recommend, their award winning ravioli was delicious and the atmosphere was fantastic, full of local italians. 'Il Duca' was also very good, excellent lasagne and very good value. Loved the 'No Smoking' policy in hotel and restaurants. This was an excellent base from which to explore an amazing city. 'Maximus' Tours gave us excellent guided tours of the Colisseum and Roman Forum, so much so that we went with them next day for their vatican tour, both well worth it , we would have missed so much without them. We have really special happy memories of the whole trip, from we were collected at the airport by a taxi arranged by the hotel, right down to our taxi drive back to the airport, where Fabrizio gave us a guided tour and commentary right to the airport, via the Appian Way. We cannot recommend this hotel enough! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful oasis in a very central location. We travelled for the first time with our 6 month old boy and stayed at Hotel Santa Maria. The room was clean, comfortable and airy (with a cot provided for us). The public areas were extremely peaceful and pleasant, with the outside areas smelling of orange blosom. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and we shall definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Beware the low ceilings”
Reviews.Author: freqflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location. A quiet oasis in a busy city. Close to everything. Breakfasts were good. The front desk was really helpful especially with directions, meal reservations and taxis. However we stayed in the Mansard Suite and the ceilings are really low. It really is just a converted attic, so it has no windows, just skylights. This 2 bedroom suite has one shower. and the ceilings are REALLY low.
