We each bumped our heads a few times getting in and out of bed or on the sofa. It is a little claustrophobic. The rest of the hotel does not have this problem and I would not stay in this suite again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: StarkX
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the negative comments about this hotel. Sure the area is a little marred by the large amount of graffiti on the walls but travelling around rome you quickly see that this particular social blight is everywhere so to use the local 'decoration' as a reason to complain against a hotel is a bit beyond the pale. Having booked the hotel for my honeymoon I think you can appreciate that i was looking for perfection, We elected to have the hotel arrange a driver to pick us up from the airport. Dressed in a suit, and driving a mercedes. more importantly it took the stress out of arriving in a country as we were delivered to the hotel in a timely fashion. The breakfasts were more than adequate, rolls, ham, cheese, cereal, croissants and other pastries, yoghurts fruit juices, scrambled egg and a choice of what coffee you wanted ( rather than a jug of stewing filter coffee) and it was lovely to sit out in the courtyard eating breakfast. the staff were all very polite, spoke excellent english, and were happy to suggest restaurants or tours which might be of interest. The rooms ( we had a double ) were all clean with aircon, tv, and phone as well as a nicely appointed ensuite bathroom. Despite trastavere being a busy area for nightlife it never interfered with our sleep as in the hotel santa maria you are always a little cloistered away from the outside world. The day we left we asked for a taxi to be arranged to take us to the station. The taxi was there, on time, and got us to the station with litle delay. It was little things like this which really made us appreciate this hotel. All in all, when we go back to rome we will be staying here. I cant recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. It was clean and comfortable, the staff very helpful. Breakfast was lovely, plenty of everything, ideal for big appetites! Very quiet, the only sound was nearby church bells, despite the nearness of a busy main road. Easy to walk to all the sights in the city from this hotel. Hotel organised a complimentary tour around the heart of Rome which was excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely use it again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position great holiday”
Reviews.Author: specs11a
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of reviews on this site. It is in a wonderful position for all the sites and resturants. We did have a problem with the low ceilings and have a few bumps to prove it. The shower over the bath worked well but flooded the floor however careful we were. The breakfast was good,the coffee excellent and staff helpful so on balance we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: TroisAteliers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this great little hotel tucked away in a narrow street in the characterful and bustling Trastavere district. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby, and within walking distance of all the main tourist sites. It is a cool oasis to return to for drinks in the garden courtyard in the early evening where complimentary snacks are provided. Our room was off the courtyard, clean and neat with a very nice bathroom. Staff are very helpful and will recommend/book restaurants, taxis etc. Internet access is provided free. Breakfast will set you up for the day. We loved it and will always stay here when in Rome. This is a quiet hotel - not for noisy late night drinkers though you can do that round the corner in the Piazza. Don't be put off by graffiti on the narrow streets of Trastavere - its just Rome.

Reviews.Title: “NN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A real quiet spot in busy Trastevere where you can take your breakfast under blues sky - if it is not too frozy. Breakfast really excellent and the rooms are small but very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “extreme low ceiling heights”
Reviews.Author: truport
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of some rooms having low ceiling heights, we wrote a letter advising them of my husbands height of 6'2" and requested a room for our family of four. We were told the Mansard Suite would accomadate us just fine. The ceiling was approximately 3 feet high at the walls. The doors could not be entered without ducking, there were no windows in the room, there were a few small skylights in the ceiling, over all the room was very claustrophobic and cave-like. Please see attached photos. The cost of the room was almost 400.00 US dollars per night. The employees were extremely polite and friendly. The neighborhood was wonderful, the room was kept spotlessly clean and the breakfast was better than average. The cappuccino was exceptional. In the afternoons the hors d'oeuvres were a very nice treat. In closing the room was horrible and the whole family dreaded sleeping there each night, so be sure and know what room you will be staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is very attentive and most helpful in every way. Plus, it is out of the main tourist area and very quiet at night unlike the hotels in the downtown area. The accommodations are excellent. I would never stay any where else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Apulia1908
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is a beautiful small hotel in a great location. The staff members were helpful. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality unlmited”
Reviews.Author: AuburnTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria five nights in March 2006. The staff is very helpful and always looks for ways to make your stay more enjoyable. They arranged airport pickup and a great Vatican tour. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfasts were wonderful. The location is great--removed somewhat from the hustle and bustle of tourist sites but within easy walking distance of everything. We would highly recommend the Santa Maria to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria - excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria for a long weekend with friends. When we missed our connecting flight to Rome, the hotel were extremely understanding, rearranged our airport transfer and when we finally arrived could not have been more helpful. A wonderful cot was made up for our baby, who was also made to feel very welcome. Breakfast was fantastic, and to get antipasti in the bar in the evening - wow! This was our third visit to Rome, and Hotel Santa Maria was definitely the best hotel we have stayed in. I hope we will be able to return many times to sample their incredible hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City...”
Reviews.Author: sbroad
Reviews.Content: A charming oasis in the middle of a bustling city. Hotel Santa Maria is immaculate and in a very convenient location. We walked to the Vatican and the Colosseum. Easy access to the other side of the Tiber as well. The staff was cordial and helpful. We hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria for four nights and it was wonderful. The large room with loft easily accomodated us and our three children. Antonio at the front desk went way beyond the call of duty helping me to activate my Italian cell phone, as well as making recommendations for day trips/tours. Breakfast was lovely, and bathroom was both spacious and spotless. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wont get better for the price”
Reviews.Author: ENGLISH EXPAT
Reviews.Content: English expatriates living in the USA my husband and I stayed at the Santa Maria for 3 nights we got back from Europe only yesterday and felt should write and let your readers know that this hotel is a gem. Great location, can walk virtually anywhere in Rome, quiet position in a very lively area. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Rooms very small, but fine because we spent nearly all our time seeing incredible sights. They are spotlessly clean, and have everything you need. If you want to visit, book early, they have only a small no. of rooms, and they were turning down business when we were there. If you dont need luxury we highly recommend this as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in February for 3 nights and we had a magical time. It was our first visit to Rome but certainly not our last ( we made sure we threw some money in the Trevi fountain!). We stayed with our 2 daughters aged 10 and 8 and the family room we had was excellent. The lounge had 2 single beds as well as a bedside table, a desk and another little table. We still had plenty of space to move around. The television was a flat screen mounted on the wall so took no place at all. The bedroom was spacious with a wardrobe with a safe and a chest of drawers with a minibar. The bathroom was fine. The service was very good; everything was clean and changed everyday and all the staff were very helpful. The breakfast was excellent and there was plenty of it. It is served in a gorgeous room with lovely beams on the ceiling and in the evenings it becomes a lovely place to enjoy a quiet drink or a read with a few free antipasti. There are also games and a computer which our girls spent a lot of time on. It rained most of the time during our stay but it did not spoiled anything because the city is so wonderful and also because the hotel seems to have an endless supply of umbrellas !. The highlight of our stay was the Vatican where we saw the Pope during his Wednesday blessing in St Peter' s Basilica. We never had to walk more than 5 minutes from the hotel to find a great restaurant. The staff recommended several restaurants which were all gorgeous. The hotel is in a great location because the Trastevere is made of narrow cobbled streets near the Tiber river and you can walk to all the major sites in 30 minutes or less.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy - our last night was spent at the Hotel Santa Maria. It is a lovely oasis of a hotel in the midst of a gritty area. I spent many many hours reading reviews of hotels before making a selection for our last night. This hotel lived up to all of the reviews. The breakfast was spectacular and the room newly remodeled. Four of us stayed in room 21 - with a loft area to accomodate two people and a double bed on the main level. Frankly the room was large enough to be comfortable for 6 people if another double bed was set up. Since it was March the air was a little chilly so we did not sit outside but the courtyard is just as the pictures posted by others show. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “everything i'd hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: fekq
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a birthday treat for my boyfriend, and it was just what we needed. the rooms are elegant yet cosy, with flat screen tv, bathtubs, minibar and yet traditional in style. The blackout linings in the curtains mean you get a truly dark room, and the cloister walls mean it's so quiet that we slept in til 11am! The staff were the most helpful we've ever come across - and polite even when we came back at 1.30am! (There are some great bars and restaurants in the streets around the hotel! Try Cassetta (sp?) di Trastevere literally round the corner. Checked table cloths, friendly staff and good-value but delicious food) Breakfast was top quality, served by a friendly waiter in the lovely dining room which doubles as a bar and "afternoon nibbles" area. Would definitely come back here, and will recommend it to all our friends and colleagues. It would be great to come late spring/early summer to be able to enjoy sitting out in the pretty courtyards. I wouldn't try to drive here, as the streets are very, very narrow and twisty - but the driver the hotel booked for us was prompt, polite and friendly. Definitely worth the 55 euros. The hotel do have bikes you can borrow to get around on, but we found it easy to walk from the hotel to the Coliseum, Vatican (go along the river) and to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: HeatherGermany
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome. We chose the Santa Maria based on the reviews of previous posters and we are very happy that we did! This hotel is in an ideal spot for a short stay in a city like Rome - within walking distance (20-30 mins) of the main sites, in a quiet spot with a relaxing atmosphere and near local restaurants. As previous posters have said, the staff were very helpful, particularly with restaurant recommendations. We ate where the Italians eat and everything was delicious! The breakfasts offer a very wide range of food (unless you are looking for full English). The hotel rooms open onto central patios and one night we were disturbed by other guests who were sitting there, but on the whole the hotel is quiet. (The church bells didn't bother us.) We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: hanabana
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a romantic weekend in Rome. We selected this hotel from TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The rooms were clean, warm and spacious. I liked the way they were arranged around courtyards full of orange trees. A quiet little haven with only the sound of church bells ringing through in the morning. Breakfasts were delicious with good coffee, and staff couldn't have been more helpful in arranging taxis, and recommending eateries. It was good to be able to walk back after sightseeing to the Trastevere district where the hotel is. The cobbled streets and many little family run bars and restaurants which come alive in the evening, enabled you to relax knowing you didn't have too far to collapse back to your room later. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel Santa Maria after staying there last March. Again we had a very pleasant stay and it is a joy to return to the hotel after a day's sightseeing. Despite the graffiti, Trastavere is a very charming/atmospheric area with a great choice of very reasonably priced quality restaurants. I highly recommend the taxi service from the airport - we arrived late at night and how the driver managed to negotiate the narrow roads and throngs of people in Trastavere is a mystery!!! In summary do not be put off by negative comments about Trastavere, unless of course you like your life sterile and ordered!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not without faults”
Reviews.Author: towsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria for 3 nights across New Year 2005. The courtyards were lovely and we felt we did not see it at its best during the winter. I would definitely recommend this to friends, on the basis of the price and location (it was a nightmare to find at first but once you got your bearings it was well situated). However, our stay was not without a couple of issues. The rooms were small. There was no hot water in the shower on night one and we had difficulty in extracting the truth of the situation from reception - they said it was fixed, it clearly wasn't and so on. We also had a crossed wire over taxis - we wanted to book a taxi in advance to take us to the Vatican very early the next morning. As it was, when we called at alloted time to see where it was, we were told then that advance bookings were not possible and we had to go to reception and wait for the first available car. When you get to Rome and see the size of the queue for the Vatican, you will understand that every minute counts and this minor set back was in fact very frustrating. Having said all this, our stay overall was good. Free cava and buffet on NYE were very well received but I didn't feel this place was somewhere to fawn over quite so much as other reviews have done.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect setting to start your visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So great to arrive (after fairly long walk from train station) at such a lovely retreat. Really pretty & traditional, with friendly staff & charming room - with spriral staircase to mezzanine level! Shower powerful & bath nice & deep; good attention to detail everywhere. Overall, very relaxing atmosphere & beautiful part of town, not too far from all the sights. We enjoyed walking everywhere (helps to put everything into context) but buses are available from across the bridge, as well as trams - ask the staff for info. Tickets cost 1 Euro for any journey, valid for 75 mins & available from little postcard stalls or tobacconists. When you get on, put ticket into yellow machine to validate it. If you get the train from Fiumicino Airport (5 Euros per person) to Trastevere, then the no.8 tram will take you close to hotel, or perhaps try a taxi - it is walkable but wouldn't be much fun with lots of luggage etc. Word of warning - watch your bag! I had wallet stolen whilst standing on platform at train station on way home (thankfully nothing really in there)... Lots of places to eat around hotel, so you can just be spontaneous & take in the atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Galateaofstow
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 delightful days in this tranquil oasis. The rooms are delightful and the staff could not be more heplpful.

Reviews.Title: “a charming hotel, shame about the areaa”
Reviews.Author: alish
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is an hospitable little oasis with an individual appeal. The staff are very helpful and friendly, the bathrooms are generous,the rooms very comfortable and well designed by the owner architect. Breakfast is good, early evening bar snacks a great idea, internet access easy and readily available( a big bonus for us). They have little extra touches that demonstrate a desire to please: pretty orange trees in the courtyard, excellent restaurant suggestions, umbrellas, and the bikes that made our trip! The ariport shuttle is excellent value. This is no anonymous corporate enterprise that is the norm in big city hotels. Sadly the hotel is let down by the depressing graffitti that adorn every and I mean every wall in the surrounding area and degrade the environment. That, plus the plastic bags decorating the trees along the Tiber and the gangs of kids hanging round the Santa Maria Piazza really spoilt that part of Rome for me. Surely they can do something about it. I would happily go back to Santa Maria but not to Trastevere. The Vatican area is much cleaner. I liked the Santa Maria and would definitely recommend it as a pleasant and amicable place to stay. But if this is one of the 10 best hotels in Rome, then, nice though it is, I hate to think what the others are like.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 restful nights at a lovely oasis of calm in Trastevere. Very well looked after, nothing was too much trouble. Very convenient for all parts of Rome and Vatican. Lovely that rooms opened out into open air of courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “Just watch where you step.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Santa Maria to be wonderful like everyone before us. High points were riding a bike along the river and through the streets of Rome, drinks and nibblies in the courtyard after a long hot day exploring, proximity to everything, buzz and activity at night and the peaceful, lazy mood of Trastevere by day. Be warned though, the smell of urine and dog faeces in the streets of Trastevere is a bit strong. We loved Rome but got tired of mangey dogs and having to dodge their 'mess' as soon as we left the popular tourist spots. We knew what to expect but it still took us by surprise and was not a pleasant experience on a hot summers day.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!! Pure Mediterranean!”
Reviews.Author: PhillipP
Reviews.Content: Due to our late booking at the Santa Maria, there was only one small double room available, but based on the raving reviews on tripadvisor, me and my partner went for it. We did not regret it for a minute. The room was a perfect size for the both of us and the shower-room was of a decent size too. The hotel surroundings were amazing - enjoyed reading books out in the garden under the summer sun. Although it's a good 20-minute walk from the centre of Rome, it is the heart of Trastevere... the traditional side of Rome. Do be careful from beggars and little kids stealing from tables at outdoor restaurants! Other than that, it was a great experience. We walked everywhere... the Vatican, the Colosseum... you name it. The reception staff were pleasant as were the bar/breakfast staff. Breakfast was simple but adequate, and the rooms were kept very clean by the cleaning staff. The hotel also arranged for an airport pick-up for us from Fiumicino airport at a charge of 50 Euros payable to the driver. Will definitely be re-visiting the Santa Maria Hotel when we are next in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “I would like to live at this hotel for the rest of my life....”
Reviews.Author: p.zindler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many higher priced hotels in more "upscale" Roman neighborhoods than the Santa Maria in Trastevere and I now will only stay at the Santa Maria. On a tiny little street (on which only a Roman taxi driver could manuever) is a beautifully ornamented gate opening onto a flowery path. This magical entrance will lead you to the tiny reception room and Pasquale, the most friendly and helpful man I have met in Italy. (He was baptized in the Pantheon!) The charming rooms at this hotel all open onto the inner courtyards which are graveled and planted with potted trees, shrubs and flowers. Metal chairs and tables are available for al fresco relaxing. The hotel bar is opened in the evening for wine and cocktails and complimentary nibbles like focaccia and cheeses. On this November evening the bar was featuring a newly harvested local fall wine for only $4/glass. We chose to return to the hotel each evening for drinks rather than the nearby establishments which were crowded with tourists. Our private oasis not so far from the madding crowd. Breakfast was perfect with the espresso machine steaming away and platters of cheeses and sliced meats, bread and rolls, fresh fruit, cakes, cereal, yogurt, 3 kinds of juice...there were eggs and bacon, I think, but I stay away from chafing dishes. You MUST eat at Osteria Glass. It is around the corner from the hotel on Vicolo del Cinque 58. Telephone: (06)58335903 It was the best food we have eaten in Rome in 20 years! La Rosetta (w/it's Michelin star) was good but not as good. We had to leave at 5 AM to catch a flight and Pasquale was there...insisting we have some espresso and breakfast. He had to be restrained from packing some food for us when we refused anything but espresso at that predawn hour. If you find fault with the Hotel Santa Maria, don't go back. It will leave more availability for those of us who appreciate the simple pleasures of Roman life.

Reviews.Title: “Trastevere Sancutuary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Hotel Santa Maria for three nights during the beginning of January, 2006. This well run hotel touts clean and comfortable rooms with a friendly and responsive staff. The interior courtyard grounds are truly beautiful in classic italian style. All around, the hotel is well maintained. After a long day of walking the streets of Rome, this is a great place to come home to. The included breakfast was very nice and the coffee top notch. You may see a few postings that haven't rated this hotel very high, but please keep in mind it's not a luxury resort...it's an excellent 3 star boutique hotel. Note: For those of you with jet lag, the nearby church bell tower rings all night long...every hour on the hour and then again each quarter hour. For us this was another hint of charming old world romanticism, but others may not feel the same. We give this hotel an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jenkos
Reviews.Content: To start of this place was amazing, grounds of the hotel are just outstanding and romantic. It is also quiet which is good and hard to get in Rome. Location is great walking distance to the coleseum. It was by far the best breakfast we had during our time in Italy. we had dinner nearby as a recommendation of the hotel, can't remember the name but best meal we had in Italy. Rome was a bit simple but comfortable, staff were friendly and always helpful, even organised a taxi to the airport that arrived on time. Perfect for a romantic getaway. Cannot praise this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ciaodarcy
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy. We loved the Hotel Santa Maria! Actually, this was my 4th time to stay with them! Everyone is wonderful and so helpful! The breakfast is the best I have found in all of Italy and the afternoon treats are a bonus! The hotel is in a great area with lots of restaurants. You can walk everywhere from here and at night, when you return, it feels as though you have left all of the tourists and crowds behind! I feel like a local staying here. The patio is a wonderful place to just sit with a glass of wine and relax listening to the sounds of the nearby church bells. I will only stay at the Hotel Santa Maria when in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RuthNorthampton
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel which is tucked away amongst the cobbled alleyways about 15 minutes walk away from the Vatican. It has a very romantic setting. It has a nice garden with wrought iron tables and chairs surrounded by trees which were full of oranges and covered in fairy lights so it looked really pretty at night. It is a very homely hotel and the room was clean. The staff were friendly and were helpful about local places of interest. The breakfast was really nice, lots of fresh bread, cheese, meats, fruit, yoghurts, fresh fruit juices and coffee. During the afternoon/evening there were complimentary food and drinks in the breakfast/dining room. There is a hop on/off bus service available not far from the hotel,if you do not want to walk to the local places of interest. There are lots of buses near the Vatican to chose from. There are lots of nice little restuarants near to the hotel. They were smaller, cosier and appeared to be run by families and frequented more by the locals than the restuarants nearer the main tourist attraction. We had a lovely evening meal outside, with patio heaters on to keep off the chill. I would recommend this as a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !! Great Place to hang out in the Best Area in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 6 of us (3 couples) stayed at this location for 4 nights, we had a great time. The staff was great. The Included breakfast was outstanding, and the location is the Best in Rome because it's in an area off the beaten path where the locals hang out night and day. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I tremendously enjoyed my stay at Santa Maria in Rome. The hotel is situated near the center of the city and yet has a very clean and quiet atmosphere. The hotel staff was very helpful. The meals were delicious. The overall ambience was pleasant and charming. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers visiting to Rome. A truly unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “A charming Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned with my husband and two teenage boys from 4 nights at the Hotel and we all enjoyed its ambiance, the rooms and the comforts afforded at this hotel. Its set in Trastevere which is an authentic Roman neighborhood and geographicly well situated for all historic visits. The boys loved the breakfasts and we all plan to return in the spring, God willing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Rome, staying in this exceptional setting of the Hotel S. Maria in Rome. Exceptional in the sense that the place is like an oasis of peace in the middle of Rome. The only thing we did not appreciate was the way a stranger from the hotel starred at you from his window at night. A bit spooky. Still, this could not waste the beautiful time spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would easily stay at this hotel again. The staff members are very helpful. The location is good. The breakfast and snacks are a plus. Furthermore, internet access is available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and safe hotel for two girls traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: dhart
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a trip to Rome for her 30th birthday and stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria. We adored the hotel, the staff and the location. Very easy walk to everywhere, everyone on the staff was very kind, and we felt extremely safe walking around even late at night. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone. It can be a bit hard to find, but just ask the locals and they're more than happy to point you in the right direction. When I return to Rome, I'll definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis in the middle of a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home after 3 nights in Rome. This hotel exceeded all expectations. The staff were very friendly, the whole hotel was spotless, the room was very comfortable and the breakfast was delicious. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary appetizers provided early evening. We plan to take our two children to Rome in the next couple of years and we hope to stay at the Santa Maria - it's peaceful and quiet, just what you need after a day in Rome! Trastevere is a maze of very narrow lanes and we didn't ever take the same route to the hotel. The recommendations for places to eat worked out very well, they were just round the corner from the hotel and were typically Italian - excellent food, very reasonable and full of locals. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone planning a to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: All hotel rooms in Europe are small when compared to American standards, and this room was larger than expected. Very clean, and a helpful staff at the reception and in the breakfast room. The breakfast buffet included Italian pastries as well as American food. Excellent location - it makes you feel like you are in a remote Italian village. The majority of the guests at the hotel appeared to be Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Flyin'Mama
Reviews.Content: My family of four (with two young teenage boys) just returned from a wonderful week at the Santa Maria. It is an extremely cozy place, tucked away in a small street in Trastavere. The room we stayed in, a Senior Suite, was perfect for our family. The boys enjoyed the cozy loft upstairs and we all enjoyed the spaciousness of the first level. The room was always warm, and the bathroom was also very warm and well equipped. The service was gracious and the breakfast and evening appetizers were always delicious - we always made it a point to be "home" for the 6:00 cocktail hour. Their lounge area was extremely comofortable with books, games, and internet available. The hotel is surrounded by a lovely square, wonderful and reasonable restaurants, and is very safe (much less overwhelming in than the more central area in Rome). It is within walking distance of all the major sights and a wonderful way to experience the real flavor of Rome. Make sure to get a copy of Rick Steve's Rome book and follow directions exactly for a nice discount (at least through 2006). We highly recommend the nearby La Torre restaurant (recommended by Antonio) for reasonable and delicious pizza and pasta. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: None56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Novemeber & couldn't fault the hotel Santa Maria in any way. The location was excellent - about 15 mins walk from the city centre, about 20 or 25mins from the Pantheon. For the location its top value for money, especially given how difficult it is to get around Rome. There's a very nice courtyard as well (too cold to sit in in November though) but it'd be fine in the summer. Breakfast was good quality & the rooms were clean & comfortable enough. Also, we had a bit of a panic one evening when our youngest son got stranded out of town. The reception couldn't have been more helpful in getting everything sorted out. [PS Don't miss the Colosseum or St Peter's - just amazing.]

Reviews.Title: “Small, but that's not all”
Reviews.Author: nannarella
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short trip to Italy, beginning with a four-night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria and ending with a one-night stay there. While the rooms aren't large, they're comfortably appointed and the baths absolutely sparkle. The owners did a beautiful job of restoring the property, and the service is excellent--way beyond what I've encountered in other three-star hotels in Rome. Nice mix of guests from all over. Lovely place to stay in Rome if you want a quiet haven and superior service off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected at Stanta Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis in a teaming city in walking distance to all the attractions. The staff were great, the breakfast was outstanding and the coffee exquisite. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: grogdog
Reviews.Content: nothing to complain about here, rooms, maids wine etc lovlely, as most people have said previously the location is perfect especially in the evening when you dont have to far to fall home from one of the many excellent restaurants in the area. Although weather was excellent for the time of year (20oc) we did not get using the courtyard as much as we would have liked but i can imagine how nice this would be inthe summer months. cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was great. The Trastavere neighborhood is a great place to stay in Rome - walking distance to everything - and this hotel is tucked away in a quiet corner. It has a beautiful courtyard and dining room. The rooms were clean and nice. The breakfast was great, and I appreciated the little extras, such as free internet usage. Overall, I highly recommend it. I stayed at two other (more expensive) hotels in Rome, and I thought Hotel Santa Maria was a much better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful but close enough to all you'll need”
Reviews.Author: Pekoe
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank all those that took such good care of us at the Santa Maria. With the weather forecast predicting rain we booked a taxi shortly before leaving, through the hotel. The driver was at the airport ready for us and the journey went very smoothly. We were so glad that we had since the narrow streets around the hotel are quite confusing until you get your bearings. We took a close up print out from multi map of the surrounding streets that was a great help. The weather forecast was thankfully wrong however and we had 4 glorious days of sunshine (70ºC) in which to tour Rome. Our room (22) is suitable for a family and had 2 bathrooms (a toilet and basin in one and a full suite in the second). There were 3 single beds in one room and a double in the second. It was a lovely room although not suitable for those of you taller than 5ft 9 since it was built into the attic space. As others have said the breakfast was great and the evening nibbles were a lovely touch. For evenings out you will not need to venture far and we found that the Trastevere area of the city was much more reasonably priced. The Piazza Santa Maria is a beautiful square to while away the hours people watching and the numerous side streets are filled with trattorias, bars and ice cream parlours. The Hotel has some good suggestions for places to eat our favourite was La Fraschetta which is a Pizzeria on Via San Francesco (about 5 - 10 minutes walk away)(web site lafraschetta.com)cheap and does great pizzas. We went to da Otello which was recommended on a review web site and although the food was OK our waiter kept getting called away whilst taking our order. We also tried La Tana on Via Della Paglia that was the only poor meal that we had during our trip. We loved the Caffe Del Cinque (on Vicolo Del Cinque) for a night cap and a good chat - again great value. Above all we would highly recommend the hotel and can't wait to go back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “The Santa Maria was a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Santa Maria. It was close to all the shops and small cafe's and was very very nice. The people were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Celebration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We choose Santa Maria to be the base of our stay in Rome while celebrating a friends birthday for a week. The location was excellent, the staff extremely freindly, helpful and for the most part very knowledgable. It was a wonderful oasis in the middle of a very busy city. After the first copy days we weren't in such a rush to leave in the morning and enjoyed the leisure atmosphere very much, just the same in the evening when we returned form a very busy day. It was so nice to be able to stroll to one of many places nearby for dinner in the evening. We've already recommended it to friends who will be staying there next month and will be happy to recommend it to others. As it is a small hotel I would only recommend if you have special needs or requests to be sure you state them when making your reservation as they seem to be fully booked quite often, another good indication of their reputation. Be sure to allow yourself time to sit in the garden and just relax, that's a real holiday. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cameraguy52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria back in Nov. of 2004. Why I haven't written a review is certainly an oversight because I cannot tell you how much we loved out stay. My son-in-law is going in Dec. with his wife and I told him that is the only place to stay - in the heart of Trastavere. The amenities are fabulous - the staff wonderful and helpful. Hot water, comfortable bed, peaceful evenings - yes - peaceful. After a long busy day in the city it was wonderful to come back to a quiet, cozy hotel. The location is so nice too, because it's not in a touristy area - it's more of where the people live. The neighborhood where the restaurants are, the bars. A short walk across the river and you're not far from shops and sight seeing. The breakfast! What a wonderful breakfast every morning. And a great place to be alone with the one you love or a time to visit with other guest. I know if I return to Rome this will be the place we stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful little gem in Trastavere, Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl
Reviews.Content: This adorable little hotel is nestled in Trastavere, a stone's throw from the Colosseum and other major sights. It is secluded, private, and offers the perfect place to take a siesta in between sightseeing excursions. Rome is a very fast-paced, crowded city and the Hotel Santa Maria offers the perfect little paradise to help you recouperate from the excitement of the city outside. It has adorable little cafe tables in the pebbled courtyard, a generous breakfast, and full bar. The hotel staff are extremely kind and courteous. E.g. when I stumbled back to the hotel on my last night in Rome, I asked the man working the reception if it was too late to get a caffe latte. He said no, not at all, and jumped up and walked to the bar to make me one. He then asked if I wanted to bring it to my room. I said yes, and he grabbed a tray and carried it to my room for me. I can't say enough good things about this place! Keep in mind --- the rooms are small by American standards; they're definitely not suites. They are clean and fully equipped and stocked though. The atmosphere of the hotel, the location, and the staff all make it 5 star quality in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCJOB
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Italy and had a great room at the Hotel Santa Maria in Rome.The staff and the accomadations were excellent. I was informed that the hotel was a former convent and the location is in the a section of Rome with narrow streets and alleys with great resturants (The Cistern). I had e-mailed prior to my arrival and had a car pick us at the Airport (50e)and had the staff palce flowers and a bottle of wine in my room for my anniversary. The breakfast was one of the best served during our stay in Italy. I would stay at the Santa Maria again... John New York

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the challenge of finding the place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very private and lovely setting almost totally tucked away in this ancient portion of Rome. Staff performed a very quality service and were most attentive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria proved to be the perfect evening respite from frenetic pace of Rome. A peaceful glass of wine in the courtyard as the stars brighten, while the churchbells nearby chime sweetly...truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria for 5 nights in Sept 2005 and enjoyed every moment. The staff were helpful and friendly while the breakfast was superb. There were also a nos of factors that reduced the cost ie the 10% discount for cash and the free guided walking tour(which was very enjoyable). We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquile and beautiful place to be in rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the santa maria and found the location, staff and facilities fantastic. The staff in particular are helpful and the service great. Will return again on next rome visit.

Reviews.Title: “5 wonderful days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Of all the small, medium-rated hotels I know in Rome, the Santa Maria is the absolut best. As a former travel agent I consider myself a judge in that matter. The rooms are very clean, tastefully furnished and one can feel at home in them. The small courtyard is an oasis of peace and you can enjoy a drink after a long day of touring. The breakfast is one of the best I ever received in Rome. For my next trip to Rome - a stay at the Santa Maria is a MUST!! My thanks and compliments to the friendly staff. Ingrid M. Bast Nuernberg, Germany

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an interesting journey to the Hotel we found the staff to be well informed and pleasant at check-in. The surrounding area is compact and we had many enjoyable walks discovering the many eating options. The staff was amazing. We had what could have been a disaster with the check-out day turn into a problem and vacation solved. We look forward to another stay at the Hotel Santa Maria on our next visit to Italy

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: babyboomer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere in Rome from Sept. 20 until Sept. 24, 2005. What a fantastic choice. This hotel tucked away in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome is a jewel. After the crowds of Rome coming back for the evening appetizers and sitting in the courtyard under umbrellas, we were refreshed each day. The staff was wonderful, courteous, fun and always ready to assist us. The breakfasts were tasty and had a wide choice of foods and of course, we loved the cappuccinos! No doubt, this hotel is a class act. Benita Brown, Chesapeake, Virginia, USA

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a narrow side street in Trastevere is the lovely, peaceful oasis from the hustle and bustle of Rome, and yet within walking distance of all that is Rome. The staff was most attentive and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, the breakfast bar scrumptious, and the atmosphere of the courtyard beautiful and peaceful. Our stay was 3 perfect days, and if we ever return to Rome, we will look no further than Hotel Santa Maria. Janet Norfolk, VA

Reviews.Title: “This is the real deal”
Reviews.Author: yogagal
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this charming hotel and it was a wonderful experience. The room, though small and modest, had a comfortable bed, good a/c and nice strong shower. Morning breakfast is lovely with cappuchino as we liked it served inside the breakfast room or outdoors in the courtyard. We too enjoyed the evening appetizers with a glass of italian red and enjoyed the opportunity to chat with the very friendly guests at the hotel. The staff is helpful but would suggest you choose your own restaurants and ask them to help with reservations(we were sent to La Torre and it was not very good). We especially enjoyed Asinocotto which is in Trastevere. We walked all over the city and finally got the hang of the public transport which is 4 Euro/day for a pass. The tram(i believe it is the # 8) is very handy for crossing the river ending at Largo Argentina where you can then walk to Piazza Venezia or Pantheon and related sites very easily. We even walked to the Vatican. Some fellow guests used the hotel's recommended tour company to see the Vatican on Sunday and waited in line many hours. We used the Angels tour to see the vatican on a thursday and had a good experience. On our way home we stopped at a cafe in the Piaza Della Scala to get out of the rain and had great pizza and pasta at a reasonable price. I do not know the name of the place but if you sit at an outside table you are sitting opposite the scuola materna i believe. We also used the Angels guides to see Ostia on a private tour which was enjoyable as well. Suggest you avoid the Museum of Rome in Trastevere even though it is close to the hotel. It is expensive and so empty that the guards follow you around-very creepy!!! Finally-be sure and take advantage of the 10% discount the hotel offers if you pay in cash. It will end up saving you 13% over using a credit card. This represents a great value when you consider that breakfast is included. I believe the hotel has a few larger rooms but we managed to put away most of our clothes and still have room to keep our suitcases out for the remaining items we could not put away. If you have been to Rome before and wish to have a more authentic experience, you can not do better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a slightly funky & fun part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: katehDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was perfect for us. We ate breakfast in the courtyard every morning, and every evening had a glass of wine, read or played cards in the courtyard before dinner. It would be the first hotel we would book if going back to Italy, although I suspect it is not for everybody. If you want to be steps away from major tourist attractions and hordes of tourists, or like to stay in large hotels with all the luxury amenities (it is very nice, attractive, and comfortable, but it's not a Four Seasons or Ritz), this probably isn't the place for you. We read both the good and bad reviews before going, and I think the secret is to have the right expectations and understand that not all people are looking for the same things, so here are the reasons why we loved it (and why someone looking for something diffrerent might not). Also, I will mention that w had perfect weather in Rome--if it had been raining our whole trip, some of our favorite things about the hotel (winding down in the courtyard at the end of the day, wandering the nearby streets) would not have been as enjoyable. Location. We absolutely loved Trastevere and the hotel's location there. There are tons of tiny restaurants on narrow cobblestone streets. The streets are lively with people (lots of young Italians and international students as well as others). We came back late every afternoon, sat in the piazza nearby having a gelato (never missed our gelato!) and watched kids play in the square, parents coming home from work and meeting their kids & nannies in the square, etc. At night, we just headed out to one of the nearby restaurants. Although there were tourists among the people on the streets and in restaurants, the vast majority were local people, which we loved. The hotel is within walking distance of major attractions IF you like to walk a lot. It is not mere steps or a block or two from the major sites or a major tourist areas. We loved that - we never met a pasta or gelato we didn't like, so we got our exercise by walking everywhere (we did take a cab once or twice, but for the most part we walked, and we logged a fair number of miles every day). And we loved coming "home" to an area that was out of the tour group areas. Noise. Some of the reviewers have mentioned noise. Trastevere is a lively part of town with a thriving night-life, so it probably isn't the quietest area of Rome (although I've never found large cities to be particularly quiet). If that's a big issue for you, you may want to give this some thought. We all slept GREAT - and I don't always. In fact, my only regret is that I slept so well in the mornings, I never got up early to use one of the bikes to ride along the Tiber in the morning, as our companions did. But those church bells really do ring every 15 minutes. While I heard them when awake, they never awakened me or kept me awake. Since the hotel rooms are all first floor and face outdoors (the courtyard area) you may get a little more noise than you would in a high-rise in other parts of Rome. Amenities. The courtyard was a wonderful place to start the day and to wind down after a long day of sightseeing. The free use of the internet during the afternoon and evening was a nice way to make a quick check of email. The breakfast was perfect for us - cereal, fresh melon every morning, coffee & juices. Again, if you're looking for a big American hotel buffet spread, you would probably be dissapointed, but it had everything we needed, and it was lovely to eat it outdoors as we mapped out our day. The rooms are very nice, pleasant and well-maintained, and had everything we wanted or needed. But if you are looking for thick towels and luxury (or big hotel) hotel amenities such as room service, it's not the place for you. Staff. The staff was very helpful. Some spoke English better than others, but I never had any trouble getting across what I needed or getting information I needed - I did a little pointing in the wine bar a day or two, but that's a pretty easy place to communicate! The hotel offered dining suggestions when asked, offered a variety of tour packages if desired, arranged our airport transportation, etc. We loved it. We enjoyed our other hotels in Italy (a very luxurious hotel in Tuscany, and a charming inn overlooking Florence), but the Hotel Santa Maria was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cholmley
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is just as delightful as everyone reports. It is an oasis in Rome, far and above comparably priced hotels. I traveled with a friend and we spent two nights at the hotel, but had to spend a third night at another 3* across the street from the lovely Villa Barbarini. The other hotel was slightly more expensive, had uncomfortable beds, and a mediocre breakfast. But most would suffer in comparison to the Hotel Santa Maria with its excellent service, beautiful surroundings, and generous hospitality. A word of advice: if you need a taxi to get anywhere and you don't want to find a taxi stand, ask the desk to book one in advance. And if you want a wonderful dinner in the neighborhood, I highly recommend L'Archetto on Via G. Mameli.

Reviews.Title: “we really enjoyed this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 6 nights in sept05.We really enjoyed this hotel.I would recommend it.I really liked the courtyard.Breakfast was nice.It is a buffet and has meats,cheeses,croissants,pastries,cereal,scrambled eggs and fruits.They have a coffee bar and juice.The room itself is small but adequate it even has a minibar.The bathroom is fine.The whole experience of this hotel is not the room but the courtyard.At 6pm they have a buffet of snacks.They have a bar so you can buy your bottle or glass of wine or spirits and have the buffet brushetta and awesome olives and cheeses.The wine ranges from glasses 4.00 to bottle 38 euros and it is great.They charge it to your room.I would recommend using the 50 euro taxi service,the streets are really narrow.If anyone has any questions about the hotel or area email me at scabral@cfl.rr.com I would be happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a great little hotel. Excellent location just across the river, close to all the good bits of Rome and surrounded by lots of good eating places. The hotel is stylish, quiet and comfortable with a lovely little courtyard for great breakfast under the orange trees. Staff were very friendly and we felt well looked after. A treat indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Gret Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Langley_traveler_11
Reviews.Content: A place to recommend. The rooms were smallish but completely adequate. The bathroom was great. Breakfast were also great. The breakfast staff did get upset at us when we tried to get food at 7.15 to get to the Vatican line up but everything ended up as it should. The reception staff were very helpfull. Now getting there and then out by car was an adventure. On the inward journey we fould the place 10 yards away from where our car was but a line of mopeds prevented us getting to the parking inside the hotel. We had to detour 1 mile arround to actually get to the paking inside the hotel grounds. On the way out we managed to scratch the car. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great place, very helpful people but a nightmare to drive to! be warned; you'll need a small car and some guts to get there! pete

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: ChrisOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of 4 booked with the help of Trip Advisor and we loved them all! The staff was so helpful and friendly. Breakfast was perfect in a beautiful outdoor location with fresh flowers and linens. Our only problem was my husband being a little too tall for the ceilings of our room. Will recommend to anyone I know going to Rome. I loved the location too.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This really has to be one of the best places to base yourself in Rome. As with all the other reviewers, we were so impressed with this unique and intimate property. Easy access to all the sights and great local restaurants, spotless rooms with everything you might need together with very helpful, friendly staff. Add to this great breakfasts and complimentary early evening snacks - perfect. We will definately stay here again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If there is one area to stay in Rome it's Trastevere. Not very touristy, but real Rome. The hotel is near Piazza Santa Maria. A beutiful piazza that is alive with people. The hotel is built around a beautiful courtyard, with orange trees. Even though the rooms are not large - they are clean and comfortable. The people there are wonderful and our stay was everything we hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a long weekend celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary, and stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. We booked this hotel on the recommendation of tripadvisor and couldn't have been more pleased. It's set in the lovely district of Trastevere, which is all old narrow cobbled streets, little piazzas etc. For us, this area is a great base. It is within walking distance of all the main sites, but is quieter than say some of the better known areas across the river. There are plenty of great restaurants and bars within a few minutes wander too. The rooms are set around two lovely courtyards with orange trees where you can sit and have your breakfasts or a bottle of wine in the evening. It is a real oasis of calm and tranquility after the helter skelter of the city centre. The rooms themselves are simply furnished but they get everything right - comfortable beds, very clean, nice decor, good bathroom, air con. The breakfasts are superb with scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, yoghurt, fruit, juice, bread, cakes etc. There's also a complementary buffet in the early evening with bruschetta etc which is a really nice touch after a long days sightseeing. On top of all this the English speaking staff are very friendly and helpful. We really have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE recently had a few days at this delightful Hotel in the fascinating Trastevere district of Rome. Most comfortable, staff informative, helpful and charming. An excellent peaceful venue from which to venture into the fascination of the eternal city. It is surrounded by the most incredible array and variety of restaurants within moments of walking time. Also delightful garden area in which to breakfast alfresco Highly recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to escape the loud hustle of Rome to a quiet and beautiful retreat, this is the place for you. We recently stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for three nights. The hotel is actually located behind private walls that give it privacy and a sense of quiet as compared to the streets. The rooms surround gorgeous gardens. Each morning and evening the hotel serves complimentary breakfast and appetizers in those gardens. Its a nice relaxing way to start off a day and to rest with a glass of wine after a long day seeing the sights of Rome. The hotel is small, so the staff is rarely overburdened and is very responsive. Another bonus for American / UK travelers is that the staff uniformly had a good command of English. When considering the location, service, hotel facilities and price - this hotel is very good. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place in Rome, we absolutely loved it. It was definitely our favorite spot in Italy and we stayed at 4 hotels/motels. Room was great, very clean! Staff was friendly and the morning breakfast was perfect to get the day started off. I thought the location was perfect as the area has great food and it is close enought to walk everywhere, we never took a bus or cab, walked everywhere. If you have a chance, stay here, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Retreat in a Big Noisy City”
Reviews.Author: twohoosiers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria for 3 nights at the end of August. We consider ourselves well traveled midwesterners and hope our experience can lend some useful information. The most appreciated: Courtyard, a great place to rest after a day of touring in a crowded and noisy city. Drinks & munchies, plentiful and tasty. Breakfast, plentiful and tasty. Shower, lots of water pressure. Bed, comfortable. Location: enjoyable walk to all major sights, good access to restaurants for dinner. Adequate: Room size, small to medium. Grafiti. Challenging: We kept getting turned around in the area. :) So, pay attention as you leave each night for dinner! We arranged for the taxi to pick us up at the airport on our arrival. Yes, it is expensive, but what isn't in Italy. It gave us peace of mind and worked out very well. I would go back to the hotel and would recommend it for those not needing to be pampered, but for those travelers who appreciate a peaceful retreat from the big city. LL & JL

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: Helena-Mary
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay. This is a really pretty hotel in a charming part of Rome within walking distance of the sights. Hotel arranged transfers to and from airport and service was excellent. Staff were friendly, food was good and accommodation was very comfortable and attractive. We got lost the first time we left the hotel. Turn left out of Hotel and keep left and Piazza Santa Maria is a stone's throw away. We walked for miles through Rome and didn't find an area we would rather have stayed in. Hotel certainly lived up to expectations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we had booked a hotel based solely on the reviews from this website. Now we will frequently take the advice of Tripadvisor. The Hotel Santa Maria was, in general, a terrific place. The hotel was charming and had just the right amount of luxury for us. The staff, other than the occasionally dismissive person at the bar in the evenings, was helpful and patient. Desk staff gave us directions and more good than not restaurant suggestions. Since it was August, many of the places we wished to dine at were closed but they suggested some lovely Trastevere trattorias. The breakfasts were terrific and the breakfast staff were absolutely lovely. The place is immaculate and comfortable - if cramped. The free internet access is a real plus - especially for our teenage son. The neighborhood was fun for us and our 16 year old but might make some people uncomfortable. Everything in the area (NOT the hotel) is graffiti covered and there were some seedy people hanging the around the piazza at night. We never felt threatened but it was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Important information”
Reviews.Author: Pegasus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last week of August '05 at two hotels in Rome, the 2nd being the Santa Maria in Trastavere. We are amazed that this is the top rated Tripadvisor hotel in Rome. The Santa Maria is an unexceptional but well run hotel of two star quality, the rooms are clean with basic furnishings, but have poor quality soft furnishing and linen. There is no residents lounge although guests can use the bar/dining room to relax in. Guests may borrow bicycles for free which is a nice idea. Rooms are situated around a courtyard and connected by an open corridor, which means you must keep the curtains drawn in the rooms to maintain any privacy with room lights switched during the day. The breakfast is again unexceptional, the usual italian cold buffet plus scrambled eggs which makes a change, it can be eaten in the courtyard from 7.30am which can create a bit of noise each morning. Reception staff are very courteous and helpful, but make sure you confirm you booking thoroughly by email and telephone. Light sleepers will have a problem with the Santa Maria church clock (50m away), which does a complete set of chimes on the quarter hour, while this is charming during the day it continues relentlessly throughout the night. The Piazza Santa Maria, and the Trastevere area while excellent in the evening with crowds and lots of busy resaurants, is almost deserted during daylight hours with many restaurants closed until evening. To conclude, there many other hotels offering much better accommodation and value in other areas of Rome so it is worth doing a little research. And if you want to visit Trastevere for dinner in the evening it is no more than a 10 euro taxi ride from any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria: the positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: LondonHolidaybuff
Reviews.Content: A slightly disappointing stay. Some over-zealous Italian staff who were over-contolling of guests was made bearable by the excellent service offered by the other fillipino staff members. Very nice accommodation. The bikes on offer were neither safe nor rideable. The breakfast was excellent. The service in the bar/lounge after breakast ranged from poor to very poor. The evening buffet periods were spoilt by the bar member who was regularly on duty for this period who was both curt and unhelpful. When we complained the other Italian staff were dismissive and uncaring. I think this hotel needs to change its Italian staff who have become staid and apathetic. I can see that this Hotel is beginning to falter and lose some of its charm and romance.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and charming rooms, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for a weekend in August and found it to be a simple, lovely hotel with great extras that added up to a really good value. The rooms are simple, pretty and very crisp and clean. Ours was the upstairs "suite" which lacked a little of the charm of the downstairs rooms I peeked in and also had eaves (I hit my head once) but it was still very nice, painted a soothing pale yellow, tile floors, simple floral print bedcover and lots of cool, fluffy pillows. It also had a great bathroom with chrome fixtures and a pedestal sink. The linen handtowels are just STUNNING. I wish they offered them for sale. And the air conditioning worked REALLY well, which was nice since it was hot while we were there. It was also nice and quiet in the rooms making for a peaceful night's sleep despite the crowds of tourists and locals enjoying the area's many night spots and wine bars. The location is great for exploring Trastevere and is also just a short walk to the Campo di Foiri and Piazza Navona. Make sure to ask the hotel for some local trattoria recommendations. They'll be happy to oblige. The service is excellent and very personal and your stay includes buffet breakfast as well as complimentary snacks from 5:30-7:30 in the bar or the very charming courtyard (check out their site for photos) We also found they offer a 10% discount for paying in cash, which makes this already reasonable hotel a true bargain. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: chilito45
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Italy was made special by the Hotel's staff and by the ambience of the property. Facilities were clean,the staff accomodating and the proximity of the hotel to points of interest was perfect. Every morning we looked forward to a relaxing and enjoyable breakfast in the patio area surrounded by citrus trees and the sound of the locals getting to their morning activities. Morning noises of the local residents adds to the feeling of being immersed in the actual neighborhood of the people in Trestavere. Yet not so much that you intrude upon their life activities and they intrude upon yours. just the right touch of cultural mix. It was our honeymoon and it will forever be meorable. We will definitely be back to renew our memorable moments. Thank You Hotel Santa Maria Joe and Diane Murillo

Reviews.Title: “Loved the entire experience, location and staff were perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place to stay in Rome. It was our first time to Rome and we took our two teenage daughters. Absolutely the best location to stay. You could walk or ride bikes to everything, the night life is great and there are great restaurants everywhere around you. The staff couldn't have been friendlier. We highly recommend Hotel Santa Maria in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, friendly hotel in the middle of the trastevere area, where the Roman's head for a good meal. A pleasant walk to all the sites, lots of local food and drink choices. Lots of atmosphere and staff willing to go out of their way to help. Great breakfast, snacks and reasonable bar prices. This hotel is not a big commercial clone, but a small friendly place to stay, and for our second honeymoon we couldn't haven't wished for better.

Reviews.Title: “Great for first timers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As first timers to Rome we found Hotel Santa Maria was perfect for us. We arranged a transfer to the hotel from the airport which was excellent. After midnight the driver parked the car and walked us to the door. We would never have found the hotel otherwise, as it is tricky to find. Breakfast was excellent with super service. The church bells are something to be aware of - If you are a light sleeper take ear plugs as the bells do ring every quarter of an hour day and night. The ear plugs do the trick though. After sightseeing all day it is great to come back for a small buffet and glass of wine whilst writing an email home. We were on our honeymoon and would highly recommend this hotel to other newlyweds. Have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria--Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: scottyl55
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Santa Maria was exactly as the internet described. The sevice was wonderful as was the breakfast each morning. We did have some trouble navigating all of the twisted and turning street, but the people at the hotel helped as much as I think anyone could. Their english was pretty good, but we did have to play charades a time or two. Our only complaint would be the air conditioning; as we were there in the last week of July, the a/c just couldn't keep up. However, we will never visit Rome in July or August again due to the high humidity and heat. Overall, we had no complaints with Santa Maria and we walked everywhere from our hotel. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice.........but not out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: clairp
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start??? My husband and I like many people booked this hotel purely on the rave reviews on this site and the mention of "oasis". We have travelled extensively all over Italy for the past 5 years so we know a bit about Italian hotels. The Santa Maria is good for the money - in the grand scheme of things it is not expensive for Italy - I would describe it about average. The hotel rooms - 9 times out of 10 are this size all over Italy especially in the cities, this is the way places are built! especially if they are old! At the Santa Maria our room did not smell, yes it was a little small (but that is pretty much expected as I said) the air conditioning worked prefectly and it was nice and clean, the maids came and did their job therefore everything fine there. The staff were friendly and helpful, the cab that we booked from the airport wasn`t there when we got there but he turned up about 10 mins later but then our flight came in early so what do you expect? Yes I think that maybe it is a little far out if you have never been to Rome before/you only have a few days and time is of the essence but personally I loved the area, nice restaurants, nice square to sit and the bus stop was round the corner (not 10 mins away like somone else mentioned) - we had no trouble getting taxi`s or buses - its lovely to stay out of the serious tourist hub especially when it is that hot! Because my husband and I have seen Rome before and were there for a concert and a break we didn`t have to break our necks to get to EVERY sight like some so it was nice to be in a different district. As for dodgey people walking around of a night basically I thought the area was fine just take the same precautions you always should whereever you are no ? Yes the little courtyards of Santa Maria are cute to sit and have a drink and breakfast etc with trees and benches - Rome is a big, smelly, busy city and it is nice to go back and chill out without having to stay in your room. Breakfast pretty good, coffee very nice, staff doing breakfast very helpful. My biggest complaint would have to be about the other guests of the hotel, the rooms all face the courtyard and are very close together. WHY? are some people so ignorant and stand around outside your door having a loud usually boring conversation at 7am, some people are so inconsiderate! these particular people are all over the country though I am afraid. They have seen "under the Tuscan Sun" and feel the need to be loud in pursuit of the hollywood dream.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria - Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here, it was very nice. The front desk staff was very welcoming, and provided great suggestions for tours we were interested in. As well, the breakfast terrace was lovely, and we appreciated the feeling of being in an oasis in the middle of Rome! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: europebound
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in room #2 in the Hotel Santa Maria from July 13th to the 16th. It was perfect (one large bed for us and bunkbeds for the kids). It is difficult to think of adjectives that have not been used to describe this hotel. It is a gem and it is an oasis! Trastevere is a perfect location to explore all the sights on foot and take in a small sample of how wonderful it would be to live in Rome. Aside from the location and comfort, special mention must be made of the warm welcome we received and the continued generous and attentive hospitality throughout. We received friendly help with restaurant reservations, taxis and directions to our car rental location. Breakfasts were yummy, the antipasti buffet was a delight - especially with wine, while sitting out in the courtyard. After a day of sightseeing, it was great to relax and regroup, and then wander out at 8 or 9 pm for dinner and a walk. La dolce vita!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel - in a fabulous neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: scout4
Reviews.Content: I wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Santa Maria. It is totally secluded and an oasis from the activity outside - the rooms are comfortable, breakfast is great, and the courtyard is a great place to relax after an afternoon of sightseeing. We enjoyed a glass of wine there before dinner both nights. The staff at the hotel is great - they called us a cab, helped us make dinner reservations and helped another guest locate her missing luggage at the airport. They also put a bottle of champagne and sweets in our room while we were out our first night - it was our honeymoon and was a wonderful surprise. One of the best things about this hotel was that it is located in Trastavere. Trastavere may seem out of the way, but it is just across the river from all the sights - we walked everywhere... and it is a charming neighborhood that you will be thrilled to spend time in. The streets are narrow and dotted with cafes, restaurants and shops. It isn't touristy - and at night Piazza Santa Maria fills with young people, couples on a stroll, musicians etc. Also, if you stay here and are coming from the airport - take the train to Trastavere INSTEAD of going all the way to the trainstation. You will have to take a different train but it is cheaper and a much shorter ride.

Reviews.Title: “Ciao bella”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - great atmosphere, great location, great breakfast, great staff !

Reviews.Title: “Charming Enclave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed this quiet enclave in Rome. Easy walking distance to major tourist historical sites. Arty location with narrow winding streets full of many wonderful restaurants. Rooms were small, but cheerfully decorated and clean. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Bar, lounge and indoor breakfast area were charming and outdoor seating area was beautiful. Looking forward to returning to this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheBeers80
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, truly wonderdful place to stay, lots of interesting squares, great location, but also very quite, my only comment and this is very minor is the hotel could have provide more comfortable outdoor seats as the outdoor area was wonderful. We will be back. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Santa Maria Hotel in Trastevere-Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just returned from Rome and would like to recommend this lovely hotel. We also had one of the smaller rooms, however we found this to be spotlessly cleaned daily by the maid with ample facilities, for our short stay. Its location whilst not being smack in the centre of Rome, is favourable in my opinion, as it is the nicer area of Trastevere, just south of the river. We used the (free) bikes everyday to get around to see all the usual attractions, and found this a big bonus, whilst also saving our legs of all the walking. There is plenty of restaurants and tavernas local to the Hotel, so there is no need to walk into the centre of town each night. All in all, we will return to Roma, and we will book here again. P.S Book the cab through the hotel for 50Euros, and dont get ripped off by the taxis from the airport like many of the tourists we spoke to.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lived up to expectations, we liked the location a lot, the staff were excellent particularly helping with a flat tyre on our car. Pasqual stayed until after midnight (2 hours after his shift ended) to make sure the breakdown company got it fixed. You don't see that level of service too often, if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: traveler292
Reviews.Content: I was amazed to see the poor review posted on the hotel! We stayed there in 2003 and are going back again in November. We found the location convenient to many good restaurants and within walking distance to many of the points of interest in Rome. Busses were easily accessable. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were immaculate, quiet and well appointed. The only sounds heard were the lovely church bells nearby! I can't imagine what more one could ask for at breakfast!
