Served in a lovely dining room, with beautiful linen table cloths, we were offered coffee, tea, hot chocolate, juice, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, breads, pastries, eggs and selections of meats and cheeses. The waiter was both professional and attentive. Trastevere is an historic section of Rome. The ancient area has narrow cobblestone streets and alleys with very old buildings. I believe that some people who unrealistically expect "new, bright and shining" surroundings mistakenly think of the area as "dirty". We never felt unsafe or threatened and throughly enjoyed the area and especially the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, but we just returned from 14 days in Rome, all of them at Santa Maria, 4 days at the beginning and 10 days after 3 weeks in Tuscany. We were delighted with the charm of the hotel, the location, the friendliness of the staff (hi to Antonio, Arianna, Conrad and everyone!). Trastevere is what some would call "the real Rome." Full of great little sidewalk cafes that spring up in the evening, and tons of interesting and unique shops and artisans. A great base for exploring Rome. And our #1 recommendation for a spot to eat... Il Torre on the Natale del Grande, a 3-minute walk away. Superb food and cheap (by Roman standards). Speaking of which... We covered every corner of Rome by either taking a cab out to an area and then slowly meandering our way back. Or vice-versa. But if you're 60 years old and in reasonable health, don't worry about Trastevere as your base location, unless you hate walking. And if you hate walking, don't come to Rome at all -- it's one of the world's great walking cities, along with New York, Paris, and Hong Kong . (By the way, my wife and I are in our 50s and not in particularly great shape, just in case you're wondering if you can walk Rome.) And Trastevere has some unique location advantages. For example, it's only a 2-minute walk to lovely parks like Gianicolo and Villa Chiara (hope I have that spelling right) and the Botannical Gardens. You won't see many tourists at these wonderful little spots (well, maybe a few at the Botannical Gardens!). At the end of the day, after 6-8 hours of 33-40 degree heat (90-100 farenheit), coming back to the peace and quiet of Santa Maria quickly became a "home away from home" feeling. The hotel is set in a secluded spot, just off the Piazza Santa Maria, so is amazingly quiet. We ran into other tourists, and they often complained of Rome's noise from their rooms. Not here. And you won't make new friends at Rome's "major hotels." But everyone tends to gather in the central courtyard/garden, shaded by canvas overhead. Wine and a nice little buffet-pre-supper snack soon leads to conversation and great stories/tips about Rome, or about life -- your choice. Breakfast is also free (and ample -- a full breakfast with eggs, fruit, meats, juices, cappucino, espresso, etc.), and gets you off to a satisfying, strong start to the day. We, a family of 4, stayed in 4 different rooms... the Mansard Suite which offers 2 separate rooms, which was a super-comfortable spot. Just remember to duck, as it's built right into what used to be the attic. But, as the pictures on its site, (---), show, it really is a fun and comfortable spot -- my wife and I would stay here without the children, too. We also stayed two days in two double rooms. They were charming and the girls were happy to be "on their own." And finally, for the last 10 days we stayed in the Senior Suite, with the girls' special little space on the second floor, which they loved. In all rooms, the bathrooms were spic and span and spacious, with great, deep bathtubs to soak in, after a day on the cobblestones. I find it hard to understand how anyone could complain about this hotel. The staff is wonderful and genuinely friendly. (Thanks so much to Antonio for the flowers and cake for Nori's birthday -- what a surprise!) You get to meet other folks from around the world at breakfast and late-afternoon. The rooms are cool and totally comfortable. All of our rooms were more than big enough, especially given the reasonable price -- they give you a discount if you stay more than 4 days. Bottom line? Unless you are absolutely married to staying at "just another Hilton or Marriott), you won't find a more Roman and enjoyable stay. I can't recommend it highly enough. Hope this helps, Ken

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am totally disgusted that I fell for this scam hook line and sinker! After blowing over 2000 Euro on a 5 day trip to Rome for 2 children and myself I feel like I have been taken, BIG TIME! Not only is this hotel even 1/10th of what it claims to be, it is worse than you can imagine. The rooms are smelly, cramped and infested. The breakfast provided is a joke, even by european standards. The location is quite possibly the worst in all of Rome. Far from all attractions as well as transportation. Try to call a cab, they refuse to pick up at the hotel, due to tiny unsafe paths leading to the hotel! We booked a Vatican and Colloseum tour throuh the hotel Roman Promenades was the name. It was the most boring, miserable waste of time and money we spent on the trip. The neighborhood is a little scary at night. After 10 pm the streets become empty and vagrants and street youth lurk in the shadows. I would definitely think twice, possibly even 3 or 4 times before booking this overpriced ripoff!

Reviews.Title: “Bello Casa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a bit of paradise in the fast moving city of Rome, then this is your place. The accomidations are up to date, comfortable and the staff are like family. We were very lucky to find such a wonderful location. P.S. the breakfasts are not to be believed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little haven”
Reviews.Author: DancingRhinos
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. An oasis of peace and calm after a day bustling around the tourist attractions of Rome. The rooms are pleasant and the staff helpful and courteous. It is excellent value for a city centre hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three week adventure in France and Italy and the highlight certainly was a two day stay at the Santa Maria. It's conveniently located in the upcoming area of Travestere and the nearby square comes to life after 7:00 p.m. The rooms were large and tastefully decorated. The little patio area in the middle was a perfect place to unwind after exploring all day. The breakfast was great and the appetizers at 5:30 were a perfect way to relax. Internet access was free and it was great to catch up with family and friends. Laundry mat was just at the end of the street so it was easy to do up a quick load. All around, a great place. Would highly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate to have found the Santa Maria in Rome. Our family of four enjoyed meeting many wonderful guests as we enjoyed the fabulous breakfasts and late afternoon cocktail hour. It was perfect, peaceful and charming . The staff was extremely helpful and the service was excellent. We hope to enjoy another stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our 5 weeks travel around Italy in June/July, we stayed 4 nights at the Santa Maria. We were delighted with the hotel, its location and the friendliness of the staff. After a day of the ususal tourist sightseeing in the heat and Rome's diabolical traffic, it was great to return to peace and quiet, (and air conditioning) each evening. Especially welcome was the free buffet. Yes, the hotel is in Trastevere which is going to mean a 10-20 minute walk across the river to the main attractions, but we actually found that it was quicker to walk than take a taxi due to the traffic. Trastevere is old and the streets are narrow, but the area is full of charm and comes alive at night when the restaurants and bars open. We would stay at the Santa Maria again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sftrav
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights in July 2005. We loved the neighborhood - the nearby Piazza Santa Maria is charming and full of people at night, and there are great restaurants all around it. But the hotel itself was quiet and peaceful, with a lovely courtyard where we had breakfast. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. They called numerous cabs for us, suggested guides for touring the Vatican - it was all just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Ending to our Europe Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a delight this little hotel was! We absolutely loved the Trastevere neighborhood in which it's situated. True, most of the "sights" are spread throughout other parts of the City, but the Trastevere neighborhood is a sight in itself: incredible restaurants, cafe's and bars (we could have stayed a week and not sampled them all), music and other entertainment in the Piazza each night (but the rooms were incredibly quiet), wonderful old neighborhood, delightful and safe for late night strolls (a quick and easy stroll across the bridge to Campo di Fiori - the starting point for Rick Steve's "Night Walk Across Rome" which was a blast!). After staying in castles, B & B's and small hotels throughout England, France and Italy on our month-long trip we found Hotel Santa Maria to be a welcome relief: wonderful, modern plumbing.... pretty rooms, air-conditioning, TV, beautiful courtyards, fantastic breakfast bufffet, delicious antipasti spread each evening, FREE internet access... AND the front desk was happy to call for a taxi to take us wherever we wanted to go in the city - no need for a taxi stand nearby (although there was a taxi stand about a one minute walk from the hotel. "Oasis" is the perfect word to describe this little gem in the Trastevere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful oasis in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I lived in Trastevere for 2 years and I knew it was going to be difficult to return to Rome and stay in my beloved neighborhood. The Hotel Santa Maria was an absolute delight. It is in a perfect location, near the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. Despite the chaos of the general area, it is secluded with a wonderful central garden area shaded by canvas umbrellas. Our room was very comfortable, and the bathroom was delightful - definitely a step up from most Italian hotels. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was much more elaborate than the traditional Roman roll and cafe combination. I can't say enough good things about this perfect little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful retreat in the midst of noisy, hectic Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after our visit to Rome and everyone in our party of four felt that our stay at the Hotel Santa Maria was an unexpected highlight of our trip. The rooms were very comfortable and they all overlooked a beautiful courtyard where we could enjoy meeting together outside of our bedrooms. Our daughter and son-in-law, from London, accompanied us on our trip we all agreed that we could not have stayed at a more perfect hotel. The secluded courtyard proved to be a favorite gathering place to sip a glass of wine, devour the delicious appetizers, read or chat about our day. The hotel also has free internet access which proved invaluable to our daughter and son-in-law to check in on colleagues after the London bombings. We all found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful; the location is perfect for those who want to experience an earthier Rome and to be a bit more removed from the bustle of city center. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the tourist area in the heart of Trastevere ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel – small, efficient, personal, and full of character. We almost felt we were staying with friends, rather than in a hotel. We so enjoyed everything about our stay here, from rising each day to enjoy one (or more if you could take it!) of the delicious but strong espresso coffees that were served with a fresh tasty breakfast, returning each afternoon to the welcome coolness of the shaded courtyard for a beer and the scrumptious complimentary buffet. The rooms were small but spotless and contained all you could need (except an iron, but who wants to iron on holiday anyway!). The staff were friendly, especially Chiara – who was a constant source of information from restaurants to directions. Not so good for children as there isn't much to do inside the hotel, but great for stressed-out adults needing some peace and quiet! Being right in the heart of the Trastevere area of Rome, we were surrounded by excellent restaurants (especially Trilussa) and ice-cream parlours - so much nicer than staying in the tourist area of the main part of the city – and make sure you walk up to Giancomo for wonderful views of Rome, only 15 minutes away. The wonderful sights of Rome were all within an hour’s walk – but buy yourself a good streetmap before you go as Rome is a maze of small alleyways and piazzas. We were sorry to leave after only 4 days, but will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis surrounded by a lively area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We'd heard about the Santa Maria from friends of ours who'd stayed there. Was even better than we'd been told. What a way to start a day, with breakfast in the charming giardino. And then just minutes by foot to wonderful piazzas, to the river, to trams and buses to get anywhere. After two wonderful days there, we unfortunately had to move to a suburban hotel for a conference I was attending, but the Rome experience was so much more real right there at the Santa Maria. When next in Rome, we'll be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Wandasue
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is an absolute gem of a place. Our room was clean and quiet. The courtyard is a delightful space for breakfast and afternoon relaxing. We found we could walk to just about everthing we wanted to see. We loved wandering the streets and piazzas of Trastevere. What a vibrant area! Our favorite part of each day was sharing nibbles and wine with the other hotel guests in the courtyard. We exchanged travel stories, books, and restaurant recommendations. We will recommend the Hotel Santa Maria to our friends, an we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, fantastic find in the middle of a big, noisy city”
Reviews.Author: jditta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was fabulous!!! Situated in the heart of Trastevere, this hotel is "a gem in the rough". It's a little hard for the taxi to get to because of the small cobblestone streets, but we made it! We researched hotels for several months and were very excited that rooms were available for our vacation (we booked 6 months ahead). We stayed for 5 nights and had 2 rooms. The rooms were very clean and the property was just perfect. The rates extremely reasonable. The staff couldn't have been nicer. They gave us cartons of milk for our baby to keep in the mini-frige in our room. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard full of citrus trees and flowers where you enjoy breakfast or just relax with a glass of wine. The breakfasts (the crossiants and cappucinos were our favorite) were great and the afternoon snacks delicious. It was so nice to return to the quite surrounding of Hotel Santa Maria for a glass of wine after a long day in the hot, noisy city. We will definitely return. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute that we spent at the Hotel Santa Maria. It was a wonderful retreat after a day of touring among the hustle and bustle of Rome. The location made it very safe and fun for dinners out on foot. The staff was so helpful and courtious. Over breakfast or cocktails the other guests that we talked to loved it as well. It was surely a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria for 3 nights May 2005. I am remiss in not writing this review sooner. We booked 3 rooms (a single, a double and a triple) and everything from making the initial reservation to checkout was a lovely experience. The hotel staff was very helpful in arranging transportation from the airport and also local taxis. Complimentary internet access and evening snacks were much appreciated. Full bar available. Close to restaurants. We had seen reviews mentioning the location was not "close in" to tourist sites, but we found the Trastevere section of Rome to be wonderful. We walked to all the tourist sites, only requiring a taxi for my 80 year old mother-in-law. But even she was able to walk to the Pantheon and other sites from Trastevere. Highly recommended - an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MEAK
Reviews.Content: Charming, idyllic oasis near the midst of a crazy busy and gritty Rome. Funky neighbourhood that comes alive at night with lovely cafes, osterias and enotecas. Our impression upon nearing the hotel was guarded as the area is definitely mixed with street people and graffiti, however, you really feel that you get a flavour of how real Romans live. Great access to the tram and buses which are a breeze to get you around the city. We were there with our 2 daughters who loved the tranquility that the hotel courtyard offered after hectic days of sightseeing. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with the booking”
Reviews.Author: KOHG
Reviews.Content: Just like a previous reviewer, I never actually stayed at this hotel. I booked in April 2005 to stay in July 2005 and received a confirmation email back. However three weeks before we were due to go to Rome, I received an email from them which was cc'd to another traveller with the same surname. To cut a long story short it turned out that a week after I had booked the hotel, a booking was received from another couple with the same surname. Despite the second booking coming from a different email address, the hotel assumed it was me changing my booking, so they cancelled my booking without informing me. The mistake only came to light when I asked the hotel to book me a taxi from the airport in July and they replied saying that I wasn't staying with them in July anymore. By the time I found out, it was too late to get into the hotel for the dates I'd originally booked and therefore I've had to find acommodation elsewhere at short notice. In addition to this the hotel had included my credit card details on the email to the other couple and therefore I've had to cancel my credit card. I think this was a genuine mistake but doesn't give a very professional image of the hotel. All I received was a brief apology and an assurance that this was a one-off. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, full of character”
Reviews.Author: jonboy96
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is a truly charming and unique hotel, perfectly situated within the Trastevere district of Rome. Trastevere is a lively and endearing part of the city, yet Hotel Santa Maria is very peaceful with its laid back atmosphere and gorgeous courtyards. Breakfast at the hotel offered a nice selection of bread, pastries, fruit, eggs, meat and cheese and the cappucino was especially refreshing. A complimentary buffet is also laid on late every afternoon, which is very welcome after a hard days sight-seeing. The staff were friendly and helpful although perhaps not as exceptionally so as at other hotels we stayed at in Italy. Our one criticism would be that we felt that the room was not of the luxurious standard expected for such a high-priced hotel. Having said that it was still comfortable and well kept. All in all Santa Maria is a charming, welcoming base from which to see Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A cool place in a hot city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something a little different to the stereotype hotel base. Right in the middle of the lovely Trastavere, we found it at the Santa Maria: rooms were small but pretty & fully equipped and it was a tucked away cool oasis to return to after a hot day's tramp around Rome in June. No traffic noise, easy access to everywhere, realistically priced - we loved it. Faults? maybe it would be nice if snacks/bar had been available throughout day (closed 10-4) but hey, outside in Trastavere are a thousand little cafes, so no real problem. Value for money, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: moo_moo78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner in January this year. We loved it. - Rome is a great place to visit but is incredibly busy- and this hotel was a great place to return to after sightseeing. - we booked the hotel through emails with the hotel, and transfers to and from the airport as it was a bit of a trek. - the driver was polite and the car very comfortable - the journey took hardly anytime at all. - when approaching the hotel - its very tucked away and we were glad to have been picked up from the airport as we may not have found it the first time on our own. The Hotel staff were polite - and not at all rude. The room was large and clean - with a fantastic bathroom. As we stayed in January we didn't get a chance to use the courtyard but i imagine it would be a nice place to sit out in the sun with a drink and relax when your feet are tired from sightseeing! The breakfast was very nice, their was a variety of foods. The area the hotel was in was fine. - there is a beautiful church nearby which is worth a visit. - and several restaurants which serve great food - so you don't have to trek far for dinner. It is a bit of a walk to some of the sights - but worth it because you then see so much more on the way. I would recommend this hotel - especially going in winter as it is cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days and 6 nights with two nieces aged 15 and 12. The breakfasts were wonderful, and the staff was generally helpful and friendly. Coming back from the long walks that we took during the day, the hotel always seemed like our home away from home. Since coming back to the States, we've especially missed the nearby churchbells chiming off the quarter hours. We found the surrounding neighborhood exciting. (But not too exciting.) The hotel was a big part of a wonderful trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for three nights in late May 2005. We were thrilled with our stay at the hotel and found it a perfect place to come back to at the end of a (very) hot day. We were in room #1 which is situated behind some of the other rooms and is the only room back there. The room has it's own patio, table and chairs and has a variety of plants around the patio, making it a great quiet place to sit and read (or drink all the wine we bought). Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great tranquil oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 teenagers and I stayed for 4 nights in mid June. It was a very tranquil setting in a very unusual area of Rome. The service was good, the breakfast was very good. Trastevere is located on the other side of the river which has it's good points and bad. It is located by many, many great restaurants; on the other hand it is far from the major sights which requires that you either walk a lot to your destination and then walk a lot more or you take a taxi, which can add up to a lot of Euros. It is also very expensive but since everything in Italy is EXTREMELY expensive at least you get your money's worth. If I return to Italy some day I will stay once again at Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't want to be near the spanish steps this is for you”
Reviews.Author: nachalgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in May. We hate the Spanish Steps area. Too many tourists shopping. The rooms were fine, the staff more than helpful, the courtyard a delight and the breakfast and free hors d'oeurves delicious. Althought the Santa Maria di Trastevere square is very crowded, especially at night, we couldn't hear anything from our room as they all faced the courtyard. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and stayed at Hotel Santamaria. We'd been touring all of Italy and we can honestly say this was one of the most pleasant places we stayed in our entire trip. The staff was very attentive and the place was pristine and peaceful. Certainly did not feel like we were in Rome! It was central to all of the wonderful sites but it was a nice place to come to at the end of each day. Highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 memorable days exploring the sights of Rome with Santa Maria as a base. Travastere is an excellent place to stay being within easy walking distance of the majority of the sights of Rome and also well served by numerous restaurants. The hotel was well maintained with friendly and courteous staff who went out of their way to accomodate our needs. It was pleasant after a days sightseeing to relax in the hotel garden area with a glass of wine and chat to other guests.

Reviews.Title: “A fun ending to our trip.”
Reviews.Author: EdandEm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for two days at the end of a cruise. It was a perfect ending to a great trip. The staff was great, charming setting, excellent breakfasts, and evening buffet. Everybody was extremely helpful. Sure the rooms were a bit small, but we did not go there to spend our time in the room. They were very clean, and we never heard the noise others have alleged. Even the bells of Santa Maria were charming. We walked the area all day and in the evening, and it's very old and different,, but we never felt threatened. The restaurants staff recommended were great. Our all day tour with Roman Promenades (ask for Stefano) was the highlight of our trip. Car service was super, and those who want it to be like home should just stay home, as they are not going to be happy anywhere else anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria proved for us to be a tranquil oasis, just as advertised. Being central to most points of interest in Rome, we were able to take walking tours. It was so relaxing , upon our return to the Hotel, to laze in the garden with a delicious cappuccino. We found the restaurants close-by to be delightful, enabling us to enjoy Roman nightlife, while dining on the outdoor patios. The narrow, winding streets were just as one imagined, and Villa Santa Maria, being nestled privately in a lovely courtyard, allowed us to enjoy a delicious breakfast in perfect tranquility in the pretty garden. We were well taken care of by a very efficient, caring staff; one of whom even guided us to and from the Hotel through the maze of one-way streets. Thank you for a most pleasant stay !

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed seven nights at the Santa Maria and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times. From this delightful base we walked all over Rome from the Villa Borghese down to Circus Maximus. Only hiccough was trying to find the hotel when we initially arrived - even the taxi driver couldn't find it - next time we would get a direct transfer from the airport organised by the hotel. A thoroughly charming hotel - enjoy. Dave & Judith Williams PS Literally round the corner is a lovely restaurant - "Casseta di Trastevere" in Piazza Renzii (good food reasonably priced)

Reviews.Title: “Real Review”
Reviews.Author: jdsf73
Reviews.Content: After staying at this hotel 3 weeks ago, and looking over the reviews today, I can't help but be suspicious there are a lot of people writing reviews with ulterior motives in mind. Here, then is the low-down on this hotel and the neighborhood of Trastevere ( impossible to describe pronunciation). The neighborhood is a local favorite and really comes alive at night, especially around Piazza Santa Maria. Restaurants throughout the area offer great and reasonably priced Italian eats, and the neighborhhod offers a great backdrop for a warm evening or after-dinner stroll. While there is trash and graffiti very visible, it does not do too much to diminish the relaxing affect the area produces. I highly recommend at the very least visiting and having dinner near the square when you are in Rome. As for the hotel. My wife and I really liked it. It's certainly not fancy, but the service is above average, and the courtyard, which is exclusively for guests, is a great retreat from the hussle of this sometimes maddening city. It is also a great place to wind down and enjoy a glass of wine with some local cheeses, hams and olives (on the house) ater a busy day seeing the magnificent sites of Rome. The location is perfect. A twenty minute walk to the Vatican, 15 minutes to the Colloseum and Forums, and about 5-10 minutes to Piazza Novano and the Pantheon. I dont know what map a previous reviewer was reading when they said it took 30-45 minutes to see anything interesting...heck in Rome you can throw a rock in any direction and you will hit some site of historical or architectural interest. So I hop-e this helps...we were really helped with reviews of this place and felt obligated to add our own. Next time in Rome there is no doubt we will stay here again. Unless of course I can afford the Hassler, but I'm not counting on it.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it so much”
Reviews.Author: korehades
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria in Jan and I am already planning my next visit to Rome because of Trastevere. I was going to stay near Piazza di Spagna and it would have been a HUGE mistake. Yes, you have to walk 20/30 min to get to major tourist attractions, but when you get back to the hotel your not in the midst of millions of noisy tourists and citty traffic.. The hotel is in a quiet (except for the chuch bells, which I love), romantic, medieval location. I can't hardly wait...

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FelixStowe10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Santa Maria for 4 nights in May/June and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Surprised to see a couple of poor reviews recently and hopefully this will in some way put the record straight. Location - the hotel is situated in Trastevere on the west side of the river and is perhaps half a mile away from some of the main sights like the Vatican and the Colosseum. We found it easy enough to walk around the City but accept that this might not suit everyone - however there are buses, trams and the metro as alternatives. One of the charms of the hotel is that it is not a modern hotel in the centre of the city but in an area that has not been overdeveloped and has plenty of small restaurants, shops and cafes nearby. Accommodation. The bedroom was not large but it was well equiped and we spent most of the waking hours either in the city or in the courtyard where we had breakfast or relaxed in the late afternoon. The breakfast was fine - reasonable choice and good quality - not much in the way of a full English breakfast it is true. Staff. We found everyone helpful and pleasant. In summary. A hotel with charm, friendly staff and unusually quiet in a city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “find of the year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well where to start! Hotel Santa Maria is set in the Trastevere about 5 to 10 minutes walk to all the major sites in Rome.walked every where and it was a pleasure to return from the hustle and busle of Rome to the peace and tranquility of the Hotel and its staff.The staff made you feel relaxed and welcomed and always there to help.rooms were very comfortable and contained everything needed for an enjoyable stay. Will definately be returning and recommending it to all of our friends and family. A real sanctuary

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Gates”
Reviews.Author: Macbit
Reviews.Content: After many evenings of searching the web and constantly returning to Hotel Santa Maria's website, from the moment we passed through the gated entrance we knew we had made the perfect choice. It was a delight for my husband and I to spend 3 nights at The Hotel Santa Maria during the beginning of May. Our only regret during the stay in Italy was that we did not spend more time at Hotel Santa Maria before moving on to the Amalfi Coast. In previous visits to Roma we had always stayed in hotels but this time we wanted something intimate and charming yet still within walking distance of the sights and we found it all at Hotel Santa Maria. The fact that Hotel Santa Maria is a converted convent was a clue that the rooms would be cozy but then most hotel rooms in cities such as Roma are. We stayed in Room 4 which was very clean and well kept with a very nice modern bathroom. Ten years ago native Romans had recommeded a wonderful restaurant to us in Trastevere so we were somewhat familiar with the area having gotten lost in our search of the restaurant and found the area to be quaint, with a neighborhood feel and close proximity to everything in Rome. We were intrigued by the narrow cobblestone streets and even the graffiti on the walls. We found wonderful little shops with local artists who were very friendly and a pleasure to meet. All of the staff at Hotel Santa Maria was more than willing to help with our arrangements and to make our stay in Rome exceptional. Beginning with the emails for reservations and arranging a driver to pick us up at the airport through to our final farewell we were always confident that the entire staff had our best interests in mind. The help we received in scheduling the "best" tours was greatly appreciated as were the various recommendations for restaurants. The courtyard provided an excellent place to relax between our afternoon and evening activities. From the appetizers served in the evening with the most delicious bruchetta we have had, to the wine suggestions we received to complement them; to the breakfast which was outstanding especially dining in the outdoor courtyard, we could not have expected more. We want to thank all of the Staff as well as the Proprietors of Hotel Santa Maria for making our stay in Rome so wonderful and please know that we look forward to a return visit to Rome and will definitely choose Hotel Santa Maria. Thank you and Best Regards to you and yours, Carl & Mary Ann

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Pots
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Santa Maria and stayed there after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived late at night in transport arranged by the hotel (there were six of us with luggage and the minibus was very reasonable - 70 Euros, which is cheaper than the two taxis we would have needed). The driver was very courteous and helpful and knew exactly where he was going. This was important as the hotel is quite hard to find, located off the historic Piazza Santa Maria, but really only accessible on foot for the last part of the journey. We decided to use the same transport for our return journey, which meant being collected at 5.30am. The minibus was exactly on time and again, the driver was friendly and helpful. On arrival at the hotel we were told that there was a problem with one of the 3 rooms we had booked. We were disappointed and worried but were told that one couple would be put in a larger suite for the whole stay at the same price as a standard double and that another couple would then have to move into the suite for the last night. The suite was lovely and very large. Four of us sharing on the last night was not a problem at all as there were two toilets etc and we had to leave very early anyway. All of the rooms were very clean and well equipped for the price. The bathrooms were lovely, with powerful showers as well as baths and bidets. If you are sensitive to noise, this may not be the place for you. You can hear the bells from the nearby (beautiful) Santa Maria church and the fact that the rooms open out onto a central courtyard can make it slightly noisey at times but in our opinion, no more so than any other city hotel. We enjoyed the breakfasts which had an extra special twist on the usual European continental breakfasts, with homemade cakes and pastries and fresh fruit. We enjoyed great weather which enabled us to eat in the wonderful courtyard (photos included). The breakfast room becomes a tranquil bar in the evening (open until 10pm) complete with free, delicious canapes (bruschetta, cheese, ham, olives). The staff were very friendly and helpful. We easily explored all the sites of Rome on foot from the hotel, although realistically these are approximately 30 mins walk away (at a slow stroll). We knew this from the Trip Advisor reviews and decided we would rather walk during the day then be closer to a good choice of restaurants close to the hotel in the evenings. The area surrounding the hotel compromises tiny cobbled streets with a huge variety of restaurants and bars, which are much better value than those in the centre of Rome near the main sites. It was great to get away from the tourist track in the evenings and still be only 5 mins walk from our beds ! Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is tired of large, boring chain hotels and really wants to experience a more 'real' sense of Rome. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria is great!”
Reviews.Author: Jillgoes2europe
Reviews.Content: In April I was with a small group tour in Italy. We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. The hotel was lovely. I saw all 5 of the rooms our group stayed in. The rooms were spotless and looked just like they do on their website. The bathrooms were wonderful. All new tile and beautiful fixtures. The courtyard and breakfast room area are charming. There is a convenient computer you can use in the breakfast room - but not during breakfast. The breakfast food was great. You could get cappuccino refills and they had some really delicious pastries in addition to the usual meats, cheeses, breads etc. One of the best things about the hotel was the service. I especially liked the young girl who works in the breakfast room/bar in the afternoons and evenings. I wish I could remember her name because she was so nice and helpful. I also enjoyed talking to her whenever she had a free moment. The office staff was helpful and friendly even though our group had some cancellations and unexpected late arrivals. They were polite, helpful and calm during all these unexpected changes. I especially love the location and setting of this hotel. It is within its own walls and a world unto itself in the middle of Trastevere. It is 5 minutes from Ponte Sisto Bridge. Campo Fiori and Piazza Navona are just across that bridge. (10-15 minute walk at tops) It is surrounded with great restaurants in all directions. Trastevere and Hotel Santa Maria combine to provide a wonderful place from which to visit Rome. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a wonderful hotel and made for a wonderful experience in Roma. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. The hotel is centered around a lush courtyard with orange trees and umbrella-shaded patio tables. Delicious and comprehensive breakfast each morning along with excellent fresh brewed coffees. Friendly staff made bruschetta with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and olive oil - perfect accompaniment to a bottle of chianti to enjoy on the patio. My husband and I loved this hotel, have already recommended it to friends, and hope to return someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is an oasis in the lively city of Rome. Fantastic staff, which gave us a warm welcome, splendid transfers and great accommodation. Their service is absolutely remarkable. The hotel is close to most of the historical sites, but located in the middle of delicious Trastavere with its great restaurants and bars. We would recommend this hotel to everybody travelling to Rome. We sure hope to return again ...

Reviews.Title: “Roman Idyll”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was perfect for our stay in Rome: quiet, charming, relaxing with an incredibly helpful staff. Definitely our new, first choice place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria on our last night in Rome. I had done a lot of research and was looking forward to getting off of the train from Naples and relaxing in the courtyard. We were not disappointed! We stayed in Room 1, which was tucked away off to the side with it's own small courtyard area. The staff was very friendly and eager to assist us. I only wished there had been room at the hotel for the first part of our stay in Rome...the neigborhood was fantastic and much more reasonable in cost for meals than the Piazza Navona area. I would highly recommend reserving the "car" to the airport. Well worth the cost. My only suggestion would be to post exact directions to the hotel on the website from the train station or airport. Our taxi left us off on a main street with a bit of a hike and we had to hunt a bit for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillHandBeckyS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in the charming and comfortable Hotel Santa Maria. It is well situated for Rome sightseeing (walking or using public transit) and yet is away from the crowds. English-speaking staff was very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast buffet (in a lovely room) breaks from Italian tradition and offered eggs (!). If you drive to the hotel, get good directions and forget the SUV; narrow alleys leading to hotel are part of its charm. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quality and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: SteveKink
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria was truly a find. We wanted something slightly away from the normal tourist traps but still within walking distance of the sights. Its location in Trastevere, provided a neighborhood feel and access to the everything in Rome. The price was very reasonable which included an outstanding breakfast which was the best we found while in Italy. But those are just the logistics of the stay. The service by the staff was outstanding. We arrived late on a Sunday night and were met by a driver at the airport who took us quickly to the Hotel in a Mercedes. They were expecting us and from that point on we received excellent attention by the entire staff. The little courtyard provided an excellent place and opportunity to relax with drink and light food service between the afternoon and nighttime tourists activities. We felt safe at all times and the bells from the Santa Maria Church added to the charm. We entertained others in the courtyard that were staying in other places in Rome, they loved the our little Hotel. I would recommend this Hotel without hestitation to those looking for a neighborhood feel, a decent price, comfortable accommodations and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa-Maria is a quiet haven in the bustling city of Rome. Very well located in the heart of the medieval Trasteverre district, the hotel and its helpful staff provide a comfortable place to return to after a full day of sight-seeing. The Trasteverre neighbourhood itself was a pleasant surprise - authentically Roman without all the tourist trimmings, it is jam-packed with good, inexpensive restaurants and for those so inclined, a wonderful church (the Church of Santa-Maria) that is a nice local parish counterpoint to some of the bigger and better known churches in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: South59
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights early May. Recommend the taxi organised by the Hotel as it’s quick and effortless but a little expensive. The Hotel is set in a very tranquil courtyard surrounded by local buildings but never felt overlooked and cramped. It certainly was peaceful when returning from the hectic Rome attractions and found the staff helpful, friendly and efficient. Can also recommend the breakfasts, plus freshly made coffees. Do not be put off by the local area, it may have graffiti but we never felt threatened and once night came it was transformed into a great local Italian scene. Enormous choice of restaurants in great piazzas. This is a unique Hotel, not a chain so if that’s what you are used too avoid this, if you want a little piece of real Rome stay here...you will love it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in Rome for four days. We found the accomodations clean and attractive. The location is an oasis of quiet in a big city. The breakfast was quite good and had a wide variety of food. The staff speaks fluent english and is most helpful. Their free internet service is a plus. There are many excellent restaurants in the neighborhood within easy walking distance. We took a taxi to several locations within the city and walked back to the hotel. The trolly and bus are a short distance away. All in all I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Orange Blossom Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The smell of orange blossoms wafted through the morning air, awakening my weary, bedraggled, travel-worn senses. I so, SO loved the hotel—it was a surreal oasis, a refuge from the the bustle of the city—truly out of this world. Thank you for the memories of a lifetime. Hazel

Reviews.Title: “#1 ranking is well deserved!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in April 2005. We chose it primarily because of its #1 ranking here and the reviews we read and we were not disappointed! This hotel is in a great part of Rome to stay (Trastevere, across the river) and has the wonderful quality of feeling sheltered and quiet at night. The staff was wonderful and their restaurant recommendations sent us to the best food for the best prices that we ate on our entire three week trip. We stayed here for five nights and we treated wonderfully the whole time. Our room was cozy and clean and we had a large bathroom with a tub. Everything was immaculate, breakfast was great and the city is a convenient walk, taxi ride, bus or metro away. We just can't say enough for this wonderful establishment!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Finding Hotel Santa Maria completely changed our view of Rome for the better. The staff was attentive and thoughtful, the location so very interesting, the hotel itself such an oasis in the midst of a busy city--we loved it! Our previous experiences in Rome have been in expensive boutique hotels in the middle of the tourist areas and have offered none of the views of life or the peace of Hotel Santa Maria. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “A charming oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A quiet gem tucked a few yards from the bustling Santa Maria Plaza. Rooms surround a lovely courtyard where we would unwind in the late afternoon over capaccino and bruchettas. The staff were kind and thoughtfull.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for Easter Weekend 2005. It was our first trip to Europe. We had booked on the Internet for ourselves and another couple. I had high anxiety about booking unknown accommodations not only for my husband and me, but good friends, too. After we had been in Rome for 2 days and had come to love Rome and the Hotel Santa Maria, I finally had the nerve to ask our friends what they were thinking as the taxi driver delivered us to the Hotel Santa Maria. The response from our charmingly candied doctor friend was. “ I was thinking we were screwed, but it turned out to be absolutely wonderful”. Don’t let the narrow alleyways and fear of the unknown keep you from staying at the Hotel Santa Maria. It was wonderful. All four of us would stay at the Santa Maria again in a heartbeat. One tip I picked up from reading the reviews worked great. Because the Hotel Santa Maria is not one of the major hotels, the taxi drivers don’t know how to get there. If you make reservations, ask them to e-mail you driving instructions from your arrival point. We requested, via e-mail, and they provided driving instructions from the train station to the hotel and the approximate cost of the taxi. It worked great. No delays, we went straight to the hotel and it only cost $15 euros plus a tip for all 4 of us in one taxi. Go for it! P.S. We booked private tours from the Roman Promenades linked to their site. These were great, too.

Reviews.Title: “we miss it !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An haven of harmony in the center of the overwhelming (and frenetic ) splendor that is Rome. Adding to our Roman holidays' wonderful memories. Thank you to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional and Delightful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just retruned from four days at the Hotel Santa Maria in the Rome neighborhood of Trastevere. This small botique Bed and Breakfast (21 rooms) prides itself with great facilities and a positive and service oreinted staff. Breakfasts were the best we found in our two and a half weeks in Italy. The Courtyard were wine, beer and hors d'oeuvres are served at 6 PM is a very comfortable place to unwind and meet other guests after a busy day of touring Rome. Also free internet service is available. The Hotel is located near many Piazza's where great food, historical sites and people watching can be found. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Church Bells/I Can't believe no one else has mentioned this”
Reviews.Author: jjb02171
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at hotel Santa MAria for a week in April. The breakfast, location, staff, etc were all fine, but there was one major problem and I cannot believe no one has mentioned this. The hotel is one block away from the Santa MAria Piazza and church. The church bells ring every 15 minutes 24 hours a day! I kid you not. At 11:00 pm the bells ring 11 times At 11:15 pm they ring 11 times and a chime for 15. At 4:00 am the bells ring 4 times and so on. This goes on 24 hours a day so unless you are a vers sound sleeper I would not reccomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJBBoise_Idaho
Reviews.Content: My parents and I recently returned from a lovely stay at the Hotel Santa Maria and were delighted with everything about the hotel. We were in the Mansard Suite, which was spacious, although it took a few days to adjust to the low sloping ceilings. The staff, particularly Antonio and Titsiana, are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious, served by gracious people. Although I have stayed at more deluxe hotels in other European cities, but have never enjoyed a place more than this. Also, please remember to be a thoughtful visitor whenever traveling abroad... There was an American guest at the hotel who came to breakfast in his pajama bottoms and socks. That sort of behavior, coupled with loud and demanding requests, make us look bad in foreign eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and friendly Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: barbara1958
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay in this charming hotel. It was centrally placed for access to major tourist sites, yet the orange blossom scented shade of the court yard provided a calm and serene haven. All the staff were friendly, helpful and very welcoming. They were particularly attentive when my mother was unwell. We would certainly stay there again should we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere and Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed in the Hotel Santa Maria in April 2005 as part of our honeymoon. We simply loved the place. The rooms are modern and spotlessly clean but none of the charm of the cloistered courtyard is lost. The staff were all extremely helpful and the breakfast was delicious. The staff even left us some bubbly and nibbles on the first night of our stay to congratulate us on our wedding - much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in the heart of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an American who has lived in Europe since 2000. Hotel Santa Maria has the most helpful, customer-oriented and friendly staff of any hotel I have stayed at in the past 5 years, including 4 and 5 star locations. Cozy and comfortable rooms recently renovated. Free internet access and bikes to borrow are great benefits. Great courtyard that you will find it difficult to leave from in the morning because its such a nice spot! The only slight downside is the Trastevere location. Trastevere is a fun spot, especially for eating, but it is slightly isolated from most of the tourist locations you will likely want to visit in Rome. Prepare to walk a lot or to use taxis, which the staff are happy to order for you. Other than that, I would give this hotel 6 stars if I could...

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gerapage
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight nights at the Hotel Santa Maria at the end of April 2005. We loved everything about it. It was like a little oasis in the lively neighborhood of Trastevere. The setting was so charming and the rooms were perfect. They were immaculate, a nice size, and opened up to a lovely courtyard filled with orange trees and comfortable wrought iron tables and chairs. The morning breakfasts, which can be taken in the dining room or outdoors in one of the courtyards, were something we looked forward to every morning. Every afternoon, they served wonderfully fresh bruschetta. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful. Also, the location of the hotel is very convenient to many of the major attractions in the old city - many are no more than a fifteen minute walk away through charming, winding streets and across the beautiful Tiber river. The neighborhood has plenty of good relatively inexpensive restaurants, the best of which the staff is happy to recommend. We enjoyed ourselves very much, and would be happy to return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Santa Maria for a 3 day break in Rome with my wife after seeing the overall Tripadvisor # 1 rating, reading visitor's reviews, visiting their website and viewing their video clip. We were delighted to have stayed there and I can add very little to the vast majority of the many excellent reviews from previous visitors which have put it into the No. 1 spot. I would find it hard to imagine a better location as we were able to walk comfortably to all the major city attractions (and the more leafy Janiculum Hill above Trastevere) at a leisurely pace in little more than 15 - 30 mins at most. Trastevere has so much atmosphere with it's narrow cobbled streets and tiny piazzas that you get a buzz from being one of it's residents whilst having the best of both worlds in being able to withdraw into the privacy and peace of the Hotel Santa Maria and it's courtyard when you have overdosed on a very busy Rome for the day (our stay coincided with the selection of Pope Benedict) Even if that fails to recharge your batteries for the evening, you have only one or two minutes' walk to find one of many excellent restaurants / pizzerias to suit your taste and pocket using the complimentary map of Trastevere provided by the hotel Yes, our taxi driver gave up too, leaving us with a hundred or so yards to walk with baggage to find the hotel in heavy rain but it was a small price to pay. When (not if) we visit Hotel Santa Maria again, we will definitely use the airport car service arranged by them which at 50 Euros is worth paying considering it cost 35 Euros to travel by airport bus into Rome then taxi to Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Trastevere Treat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from our five night Roman Holiday and what a pleasure it was after a hard day's sightseeing to return to the calm of Santa Maria and its peaceful setting. The courtyard was a real haven for a quiet drink and relaxation. A place to share experiences with fellow guests and learn of new sights to visit. Our room was immaculate and had all conveniences that we needed. A short amble through the courtyard led us to a super breakfast room and evening bar. We were glad of the free internet access available keeping us in touch with home easily. Breakfast buffet kept us going for hours until the local bars and pavement cafes lured us in for more fabulous food and wine. We would both thoroughly recommend this hotel and Trastevere as a place to stay in Rome. Pack comfortable shoes to tackle the cobbled streets and within 20-30 minutes most of the main sights are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: dgr1968NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Santa Maria and cannot say enough good things about it! It totally made our Rome experience a great one. The rooms were spotless, the staff extremely friendly, and they went out of their way for for us time and time again. Also, having been throughout Italy (and Europe) the breakfast (included!) is fresh and amazing!! We enjoyed the quietness that the hotel has as it's situated in a non-touristy part of the city, and also took advantage of its wine bar (with complimentary bruschetta) every night before venturing out to dinner. We were unfamiliar with the Trastevere area but the hotel was perfectly located among some amazing restaurants. This is definitely somewhere I'd stay again and again and am planning to do so the next time we're in Rome. Antonio at the front desk was extremely helpful in his wine suggestions and at the end of our trip, getting us a taxi to the airport for only 50 euro! I would recommend Hotel Santa Maria to all of my family and friends. As their website states, it is a true oasis.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice for your Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: A nice property in a Trasteverre, a great location from which to get a real feel for Rome. The location is within walking distance of many sites inlcuding the Forums and the Vatican. The staff are polite, attentive and efficient. The rooms are comfortable and, although not roomy, fully adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet...a hidden gem amidst a chaotic city!”
Reviews.Author: RobertTG
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night April stay was better than expected, having just come from Venice where the price was twice what we paid at the S. Maria...$165 EU/nt. seems a relative bargain + it had the best breakfast & nice large tub/shower & internet. Be sure to request the 'Rick Steves' discount when booking, and pay w/ cash...otherwise it's $210. As to Rome, we doubt if we'll be back. Graffitti everywhere, horrendous traffic, and bland food (where are the delicious sauces?) Your life it at risk whenever crossing a street. Forget obeying traffic signals...they mean nothing in Rome. Why don't the restaurant restrooms have toilet seats? Thank God for the Santa Maria!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from our first visit to Rome. We had the most wonderful time and that was not only due to the beautiful city that Rome is but also due to the hotel we stayed in. I would recommend the Hotel Santa Maria to anyone wanting a real taste of Italy. Waking up every morning and looking out onto a courtyard of orange trees was perfect! The friendly staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. The area Trastevere is a real gem. You can escape from the tourists and immerse yourself in the Italian way of life. There are so many excellent restuarants and bars in the area that you will be spoilt for choice. We particularly liked coming back through the main piazza at night and watching the street entertainers! You are guaranteed to enjoy your trip to Rome if you stay at the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: everything we read about this hotel was true and more. we loved it! the room, #20 with a special birdseye window upstairs was an added bonus we loved looking out that window. the only thing about the room is if you are 5'11' or taller the ceiling is peaked in the bedroom.IT was fine for us and my husband is 6' bt just a note if it matters to you. downstairs was fine in living area. but for the price to have 2 rooms!!! Bathtub was wonderful after a long day. breakfast was good and plentiful.their bread was the best we had in rome. the breakfast room was lovely. the staff was friendly , helpful and went out of their way to make our stay terrific. Antonio thank you we will definately be back and bring our family. Trestevere is my favorite part of rome

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. An oasis in the middle of everything. We are planning our next trip now and The Santa Maria is the only choice for us in Rome. Many thanks to all the staff for all your help during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- A bit overprice though”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points: great area, really charasmastic, very italian feel, super little cafes and bars in windy cobbled lanes, dark and atmospheric at night (but felt safe). Easy access to all tourist spots, very pretty grounds, tidy and clean rooms. Great shower. Pay cash and get a discount. Bad points: I personally think this hotel is over priced. Breakfast was ok (not "amazing" but good yes). You cannot smoke inside anywhere (bars or hotel). You also cannot use an iron in your room (?!). Overall, we did love our stay here. We loved Rome. Trastevere was a super area to stay. I was deciding between 2 hotels and picked the Santa Maria as it was No.1 on this site. However, the second hotel I was thinking of turned out to be right next door and looked nice too (and it was a fair bit cheaper!), it was called the Villa Del a Fonte - so I suggest that one too and if I go back to Rome I would stay in Trastevere again. Coming from London I am used to Graffiti but Rome does seem to have an incredibly high amount but it didn't bother us at all!!

Reviews.Title: “A real star turn in old Rome”
Reviews.Author: Denis_McQuade
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the car arranged by the hotel and were quickly sent in the direction of an inexpensive local restaraunt which was execellnet. The room was a reasonable size but very comfortable, with superb bathroom/shower. It opened into the courtyard which was very relaxing in this bustling district. The breakfast was fine and the sevice attentive. The advice and support from staff throughout was great(especially Antonio). They wanted to help and make the visit enjoyable and expected the places they recommended to be on top of the job. You could walk easily to main attractions, they had free internet access and good discount for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: A great place in a very convenient location. We stayed here for five days / four nights over a weekend. It's a great place - not your typical sterile hotel. It has friendly staff, who are genuinely very helpful with regard to sightseeing ideas, travel planning, food recommendations, and trips to and form the airport. The hotel itself has a central courtyard (actually two of them) where you can sit and eat/drink when the weather is fine. The breakfast is lovely, with great coffee, and runs from 7.30 - 10.30. The rooms are clean and warm, and are arranged around the two courtyards, which have ornage tree growing in them. The location is fantastic - right in the heart of Trastavere, ideal for restaurants and bars, plus a convenient walk to most of the key sites (Vatican, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Forum etc). All in all - I'd recommend it, especially if you're looking for a hotel with a little character that's out of the ordinary. I'll certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this lovely hotel tucked away in Trastavere. It was quiet, charming, with excellent service. The rooms bordered a courtyard filled with tables under orange trees- a wonderful place to sip cappucino or wine in the late afternnon after a long day of walking around Rome.The hotel is conveniently located to bus and tram lines but away from the noise of the center city. Breakfast was good, and the rooms nice-sized and very comfortable.We would recommend this hotel to friends and family without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a very pretty and secluded setting with a delightful garden decorated with orange trees where one could take an aperitif or even have breakfast - not an easy thing to find in Rome! The bedrooms were tastefully decorated and everything was spotlessly clean. We received a warm welcome from all the staff and were particularly impressed by the courteous and helpful attitude of the secretariat. We will definitely recommend the Hotel Santa Maria to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Rome, we stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The location was very good, easy access to public transportation to any major site in Rome. The rooms were large (especially Room #2) and very clean. The courtyard was charming and a great place to relax and have a glass of wine after a long day of sight seeing. The breakfast was excellent, could not have asked for more. We would definetly go back to Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, location is fine”
Reviews.Author: Bluesboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little way from the main tourist routes but this is a strength rather than a negative - all main attractions are easily accessable within a 20 minute walk. Well worth exploring the Trastevere area on an evening as their were many nice bars and the restaurants appeared more reasonable. Would definately stay here again if returning to Rome and have already recomended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but be aware of trade-offs”
Reviews.Author: Tomot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome the last two days of our ten day trip in Italy. I was really excited about staying in the Santa Maria based on all the positive reviews. I can see why some people love this hotel, but I was disappointed and won't be going back their the next time I visit Rome. I will try to list some of the things you should consider (both positive and negative) in deciding if this hotel is right for you: - The hotel is in the Trastevere area, which is an active and interesting neighborhood and is convenient to much of the rest of Rome (especially if you enjoy walking). Trastevere can be very loud at night; it is a popular area with a lot of bars and restaurants - the downside of this is that it can be loud - but this hotel is like a quiet oasis. - Some previous reviewers complained that the "walls are thin"- I did not find that too be the case. I am a light sleeper and I am easily bothered by noise but did not find this to be a problem even though the hotel was full. Maybe we were just lucky to have conscientious guest on either side of our room? - Our room was smallish, but I expect that in a dense European city. - The room was clean but was very dowdy. It looked like the furniture was new but it was very utilitarian and looked like something you would buy at a discount furniture store. I am not sure why they didn't spend a very small amount more to give the room some style. I am not too fussy about mattresses, but I don't think it was a very good one. I was expecting a bit more style and quality in a 200 Euro + room. - The courtyard of the hotel was very nice. - After eating out every night, we decided that we would pick up some food and wine at Volpetti and have it on one of the tables in the courtyard. When I asked for a corkscrew to open the wine, I was told that we were not permitted to eat our own food in the courtyard. We could order wine from their bar and have it in the courtyard but we could not have our own wine. I was miffed by that comment and asked why it had to be their food. The explanation is that it was a Roman law that did not allow them to have guests eat their own food on the hotel grounds. This was a huge disappointment -so we went out to east instead and had the food on the plane the next day. - They had bikes - I think they were complimentary, but maybe they rented them. They looked like good bikes (hybrid bikes i think but maybe they were mt. bikes) and appeared to be in very good condition. - What ever you do, DON'T DRIVE TO THIS HOTEL unless you are familiar with the streets around the hotel. If you are renting a car and Rome is your final destination, return your car somewhere outside of the center city and take a cab to the hotel ---- driving there was an absolute nightmare! - All of the staff was extremely friendly. There was one instance when one of the staff did not seem to take the extra effort to help us locate an address on a map - but other than that everyone was was extremely friendly. - The courtyard may seem cozy, but because all of the rooms are on the first floor, you have to remember to close your blinds unless you are an exhibitionist. In summary, I will not be going back because I know of other hotels which would suit me better for the money. I can understand why a lot of people like the hotel but I can't understand why so many people give it an "Excellent" rating based on its price. If the rate were 120 to 140 Euros, I think I could understand the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place, but extremely overrated by this site”
Reviews.Author: aarnold78
Reviews.Content: 3-star accomodations. Hard to find like everybody mentioned. Also, breakfast is the same as everywhere else I have been in Europe, nothing exceptional. Best asset is the staff, worst asset is the location. Trastevere is covered with graffiti and stench.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay, away from the tourists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good. The hotel is in the old part of Rome called Trastevere. It is within walking distance to anywhere in central Rome. There are a lot of little mom and pop restaurants near the hotel. It's an area that not many tourists would know to stay. The hotel is very, very quiet.(It was a former convent). Breakfast served daily in a breakfast room. In warm weather it is served in a very nice courtyard. Same with the wine bar. Prices were terrific. My room was only about 150 Euroes I believe. Cons: The hotel is on a very, very narrow little street near the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. My driver did not want to venture down the street. But vehicles must be able to make deliveries, etc. Anyway, it was no big deal. My room was very warm, but I think it's because everywhere in Rome was stifling.(it was winter) my room was one of the smallest in the hotel;small and austere. The room had a double bed, small desk and chair, and small bedside stands. Closet, with minibar, was small. Bathroom was standard European sink, toilet, bidet. My room had only a shower, not a tub.

Reviews.Title: “We truly enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful week in Rome and our stay at Hotel Santa Maria added to this special time. Although the rooms are small, they are well-designed and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent, far superior to that at other hotels we've stayed at in Italy. Finally, the staff was considerate and helpful. There was truly a sense that they cared about our experience here.

Reviews.Title: “A reason to visit Rome again”
Reviews.Author: famwiedenhoff
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the very kind staff of the Hotel Santa Maria. We´ll always remember our days in this very good Hotel. We will not hesitate for one second to book it again, if we want to visit Rome again. It´s the best possibility to stay in Trastevere, one of the most beautiful parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: KinnyGraham
Reviews.Content: We've just recently returned from a stay in the Santa Maria and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is excellent and very comfortable and all the the staff were very courteous and helpful. Our open air breakfasts in the charming courtyard were a great way to start the day... As for location, the narrow cobbled streets of Trastavere are well worth exploring - the piazza where the Santa Maria church is located is about a minute from the hotel and is a great place to just sit and watch and soak in the atmosphere - and there is plenty of choice in the mazy streets when it comes to finding somewhere to eat for the evening. As first time visitors to Rome we were a little surprised at the amount of grafitti about - but we soon got used to it and it did little to detract from the overall atmosphere. The main sights of Rome are all easily accessible on foot and we found Trastavere to be an excellent base to strike out from - the Tiber is just nearby and we used the river's many bridges - and the map helpfully provided to us by the hotel - to navigate our way around this amazing city. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place, superbe location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Charming Place: nice rooms arranged like littel appartemens around a nice sitting area under orange trees. Ideal do see the heart of Rom as in walking distance and good public transport connections. Situated in THE evening outgoing area, nice restaurants nearby. Very pleasant wellcome from all of the staff. We spent a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria and it was a delightful getaway nestled in a charming town. Rooms were clean and charming and the breakfast buffet was wonderful. Would definately recommend this to hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in the Senior Suite and we couldn't have had a better stay anywhere in Rome. Like many of the reviews have said ... it truly is an oasis from the hussle and bussle of Rome. All the staff was extremely helpful, recommending tours to take, arranging plans and making calls for us, fixing us cappuccinos and hot chocolate, and always with a smile. I enjoyed hearing the church bells ... which do ring every 15 minutes day and night. The breakfast each morning was a godsend for us. The all-you-can-eat breakfasts included scrambled eggs, an antipasto platter of meats and cheese, breads, sweetrolls, jams, jellies, Nutello, and juices, as well as the coffees of your choice ... expresso, cappuccino, etc. The breakfast saved us lots of time in our busy touring schedule. The only issue we had with the room had to do with the limitation of five people using one bathroom with the suite. Some helpful information ... once we figured out the routes, from the hotel, it took our family of five about 20 minutes to walk to St. Peter's and about the same to the area by the Coliseum. The restaurants close to the hotel are all excellent. When we return, we would definitely return to the Hotel Santa Maria and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Santa Maria. This is a charming hotel in a colorful section of Rome, which gave us a flavor of city life. The breakfast was excellent, cappacinos were plentiful, and the service was great. We would highly recommend a stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A peace refuge in a really magic city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The site, the comfort and the service are completed to take advantage in best of this city and it's 20 centuries of history !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Rest in Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to rest your head in Roma! The hourly ringing of the Church of Santa Maria down the cobblestone street lulled us to sleep at night, and a wonderful buffet and espresso woke us each morning. Within walking distance of everything amazing in Roma and the Trestavere neighborhood offered a not-so-touristy opportunity to enjoy Roman life!

Reviews.Title: “In the thick of things”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. a great base for exploring Rome; thank heavens we took a taxi - we'd never have found it by ourselves! Right in the middle of Trastevere, ideal for restaurants etc. Nice room, pity next doors plumbing is so noisy though, otherwise very peaceful. Very nice staff - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “looking up at life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria sits at the center of an urban canyon, a one-story hotel whose outdoor garden sits like the quiet central stage in an old Roman amphitheater. Walls, windows, and balconies ring it, 3 to 4 stories high on all sides. Cats hunt, housewives hang shirts, canaries sing, radios echo from worlds inside, scents of sauce and grill mix. Sun and shadows move across the canyon's ledges, over flower pots, and into large open windows. Sitting on the slightly hidden stage, among orange trees and flowers, a fragrant local red wine in hand, retreating from a day of seeing sights, still dazzled by the unimaginably regal meals at every corner, the gentle human lifestyles that are the real attraction in this city, and especially in this neighborhood, still surround and comfort the visitor. Not to be taken lightly or quickly...

Reviews.Title: “tom cat”
Reviews.Author: maddiemitt
