Reviews.Content: Perhaps we were unlucky in our room allocation (corner twin) but our room seemed dingy even in the day. Also the smell of tom-cat when we opened the door onto the courtyard was not pleasant. V. interesting part of Rome, though.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for children andf perfect situation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in this hotel with our baby, who is 15 months. The staff were amazing - so friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally situated as you can walk anywhere from it - the Vatican, the colosseum, spanish steps etc. The actual area is full of very good inexpensive restaurants. I can recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with small children as there is a courtyard to play in and the staff spoiled her rotten! In the summer you can sit outside the window when the baby is asleep although it was a bit cold when we were there so we sat in the very nice hotel bar. The staff even arranged take out food for us as there isnt a restaurant on the premises. Also the streets in the area are pretty much pedestrianised. I can think of absolutely nothing negative to say about the place and it seems that everyone else feels the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Escape the tourist hoard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a delightful four-night stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. We have visited Rome on five other occasions and have traveled extensively throughout all of Italy. We found the Hotel Santa Maria to be a most memorable experience. The staff was extremely accommodating, really above and beyond any hotel we have stayed at in all of Italy including the Bellevue Syrene (which we stayed at immediately before coming to the Hotel Santa Maria). They provided wonderful restaurant suggestions, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Our early morning departure to catch a flight (one hour before breakfast) was met with a fresh cappuccino and croissant. At other hotels, (e.g. the Scallinata and the Santa Chiara) we were never treated to that extra attention. We found the hotel to be very quiet, and we both LOVED the nearby church bells, which I only really noticed if I was lying awake in my comfortable bed wondering what time it was. The distant bells would pronounce the time and I would fall back into my dreams. The Trastevere area is away from the main tourist sights, but is also away from the over priced restaurants and the tourist hoards. We ate and ate and walked and walked and didn’t gain a pound. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Santa Maria again, and we intend to buy a chiming clock to remind us of our wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Santamaria is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: dbairdWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santamaria is a wonderful little "find" in the middle of the the Trestevere section of Rome (easy walk to many of the sights). The rooms are on the smaller size, but very comfortable and well-appointed. The staff is particularly helpful (especially Chiara and the owner). We will be back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored boutique hotel with friendly English-speaking staff, a charming courtyard (not much good in February however - freezing!), and extensive tasty breakfast. Not a bargain price, but still well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet spot in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a wonderful, quiet place right in busy and colourful Trastevere. Nice, clean rooms and a beautiful garden with flowers and orange trees. The staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English, the breakfast was very good with various food and fresh fruit. We could easily walk to all the famous sights. In the evening we could choose from lost of small restaurants just around the corner. We enjoyed the stay very much. Mother with son 16 from Norway

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and spent 3 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria. What a quaint hotel! Brightly decorated rooms, plenty of hot water. The staff was friendly and helpful. Just a 10 minute walk from Old Rome. It was wonderful to stay in the Trastevere area with the cobblestone streets & wonderful restaurants and shops. We would highly recommend if you don't want to stay right in the hustle and bustle of the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: fotocoquine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four nights at the Hotel Santa Maria and had a very comfortable stay. We had a junior suite and our 12 year old twins had two single beds downstairs and we had an upstairs loft. The weather was a bit cold in Rome, and the hotel was always warm and welcoming. The hotel is obviously well run and the staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants. Trastevere is a fantastic neighborhood, close to everything, but very unique. We ate at a different restaurant every day and they were all wonderful. To relax before dinner, my husband and I enjoyed reading the international edition of the NY Times, while the kids were glad to use the internet in the cafe area. Breakfast was excellent, as was the service. I would mention a couple things. I had read that the walls were thin. That may have been a problem for me since I'm a light sleeper, but the other guests were very quiet during our stay. (We also tried our best to be quiet!) Also, my husband could not stand up straight in the shower. The bathroom light was a little dim, and there was no window. These are minor details, but it's worth mentioning because if someone is seeking "luxury," it is not luxurious. The room was spotless and we were extremely comfortable. It is worth noting that taxis had problems locating the hotel. Allow extra time if you are making a flight. Thank you for a lovely stay. We hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: mairidh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in Rome and two nights spent at the Santa Maria (they were full for the 3rd night but gave us the name of another hotel which was also very good). What a wonderful stay we had! Such a pity that some taxi drivers don't know where it is and we had to ask in a local shop for the location when the taxi driver just 'dumped' us in the square at 10pm. I would like to suggest to the hotel that they put very detailed instructions about the location on their website. (ie When facing the Santa Maria church go down the lane to the right of it then first right again etc). The small details made our stay exceptional - umbrellas for the use of guests (much needed by us!), bicycles too (although just the thought of riding one in the traffic made me shudder!). There was rather a lot of noise from adjoining rooms but it did not concern us. The church bells were a delight to hear. What surprised me most was that Americans like this hotel. The rooms were small and from my experience in the tourist trade Americans usually require bigger rooms. Then again while we were there it appeared to be Irish and English visitors. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Cascio
Reviews.Content: Highly Recomend!!!!!! Truly an Incredible Experience!!!!!! The staff here was extremely helpful and knowledgeable, from guided tours to great places to eat. If you are looking for an intimate encounter with Rome and the people, this hotel is for you. We felt more like family here than guests. An excellant location, within walking distance to most sites of interest, or a short taxi ride. We can't say enough about the staff and owners at the Hotel Santa Maria, Just Thank You for all your help and kindness during our stay. Can't wait to return. LynnAnn & Craig Cascio

Reviews.Title: “A view from an oasis in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: AlisonYeadon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 6 night stay in this peaceful oasis. The Santa Maria is ideally situated for all the major sites in Rome, Colosseum and Vatican only 20 mins walking distance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are compact and very clean, the only thing missing for us was tea/coffee making facilities in the room although you can buy them at the bar throughout the day. The buffet breakfact was plentiful and varied, more than enough to set you up for the day. A good tip would be to take advantage of the pick up from the airport, although it cost 50 euros I believe it was money well spent as the hotel is difficult to find amongst the historic cobbled streets of Trastevere. Numerous quality restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel make it an ideal choice. Our only regret is that the weather didn't allow us to enjoy the courtyard with its orange trees etc. Will recommend without hesitation to friends who are considering visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: jaxre
Reviews.Content: We just returned after three nights at the Hotel Santa Maria. I found it through this site and we were definitely not disappointed. We arrived from the airport by train and No 8 tram - took about 45 mins in total and it was lovely to walk up from the main road through the maze of cobbled streets. It's tucked away (took us a few minutes to find it even though we were in the right street!) in a little courtyard, surrounded by traditional buildings. Surrounding area lovely, full of tiny cobbled streets, lots of character, and the Church in the square was beautiful. Staff were very helpful, particularly the breakfast team, and the buffet breakfast was great for stoking up before a days sightseeing. Internet in the breakfast room was a bonus and there was a great selection of guide books in there too. Rooms were simple, comfortable and clean - a bit too warm but the heating was adjustable. It felt sightly out of the way initially but actually was a pleasant walk over the nearby bridges to all the places you want to go to in Rome, and it felt like 'coming home' as we crossed the bridge to come back. Would highly recommend it and hope to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service in a peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My anticipation of the stay at Hotel Santa Maria was high. I was not disappointed -- the area was quiet, the service superior, the help from the staff great. Staying the the Hotel Santa Maria was a perfect way to end our trip to Rome and the area. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: NN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the most characteristic neighbourhoods of Rome. The cobbled streets with authentic restaurants give the feeling that you are staying in the more traditional side of Rome. The hotel itself is in a great setting, the rooms are extremely clean and the service is exceptional. The location is ideal if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city but not too far from the sites. We walked to all the main sites from the hotel and this is definately the best way to see Rome, I recommend you take comfortable walking shoes & watch out for the crazy drivers. I feel I should prepare you for the occasional wailing noises, it was suggested that these are birds or cats, we thought these were ghost noises to keep in with the character of the hotel! This certainly didn't spoil our stay but if you are a light sleeper do take ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came here with my partner and kids (boy aged 2 girl aged five) and loved it. Staff very friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were a real treat, even if our two-year-old son didn't quite sit still long enough to enjoy them. Kids loved the bunk beds in our triple. Area fantastic for food and close to everything - daughter threw a Euro into the Trevi Fountain so she will have to return and if so, to Hotel Santa Maria it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debra007
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here and can't say enough about it. Small hotel in wonderful location, great restaurants nearby. Rooms were small, but clean and well kept and breakfast buffet was great. Having free internet access at the computer in the breakfast room was a nice perk, as was the wine bar and the snacks while relaxing over a glass of wine sitting among the orange trees. Biggest plus, however, were the people. Helpful, charming, going out of their way to be helpful. Only drawback was lack of coffee making facilities in the room (I NEED a cup of coffee when I get up). I would absolutely stay there again and would suggest it to anyone who wants charm and personality in a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after 4 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria. The hotel is in a fantastic location just of Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, within walking distance of all the major sights. The hotel felt more like a mini 'home from home' rather than a hotel as unusually the rooms all opened out onto an outdoor courtyard planted with orange trees. The location was not at all touristy and it really felt like we were staying in the 'real' Rome. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were particularly enjoyable. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay in it again if we return to Rome. Bellissimo!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel for short breaks”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 3-day trip to Rome and stayed at this lovely hotel. It has a great location in the Trastevere area, within easy walking of most main sights (or a short taxi ride). Hotel rooms were spotlessly clean, staff friendly and helpful. Very good breakfasts. Excellent value - would definitely stay here again ! Family of four, Hadley Wood, Hertfordshire

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Kviby, Alta, Norhtern Norway, Norway, Europe
Reviews.Title: “Positive strange experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was for me a very special experience, mostly related to the contrast between the hotel and its garden and the surrounding Trastevere milieu. I liked this and will like to retur to it another time, preferbely will more time available. Best regards Sveinung Eikeland Research Director

Reviews.Title: “recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break. The hotel is really great, very clean and in a wonderful quiet oasis. The car to the airport although pricey is a bit of luxury. We found taxis cheap - contrary to the reports, maybe we were lucky. The breakfast, scrambled eggs ham cheese cereals etc is well presented and service is friendly and relaxed. Try and get to St Peters and the Vatican Sistine Chapel on a weekday as the queue was horrendous on the Saturday. You need to spend at least a whole day in the vatican. Have a great time

Reviews.Title: “A place to return to!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at Hotel Santa Maria for the fourth time in just as many years. Lovely hotel, literally an oasis of peace in the middle of the bustling city, with warm and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 teenagers and I spent 2 weeks in Europe this winter. We spent 4 nights each in Rome, London and Paris. We spent our 4 Roman days and nights at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trastevere. (As an aside, I have been to London and Paris before, but never to anywhere in Italy.) Though it definitely ended up as our favorite place of the 3, arriving in Roma is quite a shock to your system! It is much more "foreign" seeming than London or Paris. When we landed in Rome, a driver arranged by the hotel (not employed by them) was waiting to meet us in our terminal. However, no one was there. The streets of Trastevere are like a maze of alleys. And none were really very familiar with that area. Our driver had a large enough vehicle for all 4 of us and our bags, and we were off. Finding the hotel was quite an experience. Trastevere is a wonderful area! It is not touristy. It is more like how real Romans live. But, that being said, it is not laid out to make it easy for tourists to find their way around. (Use the map the hotel gives you once you check in.) Our cabbie drove up, down and around increasingly narrower streets (that looked like US alleys). He finally could get his cab just in the hotel. The hotel itself is small. I think there are only about 20 rooms. You enter a gate off the street, and walk into a courtyard area. All rooms open into this courtyard. Umbrella-covered tables are scattered around the courtyard, making for a wonderful outdoor breaking dining area. Buildings that adjoin the hotel make you realize you are NOT in a resort...you are in a regular Roman neighborhood, as balconies that display laundry, bicycles and such are there in view. We rented the Sr. Suite, which is the largest room they have. It has a king bed downstairs, and 2 twins upstairs in a little loft area. Like most of Rome, the floor is tile. The furnishings were very simple but adequate, the bedspread plain, the tv small (13"?). But somehow, none of that mattered and only served to convey a more realistic feeling of where you were and what you were experiencing. The room did have a safe, air conditioning/heating.The bathroom had a large marble sink, different than I've seen before. It was large/wide, but very shallow. The hand towels were not terry cloth, but more like the kind you'd use to dry dishes with in the US. Not really a problem, just kinda weird. The bathroom was decent size, not huge, not tiny. It did have a bidet, and combined shower/tub. I had read that hot water is sometimes a luxury in Rome, but not in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful and had recommended the Roman Promenades tour company. We ended up taking 2 days of private tours in Rome a night tour and a tour of Pompeii. This suggestion MADE our trip! These tour guides were so excellent and helped us to see so much more than we ever would have on our own. (I will do a review of that company in the future.) You absolutely MUST have private tours if you are in Rome for the first time! The breakfast is served in a room off of the courtyard. The "procedure" is that you take a tray, load it up with whatever you want, bring it up to the front counter, tell them what kind of coffee you want, and leave it there while you go find a seat. They will then carry it out to you. (The room is down a few stairs, so this is very helpful.) The breakfast has a lot of different kind of pastry items, cereal, strawberries, meat and cheeses, and juices. Some of the pastry items were really more like cookies. (I obviously decided to NOT do a low carb diet while traveling. It just would not be possible to do and still enjoy the trip and experience everything fully.) My absolute favorite was what I call the nutballs. They seem to be made of just chopped nuts, sugar and cinnamon, and then rolled into a ball and baked....crunchy, sweet and deliciously moist inside! Our days in Rome were not spent around our room. We would get up, enjoy the breakfast, meet our tour guide and be out until around 4pm. By then, things are kind of quiet everywhere anyway, so we'd take a little rest in the room, and then go out for dinner around 7 or 8. When I heard that dinner is usually not eaten until 8, I didn't know how I'd ever be able to wait that late. But once there, it is easy to fall into the location habits, and we grew to love the 8-10pm dinners, lingering over the pasta, wine, coffee and gelato. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Santa Maria Trastevere square, which has a number of restaurants, and it is so fun to watch in the evening as it fills up with people and activity. There are probably 50 or more restaurants within a 5 minute walk, so just pick a place, sit outside, enjoy the food and people watch! It was a let down to get back to the American way of eating dinner when we returned! A note about the neighborhood....it doesn't look like a pristine, tourist resort area. It has graffiti, trash, and people, dogs and vehicles/scooters racing through it. (Of course, so does most of Rome!) But it never felt unsafe, so don't let what some books say scare you away. (Just be mindful and smart about things.) You will have a much more authentic experience being immersed in this area. (It is across the Tiber river from the Trevi fountain, the Piazza Navona, the Spanish steps, and the Pantheon, but all those can be walked to. You just need to plan on walking while in Rome!) Our leaving was easier than arriving....our driver for our Pompeii tour picked us up and we were on our way. Truly a delightful stay that romanced us into dreaming about our return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Full Marks for Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria for 4 great days. Its a really lovely, small hotel, with very attentive, multi-lingual staff. Rooms were warm (even on the coldest of days), spacious and well equipped. The hotel has a great location, well within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions. The quiet back street location was superb. It was an easy stroll out into the neraby piazzas to find a place to eat each night. Only one thing would have made our stay complete - tea and coffee making facilities in our room.

Reviews.Title: “The one and only :)”
Reviews.Author: birdseyeview
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights only, but will be back for sure. We simply adored everything about it. The staff is very lovely, breakfast is perfect, location is a plus. After Rome, we went to Florence,Venice and New York, but I guess the "Santa Maria" is the one and only :) P.S:I have added some pix to this review..in case u wanna see what Trastevere is like..

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: lullo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from Jan 31st - Feb 4th, we were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary. It had been recommended by friends who stayed here last year and the Trip Advisor reviews merely confirmed their positive comments.( Take no notice of the odd negative comment - some people are impossibleto please! ) The hotel has a great ambience, genuinely friendly staff, spotless rooms - ours was no. 20 with a sitting room downstairs and a bedroom and bathroom in the eaves There are numerous restaurants within a five minute walk in any direction. We ate in one expensive, two moderately priced and one inexpensive and had good to great food at all of them, though the service at the bottom end was indifferent. We walked everywhere but used the Commune de Roma licensed taxis to return to the hotel each day and no journey cost more than 7 euros -brilliant value. We also used the hotel's own transfer from and to the airport. It is worth it for a hassle free start and end to the stay. We would have no hesitation in returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JayneLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Santa Maria after reading the reviews on this site. We can honestly say that it lived up to its reputation. The staff were friendly and helpful; the room was very clean and spacious; the breakfast plentiful. It was a shame that we could not make use of the courtyard, but in summer it would be delightful. Yes, you could find a cheaper hotel in Rome, but this one is worth it. Trastevere is a lovely neighbourhood with lots of winding cobbled streets (easy to get lost, but the hotel provides maps). It was just 20 minutes walk from the hotel to the Vatican and a similar distance across the river to the Colosseum. There are lots of places to eat in Trastevere, but we highly recommend Gino's in Via della Lungaretta, just around the corner from the hotel. But be warned, the portions are generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisStein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days here in the first week of November last here. The room was fantastic, very large. I don't know if all the rooms are like this, but ours had a spiral staircase which led to a loft area which was basically another bedroom. So this would be a great choice of hotels for a pair couples traveling together or a family traveling with kids. All the rooms are one the ground leve and open into a courtyard where there are tables and chairs, and people tend to congregate there in the evening for a glass of wine. Bathrooms were very nice and well trimmed out. The bed was large and the matress firm. The front desk folks were incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is located just off the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere which is in the heart of that neighborhood. You are also just 2 blocks from crossing the Tiber and an easy walk to many of the sites of Rome. We paid the $50 for the car ride back to the airport and highly recommend it. it was a brand new black mercedes, so comfortable and nice way to end a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Rome for her 40th birthday in Jan. My main motivation; Money Magazine had an article that said Rome was a great place to visit in the winter - they were correct and TripAdvisor said the HSM was the place to stay - they too were correct. The car we ordered through the HSM was waiting at the airport when we arrived - so far so good. We arrived to the hotel at 9:30am and the first thing they did was show us to breakfast while they were finishing up our room. Breakfast was great: eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals and pastries. The best part were the free and excellent Cappuccinos. After breakfast, we were allowed to check-in at 10:30, a great feature. I had ordered flowers through the hotel which were absolutely gorgeous and the HSM threw in a bottle of Champange for free - again great service. The room was small but very neat and clean with a KS bed. Full featured bathroom, again very clean. The TV was only a 13" and had only 8-10 channels, but one of them was CNN International (english) and another was the BBC. There is a honor system book rack in the breakfast room which is fantastic, everything from the latest novels to tour guides, all that guests have left for others to enjoy. Another great feature - the price quoted via email was exactly what we paid - no additional service/tax charges, and we got 10% off for paying cash! We checked out early - 6:30am and yet the clerk opened the breakfast room and got us juice and made us Cappuccinos while we waited for the car - absolutely great service! Overall the place is just as most everyone else has said - great! Some notes about the HSM and Rome in general: - The church bells do ring every 15 minutes - I slept w/ earplugs. - A new no-smoking law just went into effect; good for inside places but bad for the sidewalks where all the smokers congregate and you walk - There is trash EVERYWHERE in Rome. - Jan is great because crowds are non-existent. - Food is great and relatively inexpensive for Europe - Full service restaurants do not open for dinner until 7:30pm. - Scooters rule the city and apparently have their own laws (or lack thereof) - We walked everywhere - very pleasant and great exercise. - You can manage very nicely w/o speaking Italian - The pizza and ice cream are fantastic. - Take a guided tour at the Vatican - it's well worth it. - We felt safe everywhere but didn't take any public transportation

Reviews.Title: “A Trasteverian Delight!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Santa Maria and thought it the perfect place to stay for seeing all the sites in Rome. Most sites are less than a 20 minute leisurely walk away, so we were able to set out each morning after a pleasant breakfast in the nicely decorated breakfast room. The hotel staff are extremely pleasant and helpful and by the end of our stay, we felt we had made some new friends. The rooms are on the small side, but this is Trastevere. Size aside, the rooms are comfortable, beautifully decorated and pleasant and I will stay there again. We stayed in room 1 which is in a private space with its own courtyard, which was perfect for a weeklong stay. The only issue with this room is that every sound from the neighboring loft room (room 21 I think) can be heard in room 1. We woke up the first morning to this discovery. Luckily, the room was empty for most of our stay so it was not an issue. If you book room 1, ensure the loft room is empty. A stay in Hotel Santa Maria offers the visitor a unique Roman experience complete with a picturesque piazza around the corner, church bells tolling, great restaurants outside your door and a secure, cozy, welcoming haven in the midst of a lively and inspiring Italian village. We loved it. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmr
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful and the hotel had a wonderfully warm atmosphere. It made the whole Rome experience that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria. I agree with the positive reviews on this site. Friendly staff, good breakfasts, clean, charming setting, etc. The rooms are a bit small but most hotel rooms in this price range in Europe are small. The bathroom was nice and very clean. The walls are a little thin since we could hear showers and toilets from adjacent rooms. Nearby church bells ring every 15 mins, around the clock so if you are a light sleeper, you may want to reconsider; however, they never kept us awake. The rooms have individual heating and cooling controls so we were able to control the temperature to our own preference. I noticed a few other reviewers felt that the location was not close to things and I have to disagree. The hotel is located in Trastavere, which is a central neighborhood in Rome, so many things were not that far away. I was 6 months pregnant at the time we stayed here and we walked to the Vatican, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and the Colosseum; all in different parts of the city and all were within a 30 minute walk or less. We liked Trastavere for a few reasons; restaurants and cafes were abundant, close, and inexpensive. In addition, it is not a big touristy area so the street vendors and beggars were not a nuisance, like they can be in other parts of the city. I would not say the Hotel Santa Maria is a bargain but I also did not think the rates were excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTraveller
Reviews.Content: For the last hotel on our most recent trip to Italy, the Santa Maria could not have been a better choice. Thank you, Trip Advisor. It was a little pricier than most places that I stay at, but being in Trastevere and being at such an unusual hotel made up the difference. The first room that we were shown was very small, but they managed to come up with a much bigger and better situated room without too much fuss. The staff was most accomodating, the breakfast was sumptuous and the ambience was one of warmth. It left my husband and I with a lasting, positive feeling about our entire trip. Definitely worthy of the #1 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Just Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the cleanest and the quietest we found in Italy. It was a nice place to be able to go to at the end of a long day of sight seeing. There is a laundry 10 steps away from the hotel that came in really handy, and the restaurants in the area are local places so they were very afforadable. The rooms are a bit small so don't over pack like us!! Only pack what you can lift easily for Rome!! You will appreciate that later. The bathrooms are beautiful, with a huge tub to take nice relaxing baths in. The breakfast was wonderful, eggs, juices, pastries, cold cuts and more. Most other hotels will say they have those things and then don't. Hotel Santa Maria does plus more!! I would highly recommend this hotel and we would be back!! My partner and I felt very welcomed, and the staff was the best we knew in Italy!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Trastavere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, simple rooms, orange trees fruiting in January - quiet!! - excellent breakfast and helpful staff. Easy stroll over bridge to Ghetto area and Campo de Fiori. We'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “little sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The approach is quite unlikely, but then you enter a little sanctuary of peace and quite. The rooms are lovely and spacious, the courtyard idilic and breakfast was a feast. We were alone this week end, but could imagine staying successfully with the children, putting them to bed and sitting out in the courtyard, sipping a glass of wine... we would love to pay Santa Maria another visit, and Rome is unimaginably wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “charming respite”
Reviews.Author: Cmillson
Reviews.Content: This was a charming, albeit somewhat pricey, refuge from the overload of Rome. The employees were wonderful and the setting very peaceful. The location was also very handy, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Hotel Santa Maria. We were very satisfied. I would not be concerned about the few mediocre reviews mixed in with the overwhelming positive comments - it is a great hotel with character. It is not for everybody, but what hotel is?! It has a great location in the unique old district (easy walks to the rest of Rome), very helpful and friendly staff, very good breakfasts, and clean rooms in a pleasant courtyard setting. We visited in Jan, so the courtyard was not much use, but I imagine it is quite a treat when it is warmer. The Hotel asks guests to complete a review on this site. This would explain why there are so many reviews, and at least partially why it is so highly rated (tripadvisor factors in the quantity of reviews when ranking). As such, it may be slightly less posh than other top rated hotels in tripadvisor. However, it is truly a great find, and I would highly reccomend it. If you look at the general consensus of the many reviews, this Hotel is highly reccomended. I commend the staff and management for a great Hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great places to stay”
Reviews.Author: RoySPCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas weekend 2004 and it was perfect. My wife hates hotel elevators; this hotel doesn't have any! It doesn't need them as all the rooms are right on the courtyard. No one above us to make noise as they come and go, and the pleasant sounds of the church bells made for a perfectly comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is nice and convenient, but nothing more than that. It's also a little overpriced for a 3 star hotel. The rooms tend to be a little overheated and the bells from the nearby church sound every 15 minutes, even all night long. The breakfast room is pretty and the food is good. The staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “really within Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On my sixth trip to Rome, we decided to stay "across the river". Luckily, the Hotel Santa Maria combined two important things: easy, walkable acess to the favorite places - Vatican, Navona, Campo di Fiori, Campodiglio. and very secluded relaxing environment. The greatest benefit from staying in Trastervere was to learn a new part of Rome. We found ourselves wanting to spend more time and walk all the great streets in the neighborhood. After three days we found many shops, restaurants and piazzas which made us feel like locals rather than visitors to Rome. The pace slowed down, and the evenings were spent taking any new back street. This was the feeling of really travelling and seeing things in a different way. The first days of 2005 were so clear and beautiful in Rome that this short trip will remain in our memories.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric local hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see the large variations in the reviews for this hotel, and admittedly was partly worried about whether it would live up to my expectations. I'm pleased to say that it did - probably sited in the most atmospheric area of Rome with enough restaurants and bars within the vicinity to satisfy anyone. Great location for walking to all of the main areas of the centre as it allows different routes to be taken each time. The area was busy when we visited over the new year, but it felt more "local" than most of the other parts of Rome and more genuine than some of the more heavily touristed areas. The hotel areas were very well presented, the courtyard delightful showing off that it is a converted monastry (but probably more useful in the summer!), the service was good, and breakfast well presented. Having said that I can see why the hotel could get so more varied reviews (which seems to happen with most of the hotels on Trip Advisor!) since it depends what the visitor is looking for and whether the hotel fits what they want. If you are looking for the type of things that I describe above then I would fully recommend the hotel. The hotel is fairly small scale (20 rooms) so you do not get the amenities that you would get at more mainstream chain hotels, it could appear to be noiser if you prefer a sound proof room rather than hearing the church bells ring out, and the room sizes were not particularly large. But if you are looking for a small hotel in a local part of Rome that gives you a base for exploring it, you couldn't do much better than Hotel Santa Maria. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria after XMAS and for New Years Eve. What a cozy,warm and clean hotel. The breakfasts were great and the staff very helpful. Would stay there again next time. Restaurants abound and we walked to all the major attractions (full days)..A++++ Chris and Ray

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay over the New Year and would recommend this hotel to everyone. The staff are friendly, professional and helpful; the atmosphere is serene - a paradise amidst the bussling local community. Close to all major sites ... wonderful dining in local bars/restaurants, which are just a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week because of the reviews here, but to be honest, they were really overstated. For over 200 Euro per night, this hotel's location was its only real asset. Located in Trastevere, it's right near so many great cafes, restaurants, and small shops on windy streets that it was a great place to come home to after a long day of touristing. Still, the hotel itself had few amenities that would rank it among the best in even a small town, much less Rome. The walls were very, very thin and starting at 6 or 7 am you could hear the other guests very clearly as well as upstairs neighbors. The hotel breakfast was tasty, and the office mostly accommodating, but the beds weren't that comfortable and the atmosphere not nearly plush enough to rate anything above 3 stars. It is by no means a fancy hotel, but it's a nice, kind of loud one.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read some bad reviews of this hotel and I would like to say to everyone who has written one of these - Welcome to the real world! If you are going to book a stay in a converted monastery with stone walls please don't expect the noise levels to be that of a fake soundproofed american rubbish soulless hotel. Also, people who have said that Trastevere is not a nice area - are you blind or do you just have no concept of culture, yes there are beggars etc... but what do you want to do? - shut your eyes to the world and run to the heaving throngs of loud and brightly coloured tourists? - obviously. I thought that the hotel had real charm, the courtyard of orange trees was beautiful, the staff were great and very friendly, yes there was some noise but it was not made by the staff - sound of the city? Also, the hotel had a certain traditional (not showy) romantic feel to it that was great for my break as I just got engaged. I have read people accuse the owners of putting up fake reviews in some sort of con - but to let you know that this hotel is actually very popular and got the editors pick in the 'Lonely Planet' guide - it is also mentioned as a hotel that stands out in other guides so owners lying? - I don't think so. If you want a REAL hotel with a proper charm then definitely visit this one as it is also excellent value for money. If you have no life and want to stick on the tourist trail and do the boring unimaginative crap everybody does - then you would be better with the holiday inn. Thanks again for a great stay! Seb Cole Bergamot Limited

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there Dec. 21-24 and had a great stay. At first I will admit that we were a little nervous about the location but once we began to walk the neighborhood and began to see the essence of Trastevere it was perfect. It really is Old School Rome which is what we were looking for. There are plenty of restaurants in the area (we recommend Spirito Divino and Antico Arco), the Art Cafe Friends for a good cappucino and there was nice little Wine Bar right around the corner. The walk to the main sites were fine. Obviously a little longer than if you stay in Central Rome, but certainly walkable. Even in December. As far as the hotel, the room is a bit small, but the room and the bathroom were immaculate. The service was very good, however a little weak on restaurant recommendations (we came with a list from friends) and the breakfast even better. We had the best cappucinos and croissants each morning. Overall a great stay and we would definitely come back! Thanks for making Rome our favorite stop!

Reviews.Title: “Need a good pair of legs but so what!”
Reviews.Author: colbert2378
Reviews.Content: Booked because of reviews and not disapointed either. The room was WARM which on coming back on a cold December evening was great. Trastevere is not in the centre - but where is the city centre in Rome? So you need a good pair of legs, but then you do in any European city. Instead the location is genuine Rome - complete with magnificent church in the piazza. Would I rebook? Yes certainly - but not all the restaurants round about are good - use your guides!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast and Cappuccino to write home about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria in 2004 from Dec 13 - 17 and loved our accommodations and the best breakfast we had in Italy! It is such a convenient area and we could walk everywhere. It was just what I had imagined Italy to be with the cobblestone streets and winding alleys. The staff was very friendly and over the top helpful taking care of our luggage as we did some last minute things before leaving. And the cappuccinos anytime between 7:30am and 10:30am was heaven for us! Thank you Santa Maria in Trastevere for everything! Tom and Carol Brooks, Atlanta, Georgia, USA

Reviews.Title: “The excitement of antiquity, the comfort of modernity.”
Reviews.Author: czma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and three of our children spent 12/16-20/2004 at Hotel Santa Maria. It was a splendid vacation. Trastevere afforded the sense of antiquity while the Hotel supplied social warmth and modern comforts. We enjoyed Trastevere, its crooked streets, superabundant Trattorias, and Ristorantes,and its intriguing boutiques. The basilica of Santa Maria Trastevere , beautiful in its age and resplendent in its decor, is about one city block from the Hotel. We used public transportation and walking throughout our stay. We walked to the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, to most of the central Rome tourist venues, it was great. The presence of indigents in the neighborhood was no more nor any less than in the rest of Rome and its environs. We used the Hotel as the staging ground for our daily forays and relaxed in its comfort at the end of each day. The Hotel facilities are clean, the service staff is courteous and helpful, the breakfast was more than adequate, the entire vist was all that we desired.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, in a beautiful location, with a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good, unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend and I and also our friends after reading rave reviews on this site and inspecting their website. We weren't at all disappointed with the hotel and had nothing to complain about. My boyfriend and I stay in hotels very very frequently as part of our jobs (in fact we live out of a suitcase!!), but is was so nice to have the friendly, personal service of the Santa Maria, than the impersonal service you would receive in a larger chain hotel. The guys at breakfast were so friendly and we didn't think the choice was limited, as other users have commented. We thought there was plenty to fuel you for your days walking in Rome. Your first impression is that the location isn't terribly desirable, as the first thing that you notice is all the graffiti and the iron gates of the hotel. However, walking around Rome it seems that everywhere is littered with graffiti and bikes bombing past you all the time, so I think it's a little unfair to accuse the hotel of being in a bad area. We thought it was in a great location - plenty of bars, restaurants and shops, and the hotel was very peaceful (apart from the dinging and donging of the church bells every 15 minutes!!!). It is approx 20 minutes walk to the Colloseum, 20-25 mins to Vatican City. Nice distances to walk off all that Italian food!! All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would also recommend their airport taxi service. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “for the inquisitive”
Reviews.Author: coolswizzle
Reviews.Content: if you want to stay in an area where you can see what ordinary Romans do on a day to day basis- then this is where you should go. their beakfast is more than adequate, rooms are kept clean and staff is very friendly. but you need your walking shoes if you want to explore rome on foot. and yes, there is graffitti everywhere in trastevere & all over rome.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: smelt12
Reviews.Content: I returned home yesterday after a 5 day visit to Rome with my two sons. Never having visited Rome before, I relied heavily on internet reviews regarding accommodation. We were very happy with the location of the hotel; for us, being near a synagogue and kosher facilities was important and the Santa Maria ia only a 10 minute walk frm the main synagogue and the Jewish ghetto. We didn't find the location a disadvantage as some people seem to have.... we walked everywhere and very easily. Our room was simple but pleasant. I agree that the lighting in the bathroom was a bit dim, and there was some mildew around the showerhead. Other than that, it was fine. We would have really appreciated having an electric kettle in the room -I just assumed there would be one. (Didn't ask) The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read a lot of excellent reviews on this site regarding the Hotel Santa Maria, we decided to spend our 3 night stay there. We were not disappointed. This hotel is a small peaceful oasis in a vibrant and energetic city. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and with a fine size ensuite are a perfect base for your stay. All the rooms overlook a number of relaxing courtyards set amongst orange groves. Breakfast is excellent with a wide variety of fresh breads,pastries,fruit etc. served with very good coffee. I save the best till last, the staff were helpful, friendly and made our stay all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria owe a lot to their very proactive PR. I received an email after my stay in mid November asking me to contribute to these reviews (hence the enormous number for this hotel). The hotel is quaint, charming and understatedly comfortable situated in a low key but lively part of Rome down a back street. I wouldn't say it was luxurious but has everything you need including king size beds, decent sized rooms (by European standards) which are spotlessly clean and have a mini bar fridge for storing all that unmissable food from the local delis and supermarket (once you've unpacked the fridge) and bought your own drinks locally for half the price. The rooms are very quaint with large oak beams and terracotta tiled floors. It certainly isn't a cheap place to stay but well worth the money in low season. The price is fairly steep in high season. You get what you pay for in Europe however. The hotel is perfect if you don't want to be jammed into the central tourist zone. It isn't the quietist location (low level disturbances such as church bells, seagulls, cats, next door's plumbing) but all the walking induces many a good sleep. The major tourist attractions are within an easy walking distance. Rome is best seen on foot and the further you walk the more you discover. The taxi service offered by the hotel is somewhat expensive for couples. We got to the hotel by mini van from Ciampino for 25 euros for 2 with Minivan Service to Roma who were touting for business at the airport. It pays to haggle over the price. The buffet breakfast was very pleasant and the same everyday. The staff were unobtrusive and professional. Rome is a wonderously unforgettable experience and having an equally charming place to stay enhances the joy. Ultimately, the defining test of a hotel is whether you would stay there again. I would.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second floor suite was large, quiet and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, quiet, wonderful staff, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this intimate hotel, only one in the Trastevere neighborhood, and up and coming place with many restaurants and shops and tiny cobblestone winding streets. We were able to walk everywhere (many miles!) eat all over, and always happy to come back to our quiet little place. Breakfasts were great, evening cocktails just us in the bar. Get their driver service with your reservation, saves all hassle. We will recommend to others and stay there again. Lee Koranda and Larry Dam, Santa Barbara, California

Reviews.Title: “Pefect....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was a clean and comfortable, in an excellent location, close to some great restaurants and bars. The breakfast was amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would recomend booking a taxi from the airport (which you can do through the hotel) as it is a little difficult to find. We would definately stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Santa Maria for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and were not disappointed. Whether it's classical, renaissance, religious medieval or modern Rome you want to explore then the Santa Maria is the perfect base (most major sights walkable). Also it's a wonderful place to return to after the hustle and bustle of the city, a veritable haven in fact. The rooms are very clean and spacious, excellent breakfast, in fact standard of rooms and service equals many 5 star hotels. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and very efficient, they made us feel very much at home. The area of Trastevere is very bohemian and arty with it's narrow winding streets and has a real flavour of Roman life. There are also many great bars and restaurants within easy reach and everything is very laid back and relaxed. We will certainly stay at the Hotel Santa Maria again on any future visits to Rome and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a true Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel in center Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this very nice small and charming hotel. The atmosphere is peacefull and the employees very kind...it is really nicely located, the area (Trastevere) is very pleasant and typical...small shop, piazzas and restaurants all around...we did all our visit by walking. We recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: tmitch2315
Reviews.Content: This place is a Gem. Its right in the center of things and the staff is great. Wonderful Breakfast. Suggest you use their car service if coming from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and area of Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: crangle
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful stay at this quaint hotel Nov. 21st and 22nd 2004. Our stay here was the first stop of our 10 day trip and it proved to be one of our favorite places to stay. We began by having Hotel Santa Maria arrange for a driver to pick us up at the airport. It was hassle free! After seeing the driver wind his way thru streets we know it would have been a challenge to find it on our own. The hotel itself is charming. Breakfast here was my favorite of the trip with wonderful bread, proscuitto and salami and cappacino. Scrambled eggs are available. Our first afternoon there we walked to the Vatican, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The second day we did the Forum and Coliseum. The sights were very reachable by foot. But my favorite part is the number of good restaurants in the Trastevere area...all very close as you wander the narrow cobblestoned streets. Finally I was relieved to find out that the recommendations that I read on Trip Advisor proved true. This is a great resource.

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect start to our honeymoon. The hotel is in the Travestere area which is a quaint and charming part of Rome full of restaurants with a great night life. We loved just walking around the surronding areas of the sqaure. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and is there 24 hours a day to service any of your needs. They serve a wonderful breakfast and the grounds of the hotel are small but beautiful. The rooms are clean with very nice, new private baths. We could not have asked for a better hotel for our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Rome for Thanksgiving and stayed the entire time at Hotel Santa Maria. What a gem of a place! The building is old and charming but the rooms have modern baths (even a hairdryer!) and comfortable beds. This small hotel is tucked away in a quiet location but is only steps away from the main square of Trastevere, probably the most charming district of Rome. It was easy to get to all parts of Rome from here but we were always glad to return to our quiet hideaway after long days of sightseeing and the busy noisy parts of Rome. The breakfast was superb, and we often had a glass of wine in the small bar in the late afternoon after returning from our excursions. Many restaurants and cafes nearby, great location, and wonderful staff who spoke excellent English and were most helpful and friendly. This place is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: BSenger
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and what a better way to spend it than at the Sant Maria. This place was great. Very scenic and quiet. The rooms had everything and the staff was very helpful and curtious. Look forward to returning. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week in Italy and stayed at Hotel Santa Maria for 3 nights. We loved the location, room, breakfast, and the staff most specially Conrad! The hotel is close to many very good restaurants and major tourist sites! I love the fact that there is a laundromat very close to the hotel! We will definetely stay at Hotel Santa Maria again! Keep up the great job Hotel Santa Maria!

Reviews.Title: “the roman jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel in a secluded setting, tucked away in little narrow streets. Great for walking around rome, nearby places to eat. And very charming members of staff, we shall return here on our next visit.... Peter & Dianne Harrison

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria Trastevere -- The best find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hotel Santa Maria Trastevere. I doubt I would stay anywhere else in Rome. The hotel is small and unexpected, tucked away in a little street just behind the Piazza Santa Maria Trastevere. The location is fantastic -- you can walk to just about everything, including lots of good restaurants, cafes and interesting sights. It's just across the river to the Piazza Navona, and just down the road from the Villa Farnesi and the Vatican. The hotel itself is lovely. The service is personal and responsive, the rooms, which surround a pretty courtyard, are pleasant and comfortable. Unlike my experience in bigger hotels around the world, I have never come back after a morning of sight-seeing, to find my room undone. The included breakfast is fantastic, way better than average. If you want a large chain hotel experience with shops, a health spa and room service, this is not the place for you. If a tucked away corner of charm and grace in the middle of Rome is what you're looking for, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sadly, the review we will provide will recommend finding another place. Our experience with your hotel was mixed. On the positive side, the hotel itself was very nice. The breakfast was very good and except for the desk staff, your people were helpful. But the front office staff dominates our lasting memory of your hotel. Here is what stands out: 1) Upon arrival to the Rome airport, the shuttle your staff reserved did not arrive. After 90 minutes of waiting, we arranged another ride to your hotel. When we got there (after 24 hours of travel), and without a greeting, the front office angrily demanded 50 Euro because we did not wait at the airport longer. After a lengthy "welcome to Rome" argument, she called the shuttle service and worked out a solution (by telling them incorrectly we wanted to find another way). 2) That night, after showering from 24 hours of travel, we used both of the shampoo samples you provided. We asked the front desk if we could get another and were told, "NO. We used your allotment already." Amazing... 3) On our 5th night, at a time later than midnight, there was a rather loud party in the courtyard. We called the front desk to see if the party could be made a little quieter. The desk person, who understood English every other time we spoke, decided then he couldn't understand English and asked me to call back in the morning. Obviously he was just being lazy or rude (both). Overall, extremely disappointing front desk service. All of the aspects that are difficult to control (price, location, hotel itself) you did quite well. However, there were the things you have control over, easy stuff, personable things, greetings, generosity, etc., those were most, most disappointing. Specifically, Stephano, his wife and his sister were wonderful and warm---always. The breakfast staff---A+, Annamaria at the front desk was most. most rude and, frankly, I will have a tough time recommending a stay at your Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and tranquility….”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like stepping into a different world... Hotel Santa Maria also offers the spiritual satisfaction on top of the over abundance breakfast spread. Great memory to take home with and I highly recommend to anybody looking for a sanctuary in the beautiful & busy Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Old part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights and found this hotel to be very quiet (once you get used to the clock chiming the hours and quarters) and all the staff to be very helpful without exception. We will return and can recommend this as a base for exploring all Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful memory”
Reviews.Author: Maria-Manuel
Reviews.Content: We have returned from our vacations to Rome. We have lodged 10 nights in this hotel, and I must thank for Tripadvisor the commentaries of this Hotel in its web. This is what animated us to make the reserve. The Hotel is wonderful; calm, very clean ( very important) and with a good maintenance that is appraissed in all detail. The rooms, well equipped, and the beds very comfortables, in our opinion. The personnel i scharming; from the personnel of the reception always ready to help, to the Director of the Hotel ( who had a great detail with us), incluiding also the breakfast personnel ( greetings to Conrad and Javier). The situation is superb, right in the center of the Trastevere, coloful district, plenty of ambience, mainly at lunch and dinner time, wich is grate, after all day walking visiting the City. Also it's near of the different monumental zones, where you can go walking ( obvious those that are in downtown). In order to finish, in relation to the noises, the Hotel has a wonderful silence, considering the noisy City around it.Only you can hear the bells of Santa María in Trastevere and the gulls, is that noise? Definetly, we will return, without doubt, the next year to this Hotel; in Rome always they are left things to discover! Thank you very much to our dear Hotel Santa María!

Reviews.Title: “A place of calm in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria from 16-20 October 2004. The hotel is in a good location and within walking distance of most attractions. The breakfast was very good and the cappucinos were fabulous (not instant like other places offered during our holiday) The staff was very helpful and friendly especially the front desk. Thanks to Ricks Steeves for the recommendation. Also ate at nearby Fillet de Baccala and Osteria Ponte Sisto. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Santa Maria and would choose to stay there again when we return to Rome. It's not in a touristy area, so you get a feel for the neighborhood and all its charm. It was very safe, clean, quaint and the staff was attentive. We stayed two nights. We loved the courtyard, which is where we had a coctail and some nuts one evening before going out to dinner. Breakfast (included in the cost of the room) was one of the few places in France or Italy where we were offered eggs. In our haste to leave for the airport on our departure day, we left a small piece of jewelry in the room and emailed the hotel after returning to the US and realized it was missing. They found the ring, responded back by email and promptly mailed it to us. Thank you to Rick Steves for recommending The Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Movie Set...But Real!”
Reviews.Author: ArtAdventurer_10
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Santa Maria is like being on a movie set...you look for the lights and cameras but there are none to be found. The place reeks of atmosphere and through eyes accustomerd to all that's modern, it almost seems staged. However, as your vision clears, you realize this is ancient, authentic, and very charming Rome. The hotel is a walled oasis in the midst of a bustling, rambling warren of narrow streets with laundry stretched above, old peolple watching the world go by from behind flowering window boxes, and cats lounging in every nook or cranny. The hotel has a lovely courtyard where you can take breakfast or relax with a bottle of wine. The only sound that passes from outside is the gentle, soothing striking of church bells marking the quarter hour, or the occassion cat fight among the various tom cats that patrol the neighborhood. The neighborhood around the hotel is best at night. It rocks every night, but in a typically Roman, laid-back way. Although we only stayed a week in October, I imagine you can stay for months and eat at a different restaurant every night. Wanderig through the narrow, winding streets trying to scope out the most inviting trattoria has got to be one of the top pleasures of life. It's easy to get lost here, but it's hard to go too far astray as you'll eventually get led back to where you started...and discover so much along the way. The nearby church, Santa Maria in Trastevere, is the oldest Christian church in Rome and has mosaics that will take your breath away. The piazza outside is lined with restaurants, cafes, shops, and has a great fountain. You can have your palm read by a Hungarian fortune teller or buy an original work of art from a local artist, or listen to the wandering musicians that will entertain you late into the night. The hotel is within walking distance to all the major sites in Rome but we were happy to come "home" to the Hotel Santa Maria and Trastevere every night. We loved this hotel, this neighborhood...Rome! Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “The Santa Maria is a superb choice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better place to stay for our Rome visit, Oct. 27 through November 1, 2004, than the Hotel Santa Maria. The location in the friendly Trastevere neighborhood is convenient to all modes of transportation -- just a brief walk to the taxi stand or bus stop -- and is such that you can walk directly to many of the sights. We loved the charm of the place, the cleanliness, the beauty of the courtyard, the sumptuous breakfast buffet, and the fair prices. But above all, we were most impressed with the warmth and professionalism of the staff. The front desk staff member greeted us warmly by first name each time we appeared. That is a rare treat. These employees genuinely seem to enjoy their work and helping visitors have a comfortable stay. We would definitely stay here again for a future trip to Rome, and we offer our highest recommendation for this hotel. Sincerely, Martha Brinson

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aitken40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights in June 2004. The hotel is a little oasis near the centre of Rome, we had one room which was a little on the small size for 2 adults and 2 children but it was very clean, quiet and the courtyard was just lovely.The breakfast was the best we had in Europe and the staff very helpful.The surrounding district was fascinating with lots of good restaurants, I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria October 27 and 28 2004. We were a day late in arriving due to plane cancellations...they were most helpful and friendly when we arrived. We had to catch up with a tour we had booked for that morning; they called the guide and gave us great instructions on where to meet the tour. Also, their breakfast is great and serves wonderful cappacino. The rooms are charming as is the whole setting...nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Online-Buy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Santa Maria from 3 - 6 November 2004. The hotel is a great place in a perfect location. Most of the roman attractions are in walking distance (20 - 30 minutes). Note: Not all Taxidrivers know the Hotel (payed 11 Euro from Termini to the Hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Great idea! A place with a mysterious character.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, We had a really nice time in your hotel in October 2004. It's architecture and the mysterious place you build it in is wonderful and we were very surprised. Great idea! You gave us delicious breakfasts. If we will ever visit Rome again, we will come and visit Santa Maria Hotel for sure. We will tell our friends and family about your hotel for sure. I hope the visit too! Regards, The Klimowicz Family from Warsaw/Poland

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our four nights' stay. Everything about the hotel was perfect. In particular, the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Since we each threw a coin into the Trevi Fountain, I anticipate we will be coming back to Rome and to the one and only hotel of choice--Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this Hotel for Oct weekend and found its location and service excellent. Perfect place to use as base for touring Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a more pleasant place to stay in Rome. The area that Hotel Santa Maria is in was very lively in the evening and has many places to choose from for dinner. I will likely stay there again when I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Remarkable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria from 14-10-2004 to 18-10-2004. We booked the hotel based upon reviews we'd read on Trip-Advisor.com. We were not disappointed! The staff are attentive and friendly, the rooms always clean and crisp, and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The location of the hotel is in Trastevere, a "Greenwich Village" type area, and is situated very conveniently to all Rome's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Romance!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were picked up by the taxi arranged by the Hotel and arrived in Rome on a busy Monday morning through hectic traffic from the airport. We were so glad when the driver turned into the pretty forcourt of the Hotel Santa Maria and we felt instantly at home and fell in love with this quaint and peaceful place! Trastervere is an ideal location from which to visit all of Rome's many attractions and return to at night for relaxing in many of it's bars and restaurants. Breakfasts were scrumptious, staff couldn't be more helpful and the rooms were clean and bright. Highlights of the trip were our visit to the Pope at the Papal Audience and our trip to Pompeii. We hope to return to Rome someday to see much more of the city that we have fallen in love with.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Popart
Reviews.Content: Hard to find (hidden away on a small street; our taxi driver had to ask directions)but a great place to stay and from which to explore the wonders of Rome. Superb breakfasts; great staff; comfortable rooms and a charming neighborhood...what more could you ask for! We would definitely return if we're lucky enough to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awonderful place to stay. A great getaway from the noise & hustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TATraveller
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome when we arrived at this charming hotel in the Trastevere district of Rome. A good location from which to visit all the sites and eat out in the evening, with the added bonus of being a haven of peace and quiet in what can be a very noisy city. Our room, whilst not large was more than adequate with a comfortable, king size bed. We can't rate the Hotel Santa Maria and the service too highly and only wish the weather had been warm enough to sit out in the 2 beautiful courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “Cloistered calm in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is a quiet, almost serene hotel nestling within the jostling crowds, super restaurants and narrow cobbled streets of the Trastevere. The newly built and well finished rooms are built cloister- style around two tree sheltered courtyards reflecting the site's religous heritage. Only church bells puncture the hotel's night time tranquility! The staff were professional, friendly and helpful without being intrusive - just the right balance you'd expect from a well run hotel. The perfect base for your Roman holiday

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with the church bells”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My only worry about writing this review is that we might never be able to get a room there again because it is so popular. The taxi driver didn't have a clue where it was and abandoned us in the square. After wandering aimlessly in several wrong directions, a friendly stall holder pointed us in the right direction. Hotel Santa Maria is well worth looking for. It is situated down a small pedestrianised lane and is a real haven of peace and tranquility, every bit as good as its description on the internet. The rooms all have access to a terrace. Ours was round a corner on its own which meant we had our own private table and chairs. The rooms are comfortable and spotlessly clean, the service is very efficient and breakfasts are generous. The church bells ring out every quarter of an hour, adding to the charm of the place. Trastevere is a great area to be in - within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions - but much quieter. It is a warren of narrow streets and alleys, packed full of very reasonably priced restaurants frequented by locals as well as tourists. There's even street entertainment in the piazza on a Saturday evening. We threw a coin in the Trevi fountain, so hopefully we'll be back to Rome. I only hope we can book a room in the Hotel Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria lived up to the ratings recieved through tripadvisor.com, a very useful source for hotels, I might add. The hotel provided a nice refuge from the hustle and bustle of the main city across the Tiber River. They had the best breakfast of all of the other hotels we stayed at in Venice and Florence. The hotel staff were professional and attentive. We did not experience any difficulty with any of the staff. As someone else mentioned, the real highlight is the courtyard under the orange trees. Trastevere is an ecclectic mix of people. The real disappoint throughout the major cities in Italy is the graffitti on everything! So when you first arrive in Trastevere, you don't really know what to think of the area. It was a very safe area, however. The food was delicious--better and more cost effective than across the River. Our favorite restaurant was La Scala. Surprising because it also offered pub fare, but it was the best we had in our 14 days in Venice, Florence and Rome. I highly recommend Hotel Santa Maria and the Trastevere area. We enjoyed walking everywhere and didn't find any of the sites too far away. The only cab ride we took was from the Train Station and I swore I would never ride in a cab in Rome again after that hair raising experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller033
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited Rome from 8-11 October 2004 and we stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria as it had been so highly recommended on tripadvisor. It exceeded our expectations. The room was lovely, the bathroom a good size and everything was so clean. The rooms are set around two courtyards and all on ground level so there is very little noise which makes such a change from most inner city hotels. The breakfasts were held outside and the choice was much better than we have had offered before in Italy and the service friendly. The hotel arranged a car to collect and return us to the airport which was prompt and quick and reasonably priced. It took probably about 10 minutes to walk to the Piazza Navona and about 15 to the Forum. Rome is a very busy, noisy, traffic-filled city and to come back to Trastevere in the evenings and find the old city charm with narrow streets and a large square with lovely restaurants and shops was like coming back to an oasis of calm. The hotel looks so beautiful and the area is so interesting that we felt we really saw two sides of this great city. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret of Trasteverre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is so magnificent. The staff were very courteous and went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. Hotel Santa Maria is walking distance to to Ponte Sisto, Campo Fiori, Piazza Navorna, The Vatican and other places in Rome. They were kind enough to find a room for me when the place was completely booked. On my last night there I had the flu and I had asked the front desk if there is a possibility that I can have hot soup brought to my room. They made arrangements for me to have soup and hot tea. I would highly recommend Hotel Santa Maria. I think it is the best kept secret and I guess by now it will not be.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime...October 2 - 7, 2004”
Reviews.Author: hlg123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria far and away exceeded our expectations. My wife, adult son and I traveled to Italy to visit our daughter who is studying at the American University of Rome. We selected this hotel due to its proximity to her school, location in "Old Rome", ease of access to many of the major attractions in the city and the wonderful reviews it received on TripAdvisor.com. We were not the least disapponted. We found the front desk clerks Giovanna and Adrianna, couldn't do enough for us. (On our way back from Florence several days after we had checked out of the hotel, our train was delayed. I called Adrianna who had arranged for us to be picked up at the train station in Rome and asked her let the car service know that we would be delayed...she was most gracious and thorough in doing this...clearly above and beyond the normal call of duty.) The wait staff at breakfast (Conrad) and the cocktail waitress in the evening (Chiara) were both delightful and genuinely interested in making sure our stay was enjoyable. Our room was spotless. We did bring our own washcloths (as we knew from traveling abroad in the past that we wouldn't find the European version adequate).
