This hotel is in the heart of Trastevere a charming old section of Rome. It's just of the main piazza so there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. We found the bells from the local church (which is beautiful) most relaxing. Our only regret is that we couldn't have stayed longer....we'll definitely return....thank you all for making our visit to Italy a...trip of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: estmat
Reviews.Content: Great way to start our married life, hotel is charming and very peaceful, although the Church bells can be a bit noisy but you quickly get used to them. Great location for sightseeing and local restaurants are good and relatively inexpensive. Bedrooms are clean and airy with good facilities. The Staff are excellent and willing to help with any request.

Reviews.Title: “8th-11th October our anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the Hotel Santa Maria was negative I am afraid. This was nothing to do with the location or the hotel its self, it was the attitude of the receptionist. We had been travelling since 5am (we arrived at about 4.15 pm!) and were absolutely exhausted. When we entered the reception the woman behind the desk was on the phone, not saying anything, just sat silently holding the receiver. She completely ignored us. We waited patiently, finally about five minutes later she glanced up and said I am calling someone a taxi ,and then continued ignoring us for even longer. We were not impressed and felt offended. Eventually she showed us to our room, at no time did she say welcome to the Hotel Santa Maria. This was such a shame because I booked this special anniversary weekend back in January and had been dreaming about it ever since.It was the first chance of special time together as husband and wife without our daughters for a long time! The room was very clean and the shower and bath were fine. We did find it rather noisy when other people were using their showers and baths ,or even talking ,because the walls between the rooms are thin.It may be just be a personal preference, but I did find the pillows very hard as they were the solid foam type.The maid tried hard to find me a softer one which I very much appreciated. The next day was better, there was a much nicer receptionist (I can only identify her by saying she had a little wound on her face)this receptionist was warm and friendly as was the young lady working in the bar and it made such a difference. The breakfasts were indeed delicious with plenty of choice and it was pleasant to sit in the scrupulously clean courtyard after a long day walking. We loved the Trastavere district which had a wonderful atmosphere, there were plenty of places to eat.The beautiful church of Santa Maria is not to be missed, the bells sounded wonderful and the interior is incredible. We walked everywhere, its about 25 minutes to the Vatican City in one direction and about 20 or so to the coliseum in the other. Thr Trevi fountain was slightly disappointing because of the crowds and crowds of people, so dont imagine it will be like the scene from Roman Holiday! Walking really made the experience of Rome more fulfilling because you got to see so many little things.(Mind the traffic when you cross the roads though, its madness! )I would never want to be part of one of the numerous coach parties we saw being herded around. The hotel Santa Maria is beautifully presented but the first impression never really left us, and the noise through the walls was a shame. Its interesting how much difference a receptionist can make. One of the reasons I booked the hotel was because all the reviews spoke of the friendly welcoming staff....well most of them were. I dont think we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our world wind two weeks in Italy. We started out our trip in Rome and stayed for four nights at the lovely Hotel Santa Maria. I cannot write enough positive things about this place. The grounds are lovely, the rooms very nice and the staff could not have been more helpful, courteous and friendly. Out of all the lodging we stayed at in Italy this one has ranked number one. After many long hours in Rome it was heavenly to return to such an incredible place every evening. The breakfast was also delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Roma”
Reviews.Author: JoeM456
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Hotel Santa Maria in Trestevere was as memorable as the first. We returned to again see our friends-the wonderful staff who treated us as family. The hotel is very well maintained and is very comfortable and close to everything. Excellent breakfast in the dinning room or on the patio. In the center of Trestevere action, but secluded in its own private world. We will stay again, I recommend highly. Alert, it is not real easy for taxis to get to the hotel, because the streets of Trestevere are very narrow.

Reviews.Title: “The crowning finale to our 2 weeks in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Soggy_Portlander
Reviews.Content: After a bit of an adventure finding this hotel by car (heed my warning-Don't drive in Rome!) we arrived in the oasis that is the Hotel Santa Maria. I was continuously amazed by the quiet and tranquility that greeted us upon our return from the hectic streets of Rome. The rooms are small but efficient and the staff was always friendly and accommodating and evening upgraded us at no charge to the large family room for our 1st night when we arrived a day early. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet! Quiet! Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Silence - such a luxury in a small Roman hotel! Rooms are small but soundproof, and the shower was the best I've ever had in Europe - a near waterfall of pressure. TV actually has both CNN and BBC. Other hotels will advertise a TV but not have any English language channels. Breakfast buffet had many excellent choices including hot, scrambled eggs. Very helpful and sincere staff. A good choice for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Santa Maria in Rome is a "gem."”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a busy day of walking and sightseeing, the Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect "gem" to come home to. It's location in Trastevere was perfect... very centrally located that allowed us to walk to many sights. We loved the quiet setting amid the citrus trees. I miss hearing the churchbells from the Piazza Santa Maria. Our room looked out onto a lovely courtyard. The personnel were most friendly, helpful and courteous. The breakfast at this hotel was the best! A wonderful array and assortment of fresh fruit, juices, meats, cheese, yogurt, breads, pastries and freshly scrambled eggs! We stayed five nights and each day we were greeted as nicely as the day we arrived. The charming people tending the bar remembered our drinks of choice! The availability of airport transportation was an important plus. We would highly recommend Hotel Santa Maria and when we return to Rome in the future, we will select Hotel Santa Maria!! Marcia

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SpiritofPlace
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was very good and the service was superb. The staff went out of their way to make my visit to Rome a memorable one. They helped us arrange transportation, book tours and recommended restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Hotel Santa Maria was the perfect place to end a hectic 10-day tour of Italy. We had done some last minute re-shuffling of our arrival date due to delays caused by hurricane Frances. Not only was the hotel able to accommodate us (they did not have a room for the last night but found us a decent hotel near-by) but we also actually ended up getting a 3-bedroom suite (Rm 22) for the same price! Antonio at the front desk was extremely knowledgeable and helped us plan and arrange our tours of the Vatican and some of the other sites. The other staff were very courteous and most seemed to speak a little English. The room was huge and had 1-1/2 bathrooms. The shower curtain in the bathroom leaked a bit but not a real problem. The courtyard was the epitome of serenity and the perfect setting for breakfast. Although the breakfast was listed as continental we also got eggs, and ham and other cold cuts. Trastavere is a quaint neighborhood and had a more local feel than some of the other areas we visited. We walked most everywhere but generally took cabs back in the evenings as the walking and the sun tired us out by the end of the day. (A word of advice-cabs don't seem to like to go into Trastavere because of its narrow streets. We found it easier to have the cabs drop you off at Ponte Sisto and its a 5 minute walk to the hotel from there.) All in all I was quite impressed and satisfied with Hotel Santa Maria and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hotel. Although a little dificult to find is wonderfully located, in a quiet zone just in the middle of Trastevere. Services are excellent and the personnel very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back! :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days in August and it was a wonderful cool oasis from the heat and crowds of Rome. We loved the breakfast, the atmosphere, and the feel of the Trastevere neighborhood. The room was small and a little pricey but very comfortable and a perfect spot for a siesta in the middle of a sweltering August afternoon. We decided it was well worth the extra money. The staff was all very helpful, the pick up from the airport couldn't have been easier and we were able to walk to all the major sights. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in your hotel was wonderful. The rooms are great and so is the location and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming home...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Maria is a splendid little find (once you find it at least). It is situated in a bustling, hip area of Rome where you will experience real urban Italian life. The hotel staff are extremely cordial and almost prefer to speak English. The ambience of the inner courtyard is so relaxing especially after a long day of siteseeing. And, you will most definitely have the BEST breakfast you'll ever have in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent Hotel,an oasis of calm amidst the hustle and bustle of a very busy, hectic city. Spotless room with top notch bathroom facilities, which is very useful after a hard day tramping around Rome's streets and Piazza's. Great selection at breakfast of fresh foods with superb service. I will recommend highly to all my friends. Hope to visit again. The area around might appear a little grotty, but please look beyond and it's a treasure coming alive at night with a wonderful selection of bars, restaurants and specialist shops.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & convenient!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful days and nights in Rome - what an amazing city! Starting and ending each day at Hotel Santa Maria was lovely -- a quiet oasis, yet convenient to all the sights. The staff is friendly and helpful, and breakfast in the garden each morning was just delightful.

Reviews.Title: “A very Special Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends spent three nights at the Hotel Santa Maria at the beginning of September 2004. We found it a delightful place to base ourselves for a weekend of sightseeing, relaxing and enjoying Italian food and wine. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, and had a great charm. Ideally situated for getting to all the "must sees" in Rome. The staff were very friendly and efficient. Difficult to fault anything, and if visiting Rome again, I would certainly return to the Hotel Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “So good we had to come back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Santa Maria because we love it so much. We first discovered the Santa Maria last year (2003) when we spent our honeymoon there and it couldn't have been better. The room was lovely and spacious. Extremely clean as well. The breakfast buffet has a great variety of choices and is delicious. Cakes, fresh melon, croisssants, fresh juices and proper italian coffee. All the staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. We highly recommend that you order a bottle of wine from the bar in the evening and sit out in the lovely courtyard amid candlelight. It could not be more romantic! We went back this year and again everything was perfect. We hope to return sometime to enjoy the delights the Santa Maria has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: windandsun
Reviews.Content: I can't picture staying anywhere else in Rome besides this place. For almost 20 days in Italy, this is by far the nicest place we stayed and with an awsome breakfest. This place is very quite and hidden in the mids of the action. Walking distance to St. Peters and Rome Forum and all the beautiful fountians. If you could afford it, then it's really a must stay. Min Jin PS: If you ever read Lonely Planet, this hotel is also editor's choice for Rome Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria for 4 nights between 3-7 September 2004 for our 1st wedding anniversary and we couldn't have chosed a more perfect hotel (we thank previous trip advisor reviews for that). The hotel is heavenly - perfect location in the heart of the real rome and a quiet oasis. It was wonderful to come back each evening and have a glass of wine or a cup of coffee (best we had in rome) in the orange grove. Staff were superb, very friendly, helpful and professional - made reservations, recommended restaurants etc. Would highly recommend a meal at Cafe de Paris Only word of warning - don't use Roman Promenades - booked 2 tours and they mucked up both. Feel free to email if you have any questions. Enjoy your stay - we definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Rome. Trastevere couldn't be bettered for informal dining. The Hotel Santa Maria was an oasis of calm to return to each day.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, relaxing, romatic.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Santa Maria is a wonderful oasis. It was not inexpensive, but it was worth every euro! It is very romantic; the breakfasts are superb (which you eat in an orange grove); the staff are friendly; the rooms are clean and importantly after a days sightseeing the atmospheere is one of peace and tranquility. I would definitely reccommend this hotel for couples, however, do not feel it suits families or lively young people.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming”
Reviews.Author: martinigirl555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April while my daughter was studying in Rome. Americans would call the Santa Maria a motel, the rooms are all on courtyard level. I would have to stress that the rooms are very small. The first room we were given was so small I had to put my suitcase on the bed to open it, there wasn't enough room to move around if I left it on the suitcase rack. We left the airconditioner/heater unit on all night to drown out the noise from our neighbors. (I heard the person next door taking a bath, I mean every splish splash)The location was great, the breakfast wonderful, (like a brunch), church bells reminded me of living in the North End of Boston. Management was nice enough, though their English wasn't such that they could be of much help in navigating transportation questions, etc. The price was great, though I can't imagine more than two people in a room. Rooms very clean and bathrooms modern.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: tsuhara
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and spent 11 nights at the Hotel Santa Maria. It was a wonderful experience and we will stay here again when we return to Rome. In booking we were a little concerned about the location not being in the heart of Rome but it turned out to be the best of surprises. We walked to everything. The neighborhood has great restaurants and shops/stores that are for the locals not just tourist. The staff at the hotel is top notch, the breakfast is fabulous, rooms and grounds are very clean and well taken care of and the office will help with anything you need to have a memorable stay in Rome. We are looking forward to our next trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Santa Maria
HotelInfo.Address: Vicolo del Piede 2, 00153 Rome, Italy
